translations.english: 实 means 'actual,' 事 means 'situation,' 求 means 'seek,' and 是 means 'original way.' The meaning of this idiom is 'to handle matters according to their actual situation.' This idiom is conventionally translated as 'seek truth from facts.'

examples.simplified: 我们应该坚持实事求是的原则， 把理论和实践结合起来。
examples.pinyin: Wŏmen yīnggāi jiānchí shíshì-qiúshì de yuánzé, bă lĭlùn hé shíjiàn jiéhé qĭlai.
examples.english: 'We should insist on the principle of seeking truth from facts, and integrate theory and practice.'

examples.simplified: 大家要实事求是地评价毛泽东的历史地位， 不能因为有了文化大革命就全 盘否定他以前的贡献。
examples.pinyin: Dàjiā yào shíshi-qiúshì de píngjià Máo Zédōng de lìshĭ dìwèi, bù néng yīnwèi yŏule Wénhuà Dà Gémìng jiù quán pán fŏudìng tā yĭqián de gòngxiàn.
examples.english: 'Everyone should evaluate Mao Zedong's position in history by seeking truth from facts; one can't totally repudiate his earlier contributions because of the Cultural Revolution.'

translations.english: 艰苦 means 'difficult' and 奋斗 means 'struggle.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'difficult struggle, arduous struggle.'

examples.simplified: 即使在今天， 我们也不应该丢掉艰苦奋斗的精神。
examples.pinyin: Jíshĭ zài jīntiān, wŏmen yě bù yīnggāi diūdiào jiānkŭ-fèndòu de jīngshen.
examples.english: 'Even today, we should not lose our spirit of hardworking struggle.'

examples.simplified: 经济困难时期， 全国人民都艰苦奋斗， 最后终于渡过难关。
examples.pinyin: Jīngjì kùnnán shíqī, quánguó rénmín dōu jiānkŭ-fèndòu, zuìhòu zhōngyú dùguò nánguān.
examples.english: 'In difficult economic times, all the people of the country struggled arduously; in the end, they finally got through the difficult period.'

translations.english: The literal meaning is 'by every possible means,' with a freer translation being 'by hook or by crook.'

examples.simplified: 由于农民的收入跟城市居民的收入差距比较大， 所以政府千方百计地增加 农民的收入。
examples.pinyin: Yóuyú nóngmín de shōurù gēn chéngshì jūmín de shōurù chājù bĭjiào dà, suŏyĭ zhèngfù qiānfāng-băijì de zēngjiā nóngmín de shōurù.
examples.english: 'Due to the relatively large gap between the salaries of rural residents and those in the city, the government increased rural residents' salaries by every possible means.'

examples.simplified: 这家工厂千方百计地降低产品的成本。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā gōngchăng qiānfāng-băijì de jiàngdī chănpĭn de chéngběn.
examples.english: 'This factory decreased the production costs of its products by every possible means.'

translations.english: The literal meaning is 'complete heart complete intention,' with a freer translation being 'with all one's heart and all one's soul, wholeheartedly.'

examples.simplified: 公务员应该全心全意地为人民服务。
examples.pinyin: Gōngwùyuán yīnggāi quánxīn-quányì de wèi rénmín fúwù.
examples.english: 'Civil servants should serve the people with all their heart and all their soul.'

examples.simplified: 她一边哭一边说， "我这样全心全意地对你， 你为什么对我有二心？"
examples.pinyin: Tā yì biān kū yì biān shuō, "Wŏ zhèyàng quánxīn-quányì de duì nĭ, nĭ wèishénme duì wŏ yŏu èrxīn?"
examples.english: 'She cried as she said, "I treat you like this with all my heart and all my soul; why are you disloyal to me?" '

translations.english: 无论 means 'no matter' and 如何 means 'how?' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'no matter how, no matter what, in any event, in any case.'

examples.simplified: 你们无论如何都要在三天内把这件事情做完。
examples.pinyin: Nĭmen wúlùn-rúhé dōu yào zài sān tiān nèi bă zhè jiàn shìqing zuòwán.
examples.english: 'No matter what, you should complete this matter within three days.'

examples.simplified: 我看她非常面熟， 但是无论如何都想不起她的名字来。
examples.pinyin: Wŏ kàn tā fēicháng miànshú, dànshì wúlùn-rúhé dōu xiăngbuqĭ tā de míngzi lái.
examples.english: 'When I look at her, she's very familiar, but no matter what I can't think of her name.'

translations.english: 未 means 'did not, not yet.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'never happened before in the past, unprecedented.'

examples.simplified: 她遇到了前所未有的挑战。
examples.pinyin: Tā yùdàole qiánsuŏwèiyŏu de tiăozhàn.
examples.english: 'She encountered unprecedented challenges.'

examples.simplified: 这次行动规模之大、 速度之快， 在历史上是前所未有的。
examples.pinyin: Zhè cì xíngdòng guīmó zhī dà, sùdù zhī kuài, zài lìshĭ shàng shì qiánsuŏwèiyŏu de.
examples.english: 'The scale and speed of the operation this time were unprecedented in history.'

translations.english: 坚定 means 'firm, steadfast' and 移 means 'move, change.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'firm and unchanging.' Freer translations include 'firm and unswerving, steadfast and unchanging, resolute.'

examples.simplified: 在一场政治危机中， 他坚定不移地站在总统一边。
examples.pinyin: Zài yì cháng zhèngzhì wēijī zhōng, tā jiāndìng-bùyì de zhàn zài zŏngtŏng yì biān.
examples.english: 'In a political crisis, he steadfastly stood on the side of the president.'

examples.simplified: 中国将坚定不移地推进改革开放。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó jiāng jiāndìng-bùyí de tuījìn găigé kāifàng.
examples.english: 'China will steadfastly advance the policy of reform and opening up.'

translations.english: 引 means 'attract' and 注目 means 'fix one's eyes on, gaze at.' A literal translation would be 'attract other people's attention.' Freer translations include 'draw attention, noticeable, conspicuous.'

examples.simplified: 在一场引人注目的比赛中， 他的运气及发挥都很好， 因此轻松战胜对手。
examples.pinyin: Zài yì chăng yĭnrén-zhùmù de bĭsài zhōng, tā de yùnqì jí fāhuī dōu hěnhăo, yīncĭ qīngsōng zhànshèng duìshŏu.
examples.english: 'In an attention-grabbing competition, his luck and his performance were both very good, therefore he defeated his opponents without effort.'

examples.simplified: 台湾电子行业的迅速发展格外引人注目。
examples.pinyin: Táiwān diànzĭ hángydè xùnsù fāzhăn géwài yĭnrén-zhùmù.
examples.english: 'The rapid development of Taiwan's electronics industry especially attracts people's attention.'

translations.english: 因 here means 'according to,' 地 means 'locality,' 制 means 'formulate,' and 宜 means 'appropriate measures.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'according to the locality formulate appropriate measures,' with a freer translation being 'adapt to local conditions.'

examples.simplified: 那座城市有几座历史名胜古迹， 因此该城市因地制宜地大力发展旅游业。
examples.pinyin: Nà zuò chéngshì yŏu jĭ zuò lìshĭ míngshèng-gŭjì, yīncĭ gāi chéngshì yīndì-zhìyì de dàlì fāzhăn lǚyóuyè.
examples.english: 'That city has several famous historical sites; therefore, the aforementioned city is vigorously developing tourism, adopting appropriate measures according to concrete local conditions.'

examples.simplified: 国家在推行一些地方政策的时候要因地制宜， 不能搞一刀切。
examples.pinyin: Guójiā zài tuīxíng yìxiē dìfāng zhèngcè de shíhou yào yīndì-zhìyí, bù néng găo yì dāo qiē.
examples.english: 'When the country implements local policies, it should enact appropriate policies based on local conditions; it must not adopt a cookie-cutter approach.'

translations.english: 自 means 'self,' 相 means 'mutually,' 矛 means 'spear,' and 盾 means 'shield.' The connotation is 'self-contradictory.'

examples.simplified: 那个政治家显然在撒谎， 上个月说的话跟这个月说的话自相矛盾。
examples.pinyin: Nàge zhèngzhìjiā xiănrán zài sāhuăng, shàng ge yuè shuōde huà gēn zhège yuè shuō de huà zìxiāng-máodùn.
examples.english: 'That politician is obviously lying; what he said last month and what he said this month are self-contradictory.'

examples.simplified: 他的文章的逻辑不太清楚， 有自相矛盾的地方。
examples.pinyin: Tā de wénzhāng de luóji bú tài qīngchu, yŏu zìxiāng-máodùn de dìfang.
examples.english: 'The logic of his essay is not very clear; there are places that are self-contradictory.'

translations.english: 成 here means 'becoming' and 上 mean 'surpassing.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'tens of thousands of.'

examples.simplified: 为了找到一个好位置来看他们喜爱的歌星， 成千上万的歌迷一下子挤进了体育场。
examples.pinyin: Wèile zhăodào yí ge hăo wèizhì lái kàn tāmen xĭ'ài de gēxīng, chéngqiān-shàngwàn de gēmí yìxiàzi jĭ jìnle tĭyùchăng.
examples.english: 'In order to find a good spot to see their beloved singing star, tens of thousands of fans all at once pushed their way into the stadium.'

examples.simplified: 这部新的法律影响到成千上万人的利益， 所以引起了大家热烈的讨论。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bù xīn de fálù yĭngxiăng dào chéngqiān-shàngwàn rén de lìyì, suŏyĭ yĭnqĭle dàjiā rèliè de tăolùn.
examples.english: 'This new law affected the interests of tens of thousands of people, so it touched off passionate discussions by everyone.'

translations.english: 卓 means 'outstanding, excellent' and 成效 means 'effect, result.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'outstanding and having effect,' with freer translations including 'with outstanding results, highly effective.'

examples.simplified: 近年来， 双方在文化领域内进行了卓有成效的合作。
examples.pinyin: Jìn nián lái, shuāngfāng zài wénhuà lĭngyù nèi jìnxíngle zhuóyŏuchéngxiào de hézuò.
examples.english: 'In recent years, both sides have carried out extremely effective cooperation in cultural spheres.'

examples.simplified: 政府的新经济政策卓有成效， 受到人民的高度赞扬。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngfŭ de xīn jīngjì zhèngcè zhuóyŏuchéngxiào, shòudào rénmín de gāodù zànyáng.
examples.english: 'The government's new economic policy is highly effective; it has received a high degree of approval from the people.'

translations.english: 当 means 'should,' 务 means 'pursue,' and 急 means 'an urgent matter.' The literal meaning is 'an urgent matter that should be pursued.' The whole idiom means 'a matter of great urgency.'

examples.simplified: 如何保持经济持续发展， 是我们的当务之急。
examples.pinyin: Rúhé băochí jīngjì chíxù fāzhăn, shì wŏmen de dāngwù-zhījí.
examples.english: 'How to maintain continued economic development is a matter of great urgency for us.'

examples.simplified: 二十世纪五六十年代， 迅速推广普通话是语言文字工作者的当务之急。
examples.pinyin: Èrshí shìjì wŭ-liùshí niándài, xùnsù tuīguăng pŭtōnghuà shì yŭyán wénzì gōngzuòzhě de dāngwù-zhījí.
examples.english: 'In the 1950s and 60s, the rapid spread of Putonghua was a matter of great urgency for language and writing specialists.'

translations.english: 独立 means 'independent' and 自主 means 'be one's own master.' The whole idiom can be translated as 'independent and being one's own master' or 'independent and possessing the right of self-determination.'

examples.simplified: 中国一贯奉行独立自主的和平外交政策。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó yíguàn fèngxíng dúlì-zìzhŭ de hépíng wàijiāo zhèngcè.
examples.english: 'China has all along pursued an independent and peaceful diplomatic policy.'

examples.simplified: 那位亿万富翁的儿子不想借助他父亲的影响， 而愿意独立自主地开创他自 己的事业。
examples.pinyin: Nà wèi yìwànfùwēng de érzĭ bù xiăng jièzhù tā fùqīn de yĭngxiăng, ér yuànyì dúlì-zìzhŭ de kāichuàng tā zìjĭ de shìyè.
examples.english: 'That billionaire's son does not want to make use of his father's influence, but wants to independently establish his own career.'

translations.english: 脱 means 'break free from, escape from' and 颖 means 'an awn of wheat' (i.e., the bristle-like fiber in the wheat). This refers to the fibers that often stick through a sack of wheat. By metaphor, this has come to mean 'talent being fully exposed, talent revealing itself.'

examples.simplified: 尽管很多人批评高考， 但是高考的确能使很多优秀的人才脱颍而出。
examples.pinyin: Jĭnguăn hěn duō rén pīpíng gāokăo, dànshì gāokăo díquè néng shĭ hěn duō yōuxiù de réncái tuōyĭng-érchū.
examples.english: 'Even though many people criticize the Chinese college entrance examination, it really can make many outstanding people of talent be revealed.'

examples.simplified: 第一次世界大战以后， 梵高的作品脱颍而出， 受到人们的重视。
examples.pinyin: Dìyī cì shìjiè dàzhàn yĭhòu, Fàn Gāo de zuòpĭn tuōyĭng-érchū, shòudào rénmen de zhòngshì.
examples.english: 'After World War I, Van Gogh's works became fully revealed, and were greatly valued by people.'

translations.english: The literal meaning is 'helpless; have no alternative; there's no way out.'

examples.simplified: 他无可奈何地说："对不起， 这件事我帮不了你。"
examples.pinyin: Tā wúkěnàihé de shuō: "Duìbuqĭ, zhè jiàn shì wŏ bāng bùliăo nĭ."
examples.english: 'Having no alternative, he said: "I'm sorry, I can't help you with this."'

examples.simplified: 辛普森案判决以后， 虽然不少人都感到不满， 但是无可奈何。
examples.pinyin: Xīnpŭsēn àn pànjué yĭhòu, suīán bù shăo rén dōu găndào bùmiăn, dànshì wúkěnàihé.
examples.english: 'After the verdict of the Simpson case, although a good number of people felt unsatisfied, there was nothing they could do about it.'

translations.english: The literal meaning is 'no one can explain it; unable to make head or tail of something; be baffled.'

examples.simplified: 他一会儿说这样做， 一会儿说那样做， 大家都感到莫名其妙。
examples.pinyin: Tā yíhuìr shuō zhèyàng zuò, yíhuìr shuō nàyàng zuò, dàjiā dōu găndào mòmíng-qímiào.
examples.english: 'One moment he said to do it this way. The next moment he said to do it that way. Everyone felt baffled.'

examples.simplified: 我的手机莫名其妙地不见了。
examples.pinyin: Wŏ de shŏujī mòmíng-qímiào de bú jiàn le.
examples.english: 'My cell phone inexplicably disappeared.'

translations.english: 自力 means 'rely on one's own efforts' and 更生 means 'revive, rejuvenate.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'one's own strength changes one's life - rely on one's own efforts.'

examples.simplified: 二十世纪六十年代， 中国在失去苏联援助的情况下， 自力更生， 艰苦奋斗， 在尖端科技方面并没有落后太多。
examples.pinyin: Èrshí shìjì liùshí Zhōngguó zài shīqù Sūlián yuánzhù de qíngkuàng xià, zìlì-gēngshēng, jiānkù-fèndòu, zài jiānduān kējì fāngmiàn bìng méiyŏu luòhòu tài duō.
examples.english: 'In the 1960s, China - in the situation of having lost the Soviet Union's assistance - relied on its own efforts in its development and struggled arduously, not falling behind too much in the advanced sciences.'

examples.simplified: 灾区人民自力更生， 很快完成了家园的重建工作。
examples.pinyin: Zāiqū rénmín zìlì-gēngshēng, hěn kuài wánchéngle jiāyuán de chóngjiàn gōngzuò.
examples.english: 'The people of the disaster area relied on their own efforts; they quickly finished the work of reconstructing their homeland.'

translations.english: 既往 means 'formerly, in the past.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'exactly the same as in the past, as before.'

examples.simplified: 中国将一如既往地加强同非洲国家的友好关系。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó jiāng yìrújìwăng de jiāqiáng tóng Fēizhōu guójiā de yŏuhăo guānxi.
examples.english: 'China will, exactly as in the past, strengthen friendly relations with African nations.'

examples.simplified: 今天， 那位老教授一如既往地提前十分钟来到了教室。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān, nà wèi lăo jiàoshòu yìrújìwăng de tíqián shí fēn zhōng láidàole jiàoshì.
examples.english: 'Today that old professor, exactly as in the past, came to the classroom ten minutes ahead of time.'

translations.english: 扑朔 means 'move all over the place' and 迷离 means 'dim, blurred.' The original meaning of this idiom had to do with the difficulty of distinguishing between male and female rabbits (see note below). The extended meaning is 'things are intricate and complicated and difficult to distinguish clearly.' A freer translation is 'confusing, hard to distinguish, all mixed up.'

examples.simplified: 中国古典长篇小说的线索往往比较多， 因此故事情节扑朔迷离。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó gŭdiăn chángpiān xiăoshuō de xiànsuŏ wăngwăng bĭjiào duō, yīncĭ gùshi qíngjié pūshuò-mílí.
examples.english: 'There are often rather many threads in Classical Chinese novels; because of this, the plot of the story is confusing.'

examples.simplified: 这次多方谈判， 由于每一方都尽力维护自己的利益， 所以谈判的前景扑朔迷离。
examples.pinyin: Zhè cì duōfang tánpàn yóuyú měi yì fāng dōu jìnlì wéihù zìjĭ de lìyì, suŏyĭ tánpàn de qiánjĭng pūshuò-mílí
examples.english: 'In the current multiparty negotiations, because each side is trying its best to protect its own interests, the prospects for the negotiations are murky.'

translations.english: The whole idiom means 'unthinkable, inconceivable, unimaginable.'

examples.simplified: 她一百米跑了九秒七零， 简直太不可思议了！
examples.pinyin: Tā yìbăimĭ păole jiŭ miăo qīlíng, jiănzhí tài bùkě-sīyì le!
examples.english: 'She ran 100 meters in 9.7 seconds, which is simply inconceivable!'

examples.simplified: 他的性格有一点儿奇怪， 有时候会做出一些不可思议的事情。
examples.pinyin: Tā de xìnggé yŏu yìdiănr qíguài' yŏu shíhou huì zuò chū yìxiē bùkě-sīyì de shìqing.
examples.english: 'His temperament is a little strange; sometimes he does unthinkable things.'

translations.english: 坚持 means 'persist' and 懈 means 'relax, let up.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'persist and not relax.' Freer translations are 'persist, persevering, unremitting.'

examples.simplified: 不管社会怎么变化， 都应该坚持不懈地抓好青少年的思想教育工作。
examples.pinyin: Bùguăn shèhuì zěnme biànhuà, dōu yīnggāi jiānchí-búxiè de zhuā hăo qingshàonián de sīxiăng jiàoyù gōngzuò.
examples.english: 'No matter how society changes, we should persevere without letting up in getting a good grip on the work of the youth's ideological education.'

examples.simplified: 经过坚持不懈的努力， 艾滋病蔓延的势头终于被遏制了。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò jiānchí-búxiè de nŭli, àizībìng mànyán de shìtóu zhōngyú bèi èzhì le.
examples.english: 'Through persistent efforts, the momentum of the spread of AIDS has finally been contained.'

translations.english: 供 means 'supply,' 应 means 'respond to,' and 求 means 'demand.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'supply does not respond to demand,' with freer translations being 'supply does not meet demand' and 'in short supply.'

examples.simplified: 在美国， 医护人员供不应求。
examples.pinyin: Zài Měiguó, yīhù rényuán gōngbùyìngqiú.
examples.english: 'In the U.S., medical personnel are in short supply.'

examples.simplified: 据说那种中药能够治疗艾滋病， 于是大家纷纷抢购， 那种中药一夜之间 出现了供不应求的情况。
examples.pinyin: Jùshuō nà zhŏng zhōngyào nénggòu zhìliáo àizībìng, yúshì dàjiā fēnfēn qiănggòu, nà zhŏng zhōngyào yí yè zhījiān chūxiànle gōngbùyìngqiú de qíngkuàng.
examples.english: 'It's said that kind of Chinese medicine can cure AIDS, so everyone one after another rushed off to purchase it; regarding that kind of Chinese medicine, overnight there emerged a situation of supply not meeting demand.'

translations.english: 行 means 'put into practice,' 之 means 'it,' and 效 means 'effect, efficiency.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'put it into practice having effect or efficiency.' Freer translations include 'implement with efficiency' and 'efficient.'

examples.simplified: 这是一套行之有效的实验方法， 很多大实验室都使用过， 从来没有出现过 错误。
examples.pinyin: Zhè shì yí tào xíngzhī-yŏuxiào de shíyàn fāngfă, hěn duō dà shíyànshì dōu shĭyòngguo, cónglái méiyŏu chūxiànguo cuòwù.
examples.english: 'This is a very effective method of experimentation; many large laboratories have used it; mistakes have never occurred.'

examples.simplified: 专家呼吁， 有关部门应该采取行之有效的政策来切实保护农民工的权利。
examples.pinyin: Zhuānjiā hūyù, yŏuguān bùmén yīnggāi căiqŭ xíngzhī-yŏuxiào de zhèngcè lái qièshì băohù nóngmíngōng de quánlì.
examples.english: 'Experts have appealed that the relevant departments should adopt effective policies to protect, in a practical manner, the rights of migrant workers.'

translations.english: The literal meaning is 'as is known to all; it is well-known that; it is common knowledge that….'

examples.simplified: 众所周知， 中国人是很讲究饭桌上的客套的。
examples.pinyin: ZhòngsuSzhŏuzhī, Zhōngguórén shì hěn jiăngjiu fànzhuō shàng de kètào de.
examples.english: 'As everyone knows, Chinese people are very particular about etiquette at the dinner table.'

examples.simplified: 孩子学习外语比成年人学得快， 这是众所周知的道理。
examples.pinyin: Háizi xuéxí wàiyŭ bĭ chéngniánrén xué de kuài, zhè shì zhòngsuŏzhōuzhī de dàolĭ.
examples.english: 'Children learn foreign languages faster than adults - this is a truth that is known to all.'

translations.english: 赴 means 'go.' A literal translation is 'with all one's strength go to some place,' with a freer translation being 'put all one's energy into something, spare no effort.'

examples.simplified: 面对困难， 大家全力以赴， 终于克服了困难。
examples.pinyin: Miànduì kùnnán, dàjiā quánlì-yĭfù, zhōngyú kèfúle kùnnán.
examples.english: 'In facing the difficulties, everyone spared no effort, so that in the end they overcame the difficulties.'

examples.simplified: 中国正在全力以赴地进行经济建设， 因此一个稳定的国际环境非常重要。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó zhèngzài quánlì-yĭfù de jìnxíng jīngjì jiànshè, yīncĭ yíge wěndìng de guójì huánjìng fēicháng zhòngyào.
examples.english: 'China is putting all her energy into undertaking economic construction; therefore, a stable international environment is very important.'

translations.english: 理 means ' (according to) reason' and 当然 means 'should be like this.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'of course, naturally, needless to say, it is only right and proper that….'

examples.simplified: 有钱的人拿出一部分钱来回馈社会， 帮助穷人， 这是理所当然的。
examples.pinyin: Yŏuqián de rén náchū yíbùfen qián lái huíkuì shèhuì, bāngzhù qióngrén, zhè shì lĭsuŏ-dāngrán de.
examples.english: 'That rich people should take out part of their money to give back to society and help poor people is only right and proper.'

examples.simplified: 二十一世纪是生物医学的世纪， 所以国家在生物医学方面加大投资是理所当然的事情。
examples.pinyin: Èrshíyī shìjì shì shēngwù yīxué de shìjì, suŏyĭ guójiā zài shēngwù yīxué fāngmiàn jiādà tóuzī shì lĭsuŏ-dāngrán de shìqing.
examples.english: 'The 21st century is the century of biomedicine, so for a country to increase its investment in the area of biomedicine is completely natural.'

translations.english: 面 here means 'side' and 方 means 'direction.' The literal meaning of this idiom is 'the four sides and the eight directions,' with a freer translation being 'all directions, all around, far and wide.'

examples.simplified: 每年的三月， 中国的人大代表都会由四面八方进入北京， 举行一年一次的 全国人民代表大会。
examples.pinyin: Měi nián de sānyuè, Zhōngguó de Réndà Dàibiăo dōu huì yóu sìmiàn-bāfāng jìnrù Běijīng, jŭxíng yì nián yí cì de Quánguó Rénmín Dàibiăo Dàhuì.
examples.english: 'In March of every year, representatives from China's National People's Congress enter Beijing from far and wide to hold the annual National People's Congress.'

examples.simplified: 杭州是中国的旅游胜地， 常年吸引四面八方的游客前去旅游。
examples.pinyin: Hángzhōu shì Zhōngguó de lǚyóu shèngdì, chángnián xīyin sìmiàn-bāfāng de yóukè qiánqù lǚyóu.
examples.english: 'Hangzhou is a famous tourist spot in China; year in and year out it attracts tourists from all over to go there to tour.'

translations.english: 兴致 means 'interest' and 勃勃 means 'full of life, exuberant.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'full of interest and enthusiasm.'

examples.simplified: 总理兴致勃勃地参观了当地的一所小学并且与小学教师进行了亲切的交谈。
examples.pinyin: Zŏnglĭ xìngzhì-bóbó de cānguānle dāngdì de yì suŏ xiăoxué bìngqiě yŭ xiăoxué jiàoshī jìnxíngle qīnqiè de jiāotán.
examples.english: 'Full of enthusiasm, the prime minister visited a local elementary school and engaged in a cordial conversation with the teachers.'

examples.simplified: 新闻发布会后， 总统兴致勃勃地邀请客人到他的乡下别墅继续会谈。
examples.pinyin: Xīnwén fābùhuī hòu, zŏngtŏng xìngzhì-bóbó de yāoqĭng kèrén dào tā de xiāngxià biéshù jìxù huìtán.
examples.english: 'After the news briefing, the prime minister, full of enthusiasm, invited the guests to his country villa to continue the talks.'

translations.english: 鸣 means 'cry (of birds) ' and 惊 means 'surprise.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'one cry surprises others,' with freer translations being 'amaze the world with a single brilliant feat, achieve overnight success.'

examples.simplified: 她在这次奥运会上一鸣惊人， 打破了保持了三十年的世界纪录。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài zhè cì Àoyùnhuì shàng yìmíng-jīngrén, dăpòle băochí le sānshí nián de shìjiè jìlù.
examples.english: 'She amazed the world in this Olympic Games; she broke a world record that had held for thirty years.'

examples.simplified: 我在咖啡店看见了前几天一鸣惊人的女歌手。
examples.pinyin: Wŏ zài kāfēidiàn kànjiànle qián jĭ tiān yìmíng-jīngrén de nǚ gēshŏu.
examples.english: 'In a coffee shop I saw the female singer who had shocked the world a few days ago.'

translations.english: 方 means 'method,' 设 means 'presume, suppose,' and 法 means 'way.' A literal translation is 'think of methods and presume ways,' with a freer translation being 'think of all kinds of ways, try every possible means.'

examples.simplified: 现在很多国家都想方设法吸引外国的优秀人才前来工作。
examples.pinyin: Xiànzài hěn duō guójiā dōu xiăngfăng-shèfá xīyĭn wàiguó de yōuxiù réncái qiánlái gōngzuò.
examples.english: 'Now many countries try every possible means to attract foreigners of talent to come to their countries to work.'

examples.simplified: 遇到困难的时候他总是自己想方设法去解决。
examples.pinyin: Yùdào kùnnán de shíhou tā zŏngshì zìjĭ xiăngfāng-shèfá qù jiějué.
examples.english: 'When encountering difficulties, he always tries every possible way to resolve them by himself.'

translations.english: 千 means 'thousand,' 家 means 'home,' 万 means 'ten thousand,' and 户 means 'household.' The literal translation of this idiom is 'thousand families ten thousand households,' with freer translations being 'innumerable households, every family.'

examples.simplified: 即使在农村， 计算机也早已走进千家万户， 不再是高档的商品了。
examples.pinyin: Jíshĭ zài nóngcūn, jìsuànjī yě zăoyĭ zŏujìn qiānjiā-wànhù, bùzài shi gāodàng de shāngpĭn le.
examples.english: 'Even in the countryside, computers also early on already entered innumerable households, no longer being upmarket merchandise.'

examples.simplified: 春节的时候， 千家万户喜气洋洋， 全都笼罩在节日的喜庆气氛中。
examples.pinyin: Chūnjié de shíhou, qiānjiā-wànhù xĭqì-yángyáng, quándōu lŏngzhào zài jiérì de xĭqìng qìfēn zhōng.
examples.english: 'At the time of the Chinese New Year, multitudes of families are bursting with happiness; they are all enveloped in the celebratory atmosphere of the holiday.'

translations.english: 举 means 'raise,' 足 means 'foot,' 轻 means 'light,' and 重 means 'heavy.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'raise one's feet and influence lightness and heaviness,' with freer translations being 'play a decisive role, be pivotal in importance.'

examples.simplified: 中国的家电产品在世界市场上占有举足轻重的地位。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó de jiādiàn chănpin zài shìjiè shìchăng shàng zhànyŏu jŭzù-qīngzhòng de dīwèi.
examples.english: 'Chinese household electrical appliances occupy a pivotal position in the world market.'

examples.simplified: 法国在欧洲的政治事务中有着举足轻重的影响。
examples.pinyin: Făguó zài ōuzhōu de zhèngzhì shìwù zhōng yŏuzhe jŭzù-qīngzhòng de yĭngxiăng.
examples.english: 'France has a pivotal influence in Europe's political affairs.'

translations.english: 义 means 'righteousness,' 勇 means 'courage,' and 为 means 'do, make.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'see what is right and have the courage to do it.'

examples.simplified: 现在社会上特别缺乏见义勇为的行为和观念了。
examples.pinyin: Xiànzài shèhuì shàng tèbié quēfá jiànyì-yŏngwéi de xíngwéi hé guānniàn le.
examples.english: 'Nowadays in society we especially lack the kind of behavior and concept where you see what is right and have the courage to do it.'

examples.simplified: 大会表彰了二十位见义勇为的英雄人物。
examples.pinyin: Dàhuì biăozhāngle èrshí wèi jiànyì-yŏngwéi de yīngxióng rénwù.
examples.english: 'At the mass meeting, they publicly commended twenty heroes who saw what was right and had the courage to do it.'

translations.english: 举 here means 'whole,' 世 means 'world,' 瞩 means 'gaze at,' and 目 means 'eyes.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'the whole world gazes at with the eyes,' with freer translations including 'the entire world focuses its attention on' and 'attract world-wide attention.'

examples.simplified: 中国在改革开放以后的三十年中， 取得了举世瞩目的成就。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó zài găigé kāifàng yĭhòu de sānshí nián zhōng, qŭdéle jŭshì-zhŭmù de chéngjiù.
examples.english: 'In the thirty years after carrying out reforms and opening up to the outside world, China obtained achievements that have attracted world-wide attention.

examples.simplified: 最高法院会不会判总统有罪， 这成了举世瞩目的焦点。
examples.pinyin: Zuì Gāo Făyuàn huì bú hui pàn zŏngtŏng yŏu zuì, zhè chéngle jŭshì-zhŭmù de jiāodiăn.
examples.english: 'Whether or not the Supreme Court will judge the president guilty has become the focus of world-wide attention.'

translations.english: 翼翼 means 'cautious.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'careful and cautious.' It is often used adverbially in the sense 'cautiously, carefully.'

examples.simplified: 考古工作者小心翼翼地检查考古现场的每一件东西。
examples.pinyin: Kăogŭ gōngzuòzhě xiăoxīn-yìyì de jiănchá kăogŭ xiànchăng de měi yí jiàn dōngxi.
examples.english: 'Archeological workers very carefully and cautiously inspect every item from the archeological site.'

examples.simplified: 他的生活过于谨慎， 凡事都小心翼翼， 生怕惹别人不高兴。
examples.pinyin: Tā de shēnghuó guòyú jĭnshèn, fán shì dōu xiăoxīn-yìyì, shēngpà rě biérén bù gāoxìng.
examples.english: 'His life is overcautious; regarding every matter, he is careful and cautious, deathly afraid that he will cause others to be upset.'

translations.english: 源 means 'source,' 远 means 'distant,' 流 means 'the length the water flows,' and 长 means 'long.' A literal translation is 'the source (of a stream) is distant and (the water) flows a long distance.' Freer translations include 'age-old, long-standing, well-established.'

examples.simplified: 两国人民的友谊源远流长。
examples.pinyin: Liăng guó rénmín de yŏuyì yuányăn-liúcháng.
examples.english: 'The friendship between the peoples of the two countries is long-standing and well-established.'

examples.simplified: 中国有着源远流长的茶文化。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó yŏuzhe yuányuăn-liúcháng de chá wénhuà.
examples.english: 'China has an age-old tea culture.'

translations.english: 弄 here means 'use,' 虚 means 'empty,' 作 means 'fabricate,' and 假 means 'false.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'use emptiness to create a false appearance,' with a freer translation being 'use trickery or deception to create a false appearance.'

examples.simplified: 那家大公司在对外公布业绩报告的时候弄虛作假， 欺骗投资者。
examples.pinyin: Nà jiā dà gōngsī zài duì wài gōngbù yèjì bàogào de shíhou nòngxū-zuòjiă, qīpiàn tóuzīzhě.
examples.english: 'When that large company announced its business report to the outside, it used trickery to create a false appearance, deceiving the investors.'

examples.simplified: 应该严厉批评弄虛作假的行为和风气。
examples.pinyin: Yīnggāi yání pīpíng nòngxū-zuòjiă de xíngwéi hé fēngqì.
examples.english: 'One should severely criticize behavior or an atmosphere where deception is used to create a false appearance.'

translations.english: A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'self talk self say,' with freer translations being 'talk to oneself, think out loud.'

examples.simplified: 她自言自语地说： "真奇怪， 明明刚才还在这里， 怎么一会儿就不见了呢？"
examples.pinyin: Tā zìyán-zìyŭ de shuō: "Zhān qíguài, míngmíng gāngcái hái zài zhèlĭ, zěnme yíhuìr jiù bú jiàn le ne?"
examples.english: 'She said to herself: "That's really strange; it clearly was here just a minute ago, how could it disappear so quickly?"'

examples.simplified: 他跟别人说话的时候不看对方的眼睛， 声音又小， 别人觉得他好像自言自语。
examples.pinyin: Tā gēn biérén shuōhuà de shíhou bú kàn duìfāng de yănjing, shēngyīn yòu xiăo, biérén juéde tā hăoxiàng zìyàn-zìyŭ.
examples.english: 'When he talks with others, he doesn't look into their eyes, and his voice is low; other people think it's as if he's talking to himself.'

translations.english: 兵 here means 'military force.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'on paper speak of warfare.' The extended meaning is 'engage in empty talk that does nothing to solve problems.' One freer translation is 'be an armchair strategist.'

examples.simplified: 她的计划不过是纸上谈兵， 没有什么实际价值。
examples.pinyin: Tā de jìhuà búguò shì zhĭshàng-tánbīng, méiyŏu shénme shíjì jiàzhí.
examples.english: 'Her plan is only empty talk; it has no real value.'

examples.simplified: 他是一个只会纸上谈兵的家伙， 并没解决过实际问题。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yí ge zhĭ huì zhĭshàng-tánbīng de jiāhuo, bìng méi jiějuéguo shíjì wèntí.
examples.english: 'He's a fellow who can only engage in armchair strategies; he has never solved any real problems.'

translations.english: 副 means 'correspond to,' 其 means 'its,' and 实 means 'reality, truth.' The literal meaning is 'the name corresponds to its reality,' with a freer translation being 'worthy of the name or reputation.'

examples.simplified: 虽然在《美国新闻与世界报道》上没有排名第一， 但是大家都认为哈佛 大学才是名副其实的世界上最好的大学。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán zài
examples.english: 'Even though it wasn't ranked as number one in

examples.simplified: 到了中国， 你就会深刻体会到中国是名副其实的自行车王国。
examples.pinyin: Dàole Zhōngguó, nĭ jiù huì shēnkè tĭhuìdào Zhōngguó shì míngfu-qíshí de zìxíngchē wángguó.
examples.english: 'When you arrive in China, you will have the profound realization that China is worthy of the name "kingdom of bicycles."'

translations.english: 异 means 'different.' The literal translation of this idiom is 'day new month different,' with a freer translation being 'change rapidly with each new day.'

examples.simplified: 当代科学技术的发展日新月异， 人们的生活越来越舒适。
examples.pinyin: Dāngdài kēxué jìshù de fāzhăn rìxīn-yuèyì, rénmen de shēnghuó yuè lái yuè shūshì.
examples.english: 'Modern science and technology have been developing rapidly with each new day, and people's lives have been getting more and more comfortable.'

examples.simplified: 改革开放后的几十年内， 北京、 上海等大城市发生了日新月异的变化。
examples.pinyin: Găigé kāifàng hòu de jĭ shí nián nèi, Běijīng, Shànghăi děng dà chéngshì fāshēngle rìxīn-yuèyì de biànhuà.
examples.english: 'In the decades since the reforms and opening up to the outside world, with the passing of each new day there have taken place rapid changes in the big cities such as Beijing and Shanghai.'

translations.english: 得 means 'obtain,' 天 means 'nature,' 独 means 'by oneself,' and 厚 means 'favorable.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'by oneself obtain favorable natural conditions,' with freer translations being 'enjoy exceptional advantages' and 'in a favorable position.'

examples.simplified: 欧洲人学语言有得天独厚的优势。
examples.pinyin: ōuzhōu rén xué yŭyán yŏu détiān-dúhòu de yōushi.
examples.english: 'Europeans enjoy exceptional advantages in learning languages.'

examples.simplified: 深圳靠近香港， 因此发展经济有得天独厚的条件。
examples.pinyin: Shenzhèn kàojìn Xiānggăng, yīncĭ fāzhăn jīngjì yŏu détiān-dúhòu de tiáojiàn.
examples.english: 'Shenzhen is close to Hong Kong; therefore, with regard to developing the economy, it has extremely favorable conditions.'

translations.english: 情 means 'emotions' and 禁 means 'control, restrain.' A literal translation is 'emotions not by oneself restrain.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'unable to restrain one's emotions, excited, cannot help.'

examples.simplified: 看完这部电影， 她情不自禁地大声说， "太好了！ 太好了！"
examples.pinyin: Kànwán zhè bù diànyĭng, tā qíngbúzìjìn de dàshēng shuō, "Tài hăole! Tài hăole!"
examples.english: 'When she had seen the movie, she said, unable to restrain her emotions, "It's fantastic, it's fantastic!"'

examples.simplified: 听到那首熟悉的音乐， 他情不自禁地跳起舞来了。
examples.pinyin: Tīngdào nà shŏu shúxī de yīnyuè, tā qíngbúzìjìn de tiàoqĭ wŭ láile.
examples.english: 'When he heard that familiar piece of music, he began dancing, unable to restrain his emotions.'

translations.english: 然 means 'like that.' 不以为然 means 不以之为然 'not take it to be like that.' A freer translation would be 'think otherwise, take exception to, disapprove.'

examples.simplified: 当别人对她的成绩感到很惊奇的时候， 她却不以为然地说， "没什么了不起的。"
examples.pinyin: Dāng biérén duì tā de chéngjì găndào hěn jīngqí de shíhou, tā què bùyĭwéirán de shuō, "Méi shénme liăobùqĭ de."
examples.english: 'When others felt amazement at her grades, she took exception by saying, "It's nothing remarkable."'

examples.simplified: 不少年轻人对老年人的看法很不以为然， 认为他们的看法通通陈旧了。
examples.pinyin: Bùshăo niánqīngrén duì lăoniánrén de kànfà hěn bùyĭwéirán, rènwéi tāmen de kànfă tōngtōng chénjiù le.
examples.english: 'The view that many young people have of older people is very disapproving, believing that their views are all outdated.'

translations.english: 络绎 means 'continuous, endless' and 绝 means 'break off, cut off.' The literal meaning is 'endless and not cutting off,' with a freer translation being 'continuous flow, unending stream.'

examples.simplified: 他是名医， 所以找他看病的人络绎不绝。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì míngyī, suŏyĭ zhăo tā kànbìng de rén luòyì-bùjué.
examples.english: 'He's a famous doctor, so there is an unending stream of people who seek him out for medical treatment.'

examples.simplified: 每天， 到天安门广场瞻仰毛泽东遗体的人络绎不绝。
examples.pinyin: Měi tiān, dào Tiānānmén Guăngchăng zhānyăng Máo Zédōng yítĭ de rén luòyì-bùjué.
examples.english: 'Every day there is a continuous stream of people who go to Tiananmen Square to pay their respects to the remains of Mao Zedong.'

translations.english: 约 means 'agree' and 同 means 'same.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'have the same view or take the same action as someone else but without prior consultation with them.'

examples.simplified: 当老师问是谁打碎了玻璃的时候， 两个学生不约而同地说 "是他"。
examples.pinyin: Dāng lăoshī wèn shì shéi dăsuìle bōli de shíhou, liăng ge xuésheng bùyuē'értóng de shuō 'shì tā.'
examples.english: 'When the teacher asked who had broken the glass, two students spoke up simultaneously: "It was him!"'

examples.simplified: 提到北京， 大家会不约而同地想到故宫和天安门。
examples.pinyin: Tídào Běijing, dàjiā huì bùyuē értóng de xiăngdào Gùgōng hé Tiānānmén.
examples.english: 'When you mention Beijing, everyone automatically thinks of the Forbidden Palace and Tiananmen.'

translations.english: The literal meaning is 'thousand thousand ten thousand ten thousand,' with a freer translation being 'tens of thousands, numerous, a great number of.'

examples.simplified: 医学上的这项重大发现挽救了千千万万患者的生命。
examples.pinyin: Yīxué shàng de zhè xiàng zhòngdà fāxiàn wănjiùle qiānqiān-wànwàn huànzhě de shēngmìng.
examples.english: 'This major medical discovery saved the lives of thousands upon thousands of sufferers.'

examples.simplified: 他的演讲打动了千千万万的听众的心。
examples.pinyin: Tā de yănjiăng dădòngle qiānqiān-wànwàn de tīngzhòng de xīn.
examples.english: 'His lecture touched the hearts of tens of thousands of people in the audience.'

translations.english: 齐 means 'together,' 心 means 'heart, mind,' and 协力 means 'join forces, combine efforts.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'put together minds combine forces.' This refers to minds thinking together, and strength and forces working together. A freer translation is 'make a united effort, work as one.'

examples.simplified: 他们三个人齐心协力， 顺利地完成了那项工作。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen sān ge rén qíxīn-xiélì, shùnlì de wánchéngle nà xiàng gōngzuò.
examples.english: 'The three of them put forth a united effort, and smoothly completed that piece of work.'

examples.simplified: 国际社会应该齐心协力, 共同打击恐怖主义.
examples.pinyin: Guójì shèhuì yīnggāi qíxīn-xiélì, gòngtóng dăjī kŏngbù zhŭyì.
examples.english: 'Global society should make a united effort, and jointly combat terrorism.'

translations.english: 卧 means 'lie down,' 薪 means 'firewood,' 尝 means 'taste, lick,' and 胆 means 'gall bladder.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'sleep on firewood and taste gall bladder.' This is a metaphor for 'undergo hardships to achieve one's purpose' or 'steel oneself for revenge.'

examples.simplified: 中国女排经过十多年的卧薪尝胆， 终于又回到世界顶尖水平。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó nǚpái jīngguò shí duō nián de wòxīn-chángdăn, zhōngyú yòu huídào shìjiè dĭngjiān shuĭpíng.
examples.english: 'Chinese women's volleyball, after steeling itself for revenge for more than ten years, finally again returned to the world's top level.'

examples.simplified: 他被赶下台之后，卧薪尝胆， 八年以后重新当选总统。
examples.pinyin: Tā bèi gănxià tái zhīhòu, wòxīn-chángdăn, bā nián yĭhòu chóngxīn dāngxuăn zŏngtŏng.
examples.english: 'After being driven out of office, he underwent great hardships, steeling himself for revenge, and eight years later was once again elected president.'

translations.english: 街 means 'street' and 巷 means 'lane,' with the pattern 大 … 小 … here meaning 'all.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'all the streets and lanes.'

examples.simplified: 春节的时候，北京的大街小巷都挂满了红色的灯笼。
examples.pinyin: Chūnjié de shíhou, Běijīng de dàjiē-xiăoxiàng dōu guà mănle hóngsè de dēnglóng.
examples.english: 'At the time of the Chinese New Year, red lanterns hang in all of Beijing's streets and lanes.'

examples.simplified: 小贩们沿着大街小巷叫卖他们的东西。
examples.pinyin: Xiăofànmen yánzhe dàjiē-xiăoxiàng jiàomài tāmen de dōngxi.
examples.english: 'Peddlers were hawking their wares along all the streets and lanes.'

translations.english: 由 means 'from' or 'by,' 自 means 'oneself,' and 主 means 'be master of.' The literal meaning of the whole idiom is 'not be master over oneself.' A freer translation would be 'not be able to restrain oneself, feel an irresistible urge; involuntarily, spontaneously.'

examples.simplified: 那个男人坐得离她很近，于是她不由自主地往旁边挪了一下。
examples.pinyin: Nàge nánrén zuò de lí tā hěn jìn, yúshì tā bùyóuzìzhŭ de wăng pángbiān nuóle yíxià.
examples.english: 'That man was sitting quite close to her, and so without being aware of it, she automatically moved a bit to the side.'

examples.simplified: 地震了，人们不由自主地从房间里往外跑。
examples.pinyin: Dìzhènle, rénmen bùyóuzìzhŭ de cóng fángjiān lĭ wăng wài păo.
examples.english: 'When the earthquake occurred, people spontaneously ran from inside their rooms to the outside.'

translations.english: 应 means 'respond to,' 运 here means 'fate' or 'opportune moment,' and 生 means 'arise.' The whole idiom means 'arise in response to the needs of the times.'

examples.simplified: 因为人们的实际购买力下降，各种形式的"一元店"应运而生。
examples.pinyin: Yīnwèi rénmen de shíjì goumàilì xiàjiàng, gèzhŏng xíngshì de "yīyuàndiàn" yìngyùn-érshēng.
examples.english: 'Because people's real purchasing power has declined, various forms of "one dollar stores" have arisen in response to the needs of the times.'

examples.simplified: 美式快餐在中国获得巨大成功，于是中国的快餐店也应运而生。
examples.pinyin: Měishì kuàicān zài Zhōngguó huòdé jùdà chénggōng, yùshì Zhōngguó de kuàicāndiàn yě yìngyùn-érshēng.
examples.english: 'U.S.-style fast food achieved great success in China, and so Chinese fast food establishments also arose in response to the needs of the times.'

translations.english: 形 means 'outward appearance' and 色 means 'color.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'of all different outward appearances and colors, of all kinds.'

examples.simplified: 在火车站里，你会遇到形形色色的人，有急着乘车的旅客，也有各种各样 的骗子和小偷儿。
examples.pinyin: Zài huŏchezhàn lĭ, nĭ huì yùdào xíngxíng-sèsè de rén, yŏu jízhe chéngchē de lŭkè, yě yŏu gèzhŏng-gèyàng de piànzi hé xiăotōur.
examples.english: 'In a train station, you will meet all kinds of people; there are travelers anxious to get on their trains, and there are also all kinds of swindlers and thieves.'

examples.simplified: 最近社会上出现了形形色色的投资公司，基本上都是骗钱的。
examples.pinyin: Zuìjìn shèhuī shàng chūxiànle xíngxíng-sèsè de tóuzī gōngsī, jīběnshàng dōu shì piàn qián de.
examples.english: 'Recently in society there has appeared every kind of investment company; basically they're all out to cheat you of your money.'

translations.english: 名 means 'name,' 歹[I means 'ranked at,' and 前茅 means 'front ranks.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'one's name is ranked at the top of the list.' This refers to coming out in front or on top in an examination or a competition. A freer English translation is 'rank among the very top, be at the top of the list.'

examples.simplified: 他的学习成绩一向很优秀，每次考试都名列前茅。
examples.pinyin: Tā de xuéxí chéngjì yíxiàng hěn yōuxiù, měi cì kăoshì dōu míngliè-qiànmào.
examples.english: 'His achievements in his studies have always been superior; every time he tests he comes out on top.'

examples.simplified: 这个品牌的啤酒的销量在国际市场名列前茅。
examples.pinyin: Zhège pĭnpái de píjiŭ de xiāoliàng zài guójì shìchăng mínglié-qiánmáo.
examples.english: 'Sales volume for this brand of beer is at the top of the list in international markets.'

translations.english: 喻 means 'understand,' 户 means 'household,' and 晓 means 'know.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is '(every) family understands and (every) household knows,' with freer translations being 'known to every family,' 'widely known' and 'a household word.'

examples.simplified: 在美国， Oprah Winfrey 是一位家喻户晓的人物。
examples.pinyin: Zài Měiguó, Oprah Winfrey shì yí wèi jiāyù-hùxiăo de rénwù.
examples.english: 'In the U.S., Oprah Winfrey is a person who has become a household word.'

examples.simplified: 她的歌声美妙动人， 一夜之间成了家喻户晓的明星。
examples.pinyin: Tā de gēshēng měimiào dòngrén, yí yè zhījiān chéngle jiāyù-hùxiăo de míngxīng.
examples.english: 'Her singing voice is splendid and touching; she has overnight become a widely known star.'

translations.english: 兴 means 'interest, enthusiasm,' 采 means 'energy, spirit,' and 烈 means 'strong.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'interest high energy strong,' with a freer translation being 'in high spirits, jubilant, elated.'

examples.simplified: 在回家的路上，球迷们依然兴高采烈地谈论着刚才的那场比赛。
examples.pinyin: Zài huíjiā de lùshang, qiúmímen yìrán xìnggāo-căiliè de tánlùnzhe gāngcái de nà chăng bĭsài.
examples.english: 'On their way home, the sports fans were still elatedly discussing that game just now.'

examples.simplified: 他今天的情绪特别好，像过年一样兴高采烈。
examples.pinyin: Tā jīntiān de qíngxù tèbié hăo, xiàng guònián yíàng xìnggāo-căiliè.
examples.english: 'His mood today is especially good, as jubilant as at Chinese New Year.'

translations.english: 排 means 'remove,' 忧 means 'worry,' 解 means 'relieve,' and 难 means 'difficulty.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'remove worries relieve difficulties.' A freer translation is 'help other people overcome their difficulties.'

examples.simplified: 我们要多为残疾人排忧解难。
examples.pinyin: Wŏmen yào duō wèi cánjírén páiyōu-jiěnàn
examples.english: 'We should do more to alleviate concerns and relieve difficulties for handicapped people.'

examples.simplified: 那位市长在竞选的时候提出要为市民们排忧解难， 解决他们生活上的实际困难。
examples.pinyin: Nà wèi shìzhăng zài jìngxuăn de shíhou tíchū yào wèi shìmínmen páiyōu-jiěnàn, jiějué tāmen shēnghuó shàng de shíjì kùnnán.
examples.english: 'That mayor at the time of the election proposed that he would on behalf of the city';s residents alleviate their concerns and relieve their worries, and solve the real difficulties in their lives.'

translations.english: 自 means 'self,' 强 means 'strengthen,' and 息 means 'stop.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'strengthen oneself not stop,' with freer translations being 'strive constantly for self-improvement.'

examples.simplified: 他热情地鼓励大家越是在不利的情况下， 越要发扬自强不息的民族精神。
examples.pinyin: Tā rèqíng de gŭlì dàjiā yuè shì zài búlì de qíngkuàng xià, yuè yào fāyáng zìqiáng-bùxī de mínzú jīngshen.
examples.english: 'He enthusiastically encouraged everyone: the less beneficial the circumstances, the more one should promote a national spirit of constantly striving for self-improvement.'

examples.simplified: 他们自强不息、 顽强拼搏的精神值得我们学习。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen zìqiáng-bùxī wánqiáng pīnbó de jīngshen zhíde wŏmen xuéxí.
examples.english: 'Their spirit of constantly striving for self-improvement and tenaciously struggling is worthy of our learning from.'

translations.english: 走马 means 'ride a galloping horse' and 观 means 'look at.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'look at flowers while riding on a galloping horse.' This is a metaphor for 'observe in a hurried and rough manner' or 'give a cursory look and gain a shallow understanding of something.'

examples.simplified: 他在纽约只玩儿了一天， 只能算是走马观花， 了解不深入。
examples.pinyin: Ta zài Niŭubē zhĭ wánrle yì tiān, zhĭ néng suàn shì zŏumă-guānhuā, liŭojiŭ bù shŭnrù.
examples.english: 'He visited New York for only one day, which can only be considered a superficial visit; he does not have a deep understanding.'

examples.simplified: 我走马观花地参观了附近的几家公司。
examples.pinyin: Wŭ zŏumă-guānhuā de cŭnguŭnle fùjìn de jŭ jiŭ gōngsī.
examples.english: 'I quickly and cursorily visited several nearby companies.'

translations.english: 长 means 'long,' 治 means 'order,' 久 means 'long in time,' and 安 means 'peace.' The literal meaning of the whole idiom is 'long order long peace,' with a freer translation being 'long-term peace, long-lasting peace and good government.'

examples.simplified: 这是关系国家发展和长治久安的重大问题。
examples.pinyin: Zhè shì guīnxì guójiī fīzhīn hé chángzhì-jiī 'īn de zhòngdà wèntí.
examples.english: 'This is a major issue that has a bearing on the country's development and long-term peace and order.'

examples.simplified: 只有彻底根除黑势力， 社会才能长治久安。
examples.pinyin: Zĭyŏu chèdĭ gēnchú hēishìlì, shèhuì cáinéng chángzhì-jiŭ'ūn.
examples.english: 'Only if we thoroughly eliminate unlawful influence can society have long-term peace and order.'

translations.english: 安 means 'peaceful,' 居 means 'live, reside,' 乐 means 'happy,' and 业 means 'business, occupation.' A literal translation is 'live peacefully and be content with one's occupation.' Freer translations include 'live and work in peace and happiness, lead a peaceful and happy life.'

examples.simplified: 那个城市经济发达， 社会治安良好， 人们安居乐业。
examples.pinyin: Nàge chéngshì jīngjì fādá, shèhuì zhì'ān liánghăo, rénmen anje-lèyè.
examples.english: 'That city's economy is developed, and public security is good; its people live peacefully and work happily.'

examples.simplified: 南极洲常年严寒， 但是企鹅却能在那里安居乐业。
examples.pinyin: Nánjízhōu chángnián yánhán, dànshì qĭ'é què néng zài nàlĭ ānjū-lèyè.
examples.english: 'Antarctica is bitterly cold throughout the year, but penguins can live there peacefully and happily.'

translations.english: 惊心 means 'startle the heart' and 动魄 means 'move the soul.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'soul-stirring.'

examples.simplified: : 电影 《泰坦尼克》 场面宏大， 看得观众惊心动魄。
examples.pinyin: Diànyĭng
examples.english: 'The movie

examples.simplified: : 经过一场惊心动魄的较量， 狮子最终战胜了老虎。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò yì cháng jīngxīn-dòngpò de jiàoliàng, shīzi zuìzhōng zhànshèngle lăohŭ.
examples.english: 'After a soul-stirring contest, the lion eventually defeated the tiger.'

translations.english: 脚 means 'foot,' 踏 means 'step on,' and 实 means 'real, true, solid.' The literal meaning is 'plant one's feet on solid ground,' with a freer translation being 'conscientious and dependable, with honesty and dedication.'

examples.simplified: : 所有的人都应该脚踏实地地做好自己的本职工作。
examples.pinyin: Suŏyŏu de rén dōu yănggāi jiăotà-shídì de zuòhăo zìjĭ de běnzhí gōngzuò.
examples.english: 'Everyone should with honesty and dedication do a good job performing their own work.'

examples.simplified: 她为人很谦虚， 脚踏实地， 从来不炫耀自己。
examples.pinyin: Tā wéirén hěn qiānxe, jiăotà-shídì, cónglái bú xuànyào zìjĭ.
examples.english: 'As a person, she's modest; she's conscientious and dependable, and she never shows off.'

translations.english: 徇 means 'submit to,' 私 means 'personal gains,' and 舞弊 means 'fraudulent or corrupt practices.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'play favoritism and commit irregularities, do wrong to serve one's relatives or friends.'

examples.simplified: 他发生了徇私舞弊的丑闻， 因此， 寻求连任几乎不可能。
examples.pinyin: Tā fāshēngle xùnsī-wŭbì de chŏuwén, yīncĭ, xúnqiú liánrèn jīhū bù kěnéng.
examples.english: 'He was involved in a scandal that involved playing favoritism and committing irregularities; therefore, it is almost impossible for him to seek to serve another term in office.'

examples.simplified: 在没有法律监督的国家里， 官员们常常徇私舞弊。
examples.pinyin: Zài méiyŏu fălǜ jiāndū de guójiā lĭ, guānyuánmen chángcháng xùnsī-wŭbì.
examples.english: In countries where there is no legal supervision, government officials often play favoritism and commit irregularities.

translations.english: 措 means 'handle.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'not know what to do.'

examples.simplified: 他站在那里不知所措， 非常尴尬。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhàn zài nàli bùzhī-suŏcuò, fēicháng gān'gà.
examples.english: 'He stood there not knowing what to do, it being extremely awkward.'

examples.simplified: 这个消息对她来说太突然了， 她不知所措地说， "这是真的吗?"
examples.pinyin: Zhège xiāoxi duì tā lái shuō tài tūrán le, tā bùzhī-suŏcuò de shuō: 'Zhè shì zhēnde ma?'
examples.english: 'This news was too sudden for her; bewildered, she said, "Is this true?"'

translations.english: 来 means 'cause to come,' 之 means 'it,' and 易 means 'easy.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'causing it to come is not easy.' Freer translations include 'not easily obtained, hard-won, hard-earned.'

examples.simplified: 父母教育孩子珍惜来之不易的家庭条件。
examples.pinyin: Fùmŭ jiàoyù háizi zhēnxī láizhī-búyì de jiātíng tiáojiàn.
examples.english: 'In educating their children, the parents cherish the family conditions, which were not easily obtained.'

examples.simplified: 这样的成果确实来之不易。
examples.pinyin: Zhèyàng de chéngguŏ quèshí láizhī-búyì.
examples.english: 'This kind of result is indeed hard-won.'

translations.english: 发扬 means 'promote' and 光大 means '(make) brilliant.' The whole idiom can be translated as 'promote, develop, enhance, carry forward.'

examples.simplified: 我们应该把前人艰苦奋斗的精神不断发扬光大。
examples.pinyin: Wŏmen yīnggāi bă qiánrén jiānkŭ-fèndòu de jīngshen búduàn fāyáng-guāngdà.
examples.english: 'We should continuously promote and enhance the spirit of arduous struggle of the people who came before.'

examples.simplified: 这些都是我们宝贵的精神财富， 我们不但不应该抛弃它们， 反而应该使它们发扬光大。
examples.pinyin: Zhèxiē dōu shì wŏmen băoguì de jīngshen cáifù, wŏmen búdàn bù yīnggāi pāoqì tāmen, făn'ér yīnggāi shĭ tāmen fāyáng-guāngdà.
examples.english: 'All these are our precious spiritual riches; not only should we not abandon them, but we should cause them to be promoted and developed.'

translations.english: 顾 means 'look at, take into account.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'take the entire situation into account, consider the overall situation.'

examples.simplified: : 她做事坚持原则， 顾全大局， 不计较个人得失。
examples.pinyin: Tā zuòshì jiānchí yuánzé, gùquán-dàjú, bú jìjiào gèrén déshī.
examples.english: 'In her work she sticks to principles and considers the overall situation, disregarding personal gains or losses.'

examples.simplified: : 为了顾全大局， 他解雇了自己的办公室主任。
examples.pinyin: Wèile gùquán-dàjú, tā jiĕgùle zìjĭ de bàngōngshì zhŭrèn.
examples.english: 'Taking the overall situation into account, he laid off his own office manager.'

translations.english: 八仙 refers to the Eight Immortals (in Taoism) and 过海 means 'cross the (East China) sea.' A literal translation is 'the Eight Immortals cross the East China Sea.' The extended meaning is 'use one's own particular talents to solve problems' or 'use one's own individual resources to achieve great goals.'

examples.simplified: : 自从旅游业放开之后， 旅行社之间竞争激烈， 八仙过海， 各显神通， 想尽办法吸引游客。
examples.pinyin: Zìcóng lǚyóuyè fàngkāi zhīhòu, lǚxíngshè zhījiān jìngzhēng jīliè, bāxiān-guòhăi, gè xiăn shén tōng, xiăngjìn bànfă xīyĭn yóukè.
examples.english: 'Ever since the loosening up of the travel industry, travel agencies have been competing intensely with each other; when the Eight Immortals crossed the sea, each of them showed her or his own remarkable power; (similarly, the various travel agencies) are doing everything in their power to attract tourists.'

examples.simplified: : 今天的晚会没有固定的节目， 请大家八仙过海， 各显其能， 把你们的本事 都使出来。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān de wănhuì méiyŏu gùdìng de jiémù, qĭng dàjiā bāxiān-guòhăi, gè xiăn qínéng, bă nĭmen de běnshi dōu shĭchūlái.
examples.english: 'This evening's party has no set program; as when the Eight Immortals were crossing the sea, each of you please show your own abilities and put forth your own talents.'

translations.english: 自然 means 'naturally.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'naturally, of itself.'

examples.simplified: 经济高度发展了， 民主自然而然地成了大家讨论的话题。
examples.pinyin: Jīngjì gāodù fāzhănle, mínzhŭ zìrán-érrán de chéngle dàjiā tăolùn de huàtí.
examples.english: 'The economy has developed to a high degree; democracy has naturally become a topic of conversation discussed by everyone.'

examples.simplified: 人的生、 老、 病、 死都是自然而然的事， 你抗拒不了的。
examples.pinyin: Rén de shēng, lăo, bìng, sĭ dōu shì zìrán-érrán de shì, nī kàngjùbùliăo de.
examples.english: 'Human beings' birth, aging, illness, and death all are natural things, you can't defy them.'

translations.english: 身 means 'oneself' and 则 means 'rule, model.' A literal translation is 'take oneself as the model,' with a freer translation being 'set an example for others, practice what one preaches.'

examples.simplified: 周恩来总理严以律己、 以身作则， 为别人树立了榜样。
examples.pinyin: Zhōu Ēnlái zŏnglĭ yányĭlǜjĭ, yĭshēn-zuòzé, wèi biérén shùlìle băngyàng.
examples.english: 'Premier Zhou Enlai was strict on himself and set himself as an example, establishing a model for others.'

examples.simplified: 如果领导干部不能以身作则， 下面的工作人员就可想而知了。
examples.pinyin: Rúguŏ lĭngdăo gànbù bù néng yhshbn-zuòzé, xiàmiàn de gōngzuò rényuán jiù kěxiăng'érzhī le.
examples.english: 'If the leading cadres cannot practice what they preach, then you can imagine how it will be with the workers below.'

translations.english: 层 means 'layer' and 穷 means 'exhaust.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'pile up or emerge one after another without stopping.'

examples.simplified: 在现代社会里， 新事物、新产品层出不穷。
examples.pinyin: Zài xiàndài shèhuì lh, xīn shìwù, xīn chănpĭn céngchū-bùqióng.
examples.english: 'In modern society, new things and new products pile up one after another.'

examples.simplified: 改革开放以后， 中国出现了英语热， 各种英语培训班层出不穷。
examples.pinyin: Găigé kāifàng yĭhòu, Zhūngguó chūxiànle yīngyŭ rè, gèzhŏng yīngyŭ péixùnbān céngche-bùqióng.
examples.english: 'After the reforms and opening up of the late 1970s, there appeared in China a phenomenon of English being "hot," with all kinds of English training classes emerging one after another.'

translations.english: 轰轰 describes loud noise while 烈烈 refers to blazing fire. The meaning of the whole idiom is 'grand and gigantic, bold and dynamic.'

examples.simplified: 一个人一辈子不干一番轰轰烈烈的大事， 是不是白活了？
examples.pinyin: Yí ge rén yíbèizi bú gàn yì fān hōnghōng-lièliè de dàshì, shìbúshì báihuó le?
examples.english: 'If someone during their whole life long never does something grand and bold and dynamic, is it the case that they have lived in vain?'

examples.simplified: 她一回国就参加了轰轰烈烈的革命运动。
examples.pinyin: Tā yì huíguó jiù cānjiāle hōnghōng-lièliè de gémìng yùndòng.
examples.english: 'As soon as she returned to her native country, she took part in the great revolutionary movement.'

translations.english: 息 means 'breath,' 相 means 'mutually,' and 关 means 'related.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'mutually related as one breath is to another,' with freer translations being 'interrelated, closely linked.'

examples.simplified: 美国高科技的进步与她吸引人才的政策息息相关。
examples.pinyin: Měiguó gāo kējì de jìnbù yŭ tā xīyĭn réncái de zhèngcè xīxī-xiāngguān.
examples.english: 'The U.S.'s progress in high-tech is very closely related to her policy of attracting people of talent.'

examples.simplified: 政府应该花大力气解决与老百姓生活息息相关的问题。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngfŭ yīnggāi huā dà lìqi jiějué yŭ lăobăixìng shēnghuó xīxī-xiāngguān de wèntí.
examples.english: 'Government should expend a great deal of effort to solve those problems that are closely linked to the lives of ordinary citizens.'

translations.english: 一丝 means 'even a little, at all' and 苟 means 'careless.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'not the least bit negligent, scrupulous about every detail, conscientious and meticulous, perfectionist.'

examples.simplified: 她是公众人物， 每天的衣着打扮都很注意， 一丝不苟。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì gōngzhòng rénwù, mĕi tiān de yīzhuó dăbàn dŏu hěn zhùyì, yìsī-bùgŏu.
examples.english: 'She is a public figure; she pays great attention to her daily attire and make-up, being scrupulous about every detail.'

examples.simplified: 科学研究需要一丝不苟的态度和作风。
examples.pinyin: Kēxué yánjiū xūyào yìsī-bùgŏu de tàidu hé zuòfeng.
examples.english: 'Scientific research requires a perfectionist attitude and work style.'

translations.english: 微 means 'small,' 足 means 'worth,' and 道 means 'say, mention.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'too trifling to deserve mention, insignificant.'

examples.simplified: 这点儿小事微不足道， 你不必那么客气。
examples.pinyin: Zhè diăr xiăo shì wēibùzúdào, nĭ búbì nàme kèqi.
examples.english: 'Something as small as this is just not worth mentioning; you needn't be so polite.'

examples.simplified: 那家微不足道的小公司， 十年以后成了同行业的巨头。
examples.pinyin: Nà jiā wēibùzúdào de xiăo gōngsī, shí nián yĭhòu chéngle tónghángyè de jùtóu.
examples.english: 'That insignificant little company in ten years became a giant in the profession.'

translations.english: 刻 means 'short period of time,' 容 means 'allow,' and 缓 means 'delay.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'short time not allow delay,' with a freer translation being 'it is not allowed to delay for even a short period of time.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'allow no delay, extremely urgent.'

examples.simplified: 打击黑社会的行动刻不容缓。
examples.pinyin: Dăjī hēi shèhuì de xíngdòng kèbùrónghuăn.
examples.english: 'Operations to crack down on organized crime allow for no delay.'

examples.simplified: 解决失业人口的生计问题， 是本届政府刻不容缓的任务。
examples.pinyin: Jiějué shīyè rénkŏu de shēngjì wèntí, shì běnjiè zhèngfŭ kèbùrónghuăn de rènwù.
examples.english: 'Solving livelihood issues of the unemployed population is an urgent responsibility of this administration.'

translations.english: 截然 means 'completely.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'completely different.'

examples.simplified: 两个人从小一起长大， 后来在同一所大学上学， 可是毕业后的命运却截然不同。
examples.pinyin: Liăng ge rén cóng xiăo yìqĭ zhăngdà, hòulái zài tóng yì suŏ dàxué shàngxué, kěshì bìyè hòu de mìngyùn què jiérán-bù tóng.
examples.english: 'The two of them grew up together from the time they were children, and later they attended the same university, but their fate after graduation was completely different.'

examples.simplified: 对于同一个问题， 由于大家的立场不一样， 所以产生了两种截然不同的观点。
examples.pinyin: Duìyú tóng yí ge wèntí, yóuyú dàjiā de lìchăng bù yíyàng, suŏyĭ chănshēngle liăng zhŏng jiérán-bùtóng de guāndiăn.
examples.english: 'Because everyone's standpoint was different, there arose two completely different views about the same issue.'

translations.english: 愚 means 'foolish,' 公 means 'old man,' and 移 means 'move.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'the foolish old man moved the mountain.' This is a metaphor for 'have inexhaustible willpower and an unyielding spirit.' Possible English translations include 'where there's a will there's a way' or 'with sufficient effort anything can be achieved.'

examples.simplified: 我们要发扬愚公移山的精神， 把家乡建设好。
examples.pinyin: Wŏmen yào fāyáng yúgōng-yíshān de jīngshen, bă jiāxiāng jiànshèhăo.
examples.english: 'We should develop and promote the spirit of "the old man who moved a mountain," doing a good job of reconstructing our hometown.'

examples.simplified: 他们继承了老一辈愚公移山的精神， 踏踏实实地做出了许多贡献。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen jìchéngle lăo yíbèi yúgōng-yíshān de jīngshen, tātā-shíshí de zuòchūle xŭduō gòngxiàn.
examples.english: 'They inherited the older generation's spirit of "the old man who moved a mountain," steadily making many contributions.'

translations.english: 为 means 'do.' The literal meaning of this idiom is 'what one does,' with a freer translation being 'everything one does, all of a person's actions.'

examples.simplified: 父母的所作所为会对孩子的行为产生直接的影响。
examples.pinyin: Fùmŭ de suŏzuò-suŏwéi huì duì háizi de xíngwéi chănshēng zhíjiē de yĭngxiăng.
examples.english: 'Everything that parents do will have a direct influence on children's behavior.'

examples.simplified: 我对自己的所作所为毫不后悔。
examples.pinyin: Wŏ duì zìjĭ de suŏzuò-suŏwéi háo bú hòuhuĭ.
examples.english: 'I don't in the slightest regret my own actions.'

translations.english: 后 means 'in the back,' 顾 means 'look back,' and 忧 means 'worry.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'the worries of looking back,' with a freer translation being 'things to worry about back home or in the rear.'

examples.simplified: 公司为所有员工买了养老保险， 解决了员工们的后顾之忧。
examples.pinyin: Gōngsī wèi suŏyŏu yuángōng măile yănglăo băoxiăn, jiĕjuéle yuángōngmen de hòugù-zhīyōu.
examples.english: 'The company bought retirement insurance for all the employees; it solved the employees' domestic worries.'

examples.simplified: 在一场有关黑社会的审判中， 有关部门表示， 绝对保证证人的安全， 这样 就解除了证人的后顾之忧。
examples.pinyin: Zài yì cháng yŏuguān hēi shèhuì de shĕnpàn zhōng, yŏuguān bùmén biăoshì, juéduì băozhèng zhèngrén de ānquán, zhèyàng jiù jiĕchúle zhèngrén de hòugùzhīyōu.
examples.english: 'In a trial concerning organized crime, the departments concerned indicated that they would absolutely guarantee the safety of witnesses; in this way they relieved the domestic worries of the witnesses.'

translations.english: 德 means 'moral character,' 才 means 'ability, talent,' 兼 means 'simultaneously,' and 备 means 'equipped with.' A literal translation of the entire idiom is 'simultaneously be equipped with moral character and talent.' A freer translation is 'possess both moral integrity and professional competence.'

examples.simplified: 他是一个德才兼备的青年， 很有发展前途。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yí ge décái-jiānbèi de qīngnián, hĕn yŏu fāzhăn qiántú.
examples.english: 'He is a youth of good character and great ability; he has great prospects for development.'

examples.simplified: 提拔干部的时候得坚持德才兼备的原则。
examples.pinyin: Tíbá gànbù de shíhou děi jiānchí décái-jiānbèi de yuánzé.
examples.english: 'When promoting cadres, one must insist on the principle of their possessing both moral integrity and professional competence.'

translations.english: 相 means 'mutually,' 辅 means 'help,' and 成 means 'facilitate, bring about.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'help each other and facilitate each other,' with a freer translation being 'complement each other.'

examples.simplified: 保护环境和发展经济是相辅相成的。
examples.pinyin: Băohù huánjìng hé fāzhăn jīngjì shì xiāngfŭ-xiāngchéng de.
examples.english: 'Protecting the environment and developing the economy complement each other.'

examples.simplified: 这种药能止咳， 那种药能化痰， 二者相辅相成。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhŏng yào néng zhĭké, nà zhŏng yào néng huàtán, èrzhĕ xiāngfŭ-xiāngchéng.
examples.english: 'This kind of medicine can stop coughing, and that kind of medicine can dissolve mucus; the two of them complement each other.'

translations.english: 讨价 means 'ask a price' and 还价 means 'make a counter-offer.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'bargain back and forth, negotiate back and forth.'

examples.simplified: 经过一番讨价还价， 买卖双方最终达成了协议。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò yì fān tăojià-huánjià, măimài shuāngfāng zuìzhōng dáchéngle xiéyì.
examples.english: 'After a series of negotiations, the buyer and seller in the end reached an agreement.'

examples.simplified: 讨价还价之后， 他辞去了行政职务， 但是继任者给他增加了薪水。
examples.pinyin: Tăojià-huánjià zhīhòu, tā cíqùle xíngzhèng zhíwù, dànshì jìrènzhě gěi tā zēngjiāle xīnshuĭ.
examples.english: 'After negotiations, he resigned his administrative post, but his successor increased his salary.'

translations.english: 同 means 'same,' 心 means 'mind,' and 德 here means 'belief.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'same mind same beliefs.' Freer translations include 'of one heart and mind, united in thought and belief.'

examples.simplified: 他号召全国人民同心同德， 为民族的伟大复兴而努力奋斗。
examples.pinyin: Tā hàozhào quánguó rénmín tóngxīn-tóngdé, wèi mínzú de wĕidà fùxīng ér nŭlì fèndòu.
examples.english: 'He appealed to the people of the whole country to be of one heart and mind, and to work hard and struggle for the great rejuvenation of the nation.'

examples.simplified: 他们解决好内部矛盾以后， 同心同德工作起来。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen jiějué hăo nèibù máodùn yĭhòu, tóngxīn-tóngdé gōngzuò qĭlai.
examples.english: 'After they had solved the internal conflict, they began to work with united hearts and minds.'

translations.english: 理 means 'reason,' 直 means 'correct,' 气 means 'spirit,' and 壮 means 'strong.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'bold through being in the right, with righteous self-assurance.'

examples.simplified: 他在法庭上理直气壮地说： "我是清白的， 我没有犯罪。"
examples.pinyin: Tā zài fătíng shàng lĭzhí-qìzhuàng de shuō: "Wŏ shì qīngbái de, wŏ méiyŏu fànzuì."
examples.english: 'In court he said with righteous self-assurance: "I'm unstained, I didn't commit a crime."'

examples.simplified: 她理直气壮地回答： "绝对不可能。"
examples.pinyin: Tā lĭzhí-qìzhuàng de huídá: 'Juéduì bù kěnéng.'
examples.english: 'She answered righteously and boldly: "That is absolutely impossible."'

translations.english: 身 means 'oneself,' 体 means 'learn from experience,' 力 means 'strive hard to do something,' and 行 means 'put into practice.' The literal meaning is 'What oneself has learned from experience one should try hard to put into practice,' with a freer translation being 'practice what you preach, personally set an example.'

examples.simplified: 他不光努力宣传这种健康的生活方式， 而且身体力行， 为其他人做了一个榜样。
examples.pinyin: Tā bù guāng nŭlì xuānchuán zhè zhŏng jiànkāng de shēnghuó fāngshì, érqiě shēntĭlìxíng, wèi qíta rén zuòle yí ge băngyàng.
examples.english: 'He not only works hard in publicizing this kind of healthy lifestyle, but also practices what he preaches, serving as an example to others.'

examples.simplified: 各级领导干部都应该身体力行， 发扬自强不息的精神。
examples.pinyin: Gè jí lĭngdăo gànbù dōu yīnggāi shēntĭ-lìxíng, fāyáng zìqiáng-bùxc de jīngshen.
examples.english: 'Leading cadres at all levels should all serve as an example to others, developing and promoting a spirit of striving constantly for self-improvement.'

translations.english: 义 means 'duty, obligation,' 容 means 'allow,' and 辞 means 'decline, refuse.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'duty does not allow one to decline,' with a freer translation being 'duty-bound not to refuse.'

examples.simplified: 为人民服务是各级领导干部义不容辞的责任。
examples.pinyin: Wèi rénmín fúwù shì gè jí lĭngdăo gànbù yìbùróngcí de zérèn.
examples.english: 'To serve the people is the responsibility of leading cadres at all levels, which they are duty-bound not to decline.'

examples.simplified: 救助病人是医生义不容辞的责任。
examples.pinyin: Jiùzhù bìngrén shì yīshēng yìbùróngcí de zérèn.
examples.english: 'Helping patients is a doctor's responsibility, which he or she is duty-bound not to shirk.'

translations.english: 画 means 'draw,' 龙 means 'dragon,' 点 means 'dot, adorn,' and 睛 means 'eye.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'draw a dragon and add on the eyes.' This is a metaphor for 'add the perfect finishing touch' or 'say or write something crucially important that completes a matter.'

examples.simplified: 文章最后的一段虽然不长， 但是起到了画龙点睛的作用。
examples.pinyin: Wénzhāng zuìhòu de yí duàn suīrán bù cháng, dànshì qĭdàole huàlóng-diănjīng de zuòyòng.
examples.english: 'Though the last section of the essay is not long, it had the effect of adding the perfect finishing touch.'

examples.simplified: 有人说， 克林顿总统的朝鲜之旅， 是到那时候为止他的政治生命的画龙点睛之笔。
examples.pinyin: Yŏu rén shuō, Kèlíndùn zŏngtŏng de Cháoxiăn zhī lǚ, shì dào nà shíhou wéi zhĭ ta de zhèngzhì shēngmìng de huàlóng-diănjīng zhī bĭ.
examples.english: 'Some people say that President Clinton's trip to Korea was the perfect finishing touch for his political life up until that time.'

translations.english: 琳琅 means 'beautiful jade' and functions as a metaphor for precious things. 满目 means 'fill the eyes - seen everywhere.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'a dazzling collection of beautiful and precious things.'

examples.simplified: 购物中心里琳琅满目， 世界各国的奢侈品都有。
examples.pinyin: Gòuwù zhōngxīn lĭ línláng-mănmù, shìjiè gè guó de shēchĭpĭn dōu yŏu.
examples.english: 'In the shopping mall there was a dazzling collection of beautiful and precious things, luxury goods from countries all over the world being present.'

examples.simplified: 小商品批发市场里商品琳琅满目， 要什么有什么。
examples.pinyin: Xiăoshāngpĭn pīfā shìchăng lĭ shāngpĭn línláng-mănmù, yào shénme yŏu shénme.
examples.english: 'The goods in the small commodities wholesale market were like a dazzling collection of beautiful and precious things, whatever you might want was there.'

translations.english: 耐 means 'endure, withstand,' 寻 means 'seek,' and 味 means 'flavor,' with 寻味 meaning 'ponder, think over.' The literal meaning is 'can withstand people's pondering something.' A freer translation is 'giving food for thought - provoking.'

examples.simplified: 这个故事意义深刻， 耐人寻味。
examples.pinyin: Zhège gùshi yìyì shēnkè, nàirén-xúnwèi.
examples.english: 'This story has a profound significance and is food for thought.'

examples.simplified: 他说了一段耐人寻味的话： "两只小老鼠掉进一桶奶油里， 第一只很快放弃了希望， 便淹死了； 第二只则没有放弃， 它如此努力挣扎， 最后竟然把奶油搅成了黄油， 然后爬了出来。"
examples.pinyin: Tā shuōle yí duàn nàirén-xúnwèi de huà: "Liăng zhī xiăo lăoshŭ diàojìn yì tŏng năiyóu lĭ, dìyī zhī hĕn kuài fàngqìle xīwàng, biàn yānsĭle; dì'èr zhī zé méiyŏu fàngqì, tā rúcĭ nŭlì zhēngzhá, zuìhòu jìngrán bă năiyóu jiăochéngle huángyóu, ránhòu pále chūlái."
examples.english: 'He said the thought-provoking words: "Two little mice fell in a bucket of cream. The first mouse quickly gave up and drowned. The second mouse, wouldn't quit. He struggled so hard that eventually he churned that cream into butter and crawled out."' (from the film

translations.english: 繁荣 means 'prosperous' and 昌盛 means 'thriving,' so the whole idiom can be translated as 'prosperous and thriving.' This typically refers to an industry, society, or nation.

examples.simplified: 衷心祝愿伟大祖国繁荣昌盛。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngxīn zhùyuàn wěidà zŭguó fánróng-chāngshèng.
examples.english: 'From the bottom of my heart, I wish that my great motherland may prosper and thrive.'

examples.simplified: 服务业又复活了， 社会呈现出繁荣昌盛的景象。
examples.pinyin: Fúwùyè yòu fùhuó le, shèhuì chéngxiàn chū fánróng-chāngshèng de jĭngxiàng.
examples.english: 'The service industry has come back to life, and society presents an appearance of flourishing prosperity.'

translations.english: 难能 here means 'hard to do' and 可贵 means 'valuable, praiseworthy.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'hard to do and (therefore) praiseworthy.' Freer translations of the idiom include 'praiseworthy, commendable.'

examples.simplified: 他虽然年轻， 但是做事很稳重， 这是难能可贵的。
examples.pinyin: Tā suīrán niánqīng, dànshì zuòshì hěn wěnzhòng, zhè shì nánnéng-kěguì de.
examples.english: 'Though he's young, he does things very steadily; this is very praiseworthy.'

examples.simplified: 这家公司不但在经济危机中生存了下来， 更加难能可贵的是， 他们把成功的经验无偿地介绍给其他竞争对手。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā gōngsī búdàn zài jīngjì wēijī zhōng shēngcúnle xiàlái, gèngjia nánnéngkěguìde shì, tāmen bă chénggōng de jīngyàn wúcháng de jièshào gĕi qítā jìngzhēng duìshŏu.
examples.english: 'This company has not only survived during the economic crisis, what is even more commendable is that they took their successful experience and, without compensation, introduced it to other competitors.'

translations.english: 模 means 'model' and 样 means 'pattern.' A literal translation is 'one model one pattern.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'identical, completely the same, exactly alike.'

examples.simplified: 这对双胞胎长得一模一样， 连他们的父母有时候都分不开。
examples.pinyin: Zhè duì shuāngbāotāi zhăngde yìmú-yíyàng, lián tāmen de fùmŭ yŏu shíhou dōu fēnbukāi.
examples.english: 'This pair of twins looks exactly the same; even their parents sometimes can't tell them apart.'

examples.simplified: 两篇文章除了作者的名字不同以外， 其余的一模一样， 肯定有人抄袭。
examples.pinyin: Liăng piān wénzhāng chúle zuòzhĕ de míngzi bù tóng yĭwài, qíyú de yìmú-yíyàng, kĕndìng yŏu rén chāoxí.
examples.english: 'As for these two essays, except for the author's name being different, everything else is identical; somebody is certainly plagiarizing.'

translations.english: 突 means 'suddenly, quickly,' 飞 means 'fly, leap,' 猛 means 'vigorously,' and 进 means 'progress forward, advance.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'quickly leap vigorously advance,' with freer translations including 'advance rapidly, progress by leaps and bounds, make great strides.'

examples.simplified: 计算机出现后， 科学技术突飞猛进， 取得了惊人的成就。
examples.pinyin: Jìsuànjī chūxiàn hòu, kēxué jìshù tūfēi-mĕngjìn, qŭdéle jīngrén de chéngjiù.
examples.english: 'After computers emerged, scientific technology advanced in leaps and bounds, obtaining astonishing achievements.'

examples.simplified: 去年， 该国的出口突飞猛进， 比前年增长了五倍。
examples.pinyin: Qùnián, gāi guó de chūkŏu tūfēi-mĕngjìn, bĭ qiánnián zēngzhăngle wŭ bèi.
examples.english: 'Last year, that country's exports made great strides, increasing five times compared with the year before last.'

translations.english: 刮目 means 'rub one's eyes.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'have great respect for, hold someone in high esteem.'

examples.simplified: 这座城市最近三十年的发展令世界刮目相看。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zuò chéngshì zuìjìn sānshí nián de fāzhăn lìng shìjiè guāmù-xiāngkàn.
examples.english: 'This city's development in the last thirty years has earned the respect of the whole world.'

examples.simplified: 他在很短的时间内就做成了几件大事， 让人们刮目相看。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài hěn duăn de shíjiān nèi jiù zuòchéngle jĭ jiàn dà shì, ràng rénmen guāmùxiāngkàn.
examples.english: 'Within a short time he completed several major projects, making people hold him in high esteem.'

translations.english: A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'wind wind rain rain.' This is often used metaphorically to mean 'repeated difficulties, frequent hardships.'

examples.simplified: 最近几年她可不容易， 经历了多少风风雨雨。
examples.pinyin: Zuìjìn jĭ nián tā kĕ bù róngyì, jīnglì le duōshăo fēngfēng-yŭyŭ.
examples.english: 'The last few years she really hasn't had it easy; she has undergone so many repeated difficulties.'

examples.simplified: 二十年的风风雨雨把他磨练得无比坚强。
examples.pinyin: Èrshí nián de fēngfēng-yŭyŭ bă tā móliàn de wúbĭ jiānqiáng.
examples.english: 'Twenty years of frequent hardships have disciplined him so that he is incomparably strong.'

translations.english: 旗帜 means 'banner' or 'flag' and 鲜明 means 'bright' or 'distinct.' A literal translation of the entire idiom is 'banners are bright and distinct.' This originally referred to the brilliant colors of an army's banners. Freer translations include 'have a clear standpoint, take a clear position, take a clear political stand.'

examples.simplified: 我们要旗帜鲜明地反对民族分裂主义。
examples.pinyin: Wŏmen yào qízhì-xiānmíng de fănduì mínzú fènliè zhŭyì.
examples.english: 'We must have a clear position opposing national secessionism.'

examples.simplified: 在原则性问题上必须旗帜鲜明。
examples.pinyin: Zài yuánzéxìng wèntí shàng bìxū qízhì-xiānmíng.
examples.english: 'One must take a clear stand on questions of principle.'

translations.english: 破 means 'break,' 釜 means 'kettle, pot,' 沉 means 'sink,' and 舟 means 'boat.' The literal meaning is 'break the kettles and sink the boats.' The connotation is 'burn one's bridges, cut off all means of retreat.'

examples.simplified: 现在我们不能再犹豫了， 必须破釜沉舟， 这样还有一点儿希望。
examples.pinyin: Xiànzài wŏmen bù néng zài yóuyù le, bìxū pòfŭ-chénzhōu, zhèyàng hái yŏu yìdiănr xīwàng.
examples.english: 'Now we can hesitate no longer; we must cut off all means of retreat; this way, there is still a little hope.'

examples.simplified: 这种破釜沉舟的做法虽然勇敢， 但是考虑得不够全面。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhŏng pòfŭ-chénzhōu de zuòfă suīrán yŏnggăn, dànshì kăolǚ de bú gòu quánmiàn.
examples.english: 'Although this method of cutting off all means of retreat is brave, it does not take enough into consideration.'

translations.english: 独 means 'only.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'only one without a second one,' with freer translations being 'unique, unparalleled.'

examples.simplified: 据说,每个人的视网膜都是独一无二的，可以作为鉴别不同的人的最可靠的依据。
examples.pinyin: Jùshuō, měi ge rén de shìwăngmó dōu shì dúyī-wú'èr de, kěyĭ zuòwéi jiànbié bùtóng de rén de zuì kěkào de yījù.
examples.english: 'It's said that every person's retina is unique; it can serve as the most accurate basis for discriminating among different people.'

examples.simplified: 耶路撒冷对于宗教研究有着独一无二的研究价值。
examples.pinyin: Yēlùsālěng duìyú zōngjiào yánjiū yŏuzhe dúyī-wú'èr de yánjiū jiàzhí.
examples.english: 'Jerusalem has unique research value for religious research.'

translations.english: 兢兄克 means 'cautious' and 业业 means 'anxious.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'cautious and anxious.' Note that this idiom often conveys the additional sense of 'conscientious.' Freer translations include 'cautious and attentive' and 'careful and conscientious.'

examples.simplified: 他做任何事情都兢兢业业，让别人很放心。
examples.pinyin: Tā zuò rènhé shìqing dōu jīngjīng-yèyè, ràng biérén hěn fàngxīn.
examples.english: 'Whatever he does, he is careful and conscientious, letting others feel reassured.'

examples.simplified: 王老师教了几十年，兢兢业业地培养了一批又一批学生。
examples.pinyin: Wáng lăoshī jiāole jĭ shí nián, jīng jīng-yè yè de péiyăngle yì pī yòu yì pī xuésheng.
examples.english: 'Professor Wang has taught for several decades, carefully and conscientiously training one group of students after another.'

translations.english: 折 means 'discount' and 手口 'deduct.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'to the letter, in every sense of the term, dyed-in-the-wool.'

examples.simplified: 她是个不折不扣的共产主义者。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì ge bùzhé-búkòu de gòngchănzhǔyìzhě.
examples.english: 'She is a dyed-in-the-wool Communist.'

examples.simplified: 地方政府应该不折不扣地执行中央的政策.
examples.pinyin: Dìfāng zhèngfǔ yīnggāi bùzhé-búkòu de zhíxíng zhōngyāng de zhèngcè.
examples.english: 'The local government should carry out the policies of the central government to the letter.'
