translations.english: 五花 or 'five flowers' refers to the Five Row battle formation and 八门 J or 'eight gates' refers to the Eight Trigram battle formation in ancient Chinese military strategy. Both of these strategies involved many different kinds of tactics. Nowadays, this idiom means 'various, of all kinds, miscellaneous.'

examples.simplified: 这个商店出售五花八门的帽子。
examples.pinyin: Zhège shāngdiàn chūshòu wǔhuā-bāmén de màozĭ.
examples.english: 'This store sells hats of all kinds.'

examples.simplified: 她说尽管哲学上的流派五花八门，但是基本上可以归为两类，唯物主义和唯心主义。
examples.pinyin: Tā shuō jĭnguăn zhăxuă shàng de liúpài wúhuā-bāmén, dànshìi jīběn shàng kěyĭ guīwéi liăng lèi, wéiwù zhǔyì hé wéixīn zhǔyì.
examples.english: 'She said that although there are various schools of philosophy, basically they can be categorized into two types, materialism and idealism.'

translations.english: 求 means 'seek,'同 means 'similarity,' means 'preserve,' and 异 means 'difference.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'seek sameness maintain difference.' A freer translation is 'seek common ground while maintaining differences.'

examples.simplified: 在这个问题上，虽然我们之间有一些分歧，但是也有不少共识,我们不妨求同存异，在此基础上寻求进一歩的合作。
examples.pinyin: Zài zhège wèntí shàng, suīrán wŏmen zhījiān yŏu yīxiē fēnqí, dànshì yě yŏu bùshăo gòngshí, wŏmen bùfáng qiútóng-cúnyì, zài cĭ jīchǔ shàng xúnqiú jìnyìbù de hézuò.
examples.english: 'Concerning this question, though there are a few differences between us, there are also quite a few points of consensus; we might as well maintain our differences while seeking common ground, and on this foundation seek further cooperation.'

examples.simplified: 我们本着求同存异的原则，希望与贵方发展友好关系。
examples.pinyin: Wŏmen běnzhe qiútóng-cúnyì de yuánzé, xīwàng yǔ guì fāng fāzhăn yŏuhăo guānxī.
examples.english: 'On the basis of the principle of maintaining our differences while seeking common ground, we hope to develop friendly relations with you.'

translations.english: 无能 means 'have no ability to, be powerless to' and 为力 means 'exert oneself, make an effort.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'have no ability to make an effort,' with a freer translation being 'powerless, helpless.'

examples.simplified: 这件事情太大,即使总理也无能为力。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiàn shìqíng tài dà, jíshĭ zŏnglĭ yě wúnéng-wéilì.
examples.english: 'This matter is too big; even if it were the premier, he also would be powerless.'

examples.simplified: 医生耸了耸肩，表示无能为力了。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng sŏngle sŏng jiān, biăoshì wúnéng-wéilì le.
examples.english: 'The doctor shrugged her shoulders, indicating there was nothing she could do.'

translations.english: The meaning of this idiom is 'know absolutely nothing about something.'

examples.simplified: 不少人对于世界历史一无所知。
examples.pinyin: Bù shăo rén duìyú shìjiè lìshĭ yìwúsuŏzhí.
examples.english: 'Not a few people know absolutely nothing about world history.'

examples.simplified: 那位国会议员说,他对儿子的违法行为一无所知。
examples.pinyin: Nà wèi guóhuì yìyuán shuō, tā duì érzi de wéifă xíngwéi yìwúsuŏzhī.
examples.english: 'That member of the National Assembly said he knew absolutely nothing about the illegal activities of his son.'

translations.english: 席 means 'mat.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'the place for one mat.' By metaphor, this has come to mean 'a deserved place' or 'a proper place.'

examples.simplified: 席勒在德国文学史上占有一席之地。
examples.pinyin: Xílè zài Déguó wénxuéshĭ shàng zhànyŏu yìxí-zhīdì.
examples.english: 'Schiller has a deserved place in German literary history.'

examples.simplified: 张艺谋的电影为中国电影在世界舞台赢得一席之地。
examples.pinyin: Zhāng Yìmóu de diànyĭng wéi Zhōngguó diànyĭng zài shìjiè wǔtái yíngdé yìxízhīdì.
examples.english: 'Zhang Yimou's films have earned a deserved place for Chinese films on the world stage.'

translations.english: 轻 means 'light, not heavy,' M means 'easy,' and 举 means 'lift, raise.' The literal meaning is 'light and easy to lift,' with a freer translation being 'easy, easy as pie, without much effort.'

examples.simplified: 这件事看似简单，但是绝非一件轻而易举的事。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiàn shì kànsì jiăndān, dànshì juéfēi yījiàn qīng'éryìjǔ de shì.
examples.english: 'This matter looks simple, but it's absolutely not a very easy thing.'

examples.simplified: 那支足球队太強大，因此轻而易举地战胜了对手。
examples.pinyin: Nà zhī zúqiúduì tài qiángdà, yīncĭ qīng'éryìjǔ de zhànshèngle duìshŏu.
examples.english: 'That soccer team is too powerful, so they easily defeated their opponents.'

translations.english: 亡 means 'lose,'补 means 'mend, repair,' and 牢 means 'sheep pen.' A literal translation of the idiom is 'mend the sheep pen when one loses sheep.' This is a metaphor for it never being too late to figure out a way to solve a problem that has arisen. English translations include 'it's never too late' and 'better late than never.

examples.simplified: 虽然她在预赛中失利，但是 亡羊补牢， 决赛中取得了优异的成绩。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán tā zài yùsài zhōng shīlì, dànshì wángyáng-bǔláo, juésài zhōng qǔdéle yōuyì de chéngjì.
examples.english: 'Even though she suffered a setback in the preliminary competition, it's never too late to fix a problem; so she obtained outstanding results in the finals.'

examples.simplified: 你不要过分责备自己，亡羊补牢，还不算晚，以后多注意就是了。
examples.pinyin: Nĭ bùyào guòfèn zébèi zìjĭ, wángyáng-bǔláo, hái bù suàn wăn, yĭhòu duō zhùyì jiù shìle.
examples.english: 'Don't reproach yourself excessively; it's never too late to solve a problem; just pay more attention in the future.'

translations.english: 默默 means 'silently' and 闻 means 'hear of.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'silently and without anyone hearing of someone or something.' Freer translations include 'unknown to the public, anonymous.'

examples.simplified: 她以前是个默默无闻的歌手，但是上了春节晚会以后，一夜成名。
examples.pinyin: Tā yìqián shì ge mòmò-wúwén de gēshŏu, dànshì shàngle chūnjié wănhuì yĭhòu, yí yè chéngmíng.
examples.english: 'She formerly was an unknown singer, but after she was on the Chinese New Year's evening program, she became famous overnight.'

examples.simplified: 老李在这个工作岗位上默默无闻地工作了三十年了。
examples.pinyin: Lăo Lĭ zài zhège gōngzuò găngwèi shàng mòmò-wúwén de gōngzuòle sānshí nián le.
examples.english: 'Old Li has been working in this position quietly and unknown to the public for thirty years.'

translations.english: 迫 means 'urgent, pressing,' 不及 means 'not be up to,' and 待 means 'wait.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'too impatient to wait, be itching to do something, unable to hold oneself back.'

examples.simplified: 还没等客人把话说完，孩子就迫不及待地打开了客人送的礼物。
examples.pinyin: Hái méi děng kèrén bă huà shuōwán, háizĭ jiù pòbùjídài de dăkāile kèrén sòng de lĭwù.
examples.english: 'Without waiting for the guests to finish talking, the children - who were too impatient to wait - opened the presents that the guests had given them.'

examples.simplified: 收到大学的录取通知书后，她迫不及待地把这个好消息告诉了所有的好朋友。
examples.pinyin: Shōudào dàxué de lùqǔ tōngzhīshū hòu, tā pòbùjídài de bă zhège hăo xiāoxī gàosùle suŏyŏu de hăo péngyŏu.
examples.english: 'When she received the college's letter of admission, she couldn't wait to tell all her best friends this good news.'

translations.english: 尸 means 'sound' and 色 means 'color.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'have sound have color.' A freer translation is 'full of sound and color, vivid.'

examples.simplified: 他做了学生会主席以后，把学生会的活动搞得有声有色的。
examples.pinyin: Tā zuòle xuéshēnghuì zhǔxí yĭhòu, bă xuéshēnghuì de huódòng găode yŏushēngyŏusè de.
examples.english: 'When he became chair of the student association, he did much to liven up the association's activities.'

examples.simplified: "读书月"活动开展得有声有色。
examples.pinyin: "Dúshú Yuè" huódòng kāizhănde yŏushēng-yŏusè.
examples.english: '"Reading Month" activities were launched full of sound and color.'

translations.english: A literal translation of this idiom is 'with one heart and one mind.' Freer translations include 'wholeheartedly, very attentively, with complete concentration.'

examples.simplified: 中国的政策是不在国际上出头，一心一意搞经济建设。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó de zhèngcè shì bù zài guójì shàng chūtóu, yìxīn-yíyì găo jīngjì jiànshè.
examples.english: 'Chinese policy is not to raise its head internationally, concentrating wholeheartedly on engaging in economic construction.'

examples.simplified: 他不一心一意地工作，在工作的时间炒股，因此被解雇了。
examples.pinyin: Tā bù yìxīn-yíyì de gōngzuò, zài gōngzuò de shíjiān chăogǔ, yīncĭ bèi jiěgùle.
examples.english: 'He doesn't work with complete concentration; during working hours he traded stocks, therefore he was let go.'

translations.english: 先

examples.simplified: 大家都被这突如其来的消息吓呆了。
examples.pinyin: Dàjiā dōu bèi zhè tūrúqílái de xiāoxī xiàdāile.
examples.english: 'Everyone was scared out of their wits by this sudden news.'

examples.simplified: 一场突如其来的大地震夺走了几万个人的生命。
examples.pinyin: Yì chăng tūrúqílái de dà dìzhèn duózŏule jĭ wàn ge rén de shēngmìng.
examples.english: 'A sudden major earthquake took away the lives of tens of thousands of people.'

translations.english: 异 means 'another,' 军 means 'armv,' 突 means 'suddenly,' and M means 'arise, emerge.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'another army suddenly emerges.' This is a metaphor meaning 'sudden appearance of a new force or new trend.'

examples.simplified: 去年以来，中国女子网球选手异军突起，在世界大赛上屡次获得好成绩。
examples.pinyin: Qùnián yĭlái, Zhōngguó nǚzĭ wăngqiú xuănshŏu yìjūn-tūqĭ, zài shìjiè dàsài shàng lǔcì huòde hăo chéngjì.
examples.english: 'Since last year, the Chinese women's tennis players have turned a new leaf; at major international competitions, they have repeatedly obtained good results.'

examples.simplified: 那座城市的博彩业异军突起，占全市税收的百分之五十以上。
examples.pinyin: Nà zuò chéngshì de bócăiyè yìjūn-tūqĭ, zhàn quán shì shuìshōu de băifēnzhī wǔshí yĭshàng.
examples.english: 'That city's gambling industry has started a new trend; it constitutes over fifty percent of the tax revenues for the whole city.'

translations.english: 喜 means 'like,' 闻 means 'hear,'乐 means 'glad,' and 见 means 'see.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'like to hear and glad to see.' A freer translation is 'love to see and hear.'

examples.simplified: 相声是人们喜闻乐见的艺术形式。
examples.pinyin: Xiàngshēng shì rénmèn xĭwén-lèjiàn de yìshù xíngshì.
examples.english: 'Comic dialogues are an art form that people love to see and hear.'

examples.simplified: 近年来,她创作了大量的老百姓喜闻乐见的作品。
examples.pinyin: Jìn nián lái, tā chuàngzuòle dàliàng de lăobăixìng xĭwén-lèjiàn de zuòpĭn.
examples.english: 'During recent years, she created many works that the common people love to see and hear.'

translations.english: 任 means 'burden' and 道 means 'road.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'the burden is heavy and the road is far,' with a freer translation being 'have heavy responsibilities that take a long time to fulfill.'

examples.simplified: 对全世界来说,消除贫苦任重道远。
examples.pinyin: Duì quán shìjiè lái shuō, xiāochú pínkùn rènzhòng-dàoyuăn.
examples.english: 'For the whole world, eliminating poverty is a heavy responsibility that will take a long time to fulfill.'

examples.simplified: 中国男足成为世界强队这一目标任重道远。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó nánzú chéngwéi shìjiè qiáng duì zhè yì mùbiāo rènzhōng-dàoyuăn.
examples.english: 'This goal of China's male soccer team to become a strong team in the world is a heavy responsibility that will take many years of hard work to achieve.'

translations.english: 归 means 'go back.' A literal translation is 'have no home that you can return to,' with a freer translation being 'homeless.'

examples.simplified: 台风过后，十万人无家可归。
examples.pinyin: Táifēng guò hòu, shíwàn rén wújiā-kěguī.
examples.english: 'After the typhoon had passed, 100,000 people were homeless.'

examples.simplified: 这个机构专门收养那些无家可归的小动物。
examples.pinyin: Zhège jīgòu zhuānmén shōuyăng nàxiē wújiā-kěguī de xiăo dòngwù.
examples.english: 'This organization specializes in adopting homeless small animals.'

translations.english: A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'enter wood 3/10 of an inch (in calligraphy) - forceful, bold, sharp.' Originally, this referred to great strength in writing Chinese calligraphy, but later it came to be used as a metaphor for 'deep, astute, keen, or sharp.'

examples.simplified: 她对这部电影的评论入木三分，非常深刻。
examples.pinyin: Tā duì zhè bù diànyĭng de pínglùn rùmù-sānfēn, fēicháng shēnkè.
examples.english: 'Her review of this film is quite astute and extremely deep.'

examples.simplified: 他看人真是入木三分,一下子就看到别人的本质.
examples.pinyin: Tā kàn rén zhēn shì rùmù-sānfēn, yĭxiàzĭ jiù kàndào biérén de běnzhì.
examples.english: 'He really is very astute in his observations of people, immediately seeing the basic character of others.'

translations.english: 意味 means 'meaning, significance' and 深长 means 'profound.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'have profound significance.'

examples.simplified: 他意味深长地说，"是时候了."
examples.pinyin: Tā yìwèi-shēncháng de shuō, "Shì shíhou le."
examples.english: 'With profound significance, he said, "It's time."'

examples.simplified: 邓小平的话总是很简单，但是却意味深长，比方说那个有名的"猫和老鼠"的评论。
examples.pinyin: Dèng Xiāopíng de huà zŏngshì hěn jiāndān, dànshì què yìwèi-shēncháng, bĭfāng shuō nàge yŏumíng de "māo hé lăoshǔ" de pínglùn.
examples.english: 'Deng Xiaoping's words were always very simple, but they had a profound significance, for example, that famous comment about "the cat and the mouse."'

translations.english: 继 means 'succeed, continue,' 往 means 'the past,' 开 means 'open up, initiate,' and 来 means 'the future.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'succeed the past and initiate the future,' with freer translations being 'carry on the glorious traditions of the past and open up the way to the future.'

examples.simplified: 这是一次承前启后、继往开来的重要会议。
examples.pinyin: zhè shì yí cì chéngqián-qĭhòu, jìwāng-kāilái de zhòngyào huìyì.
examples.english: 'This is an important conference that continues the past and develops the future, that carries on the fine traditions of the past and opens up the way to the future.'

examples.simplified: 新领导呼吁大家继往开来、再创辉煌。
examples.pinyin: Xīn lĭngdăo hūyù dàjiā jìwăng-kāilái, zài chuàng huīhuáng.
examples.english: 'The new leader appealed to everyone to carry on the traditions of the past and open up the way to the future, and recreate glory.'

translations.english: 耳 means 'ear' and 目 means 'eye.' The literal meaning of this idiom is 'ear eye entirely new.' Freer translations include 'brand-new sounds and sights, find everything fresh and new, the whole atmosphere has changed for the better, a whole new look, refreshing.'

examples.simplified: 他既熟悉中国的情況，又了解美国的情況，所以他的建议令人耳目一新。
examples.pinyin: Tā jì shúxí Zhōngguó de qíngkuàng, yòu liăojiě Měiguó de qíngkuàng, suŏyĭ tā de jiànyì lìng rén ěrmù-yìxīn.
examples.english: 'He is both familiar with China's situation and also understands the U.S.'s situation, so his proposals make people feel they are very novel and refreshing.'

examples.simplified: 这种新产品的材料和样式都很特別，给人一种耳目一新的感觉。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhŏng xīn chănpĭn de cáiliào hé yàngshì dōu hěn tèbié, gěi rén yì zhŏng ěrmù-yìxīn de gănjué.
examples.english: 'The materials and style of this kind of new product are both very special; they give people a kind of new and refreshing feeling.'

translations.english: 循 means 'follow,' 斤 means 'order,' 渐 means 'gradually,' and 进 means 'move forward.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'according to the order gradually move forward,' with a freer translation being 'follow in order and proceed step by step.'

examples.simplified: 做事不能太着急，要循序渐进， 一步一个脚印。
examples.pinyin: Zuòshì bù néng tài zháojí, yào xúnxù-jiànjìn, yí bù yí ge jiăoyìn.
examples.english: 'In one's work one must not be too anxious; one should follow the established order and proceed step by step, one step and one footprint at a time.'

examples.simplified: 国家已经制定政策，要循序渐进地发展农村的基础教育。
examples.pinyin: Guójiā yĭjīng zhìdìng zhèngcè, yào xúnxù-jiànjìn de fāzhăn nóngcūn de jīchǔ jiàoyù.
examples.english: 'The nation has already formulated the policy; we should proceed step by step in developing basic education in the countryside.'

translations.english: 挺 means 'straighten' and 身 means 'body.' The literal meaning of this idiom is 'straighten one's body and come out.' A freer translation is 'step forward courageously, come out boldly.'

examples.simplified: 出现不公正的事情的时候，老李总是挺身而出，说公道话。
examples.pinyin: Chūxiàn bù gōngzhèng de shìqing de shíhou, Lăo Lĭ zŏngshì tĭngshēn-érchū, shuōgōngdào huà.
examples.english: 'When unjust things happen, Old Li always steps forward courageously and speaks fairly.'

examples.simplified: 面对凶恶的犯罪分子，警察挺身而出，保护了受害者。
examples.pinyin: Miànduì xiōng' è de fànzuì fènzĭ, jĭngchá tĭngshēn-érchū, băohùle shòuhàizhě.
examples.english: 'Facing vicious criminals, the policemen stepped forward bravely and protected the victim.'

translations.english: 滔滔 describes the continuous flow of water and 绝 means 'cut off.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'talking on and on without stopping, incessant.'

examples.simplified: 他滔滔不绝地讲了两个小吋，没有一句重复的话。
examples.pinyin: Tā tāotāo-bùjué de jiăngle liăng ge xiăoshí, méiyŏu yí jù chóngfù de huà.
examples.english: 'He talked incessantly for two hours, without a single repeated phrase.'

examples.simplified: 说起年轻时候的事情来，她滔滔不绝。
examples.pinyin: Shuōqĭ niánqīng shíhou de shìqing lái, tā tāotāo-bùjué.
examples.english: 'When she starts talking about things from when she was young, she just keeps on talking without stopping.'

translations.english: 翻 means 'turn over' and fc means 'overturn.' A literal translation is 'heavens overturn earth overturns.' A freer translation is 'earth-shaking, causing cataclysmic changes.'

examples.simplified: 改革开放以后，中国发生了天翻地覆的变化。
examples.pinyin: Găigé kāifàng yĭhòu, Zhōngguó fāshēngle tiānfān-dìfù de biànhuà.
examples.english: 'After the reforms and opening to the outside world, in China there occurred earth-shaking changes.'

examples.simplified: 夫妻吵架，把整个大家庭闹得天翻地覆。
examples.pinyin: Fūqī chăojià, bă zhěng ge dà jiātíng nàode tiānfān-dìfù.
examples.english: 'The husband and wife quarreled, causing a huge ruckus for the whole big family.'

translations.english: 言 means 'speak' and 喻 means 'understand.' The whole idiom means it goes without saying, be obvious.'

examples.simplified: 在总统选举中，他出了丑闻，结果不言而喻。
examples.pinyin: Zài zŏngtŏng xuănjǔ zhōng, tā chūle chŏuwén, jiéguŏ bùyán-éryù.
examples.english: 'In the presidential election, a scandal arose about him, with the obvious result.'

examples.simplified: 中国有七亿多农民，所以农业问题在中国的经济中不言而喻。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó yŏu qī yì duō nóngmín, suŏyĭ nóngyè wèntí zài Zhōngguó de jīngjì zhōng bùyán-éryù.
examples.english: 'China has over 700 million peasants, so in China's economy, agricultural issues are obvious in their importance.'

translations.english: 再 means 'again,' 接 here means join (battle),' and 厉 here means 'sharpen.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'again join (battle) again sharpen (one's weapon).' This originally referred to the habit some roosters had of sharpening their beaks prior to fighting. Freer translations of the idiom include 'redouble one's efforts' and 'make sustained and persistent efforts.'

examples.simplified: 你们已经取得了很大的成绩，希望你们再接再厉，取得更大的成绩。
examples.pinyin: Nĭmen yĭjīng qǔdéle hěn dà de chéngjì, xīwàng nĭmen zàijiē-zàilì, qǔdé gèng dà de chéngjì.
examples.english: 'You have already attained great achievements; I hope you redouble your efforts and attain even greater achievements.'

examples.simplified: 她输了前两盘，但是赢了第三盘，后来再接再厉，赢了最后两盘，最终以 3:2取得了胜利。
examples.pinyin: Tā shūle qián liăng pán, dànshì yíngle dìsān pán, hòulái zàijiē-zàilì, yíngle zuìhòu liăng pán, zuìzhōng yĭ sān bĭ èr qǔdéle shènglì.
examples.english: 'She lost the first two games, but won the third game; later she redoubled her efforts and won the last two games, in the end attaining victory with a score of 3 to 2.'

translations.english: 杞 is the name of a country in ancient China and '忧 means 'worry about.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is '(like) the person from Qi who worried about the sky (falling down).' This is a metaphor for 'groundless fears' or 'alarmism.'

examples.simplified: 把心放到肚子里去吧，不会有事的.你这是杞人忧天。
examples.pinyin: Bă xīn fàngdào dùzi lĭ qù ba, bú huì yŏu shì de. Nĭ zhè shì Qĭrén-yōutiān.
examples.english: 'Put your heart at ease, nothing will happen. You're being like the man of Qi who was worried about the sky falling in.'

examples.simplified: 教练们的担心并非杞人忧天，世界排名第一的选手有过被排名一百以外的 选手打败的例子。
examples.pinyin: Jiàoliànmen de dānxīn bìngfēi Qĭrén-yōutiān, shìjiè páimíng dìyī de xuănshŏu yŏuguo bèi páimíng yìbāi yĭwài de xuănshŏu dăbài de lìzi.
examples.english: 'The coaches' worries were not totally groundless; there were examples of athletes ranked number one in the world who had been defeated by athletes who didn't rank in the top 100.'

translations.english: 风 means 'wind,' 云 means 'cloud,' and 变幻 means 'change often and unpredictably.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'wind and clouds change often,' with freer translations including 'constantly changing, changeable.'

examples.simplified: 国际局势风云变幻，我们得做好充分准备。
examples.pinyin: Guójì júshì fēngyún-biànhuàn, wŏmen děi zuò hăo chōngfèn zhǔnbèi.
examples.english: 'The international situation is constantly changing; we must make full preparations.'

examples.simplified: 在风云变幻的股票市场，任何疏忽都会造成巨大的损失。
examples.pinyin: Zài fēngyún-biànhuàn de gǔpiào shìchăng, rènhé shūhū dōu huì zàochéng jùdà de sǔnshī.
examples.english: 'In the constantly shifting stock market, any negligence will cause giant losses.'

translations.english: The literal meaning of this idiom is 'soak thoroughly until dripping wet,' but it is usually used in the sense of 'thoroughly.'

examples.simplified: 比赛中，她把自己的特长发挥得淋漓尽致，最终取得了比赛的胜利。
examples.pinyin: Bĭsài zhōng, tā bă zìjĭ de tècháng fāhuī de línlí-jìnzhì, zuìzhōng qǔdéle bĭsài de shènglì.
examples.english: 'During the competition, she brought her special skills into thorough play, ultimately winning the competition.'

examples.simplified: 这部小说淋漓尽致地反映了十九世纪英国煤矿工人的生活。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bù xiăoshuō línlí-jìnzhì de fănyìngle shíjiǔ shìjì Yīngguó méikuàng gōngrén de shēnghuó.
examples.english: 'This novel thoroughly reflects the life of 19th century English coal miners.'

translations.english: 忧心 means 'worry' and 忡忡 means 'sad and worried.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'sad and worried.'

examples.simplified: 父母们对电视上的涉及暴力和性内容的节目忧心忡仲，生怕孩子受到不良习气的影响。
examples.pinyin: Fùmǔmen duì diànshì shàng de shèjí bàolì hé xìng nèiróng de jiémù yōuxīn- chōngchōng, shēngpà háizi shòudào bù liáng xíqì de yĭngxiăng.
examples.english: 'The parents were very worried about the programs on television that involved violence and sexual content, very much afraid that their child would be influenced by the bad habits.'

examples.simplified: 总理忧心忡忡地说，"没想到情况这么严重。"
examples.pinyin: Zŏnglĭ yōuxīn-chōngchōng de shuō: "Méi xiăngdào qíngkuàng zhème yánzhòng."
examples.english: 'The premier said, sad and worried, "I wouldn't have thought the situation would be so serious."'

translations.english: 直感 means 'direct' and 了当 means 'straightforward.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'direct, straightforward.'

examples.simplified: 你有什么话就直截了当地说吧，别绕弯子。
examples.pinyin: Nĭ yŏu shénme huà jiù zhíjié-liăodàng de shuō ba, bié rào wānzi.
examples.english: 'If you have anything to say, say it directly, don't beat around the bush.'

examples.simplified: 记者直截了当地问，"你跟她到底什么关系？ "
examples.pinyin: Jìzhě zhíjié-liăodàng de wèn: "Nĭ gēn tā dàodĭ shénme guānxi?"
examples.english: The reporter asked directly, "What's your relationship to her?"'

translations.english: 眼花 means 'blurrv vision' and 缭乱 means 'confused, chaotic.' The meaning of the whole idiom can be either 'confused, dazzled' or 'confusing, dazzling.'

examples.simplified: 中国武打片里眼花繚乱的动作让外国人看了大吃一惊。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó wǔdăpiān lĭ yănhuā-liáoluàn de dòngzuò ràng wàiguó rén kànle dà chī yì jīng.
examples.english: 'The dazzling movements in Chinese acrobatic fighting films astonish foreigners when they have seen them.'

examples.simplified: 十多个人竞争民主党总统候选人，每个人都有一套自己的政治主张，这可 能让部分选民眼花繚乱。
examples.pinyin: Shí duō ge rén jìngzhēng Mínzhǔdăng zŏngtŏng hòuxuănrén, měi ge rén dōu yŏu yí tào zìjĭ de zhèngzhì zhǔzhāng, zhè kěnéng ràng bùfen xuănmín yănhuā- liáoluàn.
examples.english: 'More than a dozen people competing for Democratic presidential nominee, each with his or her own political views - this may confuse a portion of the voters.'

translations.english: 屈 means 'submit' and 挠 means 'bent, crooked.' The whole idiom means 'refuse to submit, stick to one's guns.'

examples.simplified: 在困难面前，他不屈不挠，努力奋斗，最后胜利了。
examples.pinyin: Zài kùnnán miànqián, tā bùqū-bùnáo, nǔlì fèndòu, zuìhòu shènglì le.
examples.english: 'In the face of difficulty he refused to submit, struggling hard and succeeding in the end.'

examples.simplified: 中国人民经过不屈不挠的斗争，最终赢得了独立。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó rénmín jīngguò bùqū-bùnáo de dòuzhēng, zuìzhōng yíngdéle dúlì.
examples.english: 'After an unyielding struggle, the Chinese people ultimately won independence.'

translations.english: 语 here means 'manner of speaking,' 重 means 'serious,' 心 means 'intention,' and 长 here means 'profound.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'with a serious manner of speaking and profound intention,' with freer translations being 'sincere' and 'heartfelt.'

examples.simplified: 母亲语重心长地对女儿说："孩子，找对象绝对不能找三心二意的."
examples.pinyin: Mǔqīn yǔzhòng-xīncháng de duì nǚ' ér shuō: "Háizi, zhăo duìxiàng juéduì bù néng zhăo sānxīn-èryì de."
examples.english: 'The mother said in a heartfelt manner to her daughter: "Child, when you look for someone to marry, you absolutely must not look for someone who is of two minds。"'

examples.simplified: 看着灾民，总理语重心长地说："你们受苦了，有什么困难就跟政府说。"
examples.pinyin: Kànzhe zāimín, zŏnglŏ yǔzhòng-xīncháng de shuō: "Nĭmēn shòukǔ le, yŏu shénme kùnnán jiù gēn zhèngfǔ shuō."
examples.english: 'Seeing the disaster victims, the premier said in a very heartfelt way: "You all have suffered hardship; tell the government about whatever hardships you have."'

translations.english: 栩栩 means 'lively, vivid, lifelike' and 如生 means 'like life.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'lifelike.'

examples.simplified: 杜莎夫人蜡像馆里的蜡像个个栩栩如生。
examples.pinyin: Dùshā fūrén làxiàngguăn lĭ de làxiàng gègè xǔxǔ-rúshēng.
examples.english: 'Every one of the wax figures in Madame Tussaud's wax museum is very lifelike.'

examples.simplified: 那幅画上的马栩栩如生，就像真的马在奔跑。
examples.pinyin: Nà fú huà shàng de mă xǔxǔ-rúshēng, jiù xiàng zhēn de mă zài bēnpăo.
examples.english: 'The horses in that painting are very lifelike, just like real horses that are running.'

translations.english: 呕 means 'vomit,' 沥 means 'drip, trickle,' and 血 means 'blood.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'vomit one's heart and let drip out one's blood,' with a freer translation being 'work one's heart out.'

examples.simplified: 父母为了儿女长大以后能够过上幸福的生活，可以说是呕心沥血。
examples.pinyin: Fùmǔ wèile érnǚ zhăngdà yĭhòu nénggòu guòshàng xìngfú de shēnghuó, kěyĭ shuō shì ŏuxīn-lìxuè.
examples.english: 'So that their children after they grow up can lead a happy life, one could say that parents work their hearts out.'

examples.simplified: 他几十年来呕心沥血地改造沙漠，挽救了几万亩良田。
examples.pinyin: Tā jĭ shí nián lái ŏuxīn-lìxuè de găizào shāmò, wănjiùle jĭ wàn mǔ liángtiān.
examples.english: 'The last few decades he has been working his heart out to transform the desert, saving tens of thousands of acres of fertile farmland.'

translations.english: 毛遂 is the name of a person and 荐 means 'recommend.' A literal translation is 'Mao Sui recommended himself,' with a freer translation of the whole idiom being 'volunteer.'

examples.simplified: 电影剧组还缺一位演男二号的人，她毛遂自荐，化妆后演了那个角色。
examples.pinyin: Diànyĭng jùzǔ hái quē yí wèi yăn nán èrhào de rén, tā Máo Suì-zìjiàn, huàzhuāng hòu yănle nàge juésè.
examples.english: 'In the film crew they are still lacking someone to play the role of male number two; she volunteered and, after putting on make-up, played that role.'

examples.simplified: 他用毛遂自荐的方式给附近各个公司的人事部门经理打电话，希望能够找到一份工作。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng Máo Suì-zìjiàn de fāngshì gěi fùjìn gègè gōngsī de rénshì bùmen jīnglĭ dă diànhuà, xīwàng nénggòu zhăodào yí fèn gōngzuò.
examples.english: 'He used the way of Mao Sui when he recommended himself, calling the managers of the personnel departments of all the companies in the vicinity, in hopes of being able to find a job.'

translations.english: 方 here means 'just now,' 兴 means 'rise,' 未 means 'not yet,' and 艾 means 'stop.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'just now rising and not yet stopped,' with freer translations being 'on the rise, on the upswing.'

examples.simplified: 在中国"英语热"方兴未艾。
examples.pinyin: Zài Zhōngguó "Yīngyǔ rè" fāngxīng-wèi' ài.
examples.english: 'In China, the "English craze" is still on the upswing.'

examples.simplified: 据说这家电信巨头要在方兴未艾的生物医学领域投入大笔资金。
examples.pinyin: Jùshuō zhè jiā diànxìn jùtóu yào zài fāngxīng-wèi' ài de shēngwù yīxué lĭngyù tóurù dà bĭ zījīn.
examples.english: 'It is said that this telecommunications magnate wants to invest a huge sum of capital in the rapidly rising realm of biomedicine.'

translations.english: 聚 means 'collect,' 会 means 'concentrate,' and the noun object 精神 (which is here split into 精 and 神) means 'energy.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'with total concentration.'

examples.simplified: 上课的时候，学生们聚精会神地听老师讲课。
examples.pinyin: Shàngkè de shíhòu, xuéshengmen jùjīng-huìshén de tīng lăoshī jiăngkè.
examples.english: 'In class, the students listened to the teacher lecture with total concentration.'

examples.simplified: 中国需要一个和平稳定的周边环境，以便聚精会神地搞国内建设。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó xūyào yí gè hépíng wěndĭng de zhōubiān huánjìng, yĭbiàn jùjīng-huìshén de găo guónèi jiànshè。
examples.english: 'China needs a peaceful and stable peripheral environment, so that it can with total concentration engage in domestic construction.'

translations.english: 比比 means 'everywhere' and 皆 means 'all.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'everywhere in all cases it is,' with freer translations being 'can be found everywhere, great in number, in abundance.'

examples.simplified: 这是一个富人区，豪华轿车比比皆是。
examples.pinyin: Zhè shì yíge fùrén qū, háohuá jiàochē bĭbĭ-jiēshì。
examples.english: 'This is a district of rich people; luxury automobiles can be found everywhere.'

examples.simplified: 在欧洲，会说五种以上语言的人比比皆是。
examples.pinyin: Zài Ōuzhōu, huì shuō wǔ zhŏng yĭshàng yǔyán de rén bĭbĭ-jiēshì.
examples.english: 'In Europe, people who can speak five or more languages can be found everywhere.'

translations.english: 瞻 means 'gaze' and 瞩 here means 'look at with attention.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'look out from on high and see far,' with freer translations including 'far sighted' and 'take a long-range or long-term approach to something.'

examples.simplified: 她高瞻远瞩，在能源危机到来以前很多年，就提出了要发展新能源的主张。
examples.pinyin: Tā gāozhān-yuănzhǔ, zài néngyuán wēijī dào lái yĭqián hěn duō nián, jiù tíchūle yào fāzhān xīn néngyuán de zhǔzhāng.
examples.english: 'She is very far sighted, having many years before the coming of the energy crisis already put forward the suggestion to develop new sources of energy.'

examples.simplified: 邓小平高瞻远瞩，用"一国两制"的办法成功地解决了香港和澳门问题。
examples.pinyin: Dēng Xiāopíng gāozhān-yuānzhǔ, yòng "Yì Guó Liāng Zhì" de bànfā chénggōng de jiějuéle Xiānggāng hé Àomén wèntí。
examples.english: 'Deng Xiaoping was very far sighted, using the means of "One County, Two Systems" to successfully solve the problem of Hong Kong and Macao.'

translations.english: 动 means 'move' and 衷 means 'heart.' A literal translation is 'there is no moving in the heart,' with freer translations of the whole idiom being 'unmoved, unconcerned.'

examples.simplified: 因为经历得多了，好像对这种事就无动于衷了。
examples.pinyin: Yīnwèi jīnglìde duōle, hāoxiàng duì zhè zhŏng shì jiù wúdòng-yúzhōng le.
examples.english: 'Because she has experienced so much, it seems she is unmoved by this kind of thing.'

examples.simplified: 他无动于衷地说："不是我无情，而是没有办法."
examples.pinyin: Tā wúdòng-yúzhōng de shuō: "Bú shì wŏ wúqíng, ér shì méiyŏu bànfā."
examples.english: 'Quite unmoved, he said_ "It's not that I have no feelings, but that there is nothing that can be done." '

translations.english: 迫 here means 'urgent, pressing,' with 眉 meaning 'eyebrow' and 睫 meaning 'eyelash.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'pressing on the eyebrows and eyelashes.' Freer translations include 'very urgent' and 'imminent.'

examples.simplified: 社会养老保障制度的改革已经迫在眉睫。
examples.pinyin: Shèhuì yănglăo băozhàng zhìdù de găigé yĭjīng pòzài-méijié.
examples.english: 'Reforms in Social Security Retirement System (lit. "social retirement protection system") are already imminent.'

examples.simplified: 对于这个公司来说，从银行得到贷款是迫在眉睫的问题。
examples.pinyin: Duìyú zhège gōngsī lái shuō, cóng yínháng dedào dàikuăn shì pòzài-méijié de wèntí。
examples.english: 'For this company, to obtain a loan from a bank is an urgent problem.'

translations.english: 触目 means 'strike the eye, see' and 惊心 means 'alarmed in one's heart.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'frightening, shocking.'

examples.simplified: 看到这些触目惊心的照片，没有人不会流泪。
examples.pinyin: Kàndào zhèxiē chùmù-jīngxīn de zhàopiàn, méiyŏu rén búhuì liúlèi.
examples.english: 'If they saw these shocking photographs, there is no one who would not shed tears.'

examples.simplified: 这种悲惨的情景让人触目惊心。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhŏng bēicăn de qíngjĭng ràng rén chùmù-jīngxīn.
examples.english: 'A tragic scene like this makes one feel shocked.'

translations.english: 济 means 'help.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'has no help to matters.' A freer translation is 'to not help matters, of no avail, to no effect.'

examples.simplified: 父母一再劝说孩子，但是已经无济于事，孩子还是决定退学。
examples.pinyin: Fùmǔ yízài quànshuō háizi, dànshì yĭjīng wújì-yúshì, háizi háishì juédìng tuìxué.
examples.english: 'The parents repeatedly exhorted their child, but it was already of no avail; the child still decided to drop out of school.' 88 Entry 149:应有尽有

examples.simplified: 病人疼得厉害，这时候用普通的药物已经无济于事了，只能用那种进口的特效药。
examples.pinyin: Bìngrén téngde lìhai, zhè shíhou yòng pǔtōng de yàowù yĭjīng wújì-yúshì le, zhĭ néng yòng nà zhŏng jìnkŏu de tèxiàoyào.
examples.english: 'The patient was in great pain; at this time to use ordinary medicine no longer helped matters; they could only use that kind of imported, specially potent medicine.'

translations.english: 尽 means 'all.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'have everything that should be had,' with a freer translation being 'lack nothing, complete.'

examples.simplified: 中国的大商场里一般都有一层美食城，里面各地风味小吃应有尽有。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó de dà shāngchāng lĭyìbān dōu yŏu yì céng měishíchéng, lĭmiàn gè dì fēngwèi xiāochī yīngyŏu-jìnyŏu.
examples.english: 'In the larger department stores in China there is usually a "fine foods city," in which local delicacies from everywhere are to be had, with nothing lacking.'

examples.simplified: 最新的手机，集中了许多产品的功能，例如电话、电子邮件、网络、录音 机、照相机、全球卫星定位系统等等，可以说是应有尽有。
examples.pinyin: Zuì xīn de shŏujī, jízhōngle xǔduōchānpĭn de gōngnéng, lìrú diànhuà, diànzĭ yóujiàn, wăngluò, lùyīnjī, zhàoxiàngjī, quánqiú wèixīng dìngwèi xìtŏng děngděng, kěyĭ shuō shì yīngyŏu-jìnyŏu.
examples.english: 'The newest cell phones have concentrated in one place the functions of several products, such as telephone, e-mail, Internet, tape recorder, camera, GPS, etc.; it can be said they have everything that's required.'

translations.english: 轅 means 'shaft (of a vehicle) ' and 辙 means 'rut, groove, track (left by a wheel in the ground).' A literal translation is 'south shaft north rut,' which could be translated more freely as 'go south by driving north.' By metaphor this means 'head in the wrong direction,' 'one's goal and one's actions are exactly opposite,' or 'defeat one's purpose.'

examples.simplified: 要想改变贫困人口的生活状況，得给他们足够的教育和就业机会，一味地给他们钱会产生相反的结果的，会南辕北辙的。
examples.pinyin: Yào xiăng găibiàn pínkùn rénkŏu de shēnghuó zhuàngkuàng, děi gěi tāmen zúgòu de jiàoyù hé jiùyè jīhuì, yíwèi de gěi tāmen qián huì chănshēng xiāngfăn de jiéguŏ de, huì nányuán-běizhé de.
examples.english: 'If one wants to change the living conditions of the impoverished population, one must give them sufficient educational and employment opportunities, always to give them money will produce the opposite result, it will defeat one's purpose.'

examples.simplified: 他们的做法和目的正好南辕北辙。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen de zuòfă hé mùdì zhènghăo nányuán-běizhé.
examples.english: 'Their practices and their goals are exactly opposite.'

translations.english: 朝 means 'morning, day.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'some day in the future.' 90 Entry 152:大有可为

examples.simplified: 他每个星期都买一次彩票，希望有朝一日能够中大奖。
examples.pinyin: Tā měi gè xīngqī dōu măi yí cì căipiào, xīwàng yŏuzhāo-yírì nínggòu zhòng dà jiăng.
examples.english: 'He buys a lottery ticket every week, hoping that one day in the future he can win a major prize.'

examples.simplified: 如果有朝一日中国成为超级大国，那么汉语会不会变得跟英语一祥重要？
examples.pinyin: Rúguŏ yŏuzhāo-yírì Zhōngguó chéngwéi chāojí da guó, nàme Hànyǔ huì bú huì biànde gēn Yīngyǔ yíyàng zhòngyào?
examples.english: 'If some day in the future China becomes a superpower, then will the Chinese language become as important as English?'

translations.english: 大 here means 'greatly, very much,' 可 means 'can,' and 为 means 'do.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'greatly have things one can do.' Freer translations of the idiom include 'very promising, have bright prospects, have great potential.'

examples.simplified: 未来几十年中，新能源行业大有可为。
examples.pinyin: Wèilái jĭ shí nián zhōng, xīn néngyuén hángyè dàyŏu-kěwéi.
examples.english: 'In the next few decades, businesses dealing with new sources of energy will have bright prospects.'

examples.simplified: 政府鼓励青年到中西部去找工作，说中西部开发大有可为。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngfǔ gǔlì qīngnián dào zhōngxībù qù zhăo gōngzuò, shuō zhōngxībù kāifā dàyŏu-kěwéi.
examples.english: 'The government encourages young people to go to the Midwest to look for work, saying that the development of the Midwest has great potential.'

translations.english: 史 means 'history' and 前例 means 'precedent.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'in history there is no precedent.' A common translation is 'unprecedented.'

examples.simplified: 在这次足球世界杯比赛中，他平均每场踢进两个球，这是史无前例的。
examples.pinyin: Zài zhè cì zúqiú shìjièbēi bĭsài zhōng, tā pīngjūn měi chăng tíjìn lĭang gè qiú, zhè shì shĭwúqiánlì de.
examples.english: 'In this soccer world cup competition, he on average in each game has been kicking in two balls, which is unprecedented.'

examples.simplified: 在那次史无前例的唐山大地震中，死亡的人数多达二十四万人，超过了受伤的人数。
examples.pinyin: Zài nà cì shĭwúqiánlì de Tāngshān dà dìzhèn zhōng, sĭwáng de rénshù duōdá èrshisì wàn rén, chāoguòle shòushāng de rénshù.
examples.english: 'In the unprecedented great earthquake of Tangshan that time, the number of those who died was as many as 240,000, which surpassed the number injured.'

translations.english: 随 means 'follow' and 欲 means 'want, desire.' The literal meaning is 'follow what the heart desires.' This idiom is often translated as 'do exactly as one pleases, at will, anything goes.'

examples.simplified: 她是个大画家，画什么像什么，已经达到随心所欲的地歩了。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì gè dà huàjiā, huà shénme xiàng shénme, yĭjīng dádà suíxīn-suŏyù de dìbù le.
examples.english: 'She is a great painter, and whatever she paints looks real; she has already reached the point where she can do anything she wants.'

examples.simplified: 他是个亿万富翁，可以随心所欲地买他喜欢的东西。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì gè yìwàn fùwēng, kěyĭ suíxīnsuŏyu de măi tā xĭhuān de dōngxi.
examples.english: 'He's a billionaire, so he can buy the things he likes at will.'

translations.english: 丰 means 'abundant,' 功 means 'accomplishment,' 伟 means 'great,' and 绩 means 'achievement.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'abundant accomplishment great achievement,' with freer translations being 'great achievement, magnificent accomplishment.'

examples.simplified: 这本画册形象地记录了他的丰功伟绩。
examples.pinyin: Zhè běn huàcè xíngxiàng de jìlùle tā de fēnggōngwěijì.
examples.english: 'This album vividly recorded his grand achievements.'

examples.simplified: 她为世界和平建立的丰功伟绩永远留在人们心里。
examples.pinyin: Tā wèi shìjiè hépíng jiànlì de fēnggōng-wěijì yŏngyuăn liú zài rénmen xīnlĭ.
examples.english: 'The grand contributions she made for world peace will forever remain in people's hearts.'

translations.english: 声 means 'voice' and 色 here means 'facial complexion.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'not change one's voice or complexion.' More freely, the idiom means 'calm and collected, maintain one's composure.'

examples.simplified: 在演讲的过程中他得到消息，他家里出了大事，但是他却不动声色，按计划
examples.pinyin: 做完了演讲。
examples.english: Zài yănjiăng de guòchéng zhōng tā dédào xiāoxi, tā jiālĭ chūle dàshì, dànshì tā què búdòng-shēngsè, ăn jìhuà zuòwánle yănjiăng.

examples.pinyin: Example 2:
examples.english: Wàimiàn yŏu yìdiăn dòngjìng, yúshí jĭ míng tègōng búdòng-shēngsè de tiējìnle zŏngtŏng, yĭfáng chū shì.

translations.english: 取 means 'take,' 代 means 'replace,' and 之 means 'it.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'take and replace it,' with freer translations being 'replace (someone or something), take over, supersede.'

examples.simplified: 北京老城的小胡同渐渐消失了，取而代之的是宽阔、平坦的大马路。
examples.pinyin: Běijīng lăo chéng de xĭao hútòng jiànjiàn xiāoshīle, qǔ' érdàizhī de shì kuānkuò, píngtăn de dà màlù.
examples.english: 'The

examples.simplified: 石油资源总有一天会用尽的，我们将用什么新能源取而代之?
examples.pinyin: Shíyóu zīyuán zŏng yŏu yì tiàn huì yòngjìn de, wŏmen jiāng yòng shénme xīn néngyuán qǔ' érdàizhī?
examples.english: 'Petroleum resources will some day be exhausted; what new energy source shall we use to replace them?'

translations.english: 根 means 'root,' 深 means 'deep,' 蒂 means 'stem,' and 固 means 'firm, solid.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'roots deep stem firm,' with freer translations being 'deep-rooted, rock solid, ingrained.'

examples.simplified: 根深蒂固，即使生活条件改善了，那些思想还是不容易改变。
examples.pinyin: Nóngmín de yìxiē sīxiăng gēnshēn-dìgù, jíshĭ shēnghuó tiáojiàn găishàn le, nàxiē sīxiăng háishì bù róngyì găibiăn.
examples.english: 'Some of the thinking of the peasants is deep-rooted; even if living conditions have improved, that thinking is still not easy to change.'

examples.simplified: 新来的官员不敢轻易触犯在当地根深蒂固的大家族的利益。
examples.pinyin: Xīn lái de guānyuán bù găn qīngyì chùfàn zài dāngdì gēnshēn-dìgù de dà jiāzú de lìyì.
examples.english: 'The newly arrived official does not dare rashly to offend the interests of the entrenched big clans of the area.'

translations.english: The meaning of this idiom is 'in the course of time, gradually.'

examples.simplified: 她每天坚持学习十个新生词，久而久之，英语水平有了明显的提高。
examples.pinyin: Tā měi tiān jiānchí xuéxí shí ge xīn shēngcí, jiǔ' érjiǔzhī, Yīngyǔ shuĭpíng yŏule míngxiăn de tígāo.
examples.english: 'She persisted in learning ten new vocabulary words every day; in time, her English level experienced a clear improvement.'

examples.simplified: 两个人本来矛盾不深，但是由于缺乏沟通，久而久之，矛盾竟然不可调和了。
examples.pinyin: Liăng ge rén běnlái máodùn bù shēn, dànshì yóyǔ quēfá gōutōng, jiǔ' érjiǔzhī, máodùn jìngrán bùkě tiáohé le.
examples.english: 'Originally the conflict between them was not deep, but due to a lack of communication, over the course of time, their conflict actually became irreconcilable.'

translations.english: 楚 was the name of a state in ancient China. A literal translation of this idiom is 'four sides Chu songs,' with a freer translation being 'everywhere there were the sounds of soldiers from the state of Chu who were singing.' This is a metaphor for being in a situation where one is attacked by enemies everywhere and one is isolated and cut off from help. English translations include 'find oneself besieged on all sides,' 'deserted by one's allies,' and 'in dire straits.'

examples.simplified: 很多部长都反对总统，最后连副总统也反对了，总统处于四面楚歌之中。
examples.pinyin: Hěn duō bùzhăng dōu fănduì zŏngtŏng, zuìhòu lián fùzŏngtŏng yě fănduìle, zŏngtŏng chǔyuú sìmiàn-Chǔgē zhīzhōng.
examples.english: 'Many ministers opposed the president; in the end even the vice president opposed him; the president found himself besieged on all sides.'

examples.simplified: 银行不给贷款，商品卖不出去，这家公司陷于四面楚歌的境地。
examples.pinyin: Yínháng bù gěi dàikuăn, shāngpĭn màibùchūqù, zhè jiā gōngsī xiànyǔ sĭmiàn-Chǔgē de jìngdì.
examples.english: 'When the banks did not make loans, the goods could not be sold, and this company fell into dire straits.'

translations.english: 急 means 'impatient,' 功 means 'success,' and 利 means 'benefit.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'impatient to achieve success and benefit,' with a freer translation being 'eager for quick success and immediate gain.'

examples.simplified: 教育的目的是培养人才，而人才的成长需要时间，所以教育不能急功近利。
examples.pinyin: Jiàoyù de mùdì shì péiyăng réncái, ér réncái de chéngzhăng xūyào shíjiān, suŏyĭ jiàoyù bù néng jígōng-jìnlì.
examples.english: 'The purpose of education is to cultivate human talent, and the growth of human talent takes time; so education must not be eager for quick success and immediate gain.'

examples.simplified: 股票刚涨了百分之五他就急于把股票卖出去，显示了他急功近利的心理。
examples.pinyin: Gǔpiào gāng zhăngle băifēnzhīwǔ tā jiù jíyú bă gǔpiăo màichūqù, xiănshìle tā jígōng-jìnlì de xīnlĭ.
examples.english: 'Stocks have just risen five percent and he is already anxious to sell the stocks, which has demonstrated his mindset of being eager for quick success and immediate gain.'

translations.english: 始 means 'beginning,' 终 means 'end,' and 渝 means 'change.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is '(from) beginning to end not change,' with freer translations being 'unswerving, steady, steadfast.'

examples.simplified: 我们要始终不渝地奉行独立自主的和平外交政策。
examples.pinyin: Wŏmen yào shĭzhōng-bùyú de fèngxfng dúlì zìzhǔ de hépíng wàijiāo zhèngcè.
examples.english: 'We should steadfastly pursue an independent, self-determined, and peaceful foreign policy.'

examples.simplified: 多年来，他始终不渝地坚持为普通人创作诗歌。
examples.pinyin: Duō nián lái, tā shĭzhōng-bùyú de jiānchií wèi pǔtóng rén chuàngzuò shīgē.
examples.english: 'For many years, he persisted steadfastly in creating poetry for the average person.'

translations.english: 目 here means 'look, glance,' J means 'understand,' and 然 means 'in a certain way or manner.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'one glance understanding manner,' with a freer translation being 'at one glance to understand fully.'

examples.simplified: 总经理把公司的优势和劣势一条条列得清清楚楚，使人一目了然。
examples.pinyin: Zŏngjīnglĭ bă gōngsī de yōushì hé lièshì yì tiáo tiáo liède qīngqīngchǔchǔ, shĭ rén yímù-liăorán.
examples.english: 'The general manager listed the company's favorable and unfavorable conditions one at a time in a crystal clear manner, so that people would be completely clear at one glance.'

examples.simplified: 超市里的商品都标明总的价格和单价，顾客看了一目了然。
examples.pinyin: Chāoshì lĭ de shāngpĭn dōu biāomíng zŏng de jiăgé hé dānjià, gùkè kànle yímù-liăorán.
examples.english: 'The goods at the supermarket all indicate the total price and the unit price; when the customers see them they are clear at one glance.'

translations.english: 量 here means 'estimate' and 行 means 'act.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'estimate one's strength and then carry out some action,' with freer translations being 'act according to one's capacity, do what one can.'

examples.simplified: 你同时做这么多事，怎么能完成呢?不要贪多，要量力而行。
examples.pinyin: Nĭ tóngshí zuò zhème duō shì, zěnme néng wánchéng ne? Búyào tān duō, yào liànglì-érxíng.
examples.english: 'You are simultaneously doing so many things, how can you complete them? Don't be greedy; you should act according to your ability.'

examples.simplified: 各地区在发展经济的时候要量カ而行，抓住重点。
examples.pinyin: Gè dìqū zài fāzhăn jīngjì de shíhou yào liànglì-érxíng, zhuāzhù zhòngdiăn.
examples.english: 'As each region develops the economy, it should act according to its capacity and come to grips with the key points.'

translations.english: 浩荡 refers to a 'grand' or 'mighty' flow of water. The meaning of the whole idiom is 'with great strength and vigor, in formidable array, grand.'

examples.simplified: 结婚的车队从新娘的家浩浩荡荡地开向新郎的家。
examples.pinyin: Jiéhūn de chēduì cóng xīnniáng de jiā hàohào-dàngdàng de kāi xiàng xīnláng de jiā.
examples.english: 'The wedding motorcade drove in a grand procession from the bride's home to the groom's home.'

examples.simplified: 游行的队伍浩浩荡荡地走过了总统府门前。
examples.pinyin: Yóuxíng de duìwǔ hàohào-dàngdàng de zŏu guò le zòngtòngfǔ ménqián.
examples.english: 'With great strength and vigor, the marching troops passed before the gate of the presidential palace.'

translations.english: 笋 means 'bamboo shoot.' The literal meaning of this idiom is '(spring up like) bamboo shoots after spring rain.' Freer translations include 'spring up like mushrooms, emerge rapidly in large numbers.'

examples.simplified: 私人汽车增加很快，所以加油站也如雨后春笋般出现了。
examples.pinyin: Sīrén qìchē zēngjiā hěn kuài, suŏyĭ jiāyóuzhàn yě rú yǔhòu-chūnsǔn bān chūxiànle.
examples.english: 'Privately owned cars increased very quickly, so gas stations have also appeared, springing up like mushrooms.'

examples.simplified: 这几年，有关中美贸易的文章如雨后春笋，数不过来。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jĭ nián, yŏuguān Zhōng-Měi màoyì de wénzhāng rú yǔhòu-chūnsǔn, shǔ bú guòlái.
examples.english: 'In the past few years, articles about U.S.-Chinese trade have appeared rapidly in large numbers, too many to count.'

translations.english: 举 means 'action' and 动 means 'movement.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'every action and every movement.'

examples.simplified: 因为警察怀疑他涉嫌犯罪，所以开始对他进行监视。他的一举一动都在警察的监视之下。
examples.pinyin: Yīnwèi jĭngchá huáiyí tā shèxián fànzuĭ, suŏyĭ kāishĭ duì tā jìnxíng jiānshì. Tā de yìjǔ-yìdòng dōu zài jīngchá de jiānshì zhīxià.
examples.english: 'Because the police suspected him of having committed a crime, they began to keep him under surveillance; his every move was under surveillance by the police.'

examples.simplified: 那位明星的一举一动都给他的粉丝们很大的影响。
examples.pinyin: Nà wèi míngxīng de yìjǔ-yìdòng dōu gěi tā de fěnsīmen hěn dà de yĭngxiăng.
examples.english: 'That star's every move has a big influence on his fans.'

translations.english: 目 means 'eye' and 睹 means 'see.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'have eyes together see,' with a freer translation being 'obvious to all.'

examples.simplified: 她最近的进步是有目共睹的。
examples.pinyin: Tā zuìjìn de jìnbù shì yŏumù-gòngdǔ de.
examples.english: 'Her recent progress is obvious to all.'

examples.simplified: 这是有目共睹的事实，谁也否认不了。
examples.pinyin: Zhè shì yŏumù-gòngdǔ de shìshí, shuí yě fŏurèn bùliăo.
examples.english: 'This is a fact that is obvious to all; nobody can deny it.'

translations.english: 欣欣 means 'thriving,' 向 here means 'turn toward,' and 荣 means 'flourishing.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'thriving and turning toward the flourishing,' with freer translations being 'thriving, flourishing, prosperous.'

examples.simplified: 经过几十年的发展，全国各地都呈现出欣欣向荣的景象。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò jĭ shí nián de fāzhăn, quán guó gè dì dōu chéngxiànchū xīnxīn-xiàngróng de jĭngxiàng.
examples.english: 'After several decades of development, every place in the whole country presents a very thriving picture.'

examples.simplified: 春天来了，花草树木欣欣向荣。
examples.pinyin: Chūntiān láile, huācăo shùmù xīnxīn-xiàngróng.
examples.english: 'Spring has come; the flowers, plants, and trees are thriving.'

translations.english: 三 means 'three (times),' 顾 means 'pay a visit,' and 茅庐 means 'thatched hut.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'make three visits to the thatched cottage (as Liu Bei, prince of Shu, did to visit Zhuge Liang).' By metaphor this means 'repeatedly ask a worthy person to assume an important post' or 'sincerely and repeatedly request something from someone.'

examples.simplified: 厂长三顾茅庐，终于把那位技术高超的退休工人请回了工厂。
examples.pinyin: Chăngzhăng sāngù-máolú, zhōngyú bă nà wèi jìshù gāochāo de tuìxiuū gōngrén qĭnghuīle goōngchăng.
examples.english: 'The factory director sincerely and repeatedly entreated him, finally being able to get that retired worker with the superb skills to return to the factory.'

examples.simplified: 记者三顾茅庐，才釆访到那起事件的当事人。
examples.pinyin: Jìzhě sāngu-máolú, cái căifăng dào nà qĭ shìjiàn de dāngshìrén.
examples.english: 'The reporter sincerely asked over and over again; only then was she able to interview the person involved in that incident.'

translations.english: 五彩 means 'five colors, multicolored' and 缤纷 means 'many.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'a profusion of colors, riot of colors, multicolored.'

examples.simplified: 节日的时代广场五彩缤纷，非常好看。
examples.pinyin: Jiérì de sh ídài guăngchăng wǔcăi-bīnf ēn, fēicháng hăokàn.
examples.english: 'During the festival period, the square was filled with colors; it was very beautiful.'

examples.simplified: 孩子们总是梦想着生活在五彩缤纷的世界里。
examples.pinyin: Háizimen zŏngshì mèngxiăngzhe shēnghuó zài wǔcăi-bīnfēn de shìjiè lĭ.
examples.english: 'Children always dream of living in a world of many colors.'

translations.english: 正经 means 'serious, solemn.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'serious, solemn, in all seriousness.'

examples.simplified: 听完汇报以后，领导一本正经地说：外交无小事，你们一定要认真处理， 不许有任何差错。
examples.pinyin: Tīngwán huìbào hòu, lĭngdăo yìběn-zhèngjīng de shuō: "Wàijiāo wú xiăo shì, nĭmen yìdìng yào rènzhēn chùlĭ, bù xū yŏu rèn hé chācuò."
examples.english: 'After hearing the report, the leader said very seriously: "When it comes to diplomacy, there is no such thing as a trivial matter; you definitely must handle this conscientiously, it's not permitted that there be any mistakes."'

examples.simplified: 看着他一本正经的样子，她赶紧说："我是跟你开玩笑呢，别害伯。"
examples.pinyin: Kànzhe tā yìběn-zhèngjīng de yàngzĭ, tā gănjĭn shuō: "Wŏ shì gēn nĭ kāi wánxiăo ne, bié hàipà."
examples.english: 'Looking at his serious manner, she quickly said_ "I'm joking with you, don't be afraid."'

translations.english: 恍然 means 'suddenly' and 悟 means 'come to one's senses, awaken, realize.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'suddenly greatly realize,' with freer translations being 'suddenly understand, suddenly see the light, wake up to the facts.'

examples.simplified: 对方提醒以后，他恍然大悟："原来你说的是她啊！"
examples.pinyin: Duìfāng tíxĭng yĭhòu, tā huăngrán-dàwù: "Yu ánlái nĭ shuō de shì tā a!"
examples.english: 'After the other person reminded him, he suddenly realized: "So the person you were talking about is her!"'

examples.simplified: 她说出谜底以后，大家才恍然大悟。
examples.pinyin: Tā shuō chū mídĭ yĭhòu, dàjiā cái huăngrán-dàwù.
examples.english: 'Only after she mentioned the solution to the puzzle did everyone suddenly understand.'

translations.english: 视 means 'look' and 见 means 'see.' The literal meaning of this idiom is 'look but not see.' Sometimes this idiom is also used in the sense of 'see but pretend not to see, turn a blind eye to.'

examples.simplified: 警察怎么能对这类违法活动视而不见呢?
examples.pinyin: Jĭngchá zěnme néng duì zhè lèi wèifaă huoódòng shì' érbújiàn ne?
examples.english: 'How can the police pretend not to see this kind of illegal activity?'

examples.simplified: 早上我跟他打招呼，可是他却视而不见，直接走了过去。
examples.pinyin: Zăoshàng wŏ gēn tā dă zhāohu, kěshì tā què shì'eérbújiàn, zhíjiē zŏule guòqù.
examples.english: 'In the morning I greeted him, but he didn't see me, directly passing by me.'

translations.english: 条 means 'order' and 紊 means 'disorderly.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'having order and not disorderly,' with a freer translation being 'orderly, methodical.'

examples.simplified: 虽然情况相当复杂，但是各项救灾工作还是有条不紊地进行着。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán qíngkuàng xiāngdāng fùzá, dànshì gè xi àng jiùzāi gōngzuò háishì yŏutiáo-bùwěn de jìnxíngzhe.
examples.english: 'Though the situation is fairly complex, each item in the disaster relief work is being carried out in an orderly manner.'

examples.simplified: 她说话不快不慢，做事有条不紊，非常成熟。
examples.pinyin: Tā shuōhuà bú kuài bú màn, zuòshì yŏutiáo-bùwěn, fēicháng chéngshú.
examples.english: 'She speaks neither fast nor slow and is methodical in her work; she's extremely mature.'

translations.english: 別 means 'additionally,' 开 means 'open,' and 生面 means 'a new situation.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'additionally open up a new situation,' with freer translations being 'start something new, break new ground.'

examples.simplified: 这种庆祝生日的方式以前从来没见过，可以说是别开生面。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhŏng qìngzhù shēngrì de fāngshì yĭqián cónglái méi jiànguò, kěyĭ shuō shì biékāi-shēngmiàn.
examples.english: 'This way of celebrating birthdays has never been seen before; one could say that it's breaking new ground.'

examples.simplified: 会场里正在进行一场别开生面的对话，一方是大公司老总，一方是普通 小学生。
examples.pinyin: Huìchăng lĭ zhèng zài jìnxíng yì chăng biékāi-shēngmiàn de duìhuà, yìfāng shì dà gōngsī lăozŏng, yìfāng shì pǔtōng xiăoxuéshēng.
examples.english: 'At the conference site there is taking place a ground-breaking dialogue; one side is the head of a major corporation, and the other side is an ordinary elementary school student.'

translations.english: 锲 means 'carve' and 舍 means 'give up, abandon.' The literal meaning is '(keep on) carving without giving up,' this being a metaphor for possessing perseverance and willpower. This idiom can be translated as 'work with perseverance, keep on chipping away at something.'

examples.simplified: 搞研究就需要这种锲而不舍的精神。
examples.pinyin: Găo yánjiū jiù xūyào zhè zhŏng qiè' érbùshě de jīngshn.
examples.english: 'In conducting research, one needs precisely this kind of persevering spirit.'

examples.simplified: 在国家的基础建设方面必须扎扎实实，锲而不舍。
examples.pinyin: Zài guójiā de jīchǔ jiànshè fāngmiàn bìxū zhā zhā shí shí, qiè' érbùshě.
examples.english: 'In the area of national basic construction, one must be solid and persevering.'

translations.english: 全 means 'all,' 千申 means 'spirit, energy,' and 贯汪 means 'concentrate.' The literal meaning is 'with all one's energy to concentrate on something,' with a freer translation being 'give one's undivided attention to, be absorbed in.'

examples.simplified: 高水平的比赛中，选手必须全神贯注，如果有任何一秒精力不集中，就会
examples.pinyin: 失败。
examples.english: Gāo shuĭpíng de bĭsài zhàng, xuănshŏu bìxū quánshén-guànzhù, rúguŏ yŏu rènhé yì miăo jīnglì bù jízhōng, jiù huì shíbài.

examples.pinyin: Example 2:
examples.english: Tā zhèngzài quánshén-guànzhù de kànshū, yĭzh ìyú gēnběn méiyŏu tīngjiàn diànhuà língshēng.

translations.english: 失 means 'mistake.' A literal translation is in ten thousand there is not even one mistake,' with a freer translation being 'surefire, cannot go wrong.'

examples.simplified: 这次活动意义很大，你们一定要好好准备，确保万无一失。
examples.pinyin: Zhè cì huódòng yìyì hěn dà, nĭmen yídìng yào hăohăo zhǔnbèi, quèbăo wànwúyìshí.
examples.english: 'The significance of this activity is great; you must definitely prepare well to ensure that nothing goes wrong.'

examples.simplified: 为了保证万无一失，那位生物学教授同时叫三个学生再做相同的实验。
examples.pinyin: Wèile băozhèng wànwúyìshí, nà wèi shēngwùxué jiàoshòu tóngshí jiāo sān gè xuéshēng zài zuò xiāngtóng de shíyàn.
examples.english: 'To guarantee that nothing went wrong, the biology professor had three students do the same experiment simultaneously.'

translations.english: 索 means 'seek' and 驥 means 'thoroughbred horse.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'according to a sketch seek a horse.' By analogy, the meaning of the whole idiom is 'search for something based on clues.' The idiom also has an extended meaning of 'do something mechanically' or 'rigid, unimaginative.'

examples.simplified: 他给了我一张名片，几天后，我按图索骥找到了他的公司。
examples.pinyin: Tā gěile wŏ yì zhāng míngpiàn, jĭ tiān hò, wŏ àntú-suŏjì zhăodàole tā de gōngsī.
examples.english: 'He gave me a business card; after several I had, I located his company.' hou, wo antu-suoji zhaodaole ta de days, by searching based on the clues

examples.simplified: 吃药得在医生的指导下进行，不能只看电视上广告的片面宣传，按图索骥。
examples.pinyin: Chī yào děi zài yīshēng de zhĭdăo xià jìnxíng, bù néng zhĭ kàn diànshì shàng guănggào de piànmiàn xuānchuán, àntú-suŏjì.
examples.english: 'Taking medicine must be carried out under the guidance of a doctor; you can't just watch the one-sided propaganda of television advertisements and do things mechanically.'

translations.english: 诸 means 'all,' 如 means 'like,' 此 means 'this,' and 类 means 'type, kind.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'all like this kind,' with a freer translation being 'such, such as, and so on.'

examples.simplified: 不光中国有这样的问题，诸如此类的现象在欧美各国也不少见。
examples.pinyin: Bù guāng Zhōngguó yŏu zhèyàng de wèntí, zhūrú-cĭlèi de xiànxiàng zài Ōu-Měi gè guó yě bù shăo jiàn.
examples.english: 'Not only China has these kinds of problems; phenomena like these are also not rare in the various countries of Europe and the Americas.'

examples.simplified: 有时候我们需要说一些善意的谎言，比方说有人问你，她新买的衣服怎么 样?你可以说"这件衣服很特別"，"这件衣服你穿着很合适"，诸如此类。
examples.pinyin: Yŏu shíhòu wŏmen xūyào shuō yìxié shànyì de huăngyán, bĭfāng shuō yŏu rén wèn nĭ, tā xīn măi de yīfu zěnmeyang? Nĭ kěyĭ shuō "Zhè jiàn yīfu hěn tèbié," "Zhè jiàn yīfu nĭ chuānzhe hěn héshì," zhūrú-cĭlèi.
examples.english: 'Sometimes we need to tell some well-intentioned lies; for example, if someone asks you what you think of the new clothes she has bought, you could say "These clothes are very special," or "These clothes fit you very well," or something else like this.'

translations.english: 精 means 'perfect' or 'perfection,' ^ means 'even more,' and 求 means 'seek.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'perfect even more seek perfection.' Freer translations are 'keep trying to improve, strive for perfection.'

examples.simplified: 他研制出的机器人已经领先全世界了，但是他仍不满足，精益求精，不断 地完善它。
examples.pinyin: Tā yánzhìchū de jīqìrén yĭjīng lĭngxiān quán shìjiè le, dànshì tā réng bù mănzú, jīngyì-qiújīng, búduàn de wánshàn tā.
examples.english: 'The robot that he developed and produced is already in the lead in the whole world, but he is still not satisfied, striving for perfection and continuously refining it.'

examples.simplified: 经理鼓励职员对顾客的服务要精益求精，以便吸引更多的顾客。
examples.pinyin: Jīnglĭ gǔlì zhíyuán duì gùkè de fúwù yào jīngyì-qiújīng, yĭbiàn xīyĭn gèng duō de gùkè.
examples.english: 'The manager encourages employees to keep trying to improve their service to customers, thus attracting even more customers.'

translations.english: 帆 means 'sail' and M means 'favorable, smooth.' A literal translation is 'a sail full of favorable winds,' with a freer translation being 'smooth sailing, unimpeded progress, without a hitch.'

examples.simplified: 她的一生从来没有遇到过麻烦，一帆风顺。
examples.pinyin: Tā de yìshēng cónglái méiyŏu yùdàoguò máfan, yìfān-fēngshǔn.
examples.english: 'Her whole life long she has never encountered trouble; it's been smooth sailing.'

examples.simplified: 很多事情都不是一帆风顺的，你得做好失败的心理准备。
examples.pinyin: Hěn duō shìqing dōu bú shì yìfān-fēngshùn de, nĭ děi zuòhăo shíbài de xnīlĭ zhǔnbèi.
examples.english: 'Lots of things don't go so smoothly; you must prepare yourself mentally for failure.'

translations.english: 串 means 'examine,' 日寸 here means 'the times, the current situation,' 度 means 'estimate,' and 势 here means 'trend.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'examine the current situation and estimate what the trend is like,' with freer translations being 'judge the hour and size up the situation, observe the times and judge the occasion.'

examples.simplified: 在经济衰退的情况下，她审时度势，大量买入新能源方面的股票，结果赚
examples.pinyin: 了大钱。
examples.english: Zài jīngjì shuāituì de qíngkuàng xià, tā shěnshí-duóshì, dàliàng măirù xīn néngyuán fāngmiàn de gǔpiào, jiéguŏ zhuànle dà qián.

examples.pinyin: Example 2:
examples.english: Nà wèi nèigé bùzhăng shěnshí-duóshì, zài zŏngtŏng dàxuăn qián jĭ tiān gōngkāi zhīchí nà wèi nǚ hòuxuănrén.

translations.english: 何 here means 'how.' The literal meaning is 'to talk about it how is it easy,' with a freer translation being 'easier said than done, not at all easy.'

examples.simplified: 说可以那样说，但是做起来谈何容易！
examples.pinyin: Shuō kěyĭ nàyàng shuō, dànshì zuòqĭlái tánhéróngyì!
examples.english: 'You can talk about it like that, but in doing it, it's not at all easy!'

examples.simplified: 要想改变一位八十岁的老人的想法谈何容易?
examples.pinyin: Yào xiăng găibiàn yí wèi bāshí suì de lăorén de xiăngfă tánhéróngyì?
examples.english: 'If you want to change the ways of thinking of an older person of eighty years of age, that is easier said than done.'

translations.english: 大 means 'overall,' 势 means 'tendency,' and 趋 means 'tend towards.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'the direction in which the overall tendency is moving in,' with freer translations being 'the general trend of things' or 'the trend of the times.'

examples.simplified: 随着人们生活水平的提高，有机蔬菜是大势所趋。
examples.pinyin: Suízhe rénmen shēnghuó shuĭpíng de tígāo, yŏujī shūcài shì dàshì-suŏqū.
examples.english: 'Following along with the rise in people's standard of living, organic vegetables are the trend of the times.'

examples.simplified: 由于历史和文化比较接近，欧洲各国在政治上和经济上一是大势所趋。
examples.pinyin: Yŏuyú lìshĭ hé wénhuà bĭjiào jiējìn, Ōuzhōu gè guó zài zhèngzhì shàng hé jīngjì shàng tŏngyī shì dàshì-suŏqū.
examples.english: 'Because their history and culture are relatively close, that the various countries of Europe unite politically and economically is the general trend of things.'

translations.english: 潜 means 'hidden,' 移 means 'move,' 默 means 'silent,' and 化 means 'change.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'hidden move and silent change,' with freer translations being 'influence subtly or imperceptibly.'

examples.simplified: 父母的言行一定会潜移默化地影响孩子。
examples.pinyin: Fùmǔ de yánxíng yídìng huì qiányí-mòhuà de yĭngxiăng háizi.
examples.english: 'The words and actions of parents are certain to subtly influence children.'

examples.simplified: 音乐对人的成长有潜移默化的作用。
examples.pinyin: Yīnyuè duì rén de chéngzhăng yŏu qiányí-mòhuà de zuòyòng.
examples.english: 'Music has an imperceptible effect on the maturation of people.'

translations.english: 掉 here means 'swing' and 轻心、means 'careless, casual.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'careless as you swing something.' The meaning is 'treat something lightly, become complacent, lower one's guard.'

examples.simplified: 虽然我们的对手是个弱队，但是我们也不能掉以轻心。
examples.pinyin: Suírán wŏmen de duìshŏu shì gè ruò duì, dànshì wŏmen yě bù néng diàoyĭqīngxīn.
examples.english: 'Even though our opponent is a weak team, we must not be complacent.'

examples.simplified: 首相就职典礼那天，全市所有的警察一律取消放假，没有人敢掉以轻心。
examples.pinyin: Shŏuxiàng jiùzhí diănlĭ nà tiān, quán shì suŏyŏu de jĭngchá yílǜ qǔxiāo fàngjià, meéiyŏu rén găn diàoyĭqīngxīn.
examples.english: 'On the day of the prime minister's inauguration, all of the police in the whole city had their leave cancelled; nobody dared to lower their guard.'

translations.english: 此 means 'this one,' 起 means 'rise,' 彼 means 'that one,' and 伏 means 'go down.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'this one rises that one goes down,' with freer translations including 'one rises while another falls,' 'in rapid succession,' and 'continuously.'

examples.simplified: 游行示威活动此起彼伏，全国乱成了一锅粥。
examples.pinyin: Yóuxíng shìwēi huódòng cĭqĭ-bĭfú, quán guó luànchéngle yíguōzhōu.
examples.english: 'The demonstrations continued in rapid succession, the whole country ending up in one great disorderly mess.'

examples.simplified: 表演太精彩了，掌声和欢呼声此起彼伏。
examples.pinyin: Biăoyăn tài jīngcăi le, zhăngshēng hé huānhū shēng cĭqĭ-bĭfú.
examples.english: 'The performance was absolutely brilliant, applause and cheers continuing in rapid succession.'

translations.english: 名 means 'name, rank,' 落 means 'fall behind,' and 孙山 is the name of a person. A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'one's name falls behind Sun Shan,' with freer translations being 'fail to pass an examination, fail to be a successful candidate.'

examples.simplified: 虽然她参加过三次奥运会，可是每次都名落孙山。
examples.pinyin: Suírán tā cānjiāguo sān cì Àoyùnhuì, kěshì měi cì dōu míngluò-Sūn Shān.
examples.english: 'Although she participated in the Olympics three times, each time she was unsuccessful.'

examples.simplified: 在这次选举中，他以两票之差名落孙山，令人感到十分可惜。
examples.pinyin: Zài zhè cì xuănjǔ zhōng, tā yĭ liăng piào zhī chā míngluò-Sūn Shān, lìng rén găndào shífēn kěxī.
examples.english: 'In this election, he lost by two votes, making others feel it was a great pity.'

translations.english: 引 I means 'lead' and 胜 means 'beautiful, wonderful.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'lead people to enter a beautiful place.' The meaning of the whole idiom as now used is usually 'fascinating, absorbing, mesmerizing.'

examples.simplified: 美国电视上的幼儿节目内容丰富多彩，引人入胜。
examples.pinyin: Měiguŏ diànshì shàng de yòu' ér jiémù nèiróng fēngfù duōcăi, yĭnrén-rxùshèng.
examples.english: 'Children's programs on U.S. television are rich and varied in content; they are fascinating and absorbing.'

examples.simplified: 欧洲十八、十九世纪产生了大量的优秀的、引人入胜的作品。
examples.pinyin: Ōuzhōu shíbā, shíjiǔ shìjì chănshēngle dàliàng de yōuxiù de yĭnrén-rùshèng de zuòpĭn.
examples.english: 'Europe in the 18th and 19th centuries produced a great amount of outstanding and mesmerizing literary and artistic works.'

translations.english: 堪 means 'can' and 设想 means 'imagine.' The whole idiom means 'unbearable to contemplate, unthinkable, inconceivable.'

examples.simplified: 如果地球的平均温度升高两度，那么后果不堪设想。
examples.pinyin: Rúguŏ dìqiú de píngjūn wēndǔ shēnggāo liăng dù, nàme hòuguŏ bùkān-shèxiăng.
examples.english: 'If the average earth temperature were to rise by two degrees, the consequences would be unimaginable.'

examples.simplified: 因为很多国家有核武器，万一再发生世界大战，结果不堪设想。
examples.pinyin: Yīnwèi hěn duō guójiā yŏu héwǔqì, wànyī zài fāshēng shìjiè dàzhàn, jiéguŏ bùkān-shèxiăng.
examples.english: 'Because many countries possess nuclear weapons, if by some chance another world war were to occur, the results would be inconceivable.'

translations.english: 义 means 'obligation' and 汉顾 means 'look back, change one's mind.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'duty-bound not to turn back, one should not hesitate concerning one's obligations.'

examples.simplified: 大学毕业以后，他义无反顾地去了西藏工作。
examples.pinyin: Dàxué bìyè yĭhòu, tā yìwúfăngù de qùle Xīzàng gōngzuò.
examples.english: 'After graduating from college, without hesitating concerning his obligations, he went to Tibet to work.'

examples.simplified: 他坚信，只要是正义的事情，就义无反顾。
examples.pinyin: Tā jiānxìn, zhĭyào shì zhèngyì de shìqing, jiǔ yìwúfăngù.
examples.english: 'He firmly believes that so long as it is a matter that involves righteousness, then one is duty-bound not to turn back.'

translations.english: 焕然 means 'bright, shining.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'in a bright and shining manner and completely new,' with freer translations being 'look brand-new, change beyond recognition.'

examples.simplified: 装修以后，原来黑暗狭窄的小屋焕然一新，显得宽敞明亮。
examples.pinyin: Zhuāngxiū yĭhòu, yuánlái hēi àn xiázhăi de xiăowū huànrán-yìxīn, xiănde kuānchăng míngliàng.
examples.english: 'After renovation, the small room that originally had been dark and narrow appeared spacious and bright.'

examples.simplified: 经过十年发展，那座小城市焕然一新，简直让人难以相信。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò shí nián fāzhăn, nà zuò xiăo chéngshì huànrán-yìxīn, jiănzhí ràng rén nán yĭ xiāngxìn.
examples.english: 'After ten years of development, that little city changed beyond recognition; it was simply hard for a person to believe.'

translations.english: 视 here means 'look upon as, treat as,' 同 means 'same,' and 仁 means 'benevolence, kindheartedness.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'all treat same kindheartedness,' with a freer translation being 'give equal or impartial treatment to all.'

examples.simplified: 大学对所有申请的学生一视同仁，不管学生的家庭经济情况怎么样，学生 只要达到要求就可以被录取。
examples.pinyin: Dàxué duì su ŏyŏu shēnqĭng de xuéshēng yíshì-tóngrén, bùguăn xuéshēng de jiātĭng jīngjì qíngkuàng zěnmeyàng, xuéshēng zhĭyào dádào yāoqiú jiù kěyĭ bèi lùqǔ.
examples.english: 'Universities give impartial treatment to all students who apply; no matter what the students' family financial situation is like; so long as students meet the requirements, they can be enrolled.'

examples.simplified: 政府对于本国的企业和外国的企业应该一视同仁。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngfǔ duìyú běn guó de qĭyè hé wàiguó de qĭyè yīnggāi yíshì-tóngrén.
examples.english: 'The government should give equal treatment to domestic businesses and foreign businesses.'

translations.english: 颜 means 'color' and 色 means 'color.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'all kinds of colors, a variety of colors, multicolored.'

examples.simplified: 节日的时候，人们穿上五颜六色的衣服在街上游行。
examples.pinyin: Jiérì de shíhòu, r énmen chuānshàng wǔyán-liùsè de yīfu zài jiē shàng yóuxíng.
examples.english: 'On holidays, people wear brightly colored clothes and parade around on the streets.'

examples.simplified: 植物园里开满了五颜六色的花草。
examples.pinyin: Zhíwùyuán lĭ kāimănle wǔyán-liùsè de huācăo.
examples.english: 'The botanical gardens were all abloom with multicolored flowering plants.'

translations.english: 束 means 'bind, tie up' and 策 means 'plan.' The literal meaning is 'bind up one's hands and be without a strategy,' with a freer translation being 'at a complete loss about what to do.'

examples.simplified: 这是突发的情況，大家都显得束手无策。
examples.pinyin: Zhè shì tūfā de qíngkuàng, dàjiā dōu xiănde shùshŏu-wúcè.
examples.english: 'This was a situation that occurred suddenly, everyone seeming to be at a complete loss.'

examples.simplified: 眼看着华尔街股票市场道琼斯指数不断下跌，美联储主席也束手无策。
examples.pinyin: Yăn kànzhe Huā' ěr Jiē gǔpiào shìchăng Dàoqióngsī zhĭshù búduàn xiàdi, Měiliánchǔ zhǔxī yě shùshŏu-wúcè.
examples.english: 'With his own eyes watching the Dow Jones index of the Wall Street stock market continuously dropping, the chairman of the U.S. Federal Reserve Board also was at a total loss.'

translations.english: The literal meaning is 'a street intersection shaped like the character 十"ten" (i.e, like a cross or an X-shape).' This idiom is frequently used in the literal sense. However, it has gained an extended meaning of 'crossroads,' i.e., a situation of having arrived at a time or place where one must make an important choice.

examples.simplified: 高中毕业后，一个人就会处在人生和事业的十字路口，该何去何从得好好思考。
examples.pinyin: Gāozhōng bìyè hòu, yí gè rén jiù huì chǔ zài rénshēng hé shìyè de shízì-lùkŏu, gāi héqǔ-hécóng děi hăohăo sīkăo.
examples.english: 'After high school graduation, a person will be at a crossroads as regards his or her life and career; what path he or she should take is something they must think through well.'

examples.simplified: 中欧关系现在正处在十字路口，双方都小心翼翼，避免关系恶化。
examples.pinyin: Zhōng-Ōu guānxì xiànzài zhèng chǔ zài shízì-lùkŏu, shuāngfāng dōu xiăoxīn-yìyì, bìmiăn guānxì èhuà.
examples.english: 'Chinese-European relations now are just at a crossroads, both sides being extremely cautious to avoid relations deteriorating.'

translations.english: 与 means 'with,' 日 means 'days,' 俱 means 'together,' and 增 means 'increase.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'with the days together increase,' with a freer translation being 'grow day by day, be on the increase.'

examples.simplified: 多年来，两国的友好交往与日倶增。
examples.pinyin: Duō nián lái, liăng guó de yŏuhăo jiāowăng yǔrì-jùzēng.
examples.english: 'For many years, the friendly relationship between the two countries has been growing day by day.'

examples.simplified: 面对与日倶增的人口增长压力，中国政府决定实行计划生育政策。
examples.pinyin: Miànduì yǔrì-jùzēng de rénkŏu zēngzhăng yālì, Zhōngguó zhèngfǔ juédìng shíxíng jìhuà shēngyù zhèngcè.
examples.english: 'Facing the daily increasing pressure of population growth, the Chinese government decided to implement family planning policies.'

translations.english: 拔 means 'pull up,' 苗 means 'seedling, shoot,' 助 means 'help,' and 长 means 'grow.' The literal meaning of this idiom is 'pull up shoots to help them grow,' with freer translations including 'spoil things by trying to be too helpful, spoil by undue haste, haste makes waste.'

examples.simplified: 家长对孩子的期望都比较高，但是不能拔苗助长，孩子的成长需要时间。
examples.pinyin: Jiāzhăng duì háizi de qīwàng dōu bĭjiào gāo, dànshì bù néng bámiáo-zhùzhăng, háizi de chéngzhăng xūyào shíjiàn.
examples.english: 'Parents all have relatively high hopes for their children, but one cannot try to help young shoots grow by pulling them up; children's maturation takes time.'

examples.simplified: 我们反对这种拔苗助长的做法。
examples.pinyin: Wŏmen fănduì zhè zhŏng bámiáo-zhùzhăng de zuòfă.
examples.english: 'We are opposed to this kind of method that spoils things through undue haste.'

translations.english: 博 means 'broad,' 精 means 'proficient,' and 深 means 'deep.' The whole idiom means 'broad and profound, vast and profound.'

examples.simplified: 佛教文化博大精深，不是一两句话就解释得清的。
examples.pinyin: Fójiào wénhuà bódà-jīngshēn, bú shì yì liăng jù huà jiù jiěshìdeqīng de.
examples.english: 'Buddhist culture is vast and profound; it's not something that could be explained clearly in just a sentence or two.'

examples.simplified: 他在少林寺领略到了博大精深的中华武术。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài Shàolín Sì lĭnglüèdàole bódà-jīngshēn de Zhōnghuā wǔshù.
examples.english: 'At the Shaolin Temple, he came to appreciate the vast and profound martial arts of China.'

translations.english: 喜气 means 'happy mood or atmosphere' and 洋洋 means 'content.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'very cheerful and joyful, jubilant.'

examples.simplified: 春节来了，全国上下充满了喜气洋洋的气氛。
examples.pinyin: Chūnjié láile, quánguó shàngxià chōngmănle xĭqì-yángyáng de qìfēn.
examples.english: 'Chinese New Year came, and the entire country, high and low, was permeated with a jubilant atmosphere.'

examples.simplified: 卫星发射成功，在场的人都喜气洋洋。
examples.pinyin: Weixing fashe chenggong, zai chang de ren dou xiqi-yangyang.
examples.english: 'When the satellite was launched successfully, all the people present were jubilant.'

translations.english: 或 means 'a little' and 缺 means 'lack.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'not can even a little lack,' with freer translations being 'indispensable, absolutely essential.'

examples.simplified: 实习是大学生活中不可或缺的一项内容。
examples.pinyin: Shíxí shì dàxué shēnghuó zhōng bù kě-huò quē de yí xiàng nèiróng.
examples.english: 'Internships are a kind of content that is absolutely essential in college life.'

examples.simplified: "礼"是儒家思想中不可或缺的一个方面。
examples.pinyin: "Lǐ" shì Rújiā sīxiǎng zhōng bù kě-huò quē de yí ge fāngmiàn.
examples.english: 'The

translations.english: 顺 means 'according to,'理 means 'reason,' and 章 means 'order.' A literal translation is 'according to reason achieve order.' A freer translation of this idiom would be 'do something in a reasonable and orderly manner, logical, rational.'

examples.simplified: 他是副总裁，为公司做出过很多贡献，现在总裁退休了，他当选总裁是 顺理成章的事。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì fùzōngcái, wèi gōngsī zuòchūguo hěn duō gòngxiàn, xiànzài zōngcái tuìxiele, tā dāngxuǎn zōngcái shì shùnlǐ-chéngzhāng de shì.
examples.english: 'He's the deputy director general and has made a lot of contributions to the company; now the director general is about to retire, so his being elected director general is the logical thing.'

examples.simplified: 中国开放了保险业，外国保险公司顺理成章地进入了中国市场。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó kāifàngle Bǎoxiǎnyè, wàiguó bǎoxiàn gōngsī shùnlǐ-chéngzhāng de jìnrùle Zhōngguó shìchǎng.
examples.english: 'China has opened up the insurance industry, so foreign insurance firms have quite understandably entered the Chinese market.'

translations.english: 阔 means 'wide' and 斧 means 'axe.' The literal meaning of the whole idiom is 'big knife and wide axe.' A freer translation is 'bold and resolute.'

examples.simplified: 他当了领导之后，对这个公司进行了大刀阔斧的改革，取得了很大的 成绩。
examples.pinyin: Tā dāngle lǐngdǎo zhīhòu,duìzhège gōngsī jìnxíngle dàdāo-kuòfǔ de gǎigé, qǔdéle hěn dà de chéngǔjì.
examples.english: 'After he became leader, he undertook bold and resolute reforms in the company, attaining great results.'

examples.simplified: 新总统大刀阔斧地推行他的新经济政策。
examples.pinyin: Xīn zōngtǒng dàdāo-kuòfǔ de tuīxíng tā de xīn jīngjì zhèngcè.
examples.english: 'The new president is implementing his new economic policies boldly and resolutely.'

translations.english: 遗 means 'hold back' and 余 means 'surplus, remaining.' A literal translation is 'not hold back surplus effort,' with freer translations of the whole idiom being 'spare no efforts, do one's utmost.'

examples.simplified: 她一生不遗余力地宣传中国传统文化。
examples.pinyin: Tā yìshēng bùyí-yúlì de xuānchuán Zhōngguó chuántǒng wénhuà.
