examples.english: 'Her whole life long she did her utmost to popularize traditional Chinese culture.'

examples.simplified: 国际奥委会在反兴奋剂问题上不遗余力。
examples.pinyin: Guójì Àowě ihuì zài fǎn xīngfènjì wèntí shàng bùyí-yúlì.
examples.english: 'The International Olympic Committee spared no efforts on the issue of opposing stimulants.'

translations.english: 行 means 'line.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'between the lines.'

examples.simplified: 她给丈夫的信字里行间都充满着深深的爱。
examples.pinyin: Tā gěi zhàngfu de xìn zìlǐ-hángǔiān dōu chōngmǎnzhe shēnshēn de ài.
examples.english: 'As for the letters she sends her husband, between the lines they are all imbued with the deepest love.'

examples.simplified: 他的演讲字里行间透露出想退休的意思。
examples.pinyin: Tā de yǎnjiǎng zìlǐ-hángǔiān tòulùchū xiǎng tuìxiū de yìsi.
examples.english: 'Between the lines, his lecture divulged his intention to retire.'

translations.english: 解 means 'untie, dissolve' and 缘 means 'predestined relationship, fate.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'a predestined relationship that one cannot dissolve.' Freer translations of the idiom include 'indissoluble bond, very close connection.'

examples.simplified: 自从听了那位僧人演讲之后，他就与佛教结下了不解之缘。
examples.pinyin: Zìcóng tīngle nà wèi sēngrén yǎnjiǎng zhīhòu, tā jiù yǔ fójiào jiéxiàle bùjiě- zhīyuán.
examples.english: 'From the time he heard that Buddhist monk lecture, he formed an indissoluble bond with Buddhism.'

examples.simplified: 一次偶然的相遇使他们结下了不解之缘。
examples.pinyin: Yí cì ǒurán de xiàngyù shǐ Tāmen jiéxiàle bùjiě-zhīyuán.
examples.english: 'A fortuitous encounter made them form an indissoluble bond.'

translations.english: The meaning of this idiom is 'have absolutely nothing, penniless, destitute.'

examples.simplified: 他们结婚的时候，除了一身红色的新衣服，其他的一无所有。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen jiéhūn de shíhou, chúle yì shēn hóngsè de xīn yīfu, qítā de yì wú suō yǒu.
examples.english: 'When they married, except for a new suit of red clothes, they had absolutely nothing else.'

examples.simplified: 他觉得自己成了除了钱以外一无所有的可怜虫了。
examples.pinyin: Tā juéde zìjǐ chéngle chúle qián yǐwài yì wú suō yǒu de kěliánchóng le.
examples.english: 'He felt that he had become a pitiful thing who had nothing aside from money.'

translations.english: 守 means 'guard or keep watch over,'株 means 'tree stump,'待 means 'await,' and 兔 means 'hare, rabbit,' The literal meaning is 'keep watch over a tree stump waiting for hares (to come and dash themselves against it).' A freer translation is 'wait passively for a windfall, wait for gains without pains, trust chance and windfalls.'

examples.simplified: 要想吸引外资，就要主动跟外资企业联系，不能守株待免。
examples.pinyin: Yào xiǎng xīyǐn wàizī, jiù yào zhǔdòng gēn wàizī qǐyè liánxì, bù néng shǒu zhū- dàitù.
examples.english: 'If you want to attract foreign investment, then you have to take the initiative and contact foreign enterprises; you can't just wait for a windfall.'

examples.simplified: 美国是一个竞争激烈的社会，守株待兔的思想是不行的。
examples.pinyin: Měiguó shì yí ge jìngzhēng jīliè de shèhuì, shǒu zhū-dàitù de sīxiǎng shì bù xíng de.
examples.english: 'The U.S. is a society of intense competition; the kind of thinking where one "waits for gains without pains" will not do.'

translations.english: 百花 means 'all kinds of flowers,'齐 means 'together,'放 means 'bloom.' The literal meaning is 'all kinds of flowers bloom at the same time.' An extended meaning is 'different points of view exist simultaneously.'

examples.simplified: 春天来了，公园里百花齐放，非常漂亮。
examples.pinyin: Chūntiān láile, gōngyuán lǐ bǎihuā-qífàng, fěicháng piàoliàng.
examples.english: 'Spring has come, in the park all kinds of flowers are blooming at the same time, it's very pretty.'

examples.simplified: 不论是文学界、艺术界，还是政治界、思想界，都应该坚持百花齐放、百家争鸣的原则，不能认为只有一种观点是正确的。
examples.pinyin: Búlùn shì wénxué jiè yìshùjiè, háishì zhèngzhìjiè sīxiǎngǔiè, dōu yīnggāi jiānchí bǎihuā-qífàng bǎijiā-zhēngmíng de yuánzé, bù néng rènwéi zhǐyǒu yì zhǒng guāndiǎn shì zhèngquè de.
examples.english: 'Whether in literary and artistic circles or in political and ideological circles, one should insist on the principle of "let a hundred flowers bloom, let a hundred schools of thought contend"; one should not hold that only one point of view is correct.'

translations.english: 从 here means 'follow.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'one's strength does not follow one's heart,' with freer translations being 'lack the ability to do what one would like to do.'

examples.simplified: 他想像十年前那样工作，但是毕竟是四十岁的人了，有些力不从心了。
examples.pinyin: Tā xiǎng xiàng shí nián qián nàyàng gōngzuò, dànshì bìjìng shì sìshí suì de rén le, yǒuxiē lìbùcóngxīn le.
examples.english: 'He wants to work like ten years ago, but after all, he's now a man of forty; to a certain extent, he now lacks the ability to do as he would like to do.'

examples.simplified: 总统想改革，但是国会不支持，总统显得力不从心。
examples.pinyin: Zōngtǒng xiǎng gǎigé, dànshì guóhuì bù zhīchí, zōngtǒng xiǎnde lìbùcóngxīn.
examples.english: 'The president wants to implement reforms, but Congress doesn't support him; the president appears to lack the ability to do what he would like to do.'

translations.english: 异 means 'different,' 口 means 'mouth,' and 声 means 'voice.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'different mouths same sound.' A freer translation is 'with one voice, in unison, in concert.'

examples.simplified: 大家异口同声地说："不可能。"
examples.pinyin: Dàjiā yìkǒu-tóngshēng de shuō: "Bù kěnéng."
examples.english: 'Everyone said in unison: "Impossible."'

examples.simplified: 不论是共和党人还是民主党人，大家都异口同声地称赞他是位伟大的总统。
examples.pinyin: Búlùn shì Gònghédǎng rén háishì Mínzhǔdǎng rén, dàjiā dōu yìkǒu-tóngshēng de chēngzàn tā shì wèi wěidà de zŏngtǒng.
examples.english: 'No matter whether they are Republicans or Democrats, everyone unanimously praises him as having been a great president.'

translations.english: 背 here means 'opposing,'道 means 'road,' and 驰 means 'run.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'run on the opposing road,' with freer translations being 'run counter to, diametrically opposed to.'

examples.simplified: 他的做法和他的诺言显然是背道而驰的。
examples.pinyin: Tā de zuòfǎ hé tā de nuòyán xiǎnrán shì bèidào-érchí de.
examples.english: 'His practices are obviously the exact opposite of his promises.'

examples.simplified: 这项新政策实际上与宪法的精神背道而驰。
examples.pinyin: Zhè xiàng xīn zhèngcè shíjìshàng yǔ xiànfǎ de jīngshen bèidào-érchí.
examples.english: 'This new policy actually runs counter to the spirit of the constitution.'

translations.english: The literal meaning is 'imperative under the situation.'

examples.simplified: 文化大革命以后，经济改革势在必行。
examples.pinyin: Wénhuàdàgémìng yǐhòu, jīngǔì gǎigé shìzàibìxíng.
examples.english: 'After the Cultural Revolution, economic reform was imperative under the situation.'

examples.simplified: 因为全世界的石油资源只能再用三十年，所以寻找新的能源势在必行。
examples.pinyin: Yīnwèi quán shìjiè de shíyóu zīyuán zhǐ néng zài yòng sānshí nián, suǒyǐ xúnzhǎo xīnde néngyuán shìzàibìxíng.
examples.english: 'Because the entire world's oil resources can only be used for thirty more years, searching for new energy sources is imperative under the situation.'

translations.english: 当 means 'take on, accept,' 之 means 'it,' and 愦 means 'shame.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'accept it not have shame.' Freer translations of the idiom include 'deserve, merit, be worthy of.'

examples.simplified: 费德勒是网坛当之无愧的第一人。
examples.pinyin: Fèidélè shì wǎngtán dāngzhī -wúkuì de dìyī rén.
examples.english: 'Federer deserves to be the number one person of the tennis world.'

examples.simplified: 泰山当之无愧地入选了世界自然与文化双重遗产。
examples.pinyin: Tài Shān dāngzhī -wúkuì de rùxuǎnle shìjiè zìrán yǔ wénhuà shuāngchóng yíchǎn.
examples.english: 'Mount Tai fully deserves having been selected as a world natural and cultural double heritage site.'

translations.english: 咄咄 is an interjection indicating surprise,逼 means 'force,' and 逼人 means 'threatening.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'threatening and overbearing.'

examples.simplified: 他说话的声音很大，咄咄逼人，没理好象也有三分理了。
examples.pinyin: Tā shuōhuà de shēngyīn hěn dà, duōduō-bīrén, méi lǐ hǎoxiàng yě yǒu sān fēn lǐ le.
examples.english: 'He speaks with a loud voice, quite threatening and overbearing, so that even when he's wrong, it appears as though he's somewhat right.'

examples.simplified: 面对中国经济上咄咄逼人的威胁，我们应该怎么办呢？
examples.pinyin: Miànduì Zhōngguó jīngǔì shàng duōduō-bīrén de wēixié, wǒmen yīnggāi zěnme bàn ne?
examples.english: 'What should we do in the face of the aggressive and overbearing threat of China's economy?'

translations.english: 通 means 'pass through freely without impediment' and 达 means 'reach or extend to without obstruction.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'four (sides) pass through freely and eight (directions) extend to without obstruction.' This usually describes very convenient transportation networks. A possible English translation is 'extend or radiate in all directions.'

examples.simplified: 亚特兰大位于美国东南部，是一个交通四通八达的大城市。
examples.pinyin: Yàtèlándà wèiyú Měiguó dōngnán bù, shì yí ge jiāotōng sìtōng-bādá de dà chéngshì.
examples.english: 'Atlanta is located in the southeast of the U.S.; it's a major city with a transportation network that radiates in all directions.'

examples.simplified: 伦敦的地铁四通八达，十分方便。
examples.pinyin: Lúndūn de dìtiě sìtōng-bādá, shífēn fāngbiàn.
examples.english: 'The London underground railway system extends in all directions; it's very convenient.'

translations.english: 泣means 'shed tears.' The literal meaning of this idiom is 'can sing can cry - moving people to songs and tears,' with a freer translation being 'inspiring, heroic and moving.'

examples.simplified: 在抗日战争中，涌现出了许多可歌可泣的英雄人物和事迹。
examples.pinyin: Zài Kàngrì zhànzhēng zhōng, yǒngxiàn chūle xǔduō kěgē-kěqì de yīngxióng rénwù hé shìjì.
examples.english: 'In the Sino-Japanese War, there emerged many heroic and moving heroes and deeds.'

examples.simplified: 罗密欧与朱丽叶反映的是一个可歌可泣的爱情故事。
examples.pinyin: Luómì'ōu yǔ Zhūlìyè fǎnyìng de shì yí ge kěgē-kěqì de àiqíng gùshi.
examples.english: 'What Romeo and Juliet reflects is a heroic and moving love story.'

translations.english: 惊 means 'frightened of' and 弓 means 'bow (as in bow and arrow).' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'a bird that is frightened of a bow.' This is a metaphor for someone who is frightened because of past experience. A possible translation is 'once bitten twice shy.'

examples.simplified: 因为股票市场连续几天下跌，股民们成了惊弓之鸟，生怕再听到不利股市的消息。
examples.pinyin: Yīnwèi gǔpiào shìchǎng liánxù jǐ tiān xiàdiē, gǔmínmen chéngle jīnggōng-zhīniǎo, shēngpà zài tīngdào búlì gǔshì de xiāoxi.
examples.english: 'Because the stock market fell continuously for several days, speculators in stocks have become like "birds that are frightened of a bow" due to bad experiences in the past, afraid of again hearing unfavorable news about the stock market.'

examples.simplified: 头顶上的地板震动了一下，下面的人就像惊弓之鸟，赶快往门外跑，以为发生了地震。
examples.pinyin: Tóudǐng shàng de dìbǎn zhèndòngle yíxià, xiàmiàn de rén jiù xiàng jīnggōng- zhīniǎo, gǎnkuài wǎng mén wài pǎo, yǐwéi fāshēngle dìzhèn.
examples.english: 'When the floorboards above their heads vibrated, the people underneath were just like "birds that are frightened of a bow" due to bad experiences in the past and quickly ran outside the door, mistakenly thinking that an earthquake had taken place.'

translations.english: 真心 means 'true heart' and实意means 'real intention.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'true heart real intention,' with a freer translation being 'sincere, wholehearted.'

examples.simplified: 只有真心实意地为老百姓着想才能得到老百姓的拥护。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyǒu zhēnxīn-shíyì de wèi lǎobǎixìng zháoxiǎng cái néng dédào lǎobǎixìng de yōnghù.
examples.english: 'Only if one sincerely takes the common people's interests into consideration can one obtain the common people's support.'

examples.simplified: 我知道您是真心实意的，但是您的好意我不能接受。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhīdāo nín shì zhēnxīn-shíyì de, dànshì nín de hǎoyì wi bù néng jiēshòu.
examples.english: 'I know you're being sincere, but I can't accept your good intentions.'

translations.english: 恰 means 'just, exactly' and 好处 here means 'good place, best situation.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'just right.'

examples.simplified: 她很会说话，不多不少，恰到好处。
examples.pinyin: Tā hěn huì shuōhuà, bù duō bù shǎo, qiàdào-hǎochù.
examples.english: 'She is good with words, saying neither too much nor too little - just right.'

examples.simplified: 这个裁判很有经验，恰到好处地终止了比赛。
examples.pinyin: Zhège cáipàn hěn yǒu jīngyàn, qiàdào-hǎochù de zhōngzhǐle bǐsài.
examples.english: 'This umpire is very experienced, ending the match in just the right way.'

translations.english: 津means 'saliva,' 津津 means 'succulent, tasty,'乐 means 'happy to, love to,' and 道 means 'say, talk about.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'love to talk about, dwell on.'

examples.simplified: 这个故事流传了上千年了，人们到今天仍然津津乐道。
examples.pinyin: Zhège gùshi liúchuánle shàng qiān nián le, rénmen dào jīntiān réngrán jīnjīn-lèdào.
examples.english: 'This story has been handed down for thousands of years; people up until today still love to talk about it.'

examples.simplified: 她津津乐道地向朋友们介绍她收藏的艺术品。
examples.pinyin: Tā jīnjīn-lèdào de xiàng péngyoumen jièshào tā shōucáng de yìshùpǐn.
examples.english: 'With great pleasure, she introduced to her friends the works of art she had collected.'

translations.english: 取 means 'take,'长 means 'strong point,'补 means 'make up for,' and 短 means 'shortcoming.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'take strong points make up for shortcomings,' with a freer translation being 'draw on the strong points of others to make up for one's own deficiencies.'

examples.simplified: 两家大公司虽然不在同一个领域，但是合并以后能够取长补短，发挥各自的优势。
examples.pinyin: Liǎng jiā dà gōngsī suīrán bú zài tóng yí ge lǐngyù, dànshì hébìng yǐhòu nénggòu qǔcháng-bǔduǎn, fāhuī gèzì de yōushì.
examples.english: 'Even though the two large companies were not in the same domain, after they merged they were able to draw on each other's strengths to make up for deficiencies, and develop their individual advantages.'

examples.simplified: 今后我们应该互相学习，取长补短，加强合作。
examples.pinyin: Jīnhòu wǒmen yīnggāi hùxiāng xuéxí, qǔcháng-bǔduǎn, jiāqiáng hézuò.
examples.english: 'Hereafter we should learn from each other, draw on each other's strong points to make up for our own weaknesses, and strengthen cooperation.'

translations.english: 望 means 'one's hopes.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'one's happiness exceeds outside of one's hopes,' with a freer translation being 'overjoyed at unexpected good luck, pleasantly surprised.'

examples.simplified: 听到女儿考上清华大学的消息，父亲喜出望外，马上拿出一瓶好酒请大家喝。
examples.pinyin: Tīngdào nǚ'ér kǎoshàng Qīnghuá Dàxué de xiāoxi, fùqin xǐchūwàngwài, mǎshàng náchū yì píng hǎo jiǔ qǐng dàjiā hē.
examples.english: 'When he heard the news that his daughter had passed the entrance examination to and been accepted by Tsinghua University, the father was overjoyed, immediately taking out a bottle of fine wine and inviting everyone to drink.'

examples.simplified: 他不但得到了一张免费的来回机票，还有一个星期的免费旅馆，这真让他喜出望外。
examples.pinyin: Tā búdàn dédàole yì zhāng miǎnfèi de láihuí jīpiào, hái yǒu yí ge xīngqī de miǎnfèi lǚ guǎn, zhè zhēn ràng tā xǐchūwàngwài.
examples.english: 'He not only received a free round-trip ticket, but also one week's free hotel accommodations, which really made him overjoyed at his good fortune.'

translations.english: 本来 means 'original,' while 面目 means 'appearance.' The whole idiom means 'true colors' or 'true qualities.'

examples.simplified: 记者做了很多调查，终于发现了这位"明星"的本来面目。
examples.pinyin: Jìzhĕ zuòle hěn duō diàochá, zhōngyú fāxiànle zhè wèi míngxīng de běnlái- miànmù.
examples.english: 'The reporter did much investigation and in the end discovered the true colors of this "star."'

examples.simplified: 历史学就是要还原历史事件的本来面目。
examples.pinyin: Lìshǐxué jiùshì yào huányuán lìshǐ shìjiàn de běnlái-miànmù.
examples.english: 'What historians need to do is precisely restore the original appearance of historical incidents.'

translations.english: 脍 means 'minced meat,' 炙 means 'roasted meat,' and 人口 here means 'people's mouths.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'minced meat and roasted meat in people's mouths.' The original meaning was 'having a delicious taste,' but the idiom nowadays means 'liked by all, very popular, praised by all, on everyone's lips.'

examples.simplified: 她创作了大量脍炙人口的歌曲。
examples.pinyin: Tā chuàngzuòle dàliàng kuàizhì-rénkǒu de gēqǔ.
examples.english: 'She produced a large number of highly praised songs.'

examples.simplified: 他为后人留下了一部脍炙人口的作品。
examples.pinyin: Tā wèi hòurén liúxiàle yí bù kuàizhì-rénkǒu de zuòpǐn.
examples.english: 'He left behind for later generations a very popular work.'

translations.english: Since 自由 means 'free' and 自在 means 'unrestrained,' this idiom means 'free and unrestrained.'

examples.simplified: 他只想过自由自在的生活，所以不愿意結婚。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhǐ xiǎng guò zìyóu-zìzài de shēnghuó, suǒyǐ bú yuànyi jiéhūn.
examples.english: 'He only wants to have a free and unrestrained life, so he's unwilling to get married.'

examples.simplified: 孩子们在草地上自由自在地玩要。
examples.pinyin: Háizimen zài cǎodì shàng zìyóu-zìzài de wánshuǎ.
examples.english: 'The children played freely and unrestrained on the grass.'

translations.english: 喘 means 'gasp for breath, pant' and 吁吁 is the sound of panting. The meaning of the whole idiom is 'gasp for breath, pant.'

examples.simplified: 爸爸气喘吁吁地跟着儿子爬到山顶，对儿子说："我老了。"
examples.pinyin: Bàbā qìchuǎn-xūxū de gēnzhe érzi pádào shāndǐng, duì érzi shuō: "wǒ lǎo le."
examples.english: 'Gasping for breath, the father followed his son in climbing to the summit, and said to his son: "I've gotten old."'

examples.simplified: 他不常锻炼身体，所以只打了十分钟篮球就累得气喘吁吁的了。
examples.pinyin: Tā bù cháng duànliàn shēntǐ, suǒyǐ zhǐ dǎle shí fēn zhōng lánqiú jiù lèi de qìchuǎn- xūxū de le.
examples.english: 'He doesn't often exercise, so he was tired to the point of panting after playing basketball for only ten minutes.'

translations.english: 画 means 'draw,' 蛇 means 'snake,' 添 means 'add,' and 足 means 'foot.' The literal meaning of this idiom is 'draw a snake and add feet.' The meaning is 'add something superfluous and thereby ruin the effect.'

examples.simplified: 这句话没有什么意思，简直是画蛇添足。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jù huà méiyǒu shénme yìsi, jiǎnzhí shì huàshé-tiānzú.
examples.english: 'This sentence doesn't have any meaning; it simply ruins the effect by adding something superfluous.'

examples.simplified: 那个故事的結尾没有必要，给人画蛇添足的感觉。
examples.pinyin: Nàge gùshi de jiéwěi méiyǒu bìyào, gěi rén huàshé-tiānzú de gǎnjué.
examples.english: 'That story's ending is unnecessary; it gives one a feeling of the effect being ruined by the addition of something superfluous.'

translations.english: 座 means 'seat,'虚 means 'empty,' and 席 also means 'seat, place.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'as regards seats there are no empty seats,' with freer translations being 'a packed house, standing room only.'

examples.simplified: 诺贝尔文学奖得主正在演讲，礼堂里座无虚席。
examples.pinyin: Nuòbèi'ěr wénxué jiǎng dézhǔ zhèng zài yǎnjiǎng, lǐtáng lǐ zuòwúxūxí.
examples.english: 'When the recipient of the Nobel Prize in literature was lecturing, there were no empty seats in the auditorium.'

examples.simplified: 周末的圣保罗大教堂座无虚席，教皇正在布道。
examples.pinyin: Zhōumò de Shèng Bǎoluó dà jiàotáng zuòwúxūxí, jiàohuáng zhèng zài bùdào.
examples.english: 'On the weekend in St. Paul's cathedral there were no empty seats, as the pope was giving a sermon.'

translations.english: 以 means 'use' and 继 means 'continue.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'using night to continue the day,' with a freer translation being 'day and night.'

examples.simplified: 经过五天夜以继日的谈判，双方最终达成了协议。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò wǔ tiān yèyǐjìrì de tánpàn, shuāngfāng zuìzhōng dáchéngle xiéyì.
examples.english: 'After five days of day-and-night negotiations, both sides finally reatasted an agreement.'

examples.simplified: 科研人员夜以继日地工作，期望能够在最后期限到达之前完成那项任务。
examples.pinyin: Kēyán rényuán yèyǐjìrì de gōngzuò, qīwàng nénggòu zài zuìhòu qīxiàn dàodá zhīqián wánchéng nà xiàng rènwù.
examples.english: 'The scientific research personnel worked day and night, hoping that they could before the arrival of the final deadline complete that task.'

translations.english: 持 means 'hold,'之 means 'it,'以 means 'take, use,' and 恒 means 'permanence.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'hold it with permanence.' This idiom is used with the meaning 'persevere, persist.'

examples.simplified: 学习任何外语都要持之以恒，一两天是学不会的。
examples.pinyin: Xuéxí rènhé wàiyǔ dōu yào chízhī-yǐhéng, yì liǎng tiān shì xué bú huì de.
examples.english: 'In learning any foreign language, you must persevere; you can't learn it in just a day or two.'

examples.simplified: 政府决心持之以恒地反对贪污和受贿行为。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngfǔ juéxīn chízhī-yǐhéng de fǎnduì Tānwū hé shòuhuì xíngwéi.
examples.english: 'The government determined to persevere in opposing corruption and bribery.'

translations.english: 针锋 means 'pinpoint' and 相对means 'diametrically opposed, opposite.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'pinpoints diametrically opposed,' that is, the point of one pin being precisely against the point of another pin. A freer translation is 'in sharp opposition, give tit for tat.'

examples.simplified: 在最高法院大法官的人选上，保守派与改革派针锋相対，也提出了自己的候选人。
examples.pinyin: Zài zuìgāo fǎyuàn dàfǎguān de rénxuǎn shàng, Bǎoshǒupài yǔ gǎigépài zhēnfēng- xiāngduì, yě tíchūle zìjǐ de hòuxuǎnrén.
examples.english: 'In the choosing of a Chief Justice for the Supreme Court, the conservative faction stood in sharp opposition to the reformist faction, putting forward its own candidate.'

examples.simplified: 针对对手的恶意攻击，他进行了针锋相対的反击。
examples.pinyin: Zhēnduì duìshǒu de èyì gōngǔī, tā jìnxíngle zhēnfēng-xiāngduì de fǎnjī.
examples.english: 'In light of his adversary's malicious attack, he carried out a counter attack where he gave tit for Tat.'

translations.english: 相 means 'mutually,'得 means 'obtain,' 益 means 'even more,' and 彰 means 'clear, obvious.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'mutual coordination makes the results even better' or 'each improves by association with the other.' In freer translation, this can be rendered as 'bring out the best in each other, complement each other.'

examples.simplified: 这对夫妻，一个善于在外面谈生意，一个喜欢在家里做家务，两个人相得益彰。
examples.pinyin: Zhè duì feqī, yí ge shànyú zài wàimiàn tán shēngyi, yí ge xǐhuan zài jiā lǐ zuò jiāwù, liǎng ge rén xiāngdé -yìzhāng.
examples.english: 'This husband and wife, one of them is good at doing business on the outside, the other likes doing housework at home, the two of them complement each other very well.'

examples.simplified: 中国古代的画家一般来说书法和诗词都很好，因此，诗、书、画相得益彰。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó gǔdài de huàjiā yìbān lái shuō shūfǎ hé shīcí dōu hěn hǎo, yīncǐ, shī, shū, huà xiāngdé-yìzhāng.
examples.english: 'In general, ancient Chinese painters were good both at calligraphy and in poetry; therefore, poetry, calligraphy, and painting complemented and brought out the best in each other.'

translations.english: 念 here means 'think of.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'never forget, constantly bear in mind.'

examples.simplified: 他念念不忘父亲对他的教诲，"为国家多做一些事。"
examples.pinyin: Tā niànniàn-búwàng fùqīn duì tā de jiàohuì, "Wèi guójiā duō zuò yìxiē shì."
examples.english: 'He constantly bore in mind his father's teaching, "Do more for your country.'"

examples.simplified: 三年过去了，她仍念念不忘她的初恋情人。
examples.pinyin: Sān nián guòqùle, tā réng niànniàn-búwàng tā de chūliàn qíngrén.
examples.english: 'Three years had passed, but she still constantly kept in mind her first love.'

translations.english: 熟 means 'mature, thorough' and 虑 means 'consider.' The literal meaning is 'deeply think thoroughly consider,' with a freer translation being 'careful deliberation or consideration.'

examples.simplified: 经过深思熟虑，他提出了自己的建议。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò shēn sī -shúlǜ, tā tíchūle zìjǐ de jiànyì.
examples.english: 'After careful consideration, he raised his suggestion.'

examples.simplified: 总统深思熟虑之后，决定对全体公民的医疗保险进行改革。
examples.pinyin: Zōngtǒng shēn sī -shúlǜ zhīhòu, juédìng duì quántǐ gōngmín de yīliáo Bǎoxiàn jìnxíng gǎigé.
examples.english: 'After careful deliberation, the president decided to undertake reforms of all citizens' health insurance.'

translations.english: 独 means 'alone,'树 here means 'set up,' and 帜 means 'flag.'

examples.pinyin: Example 1:
examples.english: Tā de huìhuà fēnggé zài zhěnggè yìshùjiè dúshù-yízhì.

examples.pinyin: Example 2:
examples.english: Jǐ shí nián zhīhòu, tā jiànlì qǐ le dúshù-yízhì de lǐlùn tǐxì.

translations.english: 惊天 means 'startle or surprise the heavens' and 动地 means 'move the earth.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'earthshaking, resounding.'

examples.simplified: 闪电之后是惊天动地的巨响。
examples.pinyin: Shǎndiàn zhīhòu shì jīngtiān-dòngdì de jùxiǎng.
examples.english: 'After the lightning struck there was an earthshaking loud sound.'

examples.simplified: 有人在毛泽东小时候就看出他将来会做出一番惊天动地的事业。
examples.pinyin: Yǒu rén zài Máo Zédōng xiǎoshíhou jiù kànchū tā jiānglái huì zuòchū yì fān jīngtiān-dòngdì de shìyè.
examples.english: 'There are people who, when Mao Zedong was a child, already were able to tell that in the future he would accomplish earthshaking feats.'

translations.english: 窗means 'window' and 发 means 'discovered.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'the matter by the east window has been discovered.' This is a metaphor for intrigue that has failed and been exposed. English equivalents include 'the plot has come to light' and 'the secret is out.'

examples.simplified: 那位高官跟开发商有背后交易，后来东窗事发，他被迫辞去了职务。
examples.pinyin: Nà wèi gāoguān gēn kāifāshāng yǒu bèihòu jiāoyì, hòulái dōngchuāng-shìfā, tā bèipò cíqùle zhíwù.
examples.english: 'That high official had a secret business deal with a commercial developer; later their plot came to light and he was forced to resign his post.'

examples.simplified: 钱权交易要冒着很大的风险，一旦东窗事发，只好去坐牢了。
examples.pinyin: Qián quán jiāoyì yào màozhe hěndà de fēngxiàn, yídàn dōngchuāng-shìfā, zhǐ hǎo qù zuòláo le.
examples.english: 'Trading money for power involves a great amount of risk; once you have been discovered, the only alternative is to go to jail.'

translations.english: 铺 means 'spread out' and 盖 means 'cover.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'cover the earth, omnipresent.'

examples.simplified: 当一位八十二岁的老人与一位二十八岁的女人结婚的时候，媒体上批评的声浪铺天盖地而来。
examples.pinyin: Dāng yí wèi bāshí'èr suì de lǎorén yǔ yí wèi èrshíbā suì de nǚrén jiéhūn de shíhou, méitǐ shàng pīpíng de shēnglàng pūtiān-gàidì ér lái.
examples.english: 'When an 82-year-old man and a 28-year-old woman got married, the uproar of criticism in the media came from everywhere.'

examples.simplified: 在北欧，铺天盖地的大雪常常一下就是一天。
examples.pinyin: Zài Běi'ōu, pūtiān-gàidì de dà xuě chángcháng yí xià jiù shì yì tiān.
examples.english: 'In Scandinavia, there is omnipresent heavy snow; it often snows for the whole day.'

translations.english: 张 means 'open' and 旗鼓 means 'banners and drums.' The literal meaning of the idiom is 'open up banners and drums on a large scale (as in war) '; a freer translation is 'with a lot of fanfare, on a grand scale.'

examples.simplified: 我们要大张旗鼓地宣传和表扬那些为国家的利益做出贡献的人。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yào dàzhāng-qígǔ de xuānchuán hé biǎoyáng nàxiē wèi guójiā de lìyì zuòchū gòngxiàn de rén.
examples.english: 'We should with a lot of fanfare publicize and praise those who have made contributions for the benefit of the country.'

examples.simplified: 我们的研究方法还不太完善，所以对于结果先不要大张旗鼓地宣传。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen de yánjiū fāngfǎ hái bú tài wánshàn, suǒyǐ duìyú jiéguǒ xiān búyào dàzhāng-qígǔ de xuānchuán.
examples.english: 'Our research method is not yet refined enough, so let's not yet publicize our results with a lot of fanfare.'

translations.english: 彬彬 means 'refined, elegant' and 有礼 means 'courteous.' The whole idiom means 'refined and well-mannered.'

examples.simplified: 高级饭店的服务员总是彬彬有礼，让客人感觉很舒服。
examples.pinyin: Gāojí fàndiàn de fúwùyuán zōngshì bīnbīn-yǒulǐ, ràng kèrén gǎnjué hěn shūfu.
examples.english: 'The service personnel in high-class hotels are always refined and well-mannered, allowing guests to feel comfortable.'

examples.simplified: 她彬彬有礼地回答记者提出的各种各样的问题。
examples.pinyin: Tā bīnbīn-yǒulǐ de huídá jìzhě tíchū de gèzhǒng-gèyàng de wèntí.
examples.english: 'She answered all the questions that the reporters asked with great courtesy.'

translations.english: 熙熙means 'gentle, happy' and 攘攘 means 'disorderly, chaotic.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'crowded, bustling, busy.'

examples.simplified: 夏季，巴黎街头游客熙熙攘攘，非常热闹，不过本地人都到外地去度假了。
examples.pinyin: Xiàjì, Bālí jiētóu yóukè xīxī-rǎngrǎng, fěicháng rè'nao, búguò běndì rén dōu dào wàidì qù dùjiàle.
examples.english: 'In the summertime, the streets of Paris are bustling with tourists; it's very lively, but the locals have all gone out of town on vacation.'

examples.simplified: 在熙熙攘攘的人群中，有位身高两米二的大个子格外引人注目。
examples.pinyin: Zài xīxī-rǎngrǎng de rénqún zhōng, yǒu wèi shēn'gāo liǎng mh èr de dà gèzi géwài yǐnrén-zhùmù.
examples.english: 'In the bustling crowd, there was a tall fellow of two meters twenty who especially attracted people's attention.'

translations.english: 影 means 'shadow' and 踪 means 'track, trace.' A literal translation is 'there is no shadow and there is no trace.' A freer translation of this idiom is 'vanish without a trace' or simply 'without a trace.'

examples.simplified: 等警察赶到现场的时候，凶手早已消失得无影无踪。
examples.pinyin: Děng jǐngchá gǎndào xiànchǎng de shíhou, xiōngshǒu zǎoyǐ xiāoshīde wúyǐng- wúzōng.
examples.english: 'By the time the police had rushed to the scene, the assailant had long since disappeared without a trace.'

examples.simplified: 学期末的时候，学生已经把老师在学期初说的话忘得无影无踪了。
examples.pinyin: Xuéqīmò de shíhou, xuésheng yǐjīng bf lǎoshī zài xuéqīchū shuō de huà wàngde wúyǐng-wúzōng le.
examples.english: 'By the end of the term, the students had already completely forgotten what the instructor had said at the beginning of the term.'

translations.english: 至 means 'most.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'most high there is not higher,' with freer translations including 'highest' and 'supreme.'

examples.simplified: 在天主教里，教皇拥有至高无上的权力。
examples.pinyin: Zài Tiānzhǔjiào lǐ, Jiàohuáng yōngyǒu zhìgāo-wúshàng de quánlì.
examples.english: 'In Catholicism, the Pope possesses supreme authority.'

examples.simplified: 在一个传统家庭里，父亲的地位是至高无上的。
examples.pinyin: Zài yí ge chuántǒng jiatíng lǐ, fùqin de dìwèi shì zhìgāo-wúshàng de.
examples.english: 'In a traditional family, the father's position is the highest.'

translations.english: 司 空 was the title of an official in ancient China;惯 means 'become accustomed to.' The literal meaning is 'the Sikong official has gotten used to seeing things,' with a freer translation being 'to see so many things that you have gotten used to seeing almost anything and find nothing strange anymore.'

examples.simplified: 在当代社会里，老夫少妻的现象已经司空见惯了，大家不再像以前那样奇怪。
examples.pinyin: Zài dāngdài shèhuì lǐ, lǎo fe shǎo qī de xiànxiàng yǐjīng sīkōng-jiànguàn le, dàjiā bú zài xiàng yǐqián nàyàng qíguài.
examples.english: 'In contemporary society, the phenomenon of an older husband with a young wife is no longer anything unusual, everyone no longer finds it strange as in the past.'

examples.simplified: 在那个国家，踢假球是司空见惯的事情。
examples.pinyin: Zài nàge guójiā, tī jiǎ qiú shì sīkōng-jiànguàn de shìqìng.
examples.english: 'In that country, kicking fake balls is nothing out of the ordinary.'

translations.english: A literal translation of this idiom is 'join two link three' (the numbers 二 and 三 here have no particular meaning). The meaning of the whole idiom is 'one after another, repeatedly, in rapid succession.'

examples.simplified: 令大家恐怖的是，这种事情接二连三地发生了。
examples.pinyin: Lìng dàjiā kǒngbù de shì, zhè zhǒng shìqìng jiē'èr-liánsān de fāshēng le.
examples.english: 'What has horrified everyone is that this kind of thing has happened repeatedly in rapid succession.'

examples.simplified: 他的小说接二连三地出版，给他带来了巨大的声誉和收入。
examples.pinyin: Tā de xiǎoshuō jiē'èr-liánsān de chūbǎn, gěi tā dàiláile jùdà de shēngyù hé shōurù.
examples.english: 'His novels are published one after another, which has brought him an enormous reputation and income.'

translations.english: 斩 means 'cut, chop,'钉 means 'nail,'截 means 'cut, sever,' and 铁 means 'iron.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'cut a nail and sever iron,' which by metaphor means 'firm and resolute, decisive.'

examples.simplified: 孩子跟父亲要一辆新汽车，父亲斩钉截铁地回答，"没门！"
examples.pinyin: Háizi gēn fùqin yào yí liàng xīn qìchē, fùqin zhǎndīng-jiétiě de huídá, "Méi mén!"
examples.english: 'When the child wanted a new car from the father, the father answered very firmly, "No way!"'

examples.simplified: 公安局长斩钉截铁地说："我们要不惜任何代价抓住凶手。"
examples.pinyin: Gōngānjúzhǎng zhǎndīng-jiétiě de shuō: "Wǒmen yào bù xī rènhé dàijià zhuāzhù xiōngshǒu."
examples.english: 'The head of the Public Security Bureau said resolutely: "No matter what the cost, we must capture the assailant."'

translations.english: 滥 means 'excess,'竽 is the name for a musical instrument somewhat like a flute, and 充数 means 'make up a number.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'excess

examples.simplified: 现在很多有钱的商人都在高校里兼任教授，简直是滥竽充数。
examples.pinyin: Xiànzài hěn duō yǒu qián de shāngrén dōu zài gāoxiào lǐ jiānrèn jiàoshòu, jiǎnzhí shì lànyú-chōngshù.
examples.english: 'Nowadays many wealthy business people teach as part-time professors at institutes of higher education; this is simply amateurs pretending to be experts.'

examples.simplified: 市场上有很多假名牌，一些人穿上这些所谓的名牌滥竽充数。
examples.pinyin: Shìchǎng shàng yǒu hěn duō jiǎ míngpái, yìxiē rén chuānshàng zhèxiē suǒwèi de míngpái lànyú-chōngshù.
examples.english: 'On the market there are many famous brands; some people wear these so-called famous brands to pretend they are something they are not.'

translations.english: 择 means 'choose' and 手段 means 'method, means.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'resort to any means, stop at nothing.'

examples.simplified: 有的人为了达到目的而不择手段。
examples.pinyin: Yǒude rén wèile dádào mùdì ér bùzé-shǒuduàn
examples.english: 'Some people will stop at nothing in order to attain their goal.'

examples.simplified: 他不择手段 地攻击对手。
examples.pinyin: Tā bùzé-shǒuduàn de gōngǔī duìshǒu.
examples.english: 'He resorted to any means to attack his adversary.

translations.english: 津 means 'saliva,' 津津means 'succulent, tasty,' and 有味 means 'have flavor, tasty.' The meaning of the whole idiom is '(do something) with gusto.'

examples.simplified: 他津津有味地吃鸡爪子。
examples.pinyin: Tā jīnjīn-yǒuwèi de chī jīzhuǎzi.
examples.english: 'He ate the chicken feet with great gusto.'

examples.simplified: 这个故事太吸引人了，大家听得津津有味。
examples.pinyin: Zhège gùshi tài xīyǐn rén le, dàjiā tīng de jīnjīn-yǒuwèi.
examples.english: 'This story very much attracted people's attention, everyone listening with gusto.'

translations.english: 深 means 'deep' and 浅 means 'shallow.' The literal translation is 'deeply enter and shallowly come out.' This idiom refers to speech or writing with deep content that is expressed in a way that is easy to understand. The idiom can be translated as 'explain profound things in simple language, make something complicated sound simple.'

examples.simplified: 她深入浅出地向听众介绍了这个方面的最新理论。
examples.pinyin: Tā shēnrù-qiǎnchū de xiàng tīngzhòng jièshàole zhège fāngmiàn de zuì xīn lǐlùn.
examples.english: 'She introduced the newest theories in this area to the audience in a way that made them seem simple.'

examples.simplified: 他讲课的时候生动幽默、深入浅出，深受学生喜欢。
examples.pinyin: Tā jiǎngkè de shíhou shēngdòng yōumò, shēnrù-qiǎnchū, shēnshòu xuésheng xǐhuan.
examples.english: 'When he lectured, he was lively and humorous, with the ability to explain complicated matters in an easy-to-understand manner, so he was much liked by his students.'

translations.english: 相 means 'mutually,'提 means 'mention,'并 means 'simultaneously,' and 论 means 'discuss.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'talk about two different people or things at the same time, mention in the same breath.'

examples.simplified: 有的人把德州与美国的关系跟新西兰与英国的关系相提并论，其实这是不了解历史。
examples.pinyin: Yǒu de rén bǎ Dézhōu yǔ Měiguó de guānxi gēn Xīnxīlán yǔ Yīngguó de guānxi xiāngtí-bìnglùn, qíshí zhè shì bù liǎojiě lìshǐ.
examples.english: 'Some people talk about the relationship of Texas to the U.S. in the same breath as the relationship of New Zealand to England; actually, this is not understanding history.

examples.simplified: 他们两个人的贡献一大一小，根本不能相提并论。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen liǎng ge rén de gòngxiàn yí dà yì xiǎo, gēnběn bù néng xiāngtí-bìnglùn.
examples.english: 'As far as the contributions of the two of them are concerned, one was great and one was small; they absolutely cannot be mentioned in the same breath.'

translations.english: 深 means 'deeply,' 恶 means 'hate,' 痛 also means 'hate,' and 绝 means 'extremely.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'deeply hate and hate extremely,' with freer translations being 'abhor, detest.'

examples.simplified: 她对说谎的人深恶痛绝。
examples.pinyin: Tā duì shuōhuăng de rén shēnwù-tòngjué.
examples.english: 'She loathes liars.'

examples.simplified: 毒品令人深恶痛绝。
examples.pinyin: Dúpĭn lìng rén shēnwù-tòngjué.
examples.english: 'Narcotics make one detest them.'

translations.english: 可 means 'can' and 得 means 'obtain, get.' The whole idiom means 'hard to come by, uncommon.'

examples.simplified: 他又年轻又有能力，是个 不可多得的人才。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòu niánqīng yòu yŏu nénglì, shì gè bùkě-duōdé de réncái.
examples.english: 'He is both young and capable, a person of uncommon talent.'

examples.simplified: 这种瓷器是三百年前的，已经非常少了，不可多得。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhŏng cíqì shì sān băi nián qián de, yĭjīng fēicháng shăole, bùkě-duōdé.
examples.english: 'This type of porcelain is from 300 years ago; there isn't much of it around anymore, and it is very hard to come by.'

translations.english: 沸沸 describes the appearance of boiling water and 扬 means 'rise.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'noisy, tumultuous, raging.'

examples.simplified: 他们的婚外恋闹得沸沸扬扬的，全城人都知道了。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen de hūnwàiliàn nào de fèifèi-yángyáng de, quán chéng rén dōu zhīdao le.
examples.english: 'Their extramarital affair noisily raged on and on, everyone in the city finding out about it.'

examples.simplified: 沸沸扬扬的选美活动结束了，又是委内瑞拉小姐当选世界小姐。
examples.pinyin: Fèifèi-yángyáng de xuănměi huódòng jiéshùle, yòu shì Wěinèiruìlā xiăojiě dāngxuăn shìjiè xiăojiě.
examples.english: 'The tumultuous beauty contest activities concluded, with Miss Venezuela once again having been elected Miss World.'

translations.english: 雪 means 'snow,' 加 means 'add,' 霜 means 'frost.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'on top of snow to add frost,' with freer translations being 'make a bad situation even worse, exacerbate.'

examples.simplified: 在经济危机中，飞机乘客减少，这对于航空业已经是不小的打击了；现在燃油价格又大幅上涨，这无疑是雪上加霜。
examples.pinyin: Zài jīngjì wēijī zhōng, fēijī chéngkè jiănshăo, zhè duìyú hángkōngyè yĭjīng shì bùxiăo de dăjī le; xiànzài rányóu jiàgé yòu dàfú shàngzhăng, zhè wúyí shì xuěshàng-jiāshuāng.
examples.english: 'In the economic crisis, airplane passengers have reduced; this is already a big blow to the aviation industry; now the price of fuel has risen substantially; this without a doubt is exacerbating the situation.'

examples.simplified: 本来保守党在民意调查中就已经落后于对手了，最近一位重量级人物又爆出性丑闻，这对于保守党来说是雪上加霜。
examples.pinyin: Běnlái băoshŏudăng zàmínyì diàochá zhōng jiù yĭjīng luòhòu yú duìshŏu le, zuìjìn yí wèi zhòngliàngjí rénwù yòu bàochū xìngchŏuwén, zhè duìyú băoshŏudáng láishuō shì xuěshàng-jiāshuāng.
examples.english: 'In the opinion poll, the conservative party was already lagging behind its adversary; recently a scandal erupted about a major figure; for the conservative party this is making a bad situation even worse.'

translations.english: 风尘 means 'wind and dust - travel' and 仆仆 means 'fatigue from travel.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'fatigued from travel.'

examples.simplified: 总理风尘仆仆地赶到地震最严重的地区。
examples.pinyin: Zŏnglĭ fēngchén-púpú de găn dào dìzhèn zuì yánzhòng de dìqū.
examples.english: 'The premier, fatigued from travel, rushed to the area where the earthquake had been the most severe.'

examples.simplified: 你坐了一天的火车，刚下车，风尘仆仆的，先去休息吧。
examples.pinyin: Nĭ zuòle yì tiān de huŏchē, gāng xiàchē, fēngchén-púpú de, xiān qù xiūxī ba.
examples.english: 'You just got off the train after riding the whole day, you must be tired from your travels, why don't you first go rest.'

translations.english: 朝 means 'morning' and 暮 means 'evening, dusk.' The literal meaning is 'in the morning three and in the evening four.' English translations include 'fickle and inconstant, change one's mind frequently, six of one and half a dozen of the other.'

examples.simplified: 他对爱情太不认真，朝三暮四的，经常换女朋友。
examples.pinyin: Tā duì àiqíng tài bú rènzhēn, zhāosān-mùsì de, jīngcháng huàn nǚpéngyou.
examples.english: 'He's not the least bit serious about love, being fickle and inconstant, and frequently changing girlfriends.'

examples.simplified: 她是那种朝三暮四的人，别跟她交朋友。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì nà zhŏng zhāosān-mùsì de rén, bié gēn tā jiāo péngyou.
examples.english: 'She is that kind of very fickle person; don't make friends with her.'

translations.english: 平 means 'peaceful,' 气 means 'spirit,' and 和 means 'harmonious.' A literal translation of this idiom is therefore 'heart peaceful spirit harmonious.' A freer translation is 'in a calm mood, with a gentle disposition, in an even-tempered manner.'

examples.simplified: 我们能不能心平气和地坐下来谈ー谈？
examples.pinyin: Wŏmen néng bù néng xīnpíng-qìhé de zuòxiàlái tán yi tán?
examples.english: 'Could we sit down calmly and talk?'

examples.simplified: 即使孩子错了，你也不能急躁，要心平气和地跟他讲道理。
examples.pinyin: Jíshĭ háizi cuòle, nĭ yě bù néng jízào, yào xīnpíng-qìhé de gēn tā jiăng dàolĭ.
examples.english: 'Even if the child was wrong, you still mustn't be impatient; you should in an even-tempered manner reason things out with him.'

translations.english: 德 means 'moral character,' 重 means 'prestige,' and 望 here means 'weighty, heavy, considerable.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'character high prestige considerable,' with a freer translation being 'of noble character and high prestige.'

examples.simplified: 在电影界，他是一位德高望重的老前辈。
examples.pinyin: Zaì diànyĭng jiè, tā shì yí wèi dégāo-wàngzhòng de lăoqiánbèi.
examples.english: 'In film circles, he is a doyen of noble character and high prestige.'

examples.simplified: 每个春节，弟子们都会去看望他们德高望重的导师。
examples.pinyin: Měi gè chūnjiē, dìzĭmen dōu huì qù kànwàng tāmen dégāo-wàngzhòng de dăoshī.
examples.english: 'Every Chinese New Year, the disciples will all call on their teacher, who is of noble character and high prestige.'

translations.english: 燃 means 'burn,' 眉 means 'eyebrow,' and 急 means 'urgency.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'the urgency of fire singeing the eyebrows,' with a freer translation being 'a matter of great urgency.'

examples.simplified: 救援人员用直升飞机运来了饮用水，解决了灾区人民的燃眉之急。
examples.pinyin: Jiùyuán rényuán yòng zhíshēngfēijī yùnláile yĭnyòngshuĭ, jiějuéle zāiqū rénmín de ránméi-zhījí.
examples.english: 'The rescue workers used helicopters to bring in drinking water; they solved the urgent problems of the people in the disaster area.'

examples.simplified: 中央政府特別贷款一百亿美元，解了那家大银行的燃眉之急。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngyāng zhèngfǔ tèbié dàikuăn yi băi yì měiyuán, jiěle nà jiā dà yínháng de ránméi-zhījí.
examples.english: 'The central government made a special loan of 10 billion U.S. dollars, relieving the urgent problems of that large bank.'

translations.english: 厌 means 'dislike,' 其 means 'its,' and 烦 means 'trouble.' The whole idiom means 'not mind the trouble, with great patience, tirelessly.'

examples.simplified: 父母不厌其烦地回答女儿提出的一个又ー个"简单"的问题。
examples.pinyin: Fùmǔ búyàn-qífán de huídá nǚ' ér tíchú de yí gè yòu yí gè jiăndān de wèntí.
examples.english: 'Her parents tirelessly answered the "simple" questions their daughter raised one after another.'

examples.simplified: 毎次大会上，领导总是不厌其烦地强调稳定的重要性。
examples.pinyin: Měi cì dàhuì shàng, lĭngdăo zŏngshì búyàn-qífán de qiángdiào wěndìng de zhòngyàoxìng.
examples.english: 'At each mass meeting, the leader with great patience stressed the importance of stability.'

translations.english: 别 means 'another, different,' 出 means 'come out with, produce,' and 心裁 means 'idea, concept.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'come out with a different plan or concept,' with freer translations being 'have an unconventional idea, adopt an original approach.'

examples.simplified: 她别出心裁地在指甲上纹了几朵小花。
examples.pinyin: Tā biéchū-xīncái de zài zhĭjiă shàng wēnle jĭ duŏ xiăo huā.
examples.english: 'Adopting an original approach, she drew a few small flowers on her nails.'

examples.simplified: 贝聿铭为法国巴黎罗浮宫设计了一个别出心裁的玻璃金字塔入口。
examples.pinyin: Bèi Yùmíng wèi Făguō Bālí Luófú Gōng shèjìle yí ge biéchū-xīncái de bōlí jīnzìtă rùkŏu.
examples.english: 'I. M. Pei created a very original glass pyramid entrance for the Louvre museum in Paris, France.'

translations.english: 经传 means 'classics.' A literal translation is 'something not seen in the classics.' A freer translation is 'unattested by historical records, unknown.'

examples.simplified: 就是这样一位此前不见经传的小人物改写了整个历史。
examples.pinyin: Jiùshì zhèyàng yí wèi cĭqián bújiàn-jīngzhuàn de xiăorénwù găixiěle zhěnggè lìshĭ.
examples.english: 'It was precisely a heretofore unknown "nobody" like this who rewrote all of history.，

examples.simplified: 京剧曾经名不见经传，只是到了清朝以后才流行起来。
examples.pinyin: Jīngjù céngjīng míngbújiànjīngzhuàn, zhĭshì dàole Qīngcháo yĭhòu cái liúxíng qĭlái.
examples.english: 'Beijing Opera used to be unknown; it was only with the advent of the Qing Dynasty that it came into fashion.'

translations.english: 尉然 means 'luxuriant, magnificent' and 风 here means 'established practice or custom.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'magnificently become the custom.' A freer translation of the idiom is 'become common practice.'

examples.simplified: 最近几年，食疗蔚然成风。
examples.pinyin: Zuìjìn jĭ nián, shíliáo wèirán-chéngfēng.
examples.english: 'The last few years, nutritional therapy has become common practice.'

examples.simplified: 在他的号召下，减少浪费、保护环境蔚然成风。
examples.pinyin: Zài tā de hàozhāo xià, jiănshăo làngfèi, băohù huánjìng wèirán-chéngfēng.
examples.english: 'As a result of his appeal, reducing waste and protecting the environment have become common practice.'

translations.english: The meaning of this idiom is 'get excited over little things, make a big fuss about nothing.'

examples.simplified: 这没什么了不起的，别大惊小怪的。
examples.pinyin: Zhè méishénme liăobùqĭ de, béi dàjīng-xiăoguài de.
examples.english: 'This is nothing unusual, don't make such a big deal about it.'

examples.simplified: 妹妹大惊小怪地说："哎呀，你们看！这么多蚂蚊！"
examples.pinyin: Mèimei dàjīng-xiăoguài de shuō: "Āiya, nĭmen kàn! Zhème duō măyĭ!"
examples.english: 'Making a big fuss over nothing, younger sister said_ "Oh, look! So many ants!" '

translations.english: The literal meaning is 'a thousand pains and ten thousand bitternesses.' The meaning of the idiom is 'countless sufferings, innumerable hardships.'

examples.simplified: 他历尽千辛万苦，才把这个公司发展成为世界有名的大公司。
examples.pinyin: Tā lìjìn qiánxīn-wànkǔ, cái bă zhège gōngsī fāzhăn chéngwéi shìjiè yŏumíng de dà gōngsī.
examples.english: 'He experienced countless hardships; only after that did he develop this company into a world-famous major firm.'

examples.simplified: 那个年代，生活条件很差，父母千辛万苦地把一家孩子养大。
examples.pinyin: Nàge niándài, shēnghuó tiáojiàn hěn chà, fùmǔ qiānxīn-wànkǔ de bă yì jiā háizi yăngdà.
examples.english: 'In those years, living conditions were very bad; the parents endured innumerable sufferings and hardships in raising their children.'

translations.english: 东施 is the name of a fictional person in the Spring and Autumn Period in Chinese history, 效 means 'imitate,' and 颦 means 'knit the brows, frown.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'Dong Shi imitates (the famous beauty Xi Shi) in knitting her eyebrows (and ends up looking even uglier).' This is a metaphor for 'imitate others only to make a fool of oneself.'

examples.simplified: 模特的身材棒，所以穿那样的衣服好看；而你的身材那么差，穿那样的衣服可就东施效颦了。
examples.pinyin: Mótè de shēncái bàng, suŏyĭ chuān nàyàng de yīfu hăokàn; ěr nĭ de shēncái nàme chà, chuān nàyàng de yīfú kě jiù Dōng Shī-xiàopín le.
examples.english: 'The model had a great figure, so when she wore that kind of clothes, it looked good; but your figure is so bad that if you wear that kind of clothes, it will be just like when Dong Shi tried to imitate Xi Shi in knitting her eyebrows but only ended up making a fool of herself.'

examples.simplified: 你的发音那么差，却要模仿别人的腔调，真是东施效颦。
examples.pinyin: Nĭ de fāyīn nàme chà, què yào mófăng biérén de qiāngdiào, zhēn shì Dōng Shī-xiàopín.
examples.english: 'Your pronunciation is so bad, and yet you want to imitate other people's accents; it's really like the time when Dong Shi tried to imitate Xi Shi in knitting her eyebrows but only ended up making a fool of herself.'

translations.english: 因 here means 'according to,' 势 means 'situation,' and 利导 means 'skillfully guide.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'according to the situation skillfully guide (action),' with a freer translation being 'guided by the circumstances.'

examples.simplified: 在农村的改革取得成功后，邓小平因势利导，在城市以及其他行业也进行了 全面的改革。
examples.pinyin: Zài nóngcūn de găigé qǔdé chénggōng hòu, Dèng Xiăopíng yīnshì-lìdao, zài chéngshì yĭjí qītā hángyè yě jìnxíngle quánmiàn de găigé.
examples.english: 'After the reforms in the countryside achieved success, Deng Xiaoping was guided by the circumstances, and in the cities and in other professions also carried out comprehensive reforms.'

examples.simplified: 市政府抓住机遇，因势利导，建立了一批出口企业。
examples.pinyin: Shì zhèngfǔ zhuāzhù jīyù, yīnshì-lìdăo, jiànlìle yì pī chūkŏu qĭyè.
examples.english: 'The municipal government seized the opportunity, skillfully guiding their action according to the situation, and set up a number of export enterprises.'

translations.english: 迢迢 means 'far away.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'thousands of miles away, far away.'

examples.simplified: 那位记者千里迢迢地跑到偏远的边疆的农村釆访当地人的真实生活。
examples.pinyin: Nà wèi jìzhě qiānlĭ-tiáotiáo de păodào piānyuăn de biānjiāng de nóngcūn căifăng dāngdì rén de zhēnshí shēnghuó.
examples.english: 'That reporter went far away to the remote countryside in the border region to interview local people about their true lives.'

examples.simplified: 病人千里迢迢地来到北京治病。
examples.pinyin: Bìngrén qiānlĭ-tiáotiáo de láidào Bàijīng zhìbìng.
examples.english: 'Patients came to Beijing from far away to seek treatment for their illnesses.'

translations.english: 格格 means 'obstruct.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'incompatible with, incongruous with.'

examples.simplified: 这种观念跟中国的实际情况格格不入。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhŏng guānniàn gēn Zhōngguó de shíjì qíngkuàng gégé-búrù.
examples.english: 'Such an attitude is incompatible with the actual situation in China.'

examples.simplified: 跟豪华的宮殿格格不入的是，门口站着一群乞丐。
examples.pinyin: Gēn háohuá de gōngdiàn gégé-búrù de shì, ménkŏu zhànzhe yì qún qĭgài.
examples.english: 'What was incongruous with the lavish palace was that, at the entrance, there was standing a group of beggars.'

translations.english: 荼 means 'the white flowers of cogon grass.' The literal meaning of this idiom is 'as (red as) fire and as (white as) cogon grass flowers,' with freer translations being 'like a raging fire, with great fervor, flourishing.'

examples.simplified: 国家正在重点建设这个地区，所以各种建设项目如火如荼地展开了。
examples.pinyin: Guójiā zhèngzài zhòngdiăn jiànshè zhège dìqū, suŏyĭ gè zhŏng jiànshè xiàngmà rúhuŏ-rútú de zhănkāile.
examples.english: 'The country is giving priority to reconstructing this district, so all kinds of construction projects have been launched with great fervor.'

examples.simplified: 在如火如荼的文化大革命里，知识分子受到的影响最大。
examples.pinyin: Zài rúhuŏ-rútú de wénhuà dà gémìng lĭ, zhīshi fènzi shòudào de yĭngxiăng zuì dà.
examples.english: 'During the conflagration that was the Cultural Revolution, intellectuals were the most affected.'

translations.english: 肃然 means 'with great respect,' 起 means 'give rise to,' and 敬 means 'respect.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'suddenly have great respect or reverence for.'

examples.simplified: 她冒着危险从河里救上来一个小孩几，这样的行为让人肃然起敬。
examples.pinyin: Tā màozhe wēixiăn cóng hé lĭ jiùshànglái yí ge xiăoháir, zhèyàng de xàngwéi ràng rén sùrán-qĭjìng.
examples.english: 'She risked danger in rescuing a child from the river; this kind of conduct makes one suddenly feel great respect.'

examples.simplified: 听了他的故事以后，我不禁肃然起敬。
examples.pinyin: Tīngle tā de gùshi yĭhòu, wŏ bù jīn sùrán-qĭjìng.
examples.english: 'After hearing his story, I couldn't help suddenly having great respect for him.'

translations.english: 扬 means 'raise,' 长 means 'strong point,' 避 means 'avoid,' and 短 means 'shortcoming.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'raise strong points avoid shortcomings,' with a freer translation being 'enhance one's strong points and avoid any weaknesses.'

examples.simplified: 那支球队的长处是防守，于是他们扬长避短，避免跟对手对攻。
examples.pinyin: Nà zhī qiúduì de chángchù shì fángshŏu, yǔshì tāmen yángcháng-bìduăn, bìmiăn gēn duìshŏu duìgōng.
examples.english: 'That team's strong point is defense, and so they took advantage of their strong points and avoided their shortcomings, avoiding going on the offensive against their opponent.'

examples.simplified: 日本领土狹小，资源相对缺乏，但是日本人扬长避短，大力发展高禾报产品， 例如照相机和汽车等产品。
examples.pinyin: Rìběn lĭngtǔ xiáxiăo, zīyuán xiàngduì quēfá, dànshì RìDěnrén yángcháng-bìduăn, dàlì fāzhăn gāokējì chănpĭn, lìrú zhàoxiàngjī hé qìchē děng chănpĭn.
examples.english: 'Japanese territory is narrow and small, and resources are relatively lacking; but the Japanese enhance their strong points and avoid their weaknesses, vigorously developing high-tech products, for instance, products such as cameras and cars.'

translations.english: 蒸蒸 means 'thriving' and 日上 means 'improving day by day.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'become more thriving and flourishing each day, progress day by day.'

examples.simplified: 自从他当市长以来，市里的各项事业蒸蒸日上。
examples.pinyin: Zìcóng tā dāng shìzhăng yĭlái, shì lĭ de gè xiàng shìyè zhēngzhēng-rìshàng.
examples.english: 'Ever since he became mayor, all kinds of businesses in the city have been flourishing.'

examples.simplified: 国有企业困难重重的时候，私营企业呈现出蒸蒸日上的景象。
examples.pinyin: Guóyŏu qĭyè kùnnán chóngchóng de shíhou, sīyíng qĭyè chéngxiànchū zhēngzhēngrìshàng de jĭngxiàng.
examples.english: 'While state-owned enterprises have been beset with difficulties, private enterprises have been revealing a picture of being more thriving and flourishing by the day.'

translations.english: 胸 means 'chest, thorax,' 成 means 'fully developed,' and 竹 means 'bamboo.' The literal meaning is '(when about to draw bamboo,) in the chest there is fully developed bamboo.' English translations include 'have a well thought out plan, have a whole idea in one's mind, have a card up one's sleeve.'

examples.simplified: 至于下一步应该怎么做，她已经胸有成竹了。
examples.pinyin: Zhìyú xià yí bù yīnggāi zenme zuò, tā yĭjīng xiōngyouchéngzhú le.
examples.english: 'As for what she should do as the next step, she already has a well thought out plan.'

examples.simplified: 他胸有成竹地回答："这件事绝对没问题。"
examples.pinyin: Tā xiōng yŏu chéng zhú de huídá: "Zhè jiàn shì juéduì méi wèntí."
examples.english: 'With a well thought out plan in mind, he answered, "There are absolutely no problems concerning this matter."'

translations.english: 肆 means 'unrestrained,' 忌 means 'scruples, misgivings,' and 惮 means 'fear.' The literal meaning is 'unrestrained and not have any scruples or fear,' with a freer translation being 'unscrupulous, unbridled.'

examples.simplified: 他仗着他爸爸是县长，因此在那个县里到处做坏事，肆无忌惮。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhàngzhe tā bàbà shì xiànzhăng, yīncĭ zài nàge xiàn lĭ dàochù zuò huài shì, sìwújìdàn.
examples.english: 'He was relying on his father's being county magistrate, and therefore did bad things everywhere in that county, completely without scruples.'

examples.simplified: 开发商肆无忌惮地砍伐巴西亚马逊河流域的森林。
examples.pinyin: Kāifāshāng sìwújìdàn de kănfá Bāxī Yàmăxùn Hé liúyù de sēnlín.
examples.english: 'Commercial developers, completely without scruples, are felling the forests in the Amazon River basin.'

translations.english: 囫囵 means 'whole, complete,' 吞 means 'swallow,' and 枣 means 'date.' A literal translation is 'swallow a date whole,' with a freer translation being 'study or read something without thinking it through carefully' or 'accept something uncritically without careful consideration.'

examples.simplified: 对于英语不是母语的人来说，看莎士比亚的剧本有时候未免囫囵吞枣，理解
examples.pinyin: 得不一定完全准确。
examples.english: Duìyú Yīngyǔ bú shì mǔyǔ de rén lái shuō, kàn Shāshìbĭyà de jùběn yŏu shíhou wèimiăn húlún-tūnzăo, lĭjiěde bù yídìng wánquán zhǔnquè.

examples.pinyin: Example 2:
examples.english: Xuéxí wàiguó jīngyàn de shíhou yào jiéhé Děnguó de guóqíng, qiānwàn bù néng húlún-tūnzăo, shēngbān-yìngtào.

translations.english: 异 means 'different,' 乎 here means 'from,' and 寻常 means 'ordinary, common.' A literal translation is 'different from the ordinary,' with a freer translation being 'unusual, uncommon, extraordinary.'

examples.simplified: 他突然对国际关系表现出异乎寻常的热情。
examples.pinyin: Tā tūrán duì guójì guānxi biāoxiànchū yìhū-xúnchág de rèqíng.
examples.english: 'He suddenly showed unusual enthusiasm for international relations.'

examples.simplified: 今年的冬天异乎寻常地冷，是近二十年来最冷的冬天。
examples.pinyin: Jīnnián de dōngtiān yìhū-xúncháng de lěng, shì jìn èrshí nián lái zuì lěng de dōngtiān.
examples.english: 'Winter this year has been uncommonly cold; it's the coldest winter in the last twenty years.'

translations.english: 赏心 here means 'please the mind' and 悦目 means 'please the eye.' The whole idiom means 'pleasing to the mind and the eye.'

examples.simplified: 巴西球员的足球技术很华丽，他们的比赛令人赏心悦目。
examples.pinyin: Bāxī qiúyuán de zúqiú jìshù hěn huálì, tāmen de bĭsài lìng rén shāngxīn-yuèmù.
examples.english: 'The Brazil players' soccer technique is magnificent; their matches are pleasing to the eye and to the mind.'

examples.simplified: 新年那天，她看了ー场赏心悦目的演出。
examples.pinyin: Xīnnián nà tiān, tā kànle yì chāng shāngxīn-yuèmù de yānchū.
examples.english: 'On New Year's Day, she saw a very pleasing performance.'

translations.english: The meaning of this idiom is 'through the ages, since time immemorial.'

examples.simplified: 古往今来，哪个成功的人没有付出艰辛的努力？
examples.pinyin: Gǔwăng-jīnlaái, năge chénggōng de rén méiyŏu fùchū jiānxīn de nǔlì?
examples.english: 'Since time immemorial, what successful person has not had to make hard efforts?'

examples.simplified: 博物馆员给大家一一介绍了古往今来的名画。
examples.pinyin: Bówùguănyuán gěi dàjiā yī yī jièshàole gǔwăng-jīnlái de mínghuà.
examples.english: 'The museum docent introduced to everyone the famous paintings from through the ages, one after another.'

translations.english: 大 here means 'greatly, very much' and 作为 means 'achievements, contributions.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'greatly have contributions.' Freer translations include 'able to develop one's ability to the fullest, have great prospects, have great potential.'

examples.simplified: 在毕业典礼上，校长祝所有的毕业生在社会上大有作为。
examples.pinyin: Zài bìyè diănlí shàng, xiàozhăng zhù suŏyŏu de bìyè shēng zài shèhuì shàng dàyŏuzuòwéi.
examples.english: 'At the graduation ceremony, the president wished all the graduates that in society they might have great contributions.'

examples.simplified: 这两家大公司强强联手，是可以大有作为的。
examples.pinyin: Zhè liăng jiā dà gōngsī qiáng qiáng liánshŏu, shì kěyí dàyŏu zuòwéi de.
examples.english: 'If these two major companies join forces, they could have great prospects.'

translations.english: 集 means 'concentrate,' 思 means 'thought,' 广 means 'make wide,' and 益 means 'benefit.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'concentrate thoughts and enlarge the benefits,' with freer translations including 'benefit from a wide range of opinions' and 'profit by soliciting opinions from various sources.'

examples.simplified: 有关部门集思广益，充分吸收专家和群众的意见。
examples.pinyin: Yŏuguān bùmen jísī-guăngyì, chōngfèn xīshōu zhuānjiā hé qúnzhòng de yìjiàn.
examples.english: 'The concerned departments benefited from a wide range of opinions, to the fullest extent possible soliciting opinions from experts and the masses.'

examples.simplified: 我们应该集思广益，听取各方面的声音，以便完善我们的政策。
examples.pinyin: Wŏmen yīnggāi jísī-guăngyì, tīngqǔ gè fāngminà de shēngyīn, yĭbiàn wánshàn wŏmen de zhèngcè.
examples.english: 'We should profit by soliciting opinions from various sources, and listen to the voices from all quarters, so as to perfect our policies.'

translations.english: 一应 means 'all, everything' and 倶全 means 'complete.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'amply supplied with everything needed, complete with everything.'

examples.simplified: 赌场里旅馆、饭馆、商店、邮局等一应倶全，简直就是一个社区。
examples.pinyin: Dǔchăng lĭ lǚguăn, fànguăn, shāngdiàn, yóujú děng yìyīng-jùquān, jiănzhí jiùshì yí gè shèqū.
examples.english: 'In the casino, everything - hotel, restaurants, shops, post office, and so on - is amply provided; it's virtually a community.'

examples.simplified: 农民工在城里卖东西要具备四个证，只有这四个证一应倶全了，有关部门 才批准你可以合法地卖东西。
examples.pinyin: Nóngmíngōng zài chéng lĭ mài dōngxī yào jùbèi sì gè zhèng, zhĭ yŏu zhè sì gè zhèng yìyīng-jùquán le, yŏuguān bùmen cái pīzhǔn nĭ kěyĭ héfă de mài dōngxi.
examples.english: 'Peasant workers who sell things in the city must possess four permits; only when these four permits are all complete do the concerned authorities authorize you so you can legally sell things.'

translations.english: 得 means 'can' while 知 means 'know.' 而 here has no meaning, only contributing a syllable so that the idiom can have the standard four syllables. The meaning of the whole idiom is 'cannot be known, unable to ascertain.'

examples.simplified: 至于他心里是怎么想的，那就不得而知了。
examples.pinyin: Zhìyí tā xīnlĭ shì zěnme xiăng de, nă jiù Dùdé' érzhī le.
examples.english: 'As for how he thought in his mind, that cannot be known.'

examples.simplified: 这种快餐的热量到底有多少，消费者仍然不得而知。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhŏng kuàicān de rèliàng dàodí yŏu duōshao, xiāofèizhe réngrán bùdé' érzhī.
examples.english: 'Consumers are still unable to ascertain how many calories this kind of fast food really has.'

translations.english: 提 here means 'carry,' 吊 means 'hang,' and 胆 means 'gallbladder.' The literal meaning is 'carry one's heart and hang one's gallbladder,' which can be translated as 'very worried, very much afraid.'

examples.simplified: 那个街区不安全，附近的居民提心吊胆的，一到天黑就不敢上街。
examples.pinyin: Nàge jiēqū bù ānquán, fùjìn de jūmín tíxiīn-diàodăn de, yí dào tiānhēi jiù bù găn shàngjiē.
examples.english: 'That area is not safe, the residents nearby being very much afraid; as soon as it gets dark, they don't dare to go on the streets.'

examples.simplified: 他贪污了国家的钱，提心吊胆地生活了一年后，最终自己找警察承认了。
examples.pinyin: Tā tānwāle guójiā de qián, tíxīn-diàodăn de shēnghuóle yì nián hòu, zuìzhōng zĭjĭ zhăo jĭngchá chéngrènle.
examples.english: 'He embezzled the country's money; after living in great fear for a year, in the end he went to the police himself and confessed.'

translations.english: 货 means 'goods, merchandise,' 价 means 'price,' and 实 means 'honest, solid, reasonable.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'genuine goods at reasonable prices.'

examples.simplified: 这家商店卖的商品货真价实，深受消费者欢迎。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā shāngdiàn mài de shāngpĭn huòzhēn-jiāshí, shēnshòu xiāofèizhe huānyíng.
examples.english: 'The merchandise this store sells is genuine and prices are reasonable, so it is very favorably received by consumers.'

examples.simplified: 她是实力派，不是靠炒作成名的，是货真价实的明星。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì shílìpai, bú shì kào chăozuò chéngmíng de, shì huòzhēn-jiàshí de míngxīng.
examples.english: 'She has real power and she didn't gain fame through hype; she's a genuine star.'

translations.english: 鸡 means 'chicken,' 犬 means 'dog,' and 升 means 'rise up to.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is '(his) chickens and dogs rise to heaven (with him).' By metaphor, this means that if someone becomes an official, the people who have a connection with him will also gain power, or that followers benefit when their leader gains power.

examples.simplified: 不管古代的官场还是现代的官场，都是一人得道，鸡犬升天。
examples.pinyin: Bùguăn gǔdài de guānchăng háishì xiàndài de guānchăng, dōu shì yìrén-dédào, jīquăn-shēngtiān.
examples.english: 'No matter whether it's officialdom in ancient times or officialdom nowadays, it's always been the case that "when one person attains enlightenment, his chickens and dogs will rise to heaven with him" - in other words, nepotism is a very common phenomenon.'

examples.simplified: 他当了总统，兄弟姐妹都当了高官，这不是一人得道，鸡犬升天吗？
examples.pinyin: Tā dāngle zŏngtŏng, xiōngdìjiěmèi dōu dāngle gāoguān, zhè bùshì yìrén-dédào, jīquăn-shēngtiān ma?
examples.english: 'When he became president, his siblings became high officials; is this not an example of nepotism?'

translations.english: 奋 here means 'courageous,' 顾 means 'consider,' and 身 means 'one's own body.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'courageously not consider one's own body,' with a freer translation being 'act boldly without regard for one's own life.'

examples.simplified: 就在歹徒行凶的一刹那，他奋不顾身地冲了上去，紧紧地抓住了歹徒的
examples.pinyin: 手。
examples.english: Jiù zài dăitú híngxióng de yíchà'nà, tā fènbúgushēn de chōngle shàngqù, jĭnjĭn de zhuāzhùle dăitú de shŏu.

examples.pinyin: Example 2:
examples.english: Yŏu gè háizi diàojìnle hé lĭ, tā fènbúgùshēn de tiàole xiàqù, qù jiù nàgè háizi.

translations.english: 精 means 'skilled,' 细 means 'meticulous,' and 打算 means 'plan.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'careful planning and calculations.'

examples.simplified: 普通人的收入不高，过日子就得精打细算，花好每ー块钱。
examples.pinyin: Pǔtōngrén de shēurù bù gāo, guò rìzi jiù děi jīngdă-xìsuàn, huā hăo měi yì kuài qián.
examples.english: 'The income of ordinary people is not high; to live they must plan and calculate carefully, spending every dollar well.'

examples.simplified: 油价下跌了，严重影响了人们的日常生活，过惯了大手大脚的生活的 沙特人也开始精打细算了。
examples.pinyin: Yóujià xiàdiēle, yánzhòng yĭngxiāngle rénmen de rìcháng shēnghuó, guòguànle dàshŏu-dàjiāo de shēnghuó de Shātèrén yě kāishĭ jīngdā-xìsuàn le.
examples.english: 'The price of oil has dropped, which has seriously affected people's everyday lives; even Saudi Arabians, who are used to extravagant lives, have begun carefully planning and calculating.'

translations.english: 目 here means 'look at,' 转; means 'turn,' and 睛 means 'eyeballs.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'look at but not turn the eyeballs,' with freer translations being 'fix the eyes on, look at with great concentration and attention.'

examples.simplified: 孩子目不转睛地盯着电视画面。
examples.pinyin: Háizi mùbùzhuānjīng de dīngzhe diànshì huàmiàn.
examples.english: The child with great concentration stared at the televised image.

examples.simplified: 那对情人目不转睛地看着对方，眼睛里传递了多少爱！
examples.pinyin: Nà duì qíngrén mùbùzhuānjīng de kànzhe duìfāng, yānjīng lĭ chuándìle duōshāo ài!
examples.english: 'That pair of sweethearts gazed at each other without moving an eyeball; how much love was transmitted in the eyes!'

translations.english: The 车 or 'vehicles' (originally horse carriages) are like 流水'flowing water,' and the 马 or 'horses' are like playing dragons. The meaning of the whole idiom is 'a steady stream of.'

examples.simplified: 大街上车水马龙，热闹得很。
examples.pinyin: Dàjiē shàng chēshuĭ-mālóng, rènào de hěn.
examples.english: 'On the streets there was heavy traffic and it was very lively.'

examples.simplified: 开学的时候，北京大学门前车水马龙，很多家长都来送自己的孩子上学。
examples.pinyin: Kāixué de shíhou, Běijing Dàxué ménqián chēshuĭ-mālóng, hěn duō jiāzhāng dōu lái sòng zìjĭ de háizi shàngxué.
examples.english: 'At the start of the school year, there was a steady stream of people in front of the gates of Peking University, many parents having come to bring their children to school.'

translations.english: 望 means 'see, gaze' and 际 means 'border, boundary.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'once you gaze there are no boundaries,' with a freer translation being 'stretch as far as the eye can see, boundless, vast.'

examples.simplified: 俄罗斯的东部到处是一望无际的森林和草原。
examples.pinyin: Éluósī de dōngbù dàochù shì yíwàng-wújì de sēnlín hé cāoyuán.
examples.english: 'In the eastern part of Russia, there are everywhere forests and prairies that stretch as far as the eye can see.'

examples.simplified: 美国很多农场非常大，一望无际。
examples.pinyin: Měiguó hěn duō nóngchāng fēicháng dà, yíwàng-wújì.
examples.english: 'Many U.S. farms are extremely large, stretching as far as the eye can see.'

translations.english: 成 means 'form, shape.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'once something takes shape, it doesn't change,' with a freer translation being 'fixed and unalterable, invariable.'

examples.simplified: 人不是一成不变的，而是受环境很大影响的。
examples.pinyin: Rén bú shì yìchéng-búbiàn de, ěr shì shòu huánjìng hěn dà yĭngxiāng de.
examples.english: 'Humans are not fixed and unalterable, but rather are strongly influenced by their environment.'

examples.simplified: 他已经吃腻了几十年来一成不变的早餐，不是煎鸡蛋就是煮鸡蛋。
examples.pinyin: Tā yĭjīng chīnìle jĭ shí nián lái yìchéng-búbiàn de zāocān, bú shì jiān jīdàn jiùshì zhǔ jīdàn.
examples.english: 'He has gotten sick and tired of eating a breakfast that hasn't varied for decades; either it's fried eggs or it's boiled eggs.'

translations.english: 脱 means 'break free from, escape from.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'escaping from the mouth to come out,' with freer translations including 'come out spontaneously, say without thinking, blurt out, let slip.'

examples.simplified: 她是古代文学教授，不论你提到哪首诗词，她都能脱口而出，全部背下来。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì gǔdài wēnxué jiàoshòu, búlùn nĭ tídào nā shŏu shící, tā dōu néng tuōkŏu- érchū, quánbù bèixiàlái.
examples.english: 'She is a professor of ancient literature; no matter which poem you mention, she can recite it spontaneously without thinking.'

examples.simplified: 听见有人打喷嚏，旁边的人脱口而出，"Bless you!"
examples.pinyin: Tīngjiàn yŏu rén dā pēntì, pángbiān de rén tuōkŏu-érchū, "Bless you!"
examples.english: 'When they heard a person sneeze, the people next to the person said spontaneously, "Bless you!"'

translations.english: 生'3 means 'vitality' and 勃勃 means 'vigorous, exuberant.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'full of vitality.'

examples.simplified: 纽约总是给人一种生气勃勃的印象，而在美国南方则显得安静了许多。
examples.pinyin: Niǔyuē zŏngshì gěi rén yì zhŏng shēngqì-bóbó de yìnxiàng, ér zài Měiguó nánfāng zé xiānde ānjìngle xǔduō.
examples.english: 'New York always gives one an impression of great vitality, but in the south of the U.S. it appears a lot quieter.'

examples.simplified: 新领导掌管公司后，公司出现了巨大的变化，生气勃勃。
examples.pinyin: Xīn lĭngdāo zhāngguān gōngsī hòu, gōngsī chūxiànle jùdà de biànhuà, shēngqì-bóbó.
examples.english: 'After the new boss took charge of the company, the company experienced great changes, becoming full of energy.'

translations.english: The literal meaning of this idiom is 'in accordance with the rules of heaven and the principles of earth - absolutely correct, entirely justified, unalterable.'

examples.simplified: 杀人偿命、欠债还钱，这是天经地义的事。
examples.pinyin: Shā rén cháng mìng, qiàn zhài huán qián, zhè shì tiānjīng-dìyì de shì.
examples.english: 'Paying for a murder with one's own life, and paying back money if one has a debt -these are absolutely correct and justified things.'

examples.simplified: 你在别的国家的领土上，就得遵守该国的法律，天经地义，没有什么好商量的。
examples.pinyin: Nĭ zài biéde guójiá de lĭngtǔ shàng, jiù děi zūnshŏu gāi guó de fālù, tiānjīng-dìyì, méiyŏu shénme hāo shāngliáng de.
examples.english: 'When you are in the territory of another country, you must observe the laws of that country; this is absolutely correct and there is nothing further to talk about.'

translations.english: 狐 means 'fox,' 假 means 'borrow,' 虎 means 'tiger,' and 威 means 'strength.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'a fox borrows the might of a tiger.' The extended meaning is 'rely on powerful connections with one person to bully another person.'

examples.simplified: 市长的秘书狐假虎威，在当地很狂妾。
examples.pinyin: Shìzhāng de mìshū hújiā-hǔwēi, zài dāngdì hěn kuángwàng.
examples.english: 'The mayor's secretary relies on his connections with the mayor to bully others, acting extremely arrogantly in the local area.'

examples.simplified: 有的人崇洋媚外，认识了几个外国人，就狐假虎威起来，觉得自己好像高人一等了。
examples.pinyin: Yŏu de rén chóngyáng-mèiwài, rènshile jĭ ge wàiguórén, jiù hǔjiā-hǔwēi qĭlai, juéde zìjĭ hāoxiàng gāo rén yì děng le.
examples.english: 'Some people worship and fawn over all things foreign; if they have gotten to know a few foreigners, they start relying on their connections to bully others, feeling that they are a cut above others.'

translations.english: 了 means 'understand,' 如 means 'like,' and 指掌 means 'fingers and palms.' The literal meaning is 'understand as well as one's own fingers and palms,' with a freer translation being 'completely clear about, know someone or something from A to Z.'

examples.simplified: 警察对犯罪分子的情况了如指掌，只等机会来临就动手了。
examples.pinyin: Jĭngchá duì fànzuìfènzĭ de qíngkuàng liāorú-zhĭzhāng, zhĭ děng jīhuì líilín jiù dòngshŏu le.
examples.english: 'The police are completely clear about the criminals' situation, they're merely waiting for an opportunity to come for them to strike.'

examples.simplified: 她在联邦政府里工作了四十年，对政府里的ー些内幕了如指掌。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài liánbāng zhèngfǔ lĭ gōngzuòle sìshí nián, duì zhèngfǔ lĭ de yìxiē nèimù liāorú zhĭzhāng.
examples.english: 'She worked in the federal government for forty years, so she knows the inner workings of the government from A to Z.'

translations.english: 别 means 'other, separate,' 有 means 'have,' and 用心 means 'intention, motive.' The whole idiom means 'harbor ulterior motives' or 'have something up one's sleeve.'

examples.simplified: 一些别有用心的人企图利用老百姓来制造混乱。
examples.pinyin: Yìxiē biéyŏuyòngxīn de rēn qĭtú lìyòng lāobāixìng lái zhìzào hùnluàn.
examples.english: 'Some people with ulterior motives attempt to use the populace to create chaos.'

examples.simplified: 他这样做表面上是帮助你，其实别有用心。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhèyàng zuò biāomiàn shàng shì bāngzhù nĭ, qíshí biéyŏuyòngxīn.
examples.english: 'His doing this on the surface is helping you, but actually he has ulterior motives.'

translations.english: 光 means 'light' and 色 means 'color.' A literal translation is 'five lights and ten colors,' with a freer translation being 'all kinds of colors, multicolored.'

examples.simplified: 她喜欢欣赏香港街头五光十色的广告牌。
examples.pinyin: Tā xĭhuan xīnshāng Xiānggāng jiētóu wǔguāng-shísè de guānggàopái.
examples.english: 'She likes to enjoy the multicolored advertising signs on the streets of Hong Kong.'

examples.simplified: 他习惯了大都市的那种五光十色的夜生活。
examples.pinyin: Tā xíguànle dàdūshì de nà zhŏng wǔguāng-shísè de yè shēnghuó.
examples.english: 'He is used to the colorful nightlife of big cities.'

translations.english: 合 means 'conform to,' 时 means 'at the time,' and 宜 means 'that which is appropriate.' The whole idiom means 'out of keeping with the times.'

examples.simplified: 社会在发展，而他的思想没有进步，因此早就不合时宜了。
examples.pinyin: Shèhuì zài fāzhān, ér tā de sīxiāng méiyŏu jìnbù, yīncĭ zāo jiù bùhé-shíyí le.
examples.english: 'Society is developing but his thought has not progressed, therefore he has for a long time now not been in tune with the times.'

examples.simplified: 她的情绪不太好，说了ー些不合时宜的话。
examples.pinyin: Tā de qíngxù bú tài hāo, shuōle yìxiē bùhé-shíyí de huà.
examples.english: 'She's not in a very good mood, so she said some inopportune things.'

translations.english: 富丽 means 'magnificent' and 堂皇 means 'grand.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'magnificent and grand.'

examples.simplified: 巴黎罗浮宫富丽堂皇，里面有很多珍贵的艺术品。
examples.pinyin: Bālí Luófúgōng fùlì-tánghuáng, lĭmiàn yŏu hěn duō zhēnguì de yìshùpĭn.
examples.english: 'The Louvre in Paris is magnificent and grand, inside there are many precious works of art.'

examples.simplified: 这所大学在一个小镇，虽然没有富丽堂皇的建筑，但是吸引了世界一流的学者。
examples.pinyin: Zhè suŏ dàxué zài yí ge xiāozhèn, suīrán méiyŏu fùlì-tánghuáng de jiànzhù, dànshì xīyĭnle shìjiè yīliú de xuézhě.
examples.english: 'This college is in a small town; though there aren't any grand and magnificent buildings, it has attracted some of the world's top scholars.'

translations.english: 蹄 means 'hoof.' The literal meaning is 'horse doesn't stop its hooves,' with a freer translation being 'nonstop, without stopping.'

examples.simplified: 总统候选人马不停蹄地访问了一个州又一个州，到处宣传他的政策。
examples.pinyin: Zŏngtŏng hòuxuănrén măbùtíngtí de făngwènle yí ge zhōu yòu yí ge zhōu, dàochù xuānchuán ta de zhèngcè.
examples.english: 'The presidential candidate visited one state after another nonstop, publicizing his policies everywhere.'

examples.simplified: 一下飞机，她就马不停蹄地赶到了地震灾害最严重的地区。
examples.pinyin: Yí xià fēijī, tā jiù măbùtíngtí de găndàolē dìzhèn zāihài zuì yánzhòng de dìqū.
examples.english: 'As soon as she got off the plane, she rushed without stopping to the area where the earthquake disaster had been the most serious.'

translations.english: The literal meaning of this idiom is 'open the door and see the mountain,' with a freer translation being 'come straight to the point.'

examples.simplified: 记者开门见山地问："你知道不知道这是法律不允许的？"
examples.pinyin: Jìzhĕ kāimén-jiànshān de wèn: "Nĭ zhīdào bù zhīdào zhè shì fălù bù yŭnxŭ de?"
examples.english: 'The reporter came straight to the point and asked, "Do you know this is not permitted by law?" '

examples.simplified: 客人开门见山, 把他的想法直接告诉了主人。
examples.pinyin: Kèrén kāimén-jiànshān, bă tā de xiăngfă zhíjiē gàosule zhŭrén.
examples.english: 'The guest came straight to the point and told his opinion directly to the host.'

translations.english: 别 means 'other/another,'具 means 'have,' and 格 here means 'style.'

examples.pinyin: Example 1:
examples.english: Tā mĕi nián sòng gĕi biérén de shèngdàn lĭwù dōu biéjù-yìgé

examples.pinyin: Example 2:
examples.english: Wŏ hĕn xīnshăng ta yóuhuà shàng de biéjù-yìgé de sècă

translations.english: 针 means 'needle' and 血 means 'blood.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'one (prick of a) needle and one sees blood.' Freer translations include 'exactly right, to the point, hit the nail on the head, go right to the heart of a matter.'

examples.simplified: 毛泽东一针见血地指出，知识分子具有两面性。
examples.pinyin: Máo Zédōng yìzhēn-jiànxiĕ de zhĭchū, zhīshi fènzĭ jùyŏu liăngmiànxìng.
examples.english: 'Mao Zedong, getting right to the heart of the matter, pointed out that the intelligentsia possess a dual character.'

examples.simplified: 她说话虽然不多，但是往往一针见血，正中要害。
examples.pinyin: Tā shuōhuà suīrán bù duō, dànshì wăngwăng yìzhēn jiàn xiĕ, zhèngzhòng yàohài.
examples.english: 'Although she doesn't say much, she always hits the nail on the head with the central, crucial point.'

translations.english: 草 means 'grass,'木 means 'tree,'皆 means 'all,' and 兵 means 'soldier.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'the grass and the trees all (look like enemy) soldiers,' with a freer translation being 'frightened, panic-stricken.'

examples.simplified: 政府军在明处，游击队躲在树林里向政府军射击，搞得政府军草木皆兵。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngfŭjūn zài míngchù, yóujīduì duŏ zài shùlín lĭ xiàng zhèngfŭ jūn shèjc, găode zhèngfŭ jūn căomù-jiēbīng.
examples.english: 'The government troops were in the open; the guerrilla forces hid in the woods and fired at the government troops, making the government troops panic-stricken.'

examples.simplified: 在严打的大形势下，违过法的人感到风声鹤唳、草木皆兵。
examples.pinyin: Zài yándă de dà xíngshì xià, wéiguò fă de rén găndào fēngshēng-hèlì, căomùjiēbīng.
examples.english: 'In the overall situation of the anti-crime crackdown, people who had disobeyed the law felt very frightened and panic-stricken.'

translations.english: 专心means 'concentrate one's attention,'致 means 'utmost,' and 志 means 'intention.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'very attentive, with single-minded devotion.'

examples.simplified: 她每天到图书馆里专心致志地看两个小时的书。
examples.pinyin: Tā mĕi tiān dào túshūguăn lĭ zhuānxīn-zhìzhì de kàn liăng gè xiăoshí de shū
examples.english: 'Every day she goes to the library and reads very attentively for two hours.'

examples.simplified: 她从来不拍电视剧，总是专心致志地拍电影。
examples.pinyin: Tā cónglái bù pāi diànshìjù, zŏngshì zhuanxīnzhìzhì de pāi diànyĭng.
