examples.english: 'She has never made soap operas; she always, with single-minded devotion, makes movies.'

translations.english: 堂堂 means 'powerful manner' and 正正 means 'orderly manner.' The original meaning of this idiom was 'powerful and orderly' but the meaning has now become 'open and aboveboard, fair and square.'

examples.simplified: 他不但长得堂堂正正，做事也堂堂正正。
examples.pinyin: Ta búdàn zhăngde tángtáng-zhèngzhèng, zuòshì yĕ táng táng zhèng zhèng.
examples.english: 'He not only looks open and aboveboard, in his work he is also open and aboveboard.'

examples.simplified: 我是个堂堂正正的人，不怕别人在背后说坏话。
examples.pinyin: Wŏ shì gè tángtáng-zhèngzhèng de rén, bú pà biérén zài bèihòu shuō huài huà.
examples.english: 'I'm an open and aboveboard sort of person; I'm not afraid of others saying nasty things behind my back.'

translations.english: 泣 means 'cry in a low voice, sob' and 不成声 means 'it doesn't form a sound.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'choke with sobs.'

examples.simplified: 那个故事还没有听完，她早已泣不成声了。
examples.pinyin: Nàg gùshi hái méiyŏu tīngwán, tā zăo yĭ qìbùchéngshēng le.
examples.english: 'Before she finished listening to that story, she was already choking with sobs.'

examples.simplified: 他太感动了，泣不成声地说："真的太感谢您了，您真是好人！"
examples.pinyin: Tā tài găndòngle, qìbùchéng shēng de shuō: "Zhēn de tài găn xiè nín le, nín zhēn shì hăo rén!"
examples.english: 'He was too moved; choking with sobs, he said_ "I really thank you so much, you really are a good person!''

translations.english: 伦 means 'peer, match.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'unequaled, peerless, incomparable.'

examples.simplified: 莫扎特在音乐上的天分简直是无与伦比的。
examples.pinyin: Mòzhātè zài yīnyuè shàng de tianfèn jiănzhí shì wú yŭ lún bĭde.
examples.english: 'Mozart's genius in music was simply unparalleled.'

examples.simplified: 比尔·盖茨为个人计算机的普及和发展做出了无与伦比的贡献。
examples.pinyin: Bĭ'ěr Gàicí wèi gèrén jìsuànjī de pŭjí hé fāzhăn zuòchūle wúyŭlúnbĭ de gòngxiàn..
examples.english: 'Bill Gates made unparalleled contributions for the popularization and development of the personal computer.'

translations.english: 素 means 'always,'相 means 'mutually,' and 识 means 'know, be acquainted with.' The whole idiom means 'never have met someone before, not know someone.'

examples.simplified: 那个孩子因为家庭贫穷而失学了，许多素不相识的人纷纷献出爱心，资助那个孩子上学。
examples.pinyin: Nàge háizi yīnwèi jiātíng pínqióng ér shcxuéle, xjdud sùbùxiangshí de rén fēnfēn xiànchū àixīn, zīzhù nàge háizi shàngxué
examples.english: 'When that child was unable to continue her education because her family was poor, many people who had never met her before offered their love one after another, helping her financially so she could attend school.'

examples.simplified: 朋友，你我素不相识，你为什么总是跟着我？
examples.pinyin: Péngyŏu, nĭ wŏ sùbùxiāngshí, nĭ wèishénme zŏngshì gēnzhē wŏ?
examples.english: 'Friend, you and I have never met before, why are you always following me?'

translations.english: 堂皇 means 'imposing manner.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'imposingly, ostentatiously, openly.'

examples.simplified: 那对影视明星不像其他人那样害怕狗仔队，堂而皇之地在大街上牵手走路。
examples.pinyin: Nà duì yhngshì míngxcng bú xiàng qíta rén nàyàng hàipà giuzfiduì, táng'érhuángzhc de zài dàjiē shàng qianshiu ziulù.
examples.english: 'That pair of movie and T.V. stars is not like the others in being afraid of the paparazzi; they openly walk on the street holding hands.'

examples.simplified: 以前被禁止的刊物现在堂而皇之地摆在书店的书架上。
examples.pinyin: Yǐqián bèi jìnzhh de kanwù xiànzài táng'érhuángzhc de bǎi zài shediàn de shejià shàng.
examples.english: 'Publications that formerly were prohibited now openly are placed on the bookshelves of bookstores.'

translations.english: 训练 means 'train' and 素 means 'usually, always.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'always in training, well trained.'

examples.simplified: 不是每个会说英语的人都能教英文，只有训练有素的人才能够胜任这项工作。
examples.pinyin: Bú shì měi ge huì shuō Yīngyǔ de rén ddu néng jiāo Yīngwén, zhǐyǒu xùnliànyiusù de rén cái nénggòu shèngrèn zhè xiàng gdngzuò。
examples.english: 'Not every person who can speak English can teach English; only well-trained people are qualified for this work.'

examples.simplified: 看她做事的方式就知道她训练有素。
examples.pinyin: Kàn tā zuòshì de fāngshì jiù zhīdao ta xùnliàn-yǒusù.
examples.english: 'Looking at the way she works, one knows that she is well trained.'

translations.english: 刻骨 means 'carved on one's bones' and 铭心 means 'engraved on one's mind.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'engraved on one's memory, unforgettable.'

examples.simplified: "文革"十年，给他留下了刻骨铭心的记忆。
examples.pinyin: "Wén'gé" shí nián, gěi tā liúxiàle kègǔ-míngxīn de jìyì.
examples.english: 'The ten years of the 'Cultural Revolution' left him with deeply ingrained memories.'

examples.simplified: 他们的初恋刻骨铭心，两个人永远不会忘记。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen de chūliàn kègǔj-míngxīn, liǎng ge rén yǒngyuǎn bú huì wàngjì.
examples.english: 'Their first love was deeply ingrained in their memory; the two of them would never forget it.'

translations.english: 屑 means 'deign to' and 顾 means 'look.' The whole idiom means 'not deign to look, be too conceited to even take a look.'

examples.simplified: 她喜欢看科学著作，对文学作品不屑一顾。
examples.pinyin: Tā xĭhuan kàn kbxué zhùzuò, duì wénxué zuòphn búxiè-yígù.
examples.english: 'She likes to read scientific works, not deigning to look at literary works.'

examples.simplified: "这有什么了不起？"他的话音里带着不屑一顾的语气。
examples.pinyin: Zhè yǒu shénme liǎobùqǐ? Tā de huàyīn lǐ dàizhe búxiè-yígù de yǔqì.
examples.english: '"What's so special about this?" His voice carried a disdainful tone of voice.'

translations.english: 弹 means 'pluck, play' and 琴 means 'stringed instrument.' A literal translation is 'play the lute for cattle,' in other words, to discuss something complex with stupid people. English translations include 'talk over somebody's head, cast pearls to swine, preach to deaf ears, waste someone's time.'

examples.simplified: 跟大字不识的人讲芭蕾舞，简直是对牛弹琴！
examples.pinyin: Gēn dà zì bù shí de rén jiǎng baléiwǔ, jiǎnzhí shì duìniú-tánqín!
examples.english: 'To discuss ballet with illiterate people is simply a waste of time!'

examples.simplified: 演讲的人在台上很兴奋地说个不停，台下的听众都打哈欠了，这样的演讲好像对牛弹琴。
examples.pinyin: Yǎnjiǎng de rén zài táishàng hěn xīngfèn de shuō ge bù tíng, táixià de tīngzhòng dōu dǎ hāqian le, zhèyàng de yǎnjiǎng hǎoxiàng duìniú-tánqín.
examples.english: 'On stage, the lecturer kept talking on and on excitedly, while off stage, the audience was yawning; this kind of lecture is like casting pearls to swine.'

translations.english: 助 means 'help,'人 means 'other people,'刀 means 'be,' and 乐 means 'happiness.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'help other people is happiness,' with a freer translation being 'enjoy helping others.'

examples.simplified: 宗教告诫我们要多做善事，助人为乐，这样死后就能进入天堂。
examples.pinyin: Zōngjiào gàojiè wǒmen yào duō zuò shànshì, zhùrén-wéilè, zhèyàng sh hòu jiù néng jìnrù tiāntáng.
examples.english: 'Religion admonishes us that we should do more good works and enjoy helping others; this way, after we die, we can enter heaven.'

examples.simplified: 从小就要培养起助人为乐的好品质。
examples.pinyin: Cóng xiǎo jiù yào péiyǎng qǐ zhùrén-wéilè de hǎo pǐnzhì.
examples.english: 'From childhood on, one should start cultivating the good quality of enjoying helping other people.'

translations.english: 衣 means 'clothing,' 食 means 'food,'住 here means 'housing,' and 行 here means 'transportation.' The literal meaning is 'clothing, food, housing, and transportation.' The connotation is 'the basic necessities of life.'

examples.simplified: 改革开放以后，农民在衣食住行各个方面都有改善。
examples.pinyin: Gǎigé kāifàng yǐhóu, nóngmín zài yīshí-zhùxíng gègè fāngmiàn dōu yǒu gǎishàn.
examples.english: 'After the policy of reform and opening, peasants saw improvements in every aspect of life's basic necessities.'

examples.simplified: 在美国，一般说来，公司对于职员的衣食住行都不管，那是职员自己的事情。
examples.pinyin: Zài Měiguó, yìbān shudlái, gōngsīc duìyú zhíyuán de yīshí-zhùxíng dōu bù guǎn, nà shì zhíyuán zìjǐ de shìqing.
examples.english: 'In the U.S., generally speaking, companies do not take care of employees' basic necessities of life; that is the employees' own business.'

translations.english: 不胜 means 'unable to do completely,'枚 means 'one at a time,' and 举 means 'enumerate, list.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'cannot enumerate one at a time,' with a freer translation being 'too numerous to cite individually.'

examples.simplified: 中国的乒乓球世界冠军不胜枚举。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó de pīngpāngqiú shìjiè guànjūn búshèng-méijǔ.
examples.english: 'Chinese table tennis world championships are too numerous to cite individually.'

examples.simplified: 小公司发展壮大后吃掉大公司的例子不胜枚举。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎo gōngsī fāzhǎn zhuàngdà hòu chīdiào dà gōngsī de lìzi búshèng-méijǔ.
examples.english: 'Examples of small companies that, after growing strong, ate up big companies are too numerous to mention individually.'

translations.english: 赞 means 'praise,'绝 means 'stop,' and 口 means 'mouth, talk.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'praise and not stop talking.' Freer translations include 'praise profusely, be full of praise.'

examples.simplified: 外国游客对中国的杂技赞不绝口。
examples.pinyin: Wàiguó yóukè duì Zhōngguó de zájì zànbùjuékǒu.
examples.english: 'Foreign tourists are full of praise for China's acrobatics.'

examples.simplified: 那位大音乐家对这个小女孩儿的演奏赞不绝口，说他二十年来没有见过 这么有潜力的孩子。
examples.pinyin: Nà wèi dà yīnyuèjia duì zhège xiǎo nǚháir de yǎnzòu zànbùjuékiu, shuō tā èrshí nián lái méiyiu jiànguo zhème yiu qiánlì de háizi.
examples.english: 'That great musician was full of praise for this young girl's performance; he said he hadn't seen a child with such potential in twenty years.'

translations.english: 鼎鼎 means 'grand, magnificent.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'famous, well known.'

examples.simplified: 他就是大名鼎鼎的小说家金庸先生。
examples.pinyin: Tā jiù shì dàmíng-dǐngdǐng de xiǎoshuōjiā Jīnyōng xiānshēng.
examples.english: 'He is none other than the well-known novelist Mr. Jin Yong.'

examples.simplified: 这场足球比赛吸引了很多观众，因为里面有三位大名鼎鼎的球星。
examples.pinyin: Zhè chǎng zúqiú bhsài xīyǐnle hěn duō guānzhòng, yīnwèi lǐmiàn yǒu san wèi dàmíng-dǐngdǐng de qiúxīng.
examples.english: 'This soccer competition has attracted a lot of spectators, because in it there are three very famous soccer stars.'

translations.english: 如 means 'like,'数 means 'count,'家 means 'family,' and 珍 means 'treasure.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'like counting family treasures,' with a freer translation being 'very familiar with one's subject.'

examples.simplified: 一说起电影演员，她就会如数家珍般地给你讲出一大串。
examples.pinyin: Yì shud qǐ diànyǐng yǎnyuán, tā jiù huì rúshǔ-jiazhēn bān de gěi nǐ jiǎng chū yídà chuàn.
examples.english: 'Once on the topic of film actors and actresses, she is so familiar with this subject that she will talk up a storm for you, going on and on.'

examples.simplified: 谈到本地的特产，老人如数家珍。
examples.pinyin: Tán dào běndì de tèchǎn, lǎorén rúshǔ-jiazhēn.
examples.english: 'When talking about local specialties, the old people are as familiar with this topic as if they were counting their family treasures.'

translations.english: 跃 usually means 'jump'; here,跃跃 means 'impatient, anxious, in a hurry.'欲 means 'want' and 试 means 'try.' Therefore, a literal translation of this idiom is 'impatiently want to try,' with a freer translation being 'eager to try.'

examples.simplified: 听说那个城市要花巨资建设会展中心，许多建筑商跃跃欲试。
examples.pinyin: Tīngshuō nàge chéngshì yào huā jùzī jiànshè huìzhǎn zhōngxīn, xǔduō jiànzhùshang yuèyuè-yùshì.
examples.english: 'When they heard that that city was going to spend a huge amount of money to construct a conference and exhibition center, a lot of contractors were eager to give it a shot.'

examples.simplified: 一名外国乒乓球选手说要打败中国所有选手并夺得金牌，这引起了巨大的 反响，许多选手跃跃欲试。
examples.pinyin: Yì míng wàiguó pīngpāngqiú xuǎnshǒu shuō yào dǎbài Zhōngguó suǒyǒu xuǎnshǒu bìng duódé jīnpái, zhè yǐnqǐle jùdà de fánxiǎng, xǔduō xuǎnshǒu yuèyuè-yùshì.
examples.english: 'When a foreign ping pong player said that he was going to defeat all the Chinese players and capture the gold medal, this touched off an enormous response, many players being eager to try.'

translations.english: A literal translation of this idiom is 'ancient color ancient flavor.' The meaning is 'antique, old-fashioned.'

examples.simplified: 房间里面的家具都是暗红色，显得古色古香的。
examples.pinyin: Fángjiān lǐmiàn de jiājù dōu shì ànhóngsè, xiǎnde gǔsè-gǔxiāng de.
examples.english: 'The furniture in the room was all dark red, looking antique in appearance.'

examples.simplified: 他的办公室里挂着一张古色古香的字画。
examples.pinyin: Tā de bàngōngshì lǐ guàzhe yì zhāng gǔsè-gǔxiang de zìhuà.
examples.english: 'In his office hung a piece of antique calligraphy.'

translations.english: 推 means 'push,'波 means 'wave,'助 means 'help,' and 澜 means 'billow, big wave.'

examples.pinyin: Example 1:
examples.english: Běnlái zhè shì liǎng guó jian de yí ge xiǎo mócā, dànshì jīngguò mǒu ge dàguó tucbd-zhùlán hòu, yǎnbiàn chéngle lifng guó dà gucmó de jenshì chdngte.

examples.pinyin: Example 2:
examples.english: Dà shíyóu gōngsī zài zhè cì guójì yóujià dà zhǎng zhōng qhle tucbd-zhùlán de zuòyòng.

translations.english: 班 refers to Lu Ban, the founder of carpentry in China,门 means 'front door,' 弄 means 'play with,' and 斧 means 'axe.' A literal translation is 'at the front door of Lu Ban's house to play with an axe.' This means 'show off one's meager skills before an expert and not know one's own limitations.'

examples.simplified: "就你那点水平，还想在牛津大学演讲，别班门弄斧了。"
examples.pinyin: "Jiù nǐ nà diǎn shuǐpíng, hái xiǎng zài Niújīn Dàxué yǎnjiǎng, bié Bnmén-nòngfǔ le."
examples.english: '"You have only very limited proficiency, and you actually want to give a lecture at Oxford; don't show off your meager skills before the experts."'

examples.simplified: 他非常谦虚地说，"各位专家，我就班门弄斧了，不对的地方请您指正。"
examples.pinyin: Ta fēicháng qianxe de shud, "Gèwèi zhuanjia, wi jiù Bānmén-nòngfj le, bú duì de dìfang qhng nín zhhzhèng."
examples.english: 'He said very modestly, 'All of you experts, I shall show off my meager skills before you; please do correct my mistakes.''

translations.english: 光明 here means 'open' and 磊落 means 'candid, straightforward.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'open and candid, frank and forthright.'

examples.simplified: 她一生正直，坚持原则，光明磊落。
examples.pinyin: Tā yìshēng zhèngzhí, jiānchí yuánzé, guāngmíng-lěiluò.
examples.english: 'Her whole life long she was upright, sticking to her principles and being open and candid.'

examples.simplified: 她为人光明磊落，从来不滥用自己手中的权利。
examples.pinyin: Tā wéirén guāngmíng-lěiluò, cónglái bú lànyòng zìjǐ shǒuzhōng de quánlì.
examples.english: 'She is an open and straightforward person who never abuses the authority in her hands.'

translations.english: 川 means 'river,'流 means 'flow,' and 息 means 'stop.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'continuous flow.'

examples.simplified: 北京王府井大街上行人和车辆川流不息。
examples.pinyin: Běijīng Wángfǔjǐng Dàjiē shàng xíngrén hé chēliàng chuānliú-bùxī.
examples.english: 'On the streets of Wangfujing in Beijing, there is a continuous flow of pedestrians and vehicles.'

examples.simplified: 他去找工作，但是看到川流不息的求职的人，他的心很紧张。
examples.pinyin: Tā qù zhǎo gōngzuò, dànshì kàndào chuānliú-bùxī de qiúzhí de rén, tā de xīn hěn jǐnzhāng.
examples.english: 'He went looking for a job, but seeing the unending stream of people seeking employment, he was very anxious.'

translations.english: 迎 means 'meet,'刃 means 'knife blade,' and 解 means 'split.' The whole idiom literally means 'meet blade and split.' This originally referred to the splitting of bamboo, since when the knife-edge cuts into the bamboo, it splits all the way down. A freer translation is 'easily solved.'

examples.simplified: 对别人来说非常棘手的问题，他到了就迎刃而解。
examples.pinyin: Duì biérén lái shud fbicháng jíshiu de wèntí, ta dàole jiù yíngrèn-érjig.
examples.english: 'Problems that are extremely difficult for others to deal with, once he arrives he can solve them with ease.'

examples.simplified: 只要有完备的法律，任何纠纷都会迎刃而解。
examples.pinyin: Zhhyào yǒu wánbèi de fǎlǜ, rènhé jiūfēn dōu huì yíngrèn-érjiě.
examples.english: 'As long as there are perfect laws, any dispute will be easily solved.'

translations.english: 对 means 'facing, be directed at,')正 means 'illness,' f here means 'prescribe,' and 药 means 'medicine.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'prescribe medicine that is directed at the illness,' with freer translations being 'suit the medicine to the illness' and 'act appropriately to the situation.'

examples.simplified: 你得先看清问题的本质，然后才能对症下药。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ děi xiān kàn qīng wèntí de běnzhì, ránhòu cáinéng duìzhèng-xiàyào..
examples.english: 'You must first see clearly the essence of the problem; only then can you act appropriately to the situation.'

examples.simplified: 通货膨胀的原因是生产不足，只要对症下药，就能从根本上解决这个问题。
examples.pinyin: Tōnghuòpéngzhàng de yuánycn shì shbngchfn bù zú, zhhyào duìzhèng-xiàyào, jiù néng cóng gbnbgn shàng jigjué zhège wèntí.
examples.english: 'The reason for inflation is insufficient production; provided that we suit the medicine to the illness, we can thoroughly solve this problem.'

translations.english: This idiom describes an atmosphere that is enthusiastic, active, and energetic. Translations include 'bustling with activity, going ahead at full steam.'

examples.simplified: 建筑工地上，工人们干得热火朝天。
examples.pinyin: Jiànzhù gdngdì shàng, gdngrénmen gàn dé rèhui-cháotiān.
examples.english: 'At the construction site, the workers were working at full steam.'

examples.simplified: 澳大利亚网球公开赛正在热火朝天地进行，可是那名种子选手却因伤早早 退出了。
examples.pinyin: Àodàlìyà Wfngqiú Gdngkaisài zhèngzài rèhui-cháotian de jìnxíng, kěshì nà míng zhingzh xufnshiu què ycn shang zfozfo tuìche le.
examples.english: 'Australia's tennis open is currently taking place with great enthusiasm, but that seeded player because of an injury withdrew from the tournament long ago.'

translations.english: 足 means 'enough' or 'worth,'为 means 'be,' and 奇 means 'unusual.' The literal meaning of the whole idiom is 'not be enough to be considered strange' and a freer translation is 'not at all surprising, expected.'

examples.simplified: 三十磅的西瓜不足为奇，我吃过五十磅的西瓜。
examples.pinyin: Sānshí bàng de xcgua bùzú-wéiqí, wǒ chcguo wjshí bàng de xcgua.
examples.english: .'A thirty-pound watermelon is nothing unusual; I've eaten fifty-pound watermelons.'

examples.simplified: 因为美国的中小学不教英语的语法，所以美国学生不懂得汉语的词性也就 不足为奇了。
examples.pinyin: Yīnwei Měiguó de zhdng-xifoxué bù jiao Ycngyj de yjff, suiyh Mgiguó xuésheng bù dingde Hànyj de cíxìng yg jiù bùzú-wéiqí le.
examples.english: 'Because U.S. elementary and middle schools don't teach English grammar, it's not surprising that U.S. students don't understand Chinese parts of speech.'

translations.english: 脱 means 'break free from, escape from,' 胎 means 'placenta,' fe means 'change,' and 骨 means 'bones.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'break free from one's placenta and change one's bones.' This was originally a Buddhist term referring to a monk or nun obtaining enlightenment. In current usage, the meaning of the whole idiom is 'reborn, remold oneself, turn over a new leaf.'

examples.simplified: 英国的经济增长方式太依赖金融业，工业没有后劲，在面对世界经济危机时，必须脱胎换骨，才能摆脱经济危机的影响。
examples.pinyin: Yīngguó de jcngjì zbngzhfng fangshì tài yclài jcnróngyè, gdngyè méiyiu hòujìn, zài miànduì shìjiè jcngjì wbijc shí, bìxe tudtai-huàngj, cái néng bfitud jcngjì wēijc de yhngxifng.
examples.english: 'The British economic growth model relies too much on the financial sector, industry having no stamina; in facing the world economic crisis, we must remold ourselves; only then can we shake off the influence of the economic crisis.'

examples.simplified: 结婚以后，在妻子的帮助下，他发生了脱胎换骨的变化，好像变成了另外一个人。
examples.pinyin: Jiéhūn yǐhòu, zài qczi de bangzhù xià, ta fashēngle tudtai-huàngj de biànhuà,hǎoxiàng biànchéngle lìngwài yí ge rén.
examples.english: 'After getting married, with the help of his wife, he underwent change as though he had been reborn, it appearing as if he had become another person.'

translations.english: 扬 means 'raise,'眉 means 'brow,' 吐 here means 'pour out,' and 气 here means 'resentment.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'lift one's brow and pour out one's resentment,' with freer translations being 'stand up with one's head held high' and 'feel proud and elated.'

examples.simplified: 时代变了，农民不再是穷困的代名词，他们终于扬眉吐气了。
examples.pinyin: Shídài biàn le, nóngmín bú zài shì qióngkùn de dàimíngcí, tamen zhdngyú yángméitjqì le.
examples.english: 'Times have changed; peasants are no longer a synonym for poverty, they have finally stood up with their heads held high.'

examples.simplified: 每个人都有扬眉吐气的时候。
examples.pinyin: Měi ge rén ddu yiu yángméi-tjqì de shíhou.
examples.english: 'Everyone has a time when he or she feels proud and elated.'

translations.english: 荡 means 'cleanse, wash,'荡然 means 'clean,' and 无存 means 'with nothing remaining.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'vanish without a trace.'

examples.simplified: 我记忆中的那条小街如今已经荡然无存了，在那个地方盖起了高楼。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jìyì zhōng de nà tiáo xiǎo jib rújcn yhjcng dàngrán-wúcún le, zài nàge dìfang gàiqhle gāolóu.
examples.english: 'The little road that I remember has now vanished without a trace, in that space they have built tall buildings.'

examples.simplified: 那个国家的政府官员高度腐败，所以民主和法制实际上荡然无存。
examples.pinyin: Nàge guójiā de zhèngfj guanyuán gaodù fjbài, suiyh mínzhj hé ffzhì shíjìshàng dàngrán-wúcún.
examples.english: 'Government officials from that country are highly corrupt, so democracy and the legal system in fact have vanished without a trace.'

translations.english: 叶 is a Chinese surname,公 was a term of respect for males in ancient China somewhat like 'Duke,' and 奸 means 'like.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'Duke Ye likes dragons.' This is a metaphor for 'on the surface to like something but actually not to like it at all' or 'pretend to like what one really dislikes or fears.'

examples.simplified: 他口头上说欢迎大家提出不同意见，可是一旦別人真的提出了不同意见， 他又很不高兴，这就有点儿叶公好龙了。
examples.pinyin: Tā kǒutóu shàng shud huanyíng dàjia tíche bùtóng yìjiàn, kgshì yídàn biérén zhbnde tíchele bùtóng yìjiàn, ta yòu hgn bù gaoxìng, zhè jiù yiudifnr Yègōnghàolóng le.
examples.english: 'He said orally that he welcomed everyone to put forward different opinions, but once someone else really put forward a different opinion, he was very unhappy; so this was a little like Duke Ye claiming that he liked dragons but actually being terrified of them.'

examples.simplified: 我们招收人才不是叶公好龙，而是让他们真正发挥才能。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zhāoshōu réncái búshì Yègōng-hàolóng, érshì ràng tamen zhbnzhèng fahuc cáinéng.
examples.english: 'When we recruit persons of talent, we don't say one thing and mean another; instead, we let them really bring their talents into full play.'

translations.english: 脉 means 'blood vessel,'相 means 'mutually,' and 承 means 'succeed.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is '(with) one blood vessel to succeed one another.' Freer translations include 'come down in a continuous line, traced to the same origin, of the same lineage.'

examples.simplified: 世界各地的天主教的不同派别的思想是一脉相承的。
examples.pinyin: Shìjiè gè dì de Tianzhjjiào de bùtóng pàibié de scxifng shì yímài-xiangchéng de.
examples.english: 'The ideology of the different factions of Catholicism everywhere in the world can be traced to the same origin.'

examples.simplified: 他的作品的风格跟他的老师的一脉相承。
examples.pinyin: Tā de zuòpǐn de fēnggé gēn ta de lǎoshī de yímài-xiāngchéng.
examples.english: 'The style of his works comes down in a straight line from that of his teacher.'

translations.english: 置 means 'put,'之 means 'it,' and fe means 'pay attention to.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'put it aside and not pay attention to it,' with a freer translation being 'pay no attention to, ignore.'

examples.simplified: 她已经几个月没有交电话费了，电话公司几次发信，她都置之不理。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐjīng jǐ gè yuè méiyiu jiao diànhuàfèi le, diànhuà gdngsc jh cì faxìn, ta ddu zhìzhc-bùlǐ.
examples.english: 'She hasn't paid her telephone bill for several months; the telephone company has sent letters several times, but she pays no attention to them.'

examples.simplified: 他对医生的警告置之不理，依然抽烟喝酒，结果身体越来越差。
examples.pinyin: Tā duì yīshbng de jhnggào zhìzhc-bùlh, ycrán chduyan hbjij, jiégui shbnth yuè lái yuè chà.
examples.english: 'He ignores the warnings of his doctors, still smoking and drinking as before; as a result, his health is getting worse and worse.'

translations.english: 身 means 'oneself,'先 means 'in front of,' and 士毕 means 'rank-and-file soldiers.' The literal meaning of the idiom is 'oneself be in front of the rank-and-file soldiers,' with a freer translation being 'lead one's troops in a charge, provide leadership and set an example.'

examples.simplified: 在经济不景气的时期，公司的老板身先士卒，加班加点，最终率领公司 走出困境。
examples.pinyin: Zài jcngjì bù jhngqì de shíqc, gōngsī de lfobfn shbnxian-shìzú, jiaban jiadifn, zuìzhdng shuàilhng gōngsī ziuche kùnjìng.
examples.english: 'During the period when the economy was in a slump, the company boss provided leadership to his employees; he worked extra hours and in the end led the company out of its predicament.'

examples.simplified: 巴顿将军作战勇敢，身先士卒，有时候到战斗前线亲自观察情況。
examples.pinyin: Bādùn jiāngjūn zuòzhàn yinggfn, shbnxian-shìzú, yiu shíhou dào zhàndòu qiánxiàn qcnzì guanchá qíngkuàng.
examples.english: 'General Patton was brave in combat, himself leading his troops into battle; sometimes he would go to the frontline of battle to personally observe the situation.'

translations.english: 抖擞 means 'stir up, rouse.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'full of energy.'

examples.simplified: 休息了两天以后，他开始精神抖擞地上班。
examples.pinyin: Xiūxile liǎng tiīn yǐhòu, tā kāishǐ jīngshén-dǒusǒu de shàngbān.
examples.english: 'After having rested for two days, he began to go to work full of energy.'

examples.simplified: 看到士兵们个个精神抖擞，将军非常满意。
examples.pinyin: Kàndào shìbcngmen gègè jīngshén-dǒusǒu, jiangjen fēicháng mǎnyì.
examples.english: 'On seeing that each and every one of the rank-and-file soldiers was full of energy, the general was very satisfied.'

translations.english: 侃侃 means 'confident and unhurried.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'speak with confidence and conviction.'

examples.simplified: 面对记者，他侃侃而谈，表达了自己的美好愿望。
examples.pinyin: Miànduì jìzhg, ta kfnkfn'értán, bifodále zìjh de měihǎo yuànwàng.
examples.english: 'In front of the reporters, he spoke with confidence and conviction, expressing his own wonderful aspirations.'

examples.simplified: 售楼小姐与顾客侃侃而谈，介绍他们的楼盘的情況。
examples.pinyin: Shòulóu xifojig yj gùkè kfnkfn'értán, jièshào tamen de lóupán de qíngkuàng.
examples.english: 'The female real estate agent spoke with her customers with confidence and conviction, introducing the situation in their apartment building.'

translations.english: 诚心means 'sincere heart' and 诚意means 'sincere intention.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'earnestly and sincerely.'

examples.simplified: 他诚心诚意地向你道歉，你为什么不理他？
examples.pinyin: Tā chéngxcn-chéngyì de xiàng nh dàoqiàn, nh wèishénme bù lǐ ta?
examples.english: 'He apologized to you earnestly and sincerely; why do you ignore him?'

examples.simplified: 这个慈善家诚心诚意地帮助穷困地区的人民。
examples.pinyin: Zhège císhànjia chéngxcn-chéngyì de bangzhù qióngkùn dìqe de rénmín.
examples.english: 'This philanthropist earnestly and sincerely helps people from poverty-stricken areas.'

translations.english: 车 means 'soldiers, troops.' The literal meaning is 'a thousand troops and ten thousand horses,' with a freer translation being 'a vast array of infantry and cavalry, a powerful army.'

examples.simplified: 中国改革开放初期的高考，可以称得上是"千军万马过独木桥"，能够 考上大学的都是优秀的人才。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó gǎigé kaifàng cheqc de gaokfo, kgyh chbngdeshàng shì "qianjen-wànmf guò dúmùqiáo," nénggòu kfoshàng dàxué de ddu shì yduxiù de réncái.
examples.english: 'The university entrance examination during the early period of the reforms and opening up to the outside world could be called "a thousand troops and ten thousand horses crossing a single-plank bridge," with those able to get into universities being outstanding persons of talent.'

examples.simplified: 公司的领导就像军队中的将军，将军要指挥千军万马，领导要带动全体员工。
examples.pinyin: Gōngsī de lhngdfo jiù xiàng jenduì zhdng de jiangjen, jiangjen yào zhhhuc qianjenwànmf, lǐngdǎo yào dàidòng quánth yuángōng.
examples.english: 'The leader of a company is like a general in the armed forces; a general is supposed to command a vast array of infantry and cavalry, while a leader is supposed to spur on all of his or her staff members.'

translations.english: 绞 means 'entangle,'尽 means 'completely,'脑 means 'brain,' and 汁 means 'juice.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'rack one's brains.'

examples.simplified: 为了解决这个难题，他绞尽脑汁，最后终于想出了一个完美的办法。
examples.pinyin: Wèile jiějué zhège nántí, ta jifojìn-nfozhc, zuìhòu zhdngyú xifngchele yí ge wánmgi de bànff.
examples.english: 'In order to solve this difficult problem, he racked his brains, in the end finally thinking of the perfect way to deal with it.'

examples.simplified: 黑社会分子绞尽脑汁躲避警察的搜查。
examples.pinyin: Hēishèhuì fènzǐ jiǎojìn-nǎozhī duibì jǐngchá de sōuchá.
examples.english: 'The members of the criminal gang racked their brains to dodge the police during their search.'

translations.english: 垂 means 'hang down,'丧 means 'lose,' and 气 means 'spirit.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'hang head lose spirit,' with freer translations including 'hang one's head in dejection, dejected, discouraged.'

examples.simplified: 为了这场比赛，他们准备了一年，结果却被打得大败，队员们比赛后一个个垂头丧气地回了旅馆。
examples.pinyin: Wèile zhè chfng bhsài, tamen zhjnbèile yì nián, jiégui què bèi dǎde dàbài, duìyuánmen bhsài hòu yí ge ge chuítóu-sàngqì de huíle lǚguǎn.
examples.english: 'For this competition, they prepared for one year, and in the end, they suffered a great defeat; after the competition, each and every one of the team members returned to the hotel hanging his head in dejection.'

examples.simplified: 她严厉地说：看你那副垂头丧气的样子，哪像一个男人！
examples.pinyin: Ta yánlì de shuō: "Kàn nh nà fù chuítóu-sàngqì de yàngzi, nf xiàng yí ge nánren!"
examples.english: 'She said sternly: "Look at that dejected manner of yours; that isn't like a man!"'

translations.english: 掩 means 'cover,'耳 means 'ear,'盗 means 'steal,' and 铃 means 'bell.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'cover ears steal bell,' with a freer translation being 'cover one's own ears while one is stealing a bell so as to prevent others from hearing the sound of the bell.' This is a metaphor for 'deceive oneself and others.'

examples.simplified: 他一方面声称自己维护祖国统一，但是另一方面又秘密会晤分裂分子， 这种掩耳盗铃的做法让人恶心。
examples.pinyin: Tā yì fāngmiàn shēngchēng zìjǐ wéihù zjguó tingyc, dànshì lìng yì fangmiàn yòu mìmì huìwù fbnliè fènzh, zhè zhing yfn'gr-dàolíng de zuòff ràng rén ěxīn.
examples.english: 'On the one hand he declared that he was upholding the unification of the motherland, but on the other hand he was secretly meeting with the separatists; this way of doing things where you are deceiving yourself and others is disgusting.'

examples.simplified: 我们必须勇敢地面对目前的困境，不能掩耳盗铃。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmēn bìxe yinggfn de miànduì mùqián de kùnjìng, bù néng yǎn'ěr-dàolíng.
examples.english: 'We must bravely face our current difficulties; we should not try to deceive ourselves or others.'

translations.english: 日 means 'day' and 复 means 'again.' The literal meaning is 'a day and again one day,' with a freer translation being 'day after day, day in day out.'

examples.simplified: 生活就这样日复一日、年复一年地过下去，没有任何改变。
examples.pinyin: Shēnghuó jiù zhèyàng rìfùyírì, nián fù yì nián de guòxiàqù, méiyiu rènhé gǎibiàn.
examples.english: 'Life passed in this way day after day, year after year, without any change at all.'

examples.simplified: 他住在费城，但是在纽约工作，因此日复一日地坐火车往返。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhù zài Fèichéng, dànshì zài Niǔyuē gōngzuò, yīncǐ rìfùyírì de zuò huǒchē wǎngfǎn.
examples.english: 'He lives in Philadelphia but works in New York; therefore, day after day he takes the train back and forth.'

translations.english: 奄奄 means 'feeble breathing' and 息 means 'breath.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'breathe feebly, one's last gasp before dying.'

examples.simplified: 那位病人病得很重，尽管用了最好的药，但是还是救不过来，已经奄奄一息了。
examples.pinyin: Nà wèi bìngrén bìngde hgn zhòng, jhngufn yòngle zuì hfo de yào, dànshì háishì jiù bú guòlái, yhjcng yfnyfn-yìxc le.
examples.english: 'That patient is seriously ill; even though they used the best medicine, they're unable to save him; he is already on his last breath.'

examples.simplified: 由于经济受到国际资本的控制，这个国家的民族工业奄奄一息了。
examples.pinyin: Yóuyú jcngjì shòudào guójì zcbgn de kòngzhì, zhège guójia de mínzú gdngyè yǎnyǎn-yìxī le.
examples.english: 'Due to its economy being controlled by international capital, this country's national industry is on its last legs.'

translations.english: 载 here means 'year' and 逢 means 'meet, encounter.' A literal translation of the entire idiom is 'in a thousand years hard to encounter.' This describes a rare opportunity. Freer translations include 'once in a thousand years, the chance of a lifetime.'

examples.simplified: 这是一个千载难逢的机会，一定要抓住。
examples.pinyin: Zhè shì yí ge qianzfi-nánféng de jchuì, yídìng yào zhuazhù.
examples.english: 'This is the opportunity of a lifetime; you definitely need to seize it.'

examples.simplified: 深圳抓住了千载难逢的历史机遇，于是从一个村子一跃成为国际化大都市。
examples.pinyin: Shēnzhèn zhuazhù le qianzfi-nánféng de lìshh jcyù, yúshì cóng yí ge cenzi yíyuè chéngwéi guójìhuà dàdeshì.
examples.english: 'Shenzhen seized an extremely rare historical opportunity, subsequently changing from a village to an international metropolis.'

translations.english: 未 means 'not yet,' NJ here means 'rain,' and is said to once have meant 'silk umbrella.' The idea is 'prepare one's umbrella in advance even before it rains.' Nowadays, this idiom usually means 'worry about something that hasn't happened yet, take preventive measures.'

examples.simplified: 她做任何事情都未雨绸缪，因此没有出现过重大的损失。
examples.pinyin: Tā zuò rènhé shìqing ddu wèiyj-chóumóu, ycnch méiyiu chexiànguo zhòngdà de sjnshc.
examples.english: 'Whatever she does, she takes preventive measures; therefore, large losses have never occurred.'

examples.simplified: 领导者得具备未雨绸缪的意识，这样才能防患于未然。
examples.pinyin: Lǐngdǎozhě děi jùbèi wèiyj-chóumóu de yìshi, zhèyàng cái néng fáng huàn yú wèi rán.
examples.english: 'Leaders must possess an awareness of preventive measures; only in this way can they guard against undesirable things happening in the future.'

translations.english: The literal meaning is 'reside in a high place and look downward,' with a freer translation being 'a commanding position or view.'

examples.simplified: 他的别墅在城市里的小山顶上，居高临下，可以看见全城。
examples.pinyin: Tā de biéshù zài chéngshì lǐ de xifo shandhng shàng, jegao-línxià, kgyh kànjiàn quánchéng.
examples.english: 'His villa is at the top of a little hill in the city; it's located way up there and looks down, so that you can see the whole city.

examples.simplified: 有的领导总是板着脸，说话带着居高临下的语气。
examples.pinyin: Yǒude lǐngdǎo zǒngshì bǎnzhe liǎn, shuōhuà dàizhe jūgao-línxià de yǔqì.
examples.english: 'Some leaders always keep a straight face, speaking with a tone of voice as though they were in a high position looking down.'

translations.english: 安 means 'peaceful,'理 means 'reason,' and 得 means 'obtain.' A literal translation is 'mind is peaceful and reason has been obtained,' with a freer translation being 'have peace of mind, have a clear conscience.'

examples.simplified: 这个人真是无耻，居然心安理得地接受别人的贿赂。
examples.pinyin: Zhège rén zhēn shì wúchh, jerán xcn'an-lhdé de jibshòu biérén de huìlù.
examples.english: 'This person is truly shameless, actually accepting bribes from others with a clear conscience.'

examples.simplified: 我这个年纪的人做事不求别的了，只求心安理得。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhège niánjì de rén zuòshì bù qiú biéde le, zhh qiú xcn'an-lhdé.
examples.english: 'Someone of my age in doing things does not seek anything else; I only seek peace of mind.'

translations.english: 孤 means 'alone, isolated.' A literal translation is 'with full intention to walk in isolation.' Freer translations are 'cling obstinately to a reckless course' and 'hellbent on having one's own way.'

examples.simplified: 她说如果美国一意孤行 ( 对中国出口进行制裁 ( 中国也会相应地进行报复。
examples.pinyin: Tā shuō rúguǒ Měiguó yíyì-gūxíng, duì Zhōngguó chūkǒu jìnxíng zhìcái, Zhōngguó yě huì xiāngyìng de jìnxíng bàofù.
examples.english: 'She said that if the U.S. obstinately clings to its own reckless course and imposes sanctions on Chinese imports, China will retaliate accordingly.'

examples.simplified: 董事长不顾董事会其他成员的反对 ( 一意孤行 ( 结果给公司带来了巨大的经济损失。
examples.pinyin: Dǒngshìzhǎng bú gù dǒngshìhuì qítā chéngyuán de fǎnduì, yíyì-gūxíng, jiéguǒ gěi gōngsī dàiláile jùdà de jīngjì sǔnshī.
examples.english: 'The chairman of the board paid no heed to the objections of the other board members, being hell-bent on having his own way, and as a result he brought the company huge economic losses.'

translations.english: 令 means 'order' and 申 means 'explain.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'three orders five explanations,' with freer translations being 'repeated orders and commands' or 'issue orders repeatedly.'

examples.simplified: 虽然中央三令五申 ( 地方政府还是瞒报伤亡事故。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán zhōngyāng sānlìng-wǔshēn, dìfāng zhèngfǔ háishì mánbào shāngwáng shìgù.
examples.english: 'Though the central authorities issued repeated orders, the local government nonetheless withheld facts in reporting about the accident that resulted in injuries and deaths.'

examples.simplified: 教育部三令五申要保证中小学教师的工资发放 ( 可是还是有部门挪用教师工资。
examples.pinyin: Jiàoyùbù sānlìng-wǔshēn yào bǎozhèng zhōngxiǎoxué jiàoshī de gōngzī fēfàng, kěshì háishì yǒu bùmén nuóyòng jiàoshī gōngzī.
examples.english: 'The Ministry of Education issued orders repeatedly to guarantee the issuing of wages to secondary and elementary school teachers, but there were nevertheless departments that diverted the teachers' wages.'

translations.english: 依依 means 'reluctant to part with' and 舍 means 'abandon, part.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'feel a sense of regret when leaving, cannot bear to leave, reluctant to part from.'

examples.simplified: 留学生们依依不舍地离开北京 ( 盼望着尽快回来。
examples.pinyin: Liúxuéshengmen yīyī-bùshě de líkāi Běijīng, pànwàngzhe jìnkuài huílái.
examples.english: 'The foreign students left Beijing with a great sense of regret, hoping to return as soon as possible.'

examples.simplified: 大熊猫被送回山里 ( 她用依依不舍的眼神看着饲养了她三年的饲养员 ( 那场面真令人感动。
examples.pinyin: Dàxióngmāo bèi sònghuí shān lǐ, tā yòng yīyī-bùshě de yǎnshén kànzhe sìyǎngle tā sān nián de sìyǎngyuán, nà chǎngmiàn zhēn lìng rén gǎndòng.
examples.english: 'When the panda was sent back into the mountains, she looked at the keeper who had fed her for three years with a look in her eyes indicating her reluctance to part; that scene was really touching.'

translations.english: 乐 means 'happy,' 思 means 'think about, miss,' and 蜀 means 'the Kingdom of Shu Han (221-263 C.E.).' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'so happy that one doesn't miss one's home country of Shu Han,' with freer translations being 'indulge in pleasure and forget home and duty, too merry to be homesick.'

examples.simplified: 他从费城到巴黎出差 ( 办完公事以后仍然在那里待了一天又一天 ( 简直乐不思蜀了。
examples.pinyin: Tā cóng Fèichéng dào Bālí chūchāi, bànwán gōngshì yǐhòu réngrán zài nàlǐ dāile yì tiān yòu yì tiān, jiǎnzhí lèbùsīshǔ le.
examples.english: 'He went from Philadelphia to Paris on a business trip; after finishing his business, he still stayed there day after day; he was simply so happy that he almost forgot he should return.'

examples.simplified: 她们在那里玩儿了一个月了 ( 可是还不想回家 ( 一副乐不思蜀的样子。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen zài nàlǐ wánrle yí ge yuè le, kěshì hái bù xiǎng huíjiā, yí fù lèbùsīshǔ de yàngzi.
examples.english: 'They've been amusing themselves there for one month now, but still don't want to return home; it appears they're having so much fun that they have forgotten their home.'

translations.english: 叹 means 'sigh with emotion,' 观 means 'look,' and 止 means 'stop.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'sigh with emotion because once you have seen a certain place you don't need to see anything else.' Freer translations include 'in awe, sigh in wonder, acclaim something as perfect.'

examples.simplified: 故宫建筑群规模宏大 ( 令人叹为观止。
examples.pinyin: Gùgōng jiànzhùqún guīmó hóngdà, lìng rén tànwéiguānzhǐ.
examples.english: 'The cluster of buildings that is the Forbidden City is on an enormous scale; it makes people sigh in awe.'

examples.simplified: 阿根廷球员马拉多纳的脚法令观众叹为观止。
examples.pinyin: Āgēntíng qiúyuén Mǎlāduōnà de jiǎofǎ lìng guānzhòng tànwéiguānzhǐ.
examples.english: 'The footwork of the Argentinean soccer player Maradona makes the audience sigh in wonder.'

translations.english: 大 here means 'many.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'there are many people like this.'

examples.simplified: 虽然支持她的人很多 ( 但是反对的也大有人在。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán zhīchí tā de rén hěn duō, dànshì fǎnduì de yě dàyǒurénzài.
examples.english: 'Though there were many people who supported her, there were also lots of people who opposed her.'

examples.simplified: 你对我的评价太高了 ( 其实比我水平高的大有人在。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ duì wǒ de píngjià tài gāole, qíshí bǐ wǒ shuǐpíng gāo de dàyǒurénzài.
examples.english: 'Your appraisal of me is too high; actually there are plenty of people with a higher level than me.'

translations.english: 炭 means 'charcoal.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'in the midst of snowy weather send charcoal.' This is a metaphor for 'provide timely and critical assistance' or 'offer opportune help.'

examples.simplified: 世界各地的人们给受灾者送去了大批的帐篷和棉被 ( 真是雪中送炭啊！
examples.pinyin: Shìjiè gè dì de rénmen gěi shòuzāizhě sòngqùle dà pī de zhàngpéng hé miánbèi, zhēn shì xuězhōng-sòngtàn a!
examples.english: 'People from all over the world sent the natural disaster victims large quantities of tents and quilts, which really did provide timely and crucial assistance!'

examples.simplified: 整个股市处在危机之中 ( 政府雪中送炭 ( 大幅降低了银行存款利率。
examples.pinyin: Zhěnggè gǔshì chǔzài wēijī zhīzhōng, zhèngfǔ xuězhōng-sòngtàn, dàfú jiàngdīle yínháng cúnkuǎn lìlǜ.
examples.english: 'The entire stock market is in the midst of a crisis; the government has provided opportune assistance by greatly lowering banks' interest rates for savings.'

translations.english: 筹 means 'plan,' 莫 means 'not,' and 展 here means 'implement.' A literal translation is 'even one plan not implement,' with freer translations being 'can't think of any way to solve a problem, at one's wit's end.'

examples.simplified: 由于这起案件中唯一的证人不幸去世了 ( 警察因此一筹莫展。
examples.pinyin: Yóuyú zhè qǐ ànjiàn zhōng wéiyī de zhèngrén búxìng qùshì le, jǐngchá yīncǐ yìchóumòzhǎn.
examples.english: 'Because the only witness in this case unfortunately has died, the police therefore are at their wit's end.'

examples.simplified: 就在大家一筹莫展的时候 ( 突然传来一个好消息。
examples.pinyin: Jiù zài dàjiā yìchóu-mòzhǎn de shíhou, tūrán chuánlái yí ge hǎo xiāoxi.
examples.english: 'Just when everybody was at their wit's end, suddenly a piece of good news was sent in.'

translations.english: 泄 means 'let out (water)' and 通 means 'come through.' The meaning is 'not even a drop of water could come through' - so crowded is a place, so heavy is traffic, or so tightly surrounded is some person or place.

examples.simplified: 示威的人群把总统府围得水泄不通。
examples.pinyin: Shìwēi de rénqún bǎ zǒngtǒngfǔ wéide shuǐxiè-bùtōng.
examples.english: 'The crowds of people who were demonstrating surrounded the Presidential Palace very tightly.'

examples.simplified: 购物中心新开业 ( 商品打五折 ( 成千上万顾客涌了过来 ( 购物中心挤得水泄不通。
examples.pinyin: Gòuwù zhōngxīn xīn kāiyè, shāngpǐn dǎ wǔzhé, chéngqiān-shàngwàn gùkè yǒngle guòlai, gòuwù zhōngxīn jǐde shuǐxiè-bùtong.
examples.english: 'When the shopping mall started doing business, merchandise was on sale at fifty percent off; tens of thousands of customers poured in, the shopping mall being so crowded that not even a drop of water could have gotten through.'

translations.english: 相 means 'one another,' 依 means 'depend on,' 为 means 'be,' and 命 means 'life.' A literal translation is 'several people depend on one another for their lives,' with a freer translation being 'depend on each other for survival, bound by a common destiny.'

examples.simplified: 因为父亲死得早 (孩子跟母亲相依为命。
examples.pinyin: Yīnwèi fùqīn sǐde zǎo, háizi gēn mǔqin xiāngyī-wéimìng.
examples.english: 'Because the father died early, the children and their mother depended on one another for survival.'

examples.simplified: 由于生活穷困 (全家五口人挤在一间屋子里相依为命。
examples.pinyin: Yóuyú shēnghuó qióngkùn, quán jiā wǔ kǒu rén jǐ zài yì jiān wūzi lǐ xiāngyīwéimìng.
examples.english: 'Because their lives were destitute, all of the five people in the family crammed into one room, depending on each other for survival.'

translations.english: 街头 means 'street corner' and 巷尾 means 'the end of a lane.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'streets and lanes.'

examples.simplified: 在巴西街头巷尾踢球的少年中出现了许多后来的足球巨星。
examples.pinyin: Zài Bāxī jiētóu-xiàngwěi tīqiú de shàonián zhōng chūxiànle xǔduō hòulái de zúqiú jùxīng.
examples.english: 'Among the youth who kick balls in the streets and lanes of Brazil, there have emerged many a future megastar of soccer.'

examples.simplified: 夏天来了 ( 街头巷尾出现了很多水果摊儿。
examples.pinyin: Xiàtiān láile, jiētóu-xiàngwěi chūxiànle hěn duō shuǐguǒtānr.
examples.english: 'Summer has come and, in the streets and lanes, there have appeared many fruit vendor stands.'

translations.english: 微 means 'small' and 至 means 'arrive.' A literal translation is 'there is no small (area where attention or care) did not arrive.' This idiom can be translated as 'meticulous, leaving nothing undone.'

examples.simplified: 在父母无微不至的照顾下 ( 孩子健康地成长。
examples.pinyin: Zài fùmǔ wúwēi-búzhì de zhàogù xià, háizi jiànkāng de chéngzhǎng.
examples.english: 'Under the meticulous care of its parents, the child grew up in good health.'

examples.simplified: 医生无微不至地关怀所有的病人。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng wúwēi-búzhì de guānhuái suǒyǒu de bìngrén.
examples.english: 'Doctors show concern for all their patients, leaving not the slightest thing undone.'

translations.english: 假 means 'make use of' and 思索 means 'think, ponder.' The whole idiom means 'without stopping to think, without hesitation.'

examples.simplified: 她不假思索地回答： "您放心吧 ( 没问题。"
examples.pinyin: Tā bùjiǎ-sīsuǒ de huídá: 'Nín fàngxīn ba, méiwèntí.'
examples.english: 'She answered without hesitating: "Relax, there's no problem."'

examples.simplified: 听了对方的话以后 ( 他不假思索地说： "不行！"
examples.pinyin: Tīngle duìfāng de huà yǐhòu, tā bùjiǎ-sīsuǒ de shuō: 'Bùxíng.'
examples.english: 'After he had heard the remarks from the other side, he said without hesitation: "No!"'

translations.english: 江 is a Chinese surname,郎 means 'man,' 才 means 'talent,' and 尽 means 'exhausted, used up.' A literal translation is 'the talents of the man by the name of Jiang were exhausted,' with a freer translation being 'one's talents have been used up' or 'one's creative energies have become exhausted.'

examples.simplified: 牛顿晚年在科学上没有什么突出的贡献 ( 这不是因为他江郎才尽了 ( 而是走错了方向。
examples.pinyin: Niúdùn wǎnnián zài kēxué shàng méiyǒu shénme tūchū de gòngxiàn, zhè bú shì yīnwèi tā Jiāngláng-cáijìn le, ér shì zǒucuòle fāngxiàng.
examples.english: 'In his later years, Newton had no prominent contributions; this was not because his creative energies were exhausted, but because he proceeded in the wrong direction.'

examples.simplified: 他年轻的时候曾经凭借一个人的力量挽救过一个公司 ( 但是晚年也有江郎才尽的时候。
examples.pinyin: Tā niánqīng de shíhou céngjīng píngjiè yí ge rén de lìliàng wǎnjiùguo yí ge gōngsī, dànshì wǎnnián yě yǒu Jiāngláng-cáijìn de shíhou.
examples.english: 'When he was young, he once - relying on his own strength - rescued a company; but in his later years, there were also times when his creative energies were exhausted.'

translations.english: 相 means 'mutually' and 上下 means 'high and low, superior and inferior.' The whole idiom means 'equally matched, without much difference, about the same.'

examples.simplified: 两个人的乒乓球水平不相上下 ( 都很难赢对方。
examples.pinyin: Liǎng ge rén de pīngpāngqiú shuǐpíng bùxiāng-shàngxià, dōu hěn nán yíng duìfāng.
examples.english: 'Their level in ping pong is approximately the same, so it will be hard for either to win over the other.'

examples.simplified: 这两件商品的质量不相上下 ( 但是价格差得就多了。
examples.pinyin: Zhè liǎng jiàn shāngpǐn de zhìliàng bùxiāng-shàngxià, dànshì jiàgé chà de jiù duō le.
examples.english: 'The quality of these two items of merchandise is without much difference, but the price is very different.'

translations.english: 居 means 'live in,' 安 means 'peace,' 思 means 'think about,' and 危 means 'danger.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'live in peace (but) think about danger.' A freer translation of the whole idiom is 'vigilant even in peacetime.'

examples.simplified: 现在我们的形势一片大好 ( 但是我们不能盲目乐观 ( 要小心谨慎 ( 居安思危。
examples.pinyin: Xiànzài wǒmen de xíngshì yípiàn dàhǎo, dànshì wǒmen bùnéng mángmù lèguān, yào xiǎoxīn jǐnshèn, jū'ān-sīwēi.
examples.english: 'Right now our situation is that everything is excellent, but we cannot be blindly optimistic; we must be very cautious and prudent, and prepare for danger even in peacetime.'

examples.simplified: 上司告诫下属要加强居安思危的忧患意识。
examples.pinyin: Shàngsī gàojiè xiàshǔ yào jiāqiáng jū'ān-sīwēi de yōuhuàn yìshi.
examples.english: 'The superiors admonished the subordinates to strengthen their awareness of danger even at a time of security.'

translations.english: A 咫 was a unit of measurement in ancient China consisting of eight 寸 or 'Chinese inches.' A 尺 or 'Chinese foot' was another ancient measurement. Together, 咫尺 means 'short distance.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'extremely close, close at hand.'

examples.simplified: 这家旅馆就在大使馆的对面 ( 近在咫尺 ( 所以住宿的人总是满着。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā lǚguǎn jiù zài dàshǐguǎn de duìmiàn, jìnzài-zhǐchǐ, suǒyǐ zhùsù de rén zǒngshì mǎnzhe.
examples.english: 'This hotel is right across from the embassy, very close at hand, so it's always fully occupied by guests.'

examples.simplified: 他们两个人近在咫尺 ( 可是情感上却远在天涯。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen liǎng ge rén jìnzài-zhǐchǐ, kěshì qínggǎn shàng què yuǎnzài-tiānyá.
examples.english: 'The two of them are very close to each other in physical distance, but emotionally they're as distant from each other as the ends of the earth.'

translations.english: 卷土 means 'sweep up dust.' This describes people and horses who are running. 重来 means 'come again.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'stage a comeback.'

examples.simplified: 上次世界杯巴西失利了 ( 这次他们卷土重来 ( 非要夺取冠军不可。
examples.pinyin: Shàngcì Shìjièbēi Bāxī shīlìle, zhè cì tāmen juǎntǔ-chónglái, fēi yào duóqǔ guànjūn bùkě.
examples.english: 'In the last World Cup, Brazil suffered a setback; this time they are staging a comeback and are dead set on winning the championship.'

examples.simplified: 对于贪污腐败现象一定要持续不断地打击 ( 因为稍微一放松 ( 它们就会 卷土重来。
examples.pinyin: Duìyú tānwū fǔbài xiànxiàng yídìng yào chíxù búduàn de dǎjī, yīnwèi shāowēi yí fèngsōng, tēmen jiù huì juǎntǔ-chónglái.
examples.english: 'We definitely should persist in cracking down on graft and corruption without interruption, because the minute you relax just a little, they will stage a comeback.'

translations.english: 冰天 means 'icy sky' and 雪地 means 'snow-covered ground.' The whole idiom means 'all covered with ice and snow, bitterly cold.'

examples.simplified: 中国的东北跟美国的五大湖区差不多 ( 冬天的时候总是冰天雪地。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó de Dōngběi gēn Měiguó de Wǔdàhú qū chàbùduō, dōngtiān de shíhou zǒngshì bīngtiān-xuědì.
examples.english: 'The Northeast of China is much like the Great Lakes region of the U.S., being all covered with ice and snow in the winter.'

examples.simplified: 旅行者迷了路 ( 但是靠不多的一点汽油和食物 ( 在冰天雪地的山林里坚持了五天 ( 最后被人救了。
examples.pinyin: Lǚxíngzhě míle lù, dànshì kào bù duō de yìdiǎn qìyóu hé shíwù, zài bīngtiān-xuě de shānlín lǐ jiānchíle wǔ tiān, zuìhòu bèi rén jiù le.
examples.english: 'The travelers lost their way, but relying on their small supply of gasoline and provisions, they held on for five days in the mountainous forests that were all covered with ice and snow, until finally they were rescued.'

translations.english: 的 here means 'target, goal,' 放 means 'release,' and 矢 means 'arrow.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'have a target and release arrows,' with freer translations being 'have an object in mind, goal-oriented.'

examples.simplified: 做任何事都要提前调查 ( 这样才能有的放矢 ( 取得最好的效果。
examples.pinyin: Zuò rènhé shì dōu yào tíqián diàochá, zhèyàng cáinéng yǒudì-fàngshǐ, qǔdé zuì hǎo de xiàoguǒ.
examples.english: 'In doing anything you should investigate beforehand; only in this way can you be goal-oriented and obtain the best results.'

examples.simplified: 对于罪犯 ( 要充分了解他们成长的历史 ( 然后有的放矢地进行教育。
examples.pinyin: Duìyú zuìfàn, yào chōngfèn liǎojiě tāmen chéngzhǎng de lìshǐ, ránhòu yǒudì-fàngshǐ de jìnxíng jiàoyù.
examples.english: 'Regarding offenders, one must sufficiently understand the history of how they grew up, and after that, in a goal-oriented manner, carry out education.'

translations.english: 尘 means 'dust' and 染 means 'dye, contaminate.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'not contaminated by even a single particle of dust,' with a freer translation being 'spotless, clean, pure' (of the environment or of a person). This idiom derives from Buddhism, in which sight, sound, smell, taste, touch, and thought were called the 'six dusts,' by which a Buddhist was not supposed to be contaminated.

examples.simplified: 她在名利场里几十年却一尘不染 ( 太难做到了。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài mínglìchǎng lǐ jǐ shí nián què yìchén-bùrǎn, tài nán zuòdàole.
examples.english: 'She spent decades in the circles of those seeking fame and fortune and yet remained pure; that is very hard to do.'

examples.simplified: 这是一家五星级的酒店 ( 不但有一尘不染的环境 ( 还有超一流的服务。
examples.pinyin: Zhè shì yì jiā wǔxīngjí de jiǔdiàn, búdàn yǒu yìchén-bùrǎn de huánjìng, hái yǒu chāo yīliú de fúwù.
examples.english: 'This is a five-star hotel; it not only has a spotless environment, it also has more than first-class service.'

translations.english: 功 here means 'efficacy, effect' and 倍 means 'double.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'work half effect double,' with a freer translation being 'twice the results with half the effort.'

examples.simplified: 读书要动脑筋 ( 才能收到事半功倍的效果。
examples.pinyin: Dúshū yào dòng nǎojīn, cáinéng shōudào shìbàn-gōngbèi de xiàoguǒ.
examples.english: 'In studying you have to use your head, only then can you achieve twice the results with half the effort.'

examples.simplified: 高科技能起到事半功倍的作用。
examples.pinyin: Gāokējì néng qǐdào shìbàn-gōngbèi de zuòyòng.
examples.english: 'High-tech can bring about the effect of twice the results with half the effort.'

translations.english: 不同 means 'different from,' 凡 means 'ordinary,' and 凡响 means 'common music.' The whole idiom means 'out of the ordinary, head and shoulders above the rest, outstanding.'

examples.simplified: 哈佛大学的教授水平就是高 ( 观点很独特 ( 不同凡响。
examples.pinyin: Hāfó Dàxué de jiàoshòu shuǐpíng jiùshì gāo, guāndiǎn hěn dútè, bùtóng-fánxiǎng.
examples.english: 'The level of the professors at Harvard University is just high and their points of view are unique; they stand head and shoulders above everyone else.'

examples.simplified: 他是一个不同凡响的人物 ( 以后一定还会有大发展。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yí ge bùtóng-fánxiǎng de rénwù, yǐhòu yīdìng hái huì yǒu dà fāzhǎn.
examples.english: 'He is an uncommon man; in the future he is bound to experience rapid development.'

translations.english: 井 means 'well' and 蛙 means 'frog.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'a frog at the bottom of a well.' This is a metaphor for 'a narrow-minded or shortsighted or inexperienced person.'

examples.simplified: 在没有收音机、 电话、 电视和互联网的时代 ( 偏远农村的人就像井底之蛙 ( 对外面几乎一点都不了解。
examples.pinyin: Zài méiyǒu shōuyīnjī, diànhuà, diànshì hé hùliánwǎng de shídài, piānyuǎn nóngcūn de rén jiù xiàng jǐngdǐ-zhīwā, duì wàimiàn jīhū yìdiǎn dōu bù liǎojiě.
examples.english: 'During the period when there were no radios, telephones, televisions or Internet, people in the remote countryside were like frogs in the bottom of a well, understanding almost nothing about the outside.'

examples.simplified: 她第一次到法国 ( 走在香榭丽舍大街上 ( 感觉自己像一只井底之蛙。
examples.pinyin: Tā dìyī cì dào Fǎguó, zǒu zài Xiāng Xièlìshè dàjiē shàng, gǎnjué zìjǐ xiàng yì zhī jǐngdǐ-zhīwā.
examples.english: 'When she went to France for the first time, she walked along the Champs Élysées, feeling naive and inexperienced like a frog in the bottom of a well.'

translations.english: 同 means 'same' and 异 means 'different.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'mostly the same with only minor differences.'

examples.simplified: 这两本书看起来很不一样 ( 其实内容大同小异。
examples.pinyin: Zhè liǎng běn shū kànqǐlai hěn bù yíyàng, qíshí nèiróng dàtóng-xiǎoyì.
examples.english: 'These two books look quite different, but actually their content is much the same.'

examples.simplified: 近些年 ( 欧美国家遇到的问题大同小异 ( 都差不多。
examples.pinyin: Jìn xiē nián, ōuměi guójiā yùdào de wèntí dàtóng-xiǎoyì, dōu chàbùduō.
examples.english: 'In recent years, the problems that Europe and the U.S. have encountered are much the same; they're not much different.'

translations.english: 风生 means 'interest, enthusiasm.' The literal meaning of the whole idiom is 'talk and laugh with interest and enthusiasm.' A freer translation is 'chat merrily, engage in witty conversation.'

examples.simplified: 会谈的气氛非常轻松 ( 大家谈笑风生。
examples.pinyin: Huìtán de qìfēn fēicháng qīngsōng, dàjiā tánxiào-fēngshēng.
examples.english: 'The atmosphere at the negotiations was very relaxed, everyone chatting merrily.'

examples.simplified: 两个人谈笑风生 ( 一起走进教室。
examples.pinyin: Liǎng ge rén tánxiào-fēngshēng, yìqǐ zǒujìn jiàoshì.
examples.english: 'The two of them were engaged in witty conversation as together they walked into the classroom.'

translations.english: 亦 means 'also,' 乐 means 'happy,' and 乎 is the Classical Chinese equivalent of the Modern Chinese question particle 吗.The literal meaning of the whole idiom is 'Is it not also a happy thing?' A freer translation is 'what a pleasure' or 'what a delight.' However, in modern usage, this idiom is most commonly used to express a high degree and may be translated as 'very, extremely.'

examples.simplified: 圣诞节到了 ( 孩子们都来了 ( 这对老夫妇忙得不亦乐乎。
examples.pinyin: Shèngdànjié dào le, háizimen dōu lái le, zhè duì lǎo fūfù máng de búyìlèhū.
examples.english: 'When Christmas arrived, the children all came, and the old couple was extremely busy.'

examples.simplified: 两个人都很会说话 ( 这次一吵架 ( 吵得不亦乐乎。
examples.pinyin: Liǎng ge rén dōu hěn huì shuōhuà, zhè cì yì chěojià, chǎo de búyìlèhū.
examples.english: 'Both of them are very articulate, so this time when they quarreled, they had quite the argument.'

translations.english: 承 means 'continue, carry on' and 启 means 'open up, begin.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'continue what has come before and open up what is to come after,' with freer translations being 'succeed the past and develop the future' or 'carry on the great traditions of something.'

examples.simplified: 莫奈在美术史上是一位承前启后式的画家。
examples.pinyin: Mònài zài měishùshǐ shàng shì yí wèi chéngqián-qǐhòu shì de huàjiā.
examples.english: 'In art history, Monet was the type of artist who built on the great traditions of the past to develop those of the future.'

examples.simplified: 这是一次承前启后、 继往开来的大会。
examples.pinyin: Zhè shì yí cì chéngqián-qǐhòu, jìwǎng-kāilái de dàhuì.
examples.english: 'This is a conference that continues past traditions while opening up new ones, that carries on the glorious heritage of the past while developing new directions for the future.'

translations.english: 同 means 'together,' 甘 means 'sweet,' 共 means 'collectively,' and 苦 means 'bitter.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'together sweet collectively bitter,' with freer translations being 'share joys and sorrows' or 'share comforts and hardships.'

examples.simplified: 不少中国夫妻在艰难的时候能同甘共苦 ( 但是成功后有不少问题。
examples.pinyin: Bùshǎo Zhōngguó fūqī zài jiānnán de shíhou néng tónggān-gòngkǔ, dànshì chénggōng hòu yǒu bùshǎo wèntí.
examples.english: 'Many Chinese couples during difficult times can share their joys and sorrows, but after they succeed, they have many problems.'

examples.simplified: 群众特别拥护那些能与他们同甘共苦的官员。
examples.pinyin: Qúnzhòng tèbié yōnghù nà xiē néng yǔ tāmen tónggān-gòngkǔ de guānyuán.
examples.english: 'The masses particularly support those officials who can share their joys and their sorrows.'

translations.english: 明目 means 'open the eyes' and 张胆 means 'gather up one's courage.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'open, flagrant, brazen.' This refers to doing bad things openly and brazenly.

examples.simplified: 这座城市的治安太差了 ( 小偷竟然明目张胆地在大街上偷东西。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zuò chéngshì de zhì'ān tài chà le, xiǎotōu jìngrán míngmù-zhāngdǎn de zài dàjiē shàng tōu dōngxi.
examples.english: 'Law and order in this city are very much lacking, thieves actually stealing things brazenly on the open street.'

examples.simplified: 那个大国根本不顾联合国公约 ( 明目张胆地侵略别的小国。
examples.pinyin: Nàge dà guó gēnběn bú gù Liánhéguó gōngyuē, míngmù-zhāngdǎn de qīnlüè biéde xiǎo guó.
examples.english: 'That great power doesn't give any consideration at all to United Nations covenants, brazenly invading other smaller countries.'

translations.english: 耳 means 'ears,' 闻 means 'hear,' 目 means 'eyes,' and 睹 means 'see.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'ears hear and eyes see.' This refers to hearing something with one's own ears and seeing something with one's own eyes. A freer translation would be 'what one hears and sees, observe in person.'

examples.simplified: 这些年 ( 他耳闻目睹了一些让人气愤的事。
examples.pinyin: Zhè xiē nián, tā ěrwén-mùdǔ le yìxiē ràng rén qìfèn de shì.
examples.english: 'These last few years, he has personally observed some things that would make people furious.'

examples.simplified: 耳闻目睹这一切后 ( 他感动了 ( 发誓做一个好人。
examples.pinyin: Ěrwén-mùdǔ zhè yíqiè hòu, tā gǎndòng le, fāshì zuò yí ge hǎorén.
examples.english: 'After he had personally observed all this, he was moved, and swore to be a good person.'

translations.english: 啼 means 'cry,' 皆 means 'both,' and 非 means 'is not.' The literal meaning is 'cry laugh both is not.' A freer translation of this idiom is 'not know whether it is better to laugh or cry, in an awkward situation.'

examples.simplified: 他很严肃地讲了一个老掉牙的笑话 ( 让人啼笑皆非。
examples.pinyin: Tā hěn yánsù de jiǎngle yí ge lǎo diàoyá de xiàohua, ràng rén tíxiào-jiēfēi.
examples.english: 'He very seriously told an old joke, making people not know whether they should laugh or cry.'

examples.simplified: 他提出了一种让人啼笑皆非的理论。
examples.pinyin: Tā tíchūle yì zhǒng ràng rén tíxiào-jiēfēi de lǐlùn.
examples.english: 'He proposed a theory that put people in an awkward position.'

translations.english: 死灰 means 'dead ashes,' 复 means 'again,' and 燃 means 'burn.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'dead ashes burn again,' with freer translations being 'come back to life' and 'resurgence.'

examples.simplified: 冬天的时候 ( 一些在夏天高温条件下已经"死亡"的病毒常常会死灰复燃。
examples.pinyin: Dōngtiān de shíhou, yìxiē zài xiàtiān gāowēn tiáojiàn xià yǐjīng sǐwáng de bìngdú chángcháng huì sǐhuī-fùrán.
examples.english: 'In winter time, some viruses that already "died" under the conditions of high temperatures in the summer will often return to life.'

examples.simplified: 毒品交易在这座城市有死灰复燃的迹象。
examples.pinyin: Dúpǐn jiāoyì zài zhè zuò chéngshì yǒu sǐhuī-fùrán de jìxiàng.
examples.english: 'Narcotics trafficking in this city has indications of a resurgence.'

translations.english: 塞 means 'frontier,' 翁 means 'old man,' and 失 means 'lose.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'an old man living at the frontier of his country lost his horse,' with freer translations being 'a loss may turn out to be a gain, a blessing in disguise.'

examples.simplified: 我虽然在赌场里输了不少钱 ( 但是塞翁失马 ( 焉知非福 ( 或许我买的股票 明天就大涨了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ suīrán zài dǔchǎng lǐ shūle bùshǎo qián, dànshì sàiwēng-shīmǎ, yānzhī-fēifú, huòxǔ wǒ mǎi de gǔpiào míngtiān jiù dà zhǎng le.
examples.english: 'Although I lost much money at the casino, who knows if it's not a blessing in disguise; maybe the stocks I bought will rise greatly tomorrow.'

examples.simplified: 她失去了那份稳定的工作后被迫做起了小贩 ( 谁知道竟然发了大财 ( 真是塞翁失马 ( 焉知非福！
examples.pinyin: Tā shīqùle nà fèn wěndìng de gōngzuò hòu bèipò zuòqǐle xiǎofàn, shuí zhīdao jìngrán fāle dàcái, zhēn shì sàiwēng-shīmǎ, yānzhī-fēifú!
examples.english: 'After she lost that stable job, she was forced to become a vendor; who would have thought that she would actually make a fortune? It really is true that misfortune can be a blessing in disguise!'

translations.english: 口 means 'mouth' and 声 means 'voice.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'say over and over again.'

examples.simplified: 上台以前 ( 他口口声声地说要大胆改革 ( 可是上台以后却没有什么行动。
examples.pinyin: Shàngtái yǐqián, tā kǒukǒu-shēngshēng de shuō yào dàdǎn gǎigé, kěshì shàngtái yǐhòu què méiyǒu shénme xíngdòng.
examples.english: 'Before assuming power, he said over and over again that he wanted to boldly undertake reforms, but after assuming power, he didn't take any action.'

examples.simplified: 她对我很客气 ( 虽然只跟我学过几天 ( 但是以后见面的时候口口声声地叫我老师。
examples.pinyin: Tā duì wǒ hěn kèqi, suīrán zhǐ gēn wǒ xuéguo jǐ tiān, dànshì yǐhòu jiànmiàn de shíhou kǒukǒu-shēngshēng de jiào wǒ lǎoshī.
examples.english: 'She is very polite toward me; though she had only studied with me for a few days, later when she saw me she would again and again call me "Teacher."'

translations.english: 落 means 'fall, recede.' The literal meaning is 'when the water recedes, the rocks (that are hidden under the water) will appear.' The extended meaning is 'come to light, get to the bottom of, the truth is revealed.'

examples.simplified: 我一定要把这个事情查个水落石出。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yídìng yào bǎ zhège shìqing chá ge shuǐluò-shíchū.
examples.english: 'I'm definitely going to get to the bottom of this matter.'

examples.simplified: 经过数百检察人员几个月的调查 ( 这起案件终于水落石出了。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò shù bǎi jiǎnchá rényuán jǐ ge yuè de diàochá, zhè qǐ ànjiàn zhōngyú shuǐluò-shíchū le.
examples.english: 'After several months of investigations by several hundred investigators, the truth about this case is finally coming to light.'

translations.english: 行 means 'walk' and 素 means 'always.' The idea is that however you always did things in the past, you will still do things that way now without changing them. A freer translation is 'stick to one's own way of doing things.'

examples.simplified: 在中央发布文件以后 ( 下边有些地方政府依然我行我素 ( 不把中央的文件 放在眼里。
examples.pinyin: Zài zhōngyāng fābù wénjiàn yǐhòu, xiàbiān yǒu xiē dìfāng zhèngfǔ yīrán wǒxíng-wǒsù, bù bǎ zhōngyāng de wénjiàn fàng zài yǎn lǐ.
examples.english: 'After the central authorities promulgated the document, at the lower levels in some places the government still stuck to its own way of doing things, not paying attention to the central authorities' document.'

examples.simplified: 她在学校里我行我素 ( 开始的时候大家不接受她 ( 后来都觉得她很酷。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài xuéxiào lǐ wǒxíng-wǒsù, kāishǐ de shíhou dàjiā bù jiēshòu tā, hòulái dōu juéde tā hěn kù.
examples.english: 'In school she did things her own way; at the beginning, everybody didn't accept her; later they all felt she was cool.'

translations.english: 望 means 'see,' 却 means 'stop,' and 步 means 'step.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'see something and stop one's steps,' with freer translations being 'shrink back at the sight of, flinch, frightened.'

examples.simplified: 那家高档饭店的菜价高得离谱 ( 使人望而却步。
examples.pinyin: Nà jiā gāodàng fàndiàn de càijià gāo de lípǔ, shǐ rén wàng'érquèbù.
examples.english: 'The price of meals at that upmarket restaurant is unreasonably high; it makes people flinch when they see it.'

examples.simplified: 虽然那块地皮非常好 ( 但是土地的拥有者开口就要两亿美元 ( 令原本许多感兴趣的人望而却步。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán nà kuài dìpí fēicháng hǎo, dànshì tǔdì de yōngyǒuzhě kāikǒu jiù yào liǎng yì Měiyuán, lìng yuánběn xǔduō gǎnxìngqù de rén wàng'érquèbù.
examples.english: 'Although that piece of land is well located, the land owner has asked a starting price of 200 million U.S. dollars; it makes many people who were originally interested flinch upon hearing it.'

translations.english: 血 means 'blood' and 肉 means 'flesh.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'have blood have flesh,' with a freer translation being 'vivid, lifelike.'

examples.simplified: 那本长篇小说成功地塑造了几十个有血有肉的人物形象。
examples.pinyin: Nà běn chángpiān xiǎoshuō chénggōng de sùzàole jǐ shí ge yǒuxuè-yǒuròu de rénwù xíngxiàng.
examples.english: 'That novel successfully depicts several dozen vivid and lifelike character images.'

examples.simplified: 文革时期人们把毛泽东神化了 ( 其实他也是一个有血有肉的人 ( 而不是神。
examples.pinyin: Wén'gé shíqī rénmen bǎ Máo Zédōng shénhuàle, qíshí tā yě shì yí ge yǒuxuè-yǒuròu de rén, ér bú shì shén.
examples.english: 'During the period of the Cultural Revolution, people deified Mao Zedong; actually, he also was a person of blood and flesh, not a god.'

translations.english: 涯 means 'edge' and 角 means 'corner.' The literal meaning of this idiom is 'heaven's edges and sea's corners,' with a freer translation being 'the ends of the earth, a very distant place, far away.'

examples.simplified: 无论你走到天涯海角 ( 你的亲人永远关心你。
examples.pinyin: Wúlǔn nǐ zǒu dào tiānyá-hǎijiǎo, nǐ de qīnrén yǒngyuǎn guānxīn nǐ.
examples.english: 'No matter if you go to the ends of the earth, your family will forever be concerned about you.'

examples.simplified: 同班同学毕业以后奔向天涯海角 ( 各自找到自己的落脚点。
examples.pinyin: Tóngbān tóngxué bìyè yǐhòu bēnxiàng tiānyá-hǎijiǎo, gèzì zhǎodào zìjǐ de luòjiǎodiǎn.
examples.english: 'After graduation the classmates rushed off to far away places, each finding his or her own foothold.'

translations.english: 轻 means 'lightly,' 描 means 'trace,' 淡 means 'light (as in color),' and 写 here means 'paint.' The literal meaning of this idiom is 'paint in light colors.' The extended meaning is 'treat a matter lightly and superficially, mention casually.'

examples.simplified: 别人很关心地问她 ( 她却轻描淡写地说 ( "没事儿 ( 一切都过去了。"
examples.pinyin: Biérén hěn guānxīn de wèn tā, tā què qīngmiáo-dànxiě de shuō, "Méi shìr, yíqiè dōu guòqùle."
examples.english: 'When others asked her with great concern, she just said casually, "It's nothing, it has all passed now."'

examples.simplified: 因为他平时的表现很好 ( 所以虽然这次犯了错误 ( 但是领导只是轻描淡写地批评了几句。
examples.pinyin: Yīnwèi tā píngshí de biǎoxiàn hěn hǎo, suǒyǐ suīrán zhè cì fànle cuòwù, dànshì lǐngdǎo zhǐ shì qīngmiáo-dànxiě de pīpíngle jǐ jù.
examples.english: 'Because his normal performance was very good, even though he made a mistake this time, his boss only superficially criticized him in a few sentences.'

translations.english: 得 means 'appropriate.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'not know whether to cry or laugh.'

examples.simplified: 他的话弄得大家哭笑不得。
examples.pinyin: Tā de huà nòng de dàjiā kūxiào-bùdé.
examples.english: 'What he said made everyone not know whether it was appropriate to laugh or to cry.'

examples.simplified: 孙子的话把爷爷气得哭笑不得。
examples.pinyin: Sūnzi de huà bǎ yéye qì de kūxiào-bùdé.
examples.english: 'What the grandson said made the grandfather so angry that he didn't know whether he should laugh or cry.'

translations.english: 告 means 'tell, indicate' and 奋勇 means 'marshal all one's energy and courage.' A literal translation is 'oneself to indicate one's energy and courage.' Freer translations include 'offer to undertake a difficult or dangerous task, volunteer.'

examples.simplified: 他自告奋勇免费给外国人当导游。
examples.pinyin: Tā zìgào-fènyǒng miǎnfèi gěi wàiguórén dāng dǎoyǒu.
examples.english: 'He voluntarily and free of charge serves as a tour guide for foreigners.'

examples.simplified: 他自告奋勇地说 ( "你就放心吧 ( 这件事交给我了。 ('
examples.pinyin: Tā zìgào-fènyǒng de shuō, "Nǐ jiù fàngxīn ba, zhè jiàn shì jiāo gěi wǒ le."
examples.english: 'Offering to undertake a difficult task, he said, "Don't you worry, hand this matter over to me."'

translations.english: 指 means 'point at' and 鹿 means 'deer.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'point at a deer and say it's a horse.' This is a metaphor for 'purposely confuse right and wrong,' 'misrepresent something,' or 'distort the facts.'

examples.simplified: 他用指鹿为马的伎俩打击了一大批反对他的人。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng zhǐlù-wéimǎ de jìliǎng dǎjīle yí dà pī fǎnduì tā de rén.
examples.english: 'He used the trick of distorting the facts and attacked a large number of people who were opposing him.'

examples.simplified: 那个国家的某个时代曾经没有一点公正 ( 到了指鹿为马的地步。
examples.pinyin: Nàge guójiā de mǒu ge shídài céngjīng méiyǒu yīdiǎn gōngzhèng, dàole zhǐlù-wéimǎ de dìbù.
examples.english: 'During a certain period in that country there was a time when there was no justice at all, when it had reached the stage of confusing right and wrong.'

translations.english: 设 here means 'assume, imagine,' 身 means 'oneself,' 处 means 'in (a certain situation),' and 地 means 'position, circumstances.' The literal meaning is 'assume that oneself is in someone else's position,' with a freer translation being 'put oneself in someone else's shoes, think from someone else's standpoint, take someone else's interests into consideration.'

examples.simplified: 制造商应该为消费者设身处地地想想 ( 怎么样才能给他们带来更大的方便。
examples.pinyin: Zhìzàoshāng yīnggāi wèi xiāofèizhě shèshēn-chǔdì de xiǎngxiǎng, zěnmeyàng cái néng gěi tāmen dàilái gèng dà de fāngbiàn.
examples.english: 'Manufacturers should put themselves in the other person's shoes and think of the consumers; how they can bring them even greater convenience.'

examples.simplified: 你设身处地地想想 ( 就不难理解对方为什么那样做了。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ shèshēn-chǔdì de xiǎngxiǎng, jiù bù nán lǐjiě duìfāng wèishénme nàyàng zuòle.
examples.english: 'If you put yourself in the other side's shoes, then it is not hard to understand why the other side did that.'

translations.english: 天方 means 'Arabian' and 夜谭 means 'night talk.' The literal meaning of this idiom is 'Arabian Night Talks,' the Chinese title of the book known in English as Arabian Nights or One Thousand and One Nights. This expression has, by metaphor, gained the extended meaning of 'strange and incredible story or comment.'

examples.simplified: 一个三岁的孩子能够写长篇小说？ 这简直是天方夜谭。
examples.pinyin: Yí ge sān suì de háizi nénggòu xiě chángpiān xiǎoshuō? Zhè jiǎnzhí shì Tiānfāng-yètán.
examples.english: 'A three-year-old child can write novels? This is simply a strange and incredible story.'

examples.simplified: 倒退五十年 ( 奥巴马成为总统是天方夜谭般的事。
examples.pinyin: Dàotuì wǔshí nián, àobāmǎ chéngwéi zǒngtǒng shì Tiānfāng-yètán bān de shì.
examples.english: 'If you go back fifty years, for Obama to become President would be as incredible as a story from the

translations.english: 雅 here means 'cultured or refined people,' 俗 means 'ordinary people,' and 赏 means 'appreciate, enjoy.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'cultured people and ordinary people can all enjoy it,' with a freer translation being 'appeal to both cultured and popular tastes.'

examples.simplified: 《007》可以说是一系列雅俗共赏的电影。
examples.pinyin: 007 kěyǐ shuō shì yí xìliè yǎsú-gòngshǎng de diànyǐng.
examples.english: '007 can be said to be a series of films enjoyed by both cultured and ordinary people.'

examples.simplified: 乡村音乐称得上是雅俗共赏。
examples.pinyin: Xiāngcūn yīnyuè chēngdeshàng shì yǎsú-gòngshǎng.
examples.english: 'Country music can be said to be something enjoyed by both cultured and ordinary people alike.'

translations.english: 适 here means 'go' and 从 means 'follow.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'have nowhere to go and nothing to follow,' with freer translations being 'at a loss how to proceed, not know what to do.'

examples.simplified: 孩子以前总有父母照顾 ( 现在独立生活 ( 往往会感到无所适从。
examples.pinyin: Háizi yǐqián zǒng yǒu fùmǔ zhàogù, xiànzài dúlì shēnghuó, wǎngwǎng huì gǎndǎo wúsuǒshìcóng.
examples.english: 'Before the child always had her parents to look after her, now she lives independently; she often feels at a loss about what to do.'

examples.simplified: 前任领导定下了一套规矩 ( 新任领导又定下了另一套规矩 ( 搞得员工们无所适从。
examples.pinyin: Qiánrèn lǐngdǎo dìngxiàle yú tào guīju, xīnrèn lǐngdǎo yòu dìngxiàle lìng yí tào guījù, gǎode yuángōngmen wúsuǒshìcóng.
examples.english: 'The former leader made up one set of rules, and the new leader made up another set of rules, making it so that the employees were at a loss about how to proceed.'

translations.english: 容 means 'allow' and 置疑 means 'raise doubts.' The whole idiom means 'allow no doubts, undeniable.'

examples.simplified: 她的文章材料丰富 ( 论证合理 ( 结论不容置疑。
examples.pinyin: Tā de wénzhāng cáiliào fēngfù, lùnzhèng hélǐ, jiélùn bùróng-zhìyí.
examples.english: 'She has abundant data for her article and her proof is convincing; the conclusion is undeniable.'

examples.simplified: 不少人认为毛泽东的话句句是真理 ( 是不容置疑的。
examples.pinyin: Bùshǎo rén rènwéi Máo Zédōng de huà jù jù shì zhēnlǐ, shì bùróng-zhìyí de.
examples.english: 'Many people believed that every one of Mao Zedong's words was the truth; this is undeniable.'

translations.english: 流连 means 'cannot bear to leave, linger,' 忘 means 'forget,' and 返 means 'return.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'unwilling to leave and forget to return.' Freer translations of the idiom include 'enjoy oneself so much as to forget to return home, hate to leave.'

examples.simplified: 阿尔卑斯山的风景美得跟画一样 ( 真让人流连忘返。
examples.pinyin: Ā'ěrbēisī Shān de fēngjǐng měi de gēn huà yíyìng, zhēn ràng rén liúlián-wàngfǎn.
examples.english: 'The scenery in the Alps is as beautiful as a painting; it really makes people unwilling to leave and return home.'

examples.simplified: 迪斯尼乐园好玩极了 ( 令孩子们流连忘返。
examples.pinyin: Dísīní lèyuán hǎowán jí le, lìng háizǐmen liúlián-wàngfǎn.
examples.english: 'Disney World is so much fun; it makes children feel that they don't want to leave.'

translations.english: 翻 means 'turn over' and 覆 means 'turn back around.' The whole idiom can have two different meanings: 'turn over back and forth, toss and turn', (as when sleeping) or 'repeat something again and again.'

examples.simplified: 晚上, 她翻来覆去睡不好觉, 想不出一个好法子。
examples.pinyin: Wănshàng, tā fānlái-fùqù shuìbùhăo jiào, xiăngbùchū yí ge hăo făzi 。
examples.english: 'At night, she tossed and turned, not being able to sleep well; she couldn't think of any good way (to deal with her problem).'

examples.simplified: 他的那个笑话翻来覆去地用了好几年了, 一点儿都不可笑了。
examples.pinyin: Tā de nàge xiàohuà fānlái-fùqù de yòngle hăo jĭ nián le, yīdiăr dōu bù kěxiào le 。
examples.english: 'He has been using that joke of his over and over again for a number of years now; it's not at all funny any more.'

translations.english: A literal translation of this idiom is 'in the midst of nothing there is engendered something.' It is frequently translated as 'fabricated, groundless.'

examples.simplified: 狗仔队常常无中生有, 编造娱乐明星的各种小道消息。
examples.pinyin: Gŏuzăiduì chángcháng wúzhōng-shēngyŏu, biānzào yúlè míngxīng de gè zhŏng xiăodào xiāoxi.
examples.english: 'Paparazzi often create rumors out of nothing, fabricating all kinds of hearsay about stars from the entertainment world.'

examples.simplified: 面对无中生有的谣言, 他根本不在乎。
examples.pinyin: Miànduì wúzhōng-shēngyŏu de yáoyán, tā gēnběn bú zàihu.
examples.english: 'Facing groundless rumors, he didn't pay any attention at all.'

translations.english: 庞然 means 'gigantic' and 大物 means 'big thing.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'a monster, a giant, a colossus.'

examples.simplified: 波音 747 飞机是个庞然大物, 里面可以载四百多名乘客。
examples.pinyin: Bōyīn 747 fēijī shì gè pángrán-dàwù, lĭmiàn kěyĭ zài sì băi duō míng chéngkè.
examples.english: 'A Boeing 747 is a colossus, which on the inside can carry over 400 passengers.'

examples.simplified: 沃尔玛在零售市场业中是个庞然大物, 没有公司能动摇她的地位。
examples.pinyin: Wó'ěrmă zài língshòu shìchăngyè zhōng shì ge pángrán-dàwù, méiyŏu gōngsī néng dòngyáo tā de dìwèi.
examples.english: 'Walmart is a giant in the retail industry whose position no company can shake.'

translations.english: 黔 is an ancient name for Guizhou Province, 驴 means 'donkey,' 技 means 'skill,' and 穷 means 'exhaust.' A literal translation is 'the Guizhou donkey's skills have been exhausted,' with a freer translation being 'exhaust one's, limited) bag of tricks' or 'have used up all the, limited) skills that one possesses.'

examples.simplified: 他已经黔驴技穷了, 不过, 要小心他狗急了跳墙, 做出一些违法的事。
examples.pinyin: Tā yĭjīng Qiánlú-jìqióng le, búguò, yào xiăoxīn tā gŏu jíle tiàoqiáng, zuòchū yìxiē wéifă de shì.
