examples.english: 'He has already used up his bag of tricks; however, we have to be careful lest he gets desperate and does something illegal.'

examples.simplified: 黔驴技穷 的她只好承认自己失败了。
examples.pinyin: Qiánlú-jìqióng de tā zhĭhăo chéngrèn zìjĭ shībàile.
examples.english: 'She, having used up her bag of tricks, had no choice but to admit defeat.'

translations.english: The literal meaning is 'three three two two,' with a freer translation being 'in twos and threes, not many people.'

examples.simplified: 因为太早, 集市上冷冷清清, 只能看到三三两两的人群。
examples.pinyin: Yīnwèi tài zăo, jíshì shàng lěnglěng qīngqīng, zhĭ néng kàndào sānsān-liăngliăng de rénqún.
examples.english: 'Because it was too early, the market was deserted, one only being able to see small groups of people in twos and threes.'

examples.simplified: 晚会开始前的半个小吋, 大家三三两两地来到了现场。
examples.pinyin: Wănhuì kāishĭ qián de bàn ge xiăoshí, dàjiā sānsān-liăngliăng de láidàole xiànchăng.
examples.english: 'During the half hour before the party started, everyone arrived on the scene in groups of two and three.'

translations.english: Both 号 and 令 mean 'a command, an order' while 施 means 'carry out, execute.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'give orders, boss people around.'

examples.simplified: 每个国家的主权都平等, 我们不接受任何国家对我们发号施令。
examples.pinyin: Měi ge guójiā de zhǔquán dōu píngděng, wŏmen bù jiēshòu rènhé guójiā duì wŏmen fāhào-shīlìng.
examples.english: 'Every country's sovereignty is equal, so we don't accept any country's giving us orders.'

examples.simplified: 当领导的发号施令后, 手下的人就开始忙了。
examples.pinyin: Dāng lĭngdăo de fāhào-shīlìng hòu, shŏuxià de rén jiù kāishĭ máng le。
examples.english: 'After the leader had given her orders, the subordinates began their work.'

translations.english: 旷 means 'open,'神 means 'spirits,' and 怡 means 'happy.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'heart open spirits happy,' with a freer translation being 'relaxed and joyful, cheerful and happy.'

examples.simplified: 黄石公园风景优美, 使人心旷神怡。
examples.pinyin: Huángshí Gōngyuán fēngjĭng yōuměi, shĭ rén xīnkuàng-shényí.
examples.english: 'The scenery in Yellowstone National Park is exquisite, making one feel open and relaxed in one's heart and joyful in one's spirits.'

examples.simplified: 行走在巴黎的街道上, 一边听着缓缓的古典音乐, 一边慢慢地欣赏着美丽的街景, 真的令人心旷神怡。
examples.pinyin: Xíngzŏu zài Bālí de jiēdào shàng, yìbiān tīngzhe huănhuăn de gǔdiăn yīnyue, yìbiān mànmàn de xīnshăngzhe měilì de jiējĭng, zhēn de lìng rén xīnkuàng-shényí.
examples.english: 'Walking on the streets of Paris, on the one hand listening to the leisurely classical music and on the other hand unhurriedly appreciating the beautiful sights on the streets, really does make one relaxed and joyful.'

translations.english: 雷 means 'thunder,'厉 means 'violence,' and 行 here means 'swift.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'as violent as thunder and as swift as wind,' with a freer translation being 'vigorous and resolute, in a sweeping manner.'

examples.simplified: 他在军队里养成了雷厉风行的作风。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài jūnduì lĭ yăngchéngle léilì-fēngxíng de zuòfēng.
examples.english: 'He cultivated a vigorous and resolute manner in the military.'

examples.simplified: 他做事雷厉风行, 说干就干。
examples.pinyin: Tā zuòshì léilì-fēngxíng, shuō gàn jiù gàn.
examples.english: 'He has a vigorous and resolute manner in his work, and does what he promises.'

translations.english: 朝 means 'morning,' 夕 means 'evening,' and 相处 means 'live together.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'constantly together.'

examples.simplified: 他们在同一所学校里, 朝夕相处, 后来产生了爱情。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen zài tóng yì suǒ xuéxiào lǐ zhāoxī-xiāngchǔ, hòulái chǎnshēngle àiqíng.
examples.english: 'They were in the same school, constantly together, and later they fell in love.'

examples.simplified: 就要告別朝夕相处的教练, 运动员们禁不住哭了。
examples.pinyin: Jiù yào gàobié zhāoxī-xiāngchǔ de jiàoliàn, yùndòngyuánmen jīnbúzhù kū le.
examples.english: 'When they were about to take leave of their coach, with whom they had been together night and day for such a long time, the athletes couldn't help but cry.'

translations.english: 畴躇 means 'pleased with oneself,' 满 means 'content,' and 志 means 'ideals.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'self-satisfied, puffed up with pride.'

examples.simplified: 她在数万人的大会上兴奋地演讲, 一副踌躇满志的样子。
examples.pinyin: Tāzài shù wàn rén de dàhuì shàng xīngfèn de yǎnjiǎng, yí fù chóuchú-mǎnzhì de yàngzi.
examples.english: 'At a mass meeting of tens of thousands of people, she lectured excitedly, with a smug expression on her face.'

examples.simplified: 总统在就职典礼上大谈他会如何如何改革, 对未来踌躇满志。
examples.pinyin: Zǒngtǒng zài jiùzhí diǎnlǐshàng dà tán tāhuì rúhé rúhé gǎigé, duì wèilái chóuchúmǎnzhì.
examples.english: 'At the inauguration, the president spoke on and on about how he would reform things, puffed up with pride about the future.'

translations.english: 金碧 means 'gold and green pigments' and 辉煌 means 'glorious, magnificent.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'resplendent in bright colors.'

examples.simplified: 故宫金碧辉煌, 是中国古代宫廷建筑的代表。
examples.pinyin: Gùgōng jīnbì-huīhuáng, shì Zhōngguó gǔdài gōngtíng jiànzhù de dàibiǎo.
examples.english: 'The Forbidden Palace is resplendent in bright colors; it's the representative of ancient Chinese palace architecture.'

examples.simplified: 他们参观了西藏金碧辉煌的寺庙。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen cānguānle Xīzàng jīnbì-huīhuáng de sìmiào.
examples.english: 'They visited the brightly colored temples of Tibet.'

translations.english: 同 means 'same,' 舟 means 'boat,' 济 means 'cross a river,' and 共 means 'together.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'cross the river together in the same boat.' Freer translations include 'overcome difficulties together, pull together to resolve problems, stand together in time of need.'

examples.simplified: 在这个危难的关头, 大家要同舟共济, 否则全部遭殃。
examples.pinyin: Zài zhège wēinàn de guāntóu, dàjiāyào tóngzhōu-gòngjì, fǒuzé quánbù zāoyāng.
examples.english: 'At this dangerous juncture, everybody must pull together to overcome this difficulty; otherwise, all will suffer disaster.'

examples.simplified: 公司高层领导与普通员工同舟共济, 终于度过了这段最艰难的经济危机时期。
examples.pinyin: Gōngsīgāocéng lǐngdāo yǔpǔtōng yuángōng tóngzhōu-gòngjì, zhōngyú dùguòle zhè duàn zuì jiānnán de jīngjì wēijīshíqī.
examples.english: 'The senior leaders of the company and the ordinary workers pulled together, finally passing through this period of a most difficult economic crisis.'

translations.english: 志 means 'aspiration' and 道 means 'road.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'aspiration the same and road conforming,' with a freer translation being 'have the same aspirations, have common goals.'

examples.simplified: 他有一位美丽善良、志同道合的妻子。
examples.pinyin: Tāyǒu yí wèi měilì shànliáng, zhìtóng-dàohé de qīzi.
examples.english: 'He has a beautiful, kindhearted wife who has the same aspirations he has.'

examples.simplified: 他们寻找志同道合的朋友, 然后一起建立一家新公司。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen xúnzhǎo zhìtóng-dàohé de péngyou, ránhòu yìqǐjiànlì yì jiāxīn gōngsī.
examples.english: 'They are looking for friends with the same aspirations; then together they will set up a new company.'

translations.english: 唇 means 'lip,' 亡 means 'lose,' 齿 means 'tooth,' and 寒 means 'cold.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'when the lips are gone the teeth are cold.' The extended meaning is 'closely related and share common concerns.'

examples.simplified: 朝鲜跟中国东北是唇亡齿寒的关系, 这也就是为什么中国在朝鲜战争中 出兵援助朝鮮的原因。
examples.pinyin: Cháoxiǎn gēn Zhōngguó dōngběi shì chúnwáng-chǐhán de guānxi, zhè yějiùshì wèishénme Zhāngguó zài Cháoxiǎn zhànzhēng zhōng chūbīng yuánzhù Cháoxiǎn de yuányīn.
examples.english: 'North Korea and northeast China are very closely related, this being the reason why China, during the Korean War, dispatched troops to assist North Korea.'

examples.simplified: 总统和副总统关系密切, 如果副总统出了事, 唇亡齿寒, 总统也会受到牵连。
examples.pinyin: Zǒngtǒng hé fùzǒngtǒng guānxi mìqiè, rúguǒfùzǒngtǒng chūle shì, chúnwángchǐhán, zǒngtǒng yěhuì shòudào qiānlián.
examples.english: 'The relationship between the president and the vice president is very close; if anything happened to the vice president, given that the two of them are as close as the lips and the teeth, the president would also become involved.'

translations.english: The literal meaning of this idiom is 'willows shady flowers bright.' It describes a beautiful scene where willow trees create shade and where flowers are blooming, dazzling the eyes with their bright colors. Later this idiom was also used as a metaphor for hope in the midst of difficulty, or for a bright future after a period of difficulty. This idiom can sometimes be translated as 'joy after sorrow' or 'good fortune after hardship.'

examples.simplified: 集邮市场曾经有过一段时间不景气, 但是现在柳暗花明了, 因为社会上对集邮的兴趣又高涨了。
examples.pinyin: Jíyóu shìchǎng céngjīng yǒuguo yí duàn shíjiān bù jǐngqì, dànshì xiànzài liǔànhuāmíng le, yīnwèi shèhuì shàng duì jíyóu de xìngqù yòu gāozhǎng le.
examples.english: 'The stamp collecting market in the past had a period that was depressed, but now there is a bright future after a period of difficulty, because interest in stamp collecting in society has risen again.'

examples.simplified: 他的事业三起三落, 曾经陷入过低谷, 也曾经柳暗花明过。
examples.pinyin: Tāde shìyè sānqǐ-sānluò, céngjīng xiànrùguo dīgǔ, yěcéngjīng liǔàn-huāmíng guò.
examples.english: 'His career has had its ups and downs; in the past there have been times when it sank into the pits, and there have also been times when it blossomed forth brightly after periods of difficulty.'

translations.english: 袖 means 'put in one's sleeves,' 旁 means 'from the sides,' and观 means 'look on.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'put one's hands in one's sleeves and look on from the sidelines.' A freer translation is 'stand by with one's arms folded, stand idly by.'

examples.simplified: 该国的外交政策是, 如果东亚发生了战争, 他们不会袖手旁观, 而是要积极参与。
examples.pinyin: Gāi guó de wàijiāo zhèngcè shì, rúguǒdōngyà fāshēngle zhànzhēng, tāmen bú huì xiùshǒu-pángguān, ér shì yào jījí cānyù.
examples.english: 'The foreign policy of that country is that, if in East Asia war erupts, they will not stand idly by but will participate actively.'

examples.simplified: 你们是好朋友, 现在他遇到了那么大的麻烦, 你怎么能袖手旁观呢？
examples.pinyin: Nǐmen shì hǎo péngyou, xiànzài tāyùdàole nàme dà de máfan, nǐzěnme néng xiùshǒu-pángguān ne?
examples.english: 'You're good friends; now that he has encountered such big trouble, how can you just look on from the sidelines?'

translations.english: 豁然 means 'open' and 开朗 means 'open and bright.' The literal meaning is 'open and bright,' with a freer translation being 'suddenly see the light.'

examples.simplified: 他们钻出山洞, 眼前豁然开朗。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen zuānchūshāndòng, yǎnqián huòrán-kāilǎng.
examples.english: 'When they had made their way out of the cave, before their eyes it suddenly became open and bright.'

examples.simplified: 听老师解释以后, 他豁然开朗, 一下子明白了。
examples.pinyin: Tīng lǎoshījiěshì yǐhòu, tāhuòrán-kāilǎng, yíxiàzi míngbai le.
examples.english: 'After hearing the teacher's explanation, he suddenly saw the light.'

translations.english: 诗 means 'poem,' 情 means 'feeling,' and m means 'meaning, idea.' The literal meaning is 'poem-feeling painting-idea,' with a freer translation being 'rich in poetic and artistic flavor.'

examples.simplified: 大学生活不纯粹是诗情画意, 也充满了就业前的准备。
examples.pinyin: Dàxué shēnghuó bù chúncuì shì shīqíng-huàyì, yěchōngmǎnle jiùyè qián de zhǔnbèi.
examples.english: 'University life is not purely poetry and art; it's also filled with preparation prior to employment.'

examples.simplified: 浪漫主义作品给人以诗情画意般的享受。
examples.pinyin: Làngmàn zhǔyì zuòpǐn gěi rén yǐshīqíng-huàyì bān de xiǎngshòu.
examples.english: 'Works of Romanticism give one a poetic and artistic kind of enjoyment.'

translations.english: 同 means 'same,' 日 means 'day,' and 语 means 'speak.' The literal meaning of this idiom is 'speak about on the same day,' with a freer translation being 'talk about at the same time, mention in the same breath, compare with.'

examples.simplified: 迈克尔•乔丹第二次复出后, 水平跟以前不可同日而语。
examples.pinyin: Màikè'ěr Qiáodān dì'èr cì fùchūhòu, shuǐpíng gēn yǐqián bù kětóngrì-éryǔ.
examples.english: 'After Michael Jordan resurfaced the second time, his level couldn't compare with before.'

examples.simplified: 他大学毕业后在很多国家工作过, 到过很多不同的地方, 因此现在的见识岂能跟大学时期的同日而语？
examples.pinyin: Tādàxué bìyè hòu zài hěn duōguójiāgōngzuòguo, dàoguò hěn duōbùtóng de dìfang, yīncǐxiànzài de jiànshi qǐnéng gěn dàxué shíqīde tóngrì-éryǔ?
examples.english: 'After graduating from college, he worked in many countries and visited many different places; so how could his current knowledge be mentioned in the same breath as that of the period when he was in college?'

translations.english: 曾 is Classical Chinese for the modern 曾经 and means 'before, once,' 几何 means 'how much,' and 时 means 'time.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'not very much time, has passed).' A freer translation is 'it was not so long ago that…, it was not long before….' However, this idiom is not infrequently misused to mean 'at some point in the past' or 'long ago,' which is gradually becoming accepted usage.

examples.simplified: 曾几何时, 水果是过节的象征, 是去亲戚朋友家的礼品。
examples.pinyin: Céngjǐhéshí, shuǐguǒshì guòjié de xiàngzhēng, shì qù qīnqi péngyou jiāde lǐpǐn.
examples.english: 'It was not so long ago that fruit was the symbol for celebrating holidays, or a gift when going to the homes of relatives and friends.'

examples.simplified: 曾几何时, 《周易》热了一段时间。
examples.pinyin: Céngjǐhéshí,
examples.english: 'It was not so long ago that

translations.english: This idiom means 'up very high, isolated from the masses.'

examples.simplified: 当领导的不能给别人一种高高在上的感觉, 否则没人愿意跟你接近。
examples.pinyin: Dāng lǐngdǎo de bùnéng gěi biérén yì zhǒng gāogāo-zàishàng de gǎnjúe, fǒuzé méi rén yuànyì gēn nǐjiējìn.
examples.english: 'Those who serve as leaders must not give others the feeling that they are very high in position, otherwise there won't be anyone who wants to approach you.'

examples.simplified: 这个话剧是讽刺那些高高在上的法官的。
examples.pinyin: Zhège huàjù shì fěngcì nàxiēgāogāo-zàishàng de fǎguān de.
examples.english: 'This play satirizes those judges who have such high positions.'

translations.english: The meaning of this idiom is 'fall passionately in love with, head over heels in love with.'

examples.simplified: 虽然丈夫出了车祸, 双腿残疾, 但是妻子对丈夫一往情深地说："我永远不会离开你。"
examples.pinyin: Suīrán zhàngfu chūle chēhuò, shuāng tuǐcánjí, dànshì qīzi duì zhàngfu yìwǎngqíngshēn de shuō:"Wǒyǒngyuǎn bú huì líkāi nǐ."
examples.english: 'Though the husband had an automobile accident and lost the use of both of his legs, the wife said to the husband, deeply in love with him: "I shall never leave you."'

examples.simplified: 她对舞蹈事业一往情深, 六十多岁了还亲自登台演出。
examples.pinyin: Tāduì wǔdǎo shìyè yìwǎng-qíngshēn, liùshí duōsuì le hái qīnzì dēngtái yǎnchū.
examples.english: 'She is passionately in love with dance; at the age of over sixty, she still personally gets on stage to perform.'

translations.english: 痛 means 'hurt,' 疾 means 'pain,' and 首 means 'head.' A literal translation of the idiom is 'hurt the heart and pain the head,' with a freer translation being 'very distressing or distressed, full of resentment.'

examples.simplified: 长江受到这么严重的污染, 真让人痛心疾首。
examples.pinyin: Chángjiāng shòudào zhème yánzhòng de wūrǎn, zhēn ràng rén tòngxīn-jíshǒu.
examples.english: 'That the Yangtze River was so seriously polluted has really distressed people.'

examples.simplified: 在中国的成长的历史上, 发生过痛心疾首的事。
examples.pinyin: Zài Zhōngguó de chéngzhǎng de lìshǐshàng, fāshēngguo tòngxīn-jíshǒu de shì.
examples.english: 'In the history of China's growth, there have occurred very distressing things.'

phrase.zh-CN: 鹬蚌相争, 渔翁得利
phrase.zh-HK: 鹬蚌相爭, 漁翁得利
phrase.pinyin: yù bàng xiāng zhēng, yú wēng dé lì

translations.english: 鹬 means 'snipe, a type of water bird),' 蚌 means 'clam,' 相 means 'mutually,' 争 means 'fight,' 渔翁 means 'fisherman,' and 利 means 'benefit.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'when the snipe and the clam fought with each other, the fisherman obtained the benefit', (since he could grab them both while they were distracted). This is a metaphor for a third party's benefiting when two parties are engaged in a quarrel and neither is willing to yield.

examples.simplified: 二十世纪八十年代, 美国和前苏联鹬蚌相争的时候, 中国得到了很多好处。
examples.pinyin: èrshí shìjì bāshí niándài, Měiguó hé qián Sūlián yùbàng-xiāngzhēng de shíhou, Zhōngguó dédàole hěn duōhǎochù.
examples.english: 'During the 1980s in the 20th century, when the U.S. and the former Soviet Union were involved in disputes much like the proverbial "snipe and clam," China reaped many benefits.'

examples.simplified: 总统大选初选的时候, 候选人都盼望着其他候选人鹬蚌相争, 他们好渔翁得利。
examples.pinyin: Zǒngtǒng dàxuǎn chūxuǎn de shíhou, hòuxuǎnrén dōu pànwàngzhe qítāhòuxuǎnrén yùbàng-xiāngzhēng, tāmen hǎo yú wēng dé lì.
examples.english: 'In the primaries of the presidential election, the candidates all hoped that the other candidates would fight with each other like the proverbial "snipe and clam," so that they could "reap the benefit of the fisherman."'

translations.english: A literal translation of this idiom is 'there isn't an hour and there isn't a quarter hour.' The meaning is 'constantly, incessantly, all the time.'

examples.simplified: 她无时无刻不在思念远方的丈夫。
examples.pinyin: Tāwúshí-wúkè bú zài sīniàn yuǎnfāng de zhàngfu.
examples.english: 'There wasn't a moment when she wasn't longing for her faraway husband.'

examples.simplified: 贫困无时无刻都在阻止发展中国家的进步。
examples.pinyin: Pínkùn wúshí-wúkè dōu zài zǔzhǐfāzhǎnzhōng guójiāde jìnbù.
examples.english: 'Poverty is constantly preventing the progress of developing countries.'

translations.english: A literal translation of this idiom is 'happy heaven happy earth.' The meaning is 'completely overjoyed.'

examples.simplified: 他们欢天喜地地搬进了新房子。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen huāntiān-xǐdì de bānjìnle xīn fángzi.
examples.english: 'They moved into their new home completely overjoyed.'

examples.simplified: 这个大家庭新添了一个孙子, 全家人都欢天喜地的。
examples.pinyin: Zhège dàjiātíng xīntiānle yí ge sūnzi, quán jiārén dōu huāntiān-xǐdì de.
examples.english: 'This large family newly added a grandson, so everyone in the family was overjoyed.'

translations.english: 殚 means 'use up,' 精 means 'energy,' 竭 also means 'use up,' and 虑 means 'thought.' The literal meaning of the whole idiom is 'use up all one's energy and thought,' with a freer translation being 'rack one's brains.'

examples.simplified: 文化大革命期间, 周恩来总理殚精竭虑, 努力保护了ー批老同志。
examples.pinyin: Wénhuà Dàgémìng qījiān, Zhōu Ēnlái zǒnglǐdānjīng-jiélǜ, nǔlì bǎohùle yì pīlǎotóngzhì.
examples.english: 'During the Cultural Revolution, Premier Zhou Enlai racked his brains trying to protect a group of old comrades.'

examples.simplified: 为了儿子的婚事, 父母殚精竭虑, 明显痩了许多。
examples.pinyin: Wéile érzi de hūnshì, fùmǔdānjīng-jiélǜ, míngxiǎn shòule xǔduō.
examples.english: 'For the sake of their son's marriage, his parents racked their brains, obviously losing a lot of weight.'

translations.english: 通 means 'understand,' 情 means 'situation,' 达 means 'attain,' and 理 means 'reason.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'very reasonable or sensible.'

examples.simplified: 她很通情达理, 因此交了很多朋友。
examples.pinyin: Tāhěn tōngqíng-dálǐ, yīncǐjiāole hěn duōpéngyou.
examples.english: 'She is very sensible, therefore she has made many friends.'

examples.simplified: 温网的观众是最通情达理的观众, 也给失败者很多掌声。
examples.pinyin: Wēnwǎng de guānzhòng shì zuì tōngqíng-dálǐde guānzhòng, yěgěi shībàizhěhěn duōzhǎngshēng.
examples.english: 'The spectators at the Wimbledon Open are extremely reasonable spectators, also giving the losers a lot of applause.'

translations.english: 降 means 'fall.' The literal meaning of the whole idiom is 'fall from the sky.' A freer English equivalent is 'come out of a clear blue sky.'

examples.simplified: 这条坏消息简直从天而降, 让人一点准备也没有。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tiáo huài xiāoxi jiǎnzhí cóngtiān-érjiàng, ràng rén yìdiǎn zhǔnbèi yěméiyǒu.
examples.english: 'This piece of bad news simply came out of a clear blue sky, there being no way that one could have been prepared.'

examples.simplified: 她买彩票中了特等奖, 财富从天而降, 一下子发了大财。
examples.pinyin: Tāmǎi cǎipiào zhòngle tèděngjiǎng, cáifù cóngtiān-érjiàng, yíxiàzi fāle dà cái.
examples.english: 'She bought a lottery ticket and won the special prize, with riches falling from the sky; all of a sudden, she struck it rich.'

translations.english: 井井 means 'orderly, well arranged.' 有条 means 有条理' which also means 'orderly, well arranged.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'orderly, in good order, methodical.'

examples.simplified: 他太太把家里收拾得井井有条, 干净利落。
examples.pinyin: Tātàitai bǎjiālǐshōushí de jǐngjǐng-yǒutiáo, gānjìng-lìluò.
examples.english: 'His wife arranged everything in their home in good order, clean and tidy.'

examples.simplified: 秘书把事情安排得井井有条, 领导非常满意。
examples.pinyin: Mìshūbǎshìqing ānpái de jǐngjǐng-yǒutiáo, lǐngdǎo fēicháng mǎnyì.
examples.english: 'The secretary arranged matters in an orderly manner, the boss being extremely satisfied.'

translations.english: 苦口 means 'urge with great patience,' 婆 means 'old woman,' and 婆 means 'kindheartedness.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'admonish over and over with good intentions.'

examples.simplified: 父母苦口婆心地跟孩子讲为什么要上大学的道理。
examples.pinyin: Fùmǔkǔkǒu-póxīn de gēn háizi jiǎng wèishénme yào shàng dàxué de dàolǐ.
examples.english: 'Admonishing them over and over again with good intentions, the parents explained to their children the reasons why they should attend college.'

examples.simplified: 传教士苦口婆心地劝说人们信仰上帝。
examples.pinyin: Chuánjiàoshì kǔkǒu-póxīn de quànshuōrénmen xìnyǎng Shàngdì.
examples.english: 'Admonishing them over and over with good intentions, the missionary urged the people to believe in God.'

translations.english: The literal translation of this idiom is 'people-mountain and people-sea.' The meaning is 'many people, huge crowds.'

examples.simplified: 国庆节的时候, 天安门广场游客非常多, 人山人海。
examples.pinyin: Guóqìngjié de shíhou, Tiānānmén guǎngchǎng yóukè fēicháng duō, rénshānrénhǎi.
examples.english: 'On National Day, there were extremely many sightseers on Tiananmen Square - crowds and crowds.'

examples.simplified: 她是现在最有名的歌星, 在她的演唱会现场, 人山人海。
examples.pinyin: Tāshì xiànzài zuì yǒumíng de gēxīng, zài tāde yǎnchànghuì xiànchǎng, rénshānrénhǎi.
examples.english: 'She is currently the most famous singer; at the site of her performances, there are always huge crowds of people.'

translations.english: 运筹 means 'map out tactics, plan' and 帷幄 means 'army tent.' A literal translation is 'map out strategic plans in an army tent.' Nowadays, this idiom is usually employed with the extended meaning 'good at strategies and planning.'

examples.simplified: 国共战争期间, 毛泽东运筹帷幄, 只用了四年时间就打败了蒋介石的八百万军队, 真是军事史上的奇迹。
examples.pinyin: Guó-Gòng zhànzhēng qījiān, Máo Zédōng yùnchóu-wéiwò, zhǐyòngle sì nián shíjiān jiù dǎbàile Jiǎng Jièshí de bābǎi wàn jūnduì, zhēn shì jūnshìshǐshàng de qíjì.
examples.english: 'At the time of the war between the Kuomintang and the Communists, Mao Zedong excelled at strategic planning, it taking him only four years to defeat Chiang Kai-shek's eight million troops; it really was a miracle in military history.'

examples.simplified: 巴菲特运筹帷幄, 即使在股市大跌的时期依然能赚到不少钱。
examples.pinyin: Bāfēitè yùnchóu-wéiwò, jíshǐzài gǔshì dàdiēde shíqīyīrán néng zhuàndào bù shǎo qián.
examples.english: 'U.S. investor Warren Buffett is good at strategies and planning; even at the time of the sharp drop in the stock market, he still was able to earn quite a bit of money.'

translations.english: 才 means 'talent', (especially literary talent) and 斗 was a unit of measurement in ancient China, with ten

examples.simplified: 王教授古典文学基础深厚, 才高八斗, 学富五车, 写副对联不费什么功夫。
examples.pinyin: Wáng jiàoshòu gǔdiǎn wénxué jīchǔshēnhòu, cáigāo-bādǒu, xuéfù-wǔchē, xiěfù duìlián bú fèi shénme gōngfu.
examples.english: 'Professor Wang's foundation in classical literature is very deep, and he is extremely talented and well-read; composing a couplet expends no effort on his part.'

examples.simplified: 那些自以为才高八斗的评论家, 人家的作品他根本没有看完就乱发评论。
examples.pinyin: Nà xiēzìyǐwéi cáigāo-bādǒu de pínglùnjiā, rénjiāde zuòpǐn tāgēnběn méiyǒu kànwán jiù luàn fāpínglùn.
examples.english: 'Those critics who consider themselves extremely talented, they haven't even finished reading someone's works and already they indiscriminately issue their criticisms.'

translations.english: 沾沾 means 'frivolous, flighty,' 自 means 'oneself,' and 喜 means 'like, happy with.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'frivolous and happy with oneself,' with freer translations including 'pleased with oneself, self-satisfied, complacent.'

examples.simplified: 他取得了不小的成就, 但是没有沾沾自喜, 而是继续奋斗。
examples.pinyin: Tāqǔdéle bù xiǎo de chéngjiù, dànshì méiyǒu zhānzhān-zìxǐ, ér shì jìxù fèndòu.
examples.english: 'He obtained great achievements, but was not complacent, continuing to struggle.'

examples.simplified: 第二次世界大战前, 法国人以为德国不会进攻法国及其盟国, 因而沾沾自喜的时候, 德国的坦克已经悄悄地出发了。
examples.pinyin: Dì'èr Cì Shìjiè Dàzhàn qián, Fǎguórén yǐwéi Déguó bú huì jìngōng Fǎguó jí qí méngguó, yīn'ér zhānzhān-zìxǐde shíhou, Déguó de tǎnkè yǐjīng qiāoqiāo de chūfāle.
examples.english: 'Before World War II, the French thought that Germany would not attack France and its allies; therefore, while it was feeling self-satisfied, the German tanks were already secretly setting out.'

translations.english: 皆 means 'all,' 大 means 'greatly,' and 欢喜 means 'joyful, happy, delighted.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'everyone is happy, to the satisfaction of all.'

examples.simplified: 事情的结果是双方皆大欢喜。
examples.pinyin: Shìqing de jiéguǒshì shuāngfāng jiēdàhuānxǐ.
examples.english: 'The result of the matter was that both sides were very pleased.'

examples.simplified: 市长改善了城市的交通, 市民们皆大欢喜。
examples.pinyin: Shìzhǎng gǎishànle chéngshì de jiāotōng, shìmínmen jiēdàhuānxǐ.
examples.english: 'The mayor improved city traffic, so the city residents were all very happy.'

translations.english: 大千 means 'the infinite universe.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'the vast world, the infinite universe.'

examples.simplified: 大千世界, 无奇不有。
examples.pinyin: Dàqiān-shìjiè, wúqí-bùyǒu.
examples.english: 'Anything under the sun.', (lit. 'In the vast world, there is no strange thing that does not exist.')

examples.simplified: 人生活在大千世界里, 总会遇到自己喜欢的人。
examples.pinyin: Rén shēnghuó zài dàqiān-shìjiè lǐ, zǒng huì yùdào zìjǐxǐhuan de rén.
examples.english: 'People live in such a vast world, eventually they will come across someone they like.'

translations.english: 举 means 'mention, give an example' and 反 means 'infer.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'when one, corner of a room) is mentioned, you infer the other three, corners of the room),' with a freer translation being 'infer other things from one fact that is already known, extrapolate.'

examples.simplified: 她聪明绝顶, 举一反三, 什么事情一点就透。
examples.pinyin: Tācōngmíng juédǐng, jǔyī-fǎnsān, shénme shìqing yì diǎn jiù tòu.
examples.english: 'She is utterly brilliant, and can infer other things from one fact; she can understand anything right away with just a little bit of information.'

examples.simplified: 我们要善于抓住事情的本质, 然后举一反三, 这样才能有大收获。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yào shànyú zhuāzhù shìqing de běnzhì, ránhòu jǔyī-fǎnsān, zhèyàng cáinéng yǒu dà shōuhuò.
examples.english: 'We must be good at capturing the essence of things, and then infer other things from one fact; only in this way can we have great achievements.'

translations.english: S means 'end, finish.' The whole idiom means 'settle a matter by leaving it unsettled, let an issue disappear.'

examples.simplified: 那件事情因为没有人继续追究了, 最后也就不了了之了。
examples.pinyin: Nà jiàn shìqing yīnwèi méiyǒu rén jìxù zhuījiūle, zuìhòu yě jiù bùliǎo-liǎozhī le.
examples.english: 'Because nobody continued looking into it, that matter in the end disappeared on its own.'

examples.simplified: 他们的恋爱关系没有发展下去, 时间久了, 就不了了之了。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen de liàn'ài guānxi méiyǒu fāzhǎn xiàqù, shíjiān jiǔ le, jiù bùliǎo-liǎozhī le.
examples.english: 'Their romance did not continue developing; with time, it ended on its own.'

translations.english: 得 means 'get, gain,' and 偿 means 'compensate.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'the gain does not make up for the loss.'

examples.simplified: 这样做有很大的风险, 如果失败, 就得不偿失了。
examples.pinyin: Zhèyàng zuò yǒu hěn dà de fēngxiǎn, rúguǒshībài, jiù débùchángshīle.
examples.english: 'Doing this is very risky; if you fail, any gain won't make up for the loss.'

examples.simplified: 那家大公司在这件新产品上光打广告就花了五百万美元, 结果卖得并不好, 得不偿失了。
examples.pinyin: Nà jiādà gōngsīzài zhè jiàn xīn chǎnpǐn shàng guāng dǎguǎnggào jiù huāle wǔbǎi wàn Měiyuán, jiéguǒmài de bìng bù hǎo, débùchángshīle.
examples.english: 'That large firm spent five million dollars just on advertising for this new product, and the result was that it didn't sell well at all, so the gain didn't equal the loss.'

translations.english: 偷 means 'steal,' 工 means 'work,' 减 means 'reduce,' and 料 means 'materials.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'do shoddy work by skimping on materials.' This recently has gained the extended meaning of 'not be responsible in one's work, careless, deceive others.'

examples.simplified: 建筑商偷工减料, 都是"豆腐渣"工程, 结果地震的时候许多建筑都倒塌了。
examples.pinyin: Jiànzhùshāng tōugōng-jiǎnliào, dōu shì "dòufǔzhā" gōngchéng, jiéguǒ dìzhèn de shíhou xǔduō jiànzhù dōu dǎotāle.
examples.english: 'The builders did shoddy work and skimped on materials, it all being construction of the quality of the "bean waste" that is left over after making soy milk; as a result, when the earthquake occurred, many buildings collapsed.'

examples.simplified: 做功课的时候要认真, 不能偷工减料。
examples.pinyin: Zuò gōngkè de shíhou yào rènzhēn, bù néng tōugōng-jiǎnliào.
examples.english: 'When you do your homework you should be diligent; you can't take shortcuts.'

translations.english: 屋 means 'roof,' 建 here means 'to pour water,' and 瓴 here means 'water vase.' A literal translation would be 'on a high rooftop pour water down.' A freer translation is 'operate from a strategically advantageous position.'

examples.simplified: 首长的讲话高屋建瓴, 对我们以后的工作具有十分重要的意义。
examples.pinyin: Shǒuzhǎng de jiǎnghuà gāowū-jiànlíng, duì wǒmen yǐhòu de gōngzuò jùyǒu shífēn zhòngyào de yìyì.
examples.english: 'A leading cadre's speech is from a strategically advantageous position; it will have very important significance for our jobs in the future.'

examples.simplified: 她高屋建瓴地对以前的研究进行了一个简要的总结。
examples.pinyin: Tā gāowū-jiànlíng de duì yǐqián de yánjiū jìnxíngle yí ge jiǎnyào de zǒngjié.
examples.english: 'From a strategically advantageous position, she made a brief summary of previous research.'

translations.english: 恋恋 means 'lovingly, with great affection' and 舍 means 'abandon, leave.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'lovingly not willing to leave,' with freer translations being 'very reluctant to leave, hate to part from.'

examples.simplified: 他让司机开得慢一点儿, 不停地回头看, 恋恋不舍地离开了生活过十年的总统府。
examples.pinyin: Tā ràng sījī kāide màn yìdiǎr, bù tíng de huítóu kàn, liànliàn-bùshě de líkāile shēnghuóguo shí nián de zǒngtǒngfǔ.
examples.english: 'He had the driver drive slower, incessantly looking back; very reluctant to depart, he left the presidential palace where he had lived for ten years.'

examples.simplified: 她恋恋不舍地跟男朋友告別。
examples.pinyin: Tā liànliàn-bùshě de gēn nánpéngyou gàobié.
examples.english: 'Very reluctant to part, she took leave of her boyfriend.'

translations.english: 围 means 'encircle, surround,' 魏 was the name of a state in ancient China, 救 means 'rescue,' and 赵 was the name of another state in ancient China. A literal translation of this idiom is 'encircle the state of Wei and rescue the state of Zhao.' This is a metaphor for 'attack an enemy's rear in order to force it to give up its own attack.'

examples.simplified: 二战中, 1940年8月26日, 英国空军用围魏救赵的方法袭击了德国的首都柏林, 从而减小了英国方面的压力。
examples.pinyin: Èrzhàn zhōng, yī-jiǔ-sì-líng nián bá yuè èrshiliù rì, Yīngguó kōngjūn yòng wéi Wèi jiù Zhào de fāngfǎ xíjīle Déguó de shǒudū Bólín, cóng'ér jiǎnxiǎole Yīngguó fāngmiàn de yālì.
examples.english: 'During World War II, on August 26, 1940, the British air force used the method of "encircling the state of Wei to rescue the state of Zhao" and attacked the German capital of Berlin, thereby lessening the pressure on England.'

examples.simplified: 甲公司想整个吞并乙公司, 乙公司找到甲公司支柱产品的漏洞, 通过起诉 甲公司的做法起到了围魏救赵的效果。
examples.pinyin: Jiǎ gōngsī xiǎng zhěnggè tūnbìng yǐ gōngsī, yǐ gōngsī zhǎodào jiǎ gōngsī zhīzhù chǎnpǐn de lòudòng, tōngguò qǐsù jiǎ gōngsī de zuòfā qǐdàole wéi Wèi jiù Zhào de xiàoguǒ.
examples.english: 'When Company A wanted to completely swallow up Company B, Company B found a flaw in one of Company A's signature products and, by suing Company A, brought about the result of "encircling Wei to save Zhao," so that Company A was forced to give up its attack.'

translations.english: This idiom means 'masses of flowers and piles of brocade.' This can also refer to well-dressed people or beautiful decorations.

examples.simplified: 国庆节的时候, 北京城的大街小巷, 花团锦簇。
examples.pinyin: Guóqìngjié de shíhou, Běijīngchéng de dàjiē-xiǎoxiàng, huātuán-jǐncù.
examples.english: 'At the time of National Day, all the streets and lanes of the city of Beijing are filled with masses of flowers and piles of brocade.'

examples.simplified: 广州的春天花团锦簇, 非常漂亮。
examples.pinyin: Guǎngzhōu de chūntiān huātuán-jǐncù, fēicháng piàoliang.
examples.english: 'At spring time in Guangzhou, you see masses of flowers and piles of brocade; it's very pretty.'

translations.english: The four characters literally mean 'sad, happy, separate, reunite.' The whole idiom means 'sorrows, joys, partings, and reunions' or 'the vicissitudes of human life.' Though 欢 and 合 have a positive sense, the overall meaning of this idiom emphasizes 悲 and 离' with their negative sense.

examples.simplified: 罗密欧与朱丽叶悲欢离合的爱情故事感动了一代又一代人。
examples.pinyin: Luómì'ōu yǔ Zhūlìyè bēihuān-líhé de àiqíng gùshi gǎndòngle yí dài yòu yí dài rén.
examples.english: 'The love story of Romeo and Juliet with its sorrows, joys, partings, and reunions has moved one generation after another.'

examples.simplified: 每次战争中都有很多悲欢离合。
examples.pinyin: Měicì zhànzhēng zhōng dōu yǒu hěn duō bēihuān-líhé.
examples.english: 'In every war there are many sorrows, joys, partings, and reunions.'

translations.english: 昔 means 'former times.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'the present does not compare with the past, times have changed.'

examples.simplified: 中国经过三十多年稳定的高速的发展, 实力已经今非昔比了。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó jīngguò sānshí duō nián wěndìng de gāosù de fāzhǎn, shílì yǐjīng jīn fēi xī bǐ le.
examples.english: 'After over thirty years of stable and rapid development, China's real power has become unprecedented in her history.'

examples.simplified: 那个电影明星老了以后, 影响力也下降了, 今非昔比了。
examples.pinyin: Nàge diànyǐng míngxīng lǎole yǐhòu, yǐngxiǎnglì yě xiàjiàng le, jīn fēi xī bǐ le.
examples.english: 'After that movie star aged, his influence declined; his situation today can't compare with that in the past.'

translations.english: 成 here means 'accomplishment.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'accomplish or achieve nothing, get nowhere.'

examples.simplified: 他自以为聪明, 但是做事不认真, 结果一辈子一事无成。
examples.pinyin: Tā zìyǐwéi cōngmíng, dànshì zuòshì bú rènzhēn, jiéguǒ yíbèizi yíshì-wúchéng.
examples.english: 'He considered himself smart, but he wasn't diligent in his work, with the result that his whole life long he accomplished nothing.'

examples.simplified: 如果一个人过于保守, 什么都不敢尝试, 很可能会一事无成。
examples.pinyin: Rúguǒ yí ge rén guòyú bǎoshǒu, shénme dōu bù gǎn chángshì, hěn kěnéng huì yíshì-wúchéng.
examples.english: 'If someone is excessively conservative, not daring to try anything, it is quite possible that they will achieve nothing.'

translations.english: Both 伦 and 类 mean 'class, category.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'not one thing not another, neither fish nor fowl, nondescript.'

examples.simplified: 这座建筑下面四四方方的, 像是中国传统的建筑, 可是上面有个很高的 尖顶, 看起来不伦不类的。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zuò jiànzhù xiàmiàn sìsìfāngfāng de, xiàng shì Zhōngguó chuántǒng de jiànzhù, kěshì shàngmiàn yǒu ge hěn gāo de jiāndǐng, kànqǐlai bùlún-búlèi de.
examples.english: 'This building is square-shaped below, like traditional Chinese buildings, but on top there is a very tall apex that looks neither here nor there.'

examples.simplified: 有人把豆汁翻译成北京可乐, 听起来不伦不类的。
examples.pinyin: Yǒu rén bǎ dòuzhī fānyì chéng Bēijing kělè, tīngqǐlai bùlún-búlèi de.
examples.english: 'There is someone who has translated

translations.english: 家常 means 'home-style' and 便饭 means 'simple meal,' so the literal meaning of this idiom is 'simple home-style food.' This idiom is often used with the literal meaning, but it is just as often employed as a metaphor for anything that is very common or ordinary.

examples.simplified: 这是家常便饭, 请随使用, 不要客气。
examples.pinyin: Zhè shì jiācháng-biànfàn, qǐng suíbiàn yòng, búyào kèqi.
examples.english: 'This is simple home-style cooking, please help yourself, don't be polite.'

examples.simplified: 他是个工作狂, 加班到晚上十一、二点是家常便饭。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì ge gdngzuòkuáng, jiābān dào wǎnshang shíyī-èr diǎn shì jiācháng-biànfàn.
examples.english: 'He's a workaholic; for him to work overtime until 11 or 12 p.m. is a common occurrence.'

translations.english: 平心 means 'with an impartial heart' and 论 means 'discuss.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'objectively speaking, in all fairness, to be honest.'

examples.simplified: 平心而论, 这位总统虽然很有成就, 但是也有不完美的地方。
examples.pinyin: Píngxīn-érlùn, zhè wèi zǒngtǒng suīrán hěn yǒu chéngjiù, dànshì yě yǒu bù wánměi de dìfang.
examples.english: 'In all fairness, though this president has lots of achievements, there are also areas that are not perfect.'

examples.simplified: 平心而论, 这篇文章写得不算太好。
examples.pinyin: Píngxīn-érlùn, zhè piān wénzhāng xiěde bú suàn tài hǎo.
examples.english: 'To be honest, this essay was not written particularly well.'

translations.english: 变 means 'change,'本 means 'basic nature,' 加 means 'add,' and 厉 means 'severity.' The whole idiom means 'intensify, become worse.'

examples.simplified: 外资企业对当地工人的剥削变本加厉了，不但没有涨工资，反而降了一些
examples.pinyin: Wàizī qĭyè duì dāngdì gōngrén de bōxuē biànběn-jiālì le, búdàn méiyǒu zhǎng gōngzī, fǎn'ér jiàngle yìxiē.
examples.english: 'The exploitation of local workers by foreign enterprises has intensified; not only have wages not risen but, on the contrary, they have fallen a little.'

examples.simplified: 东南沿海一帯的走私活动变本加厉了，从开始的香烟、摩托车，到现在的汽车、石油。
examples.pinyin: Dōngnán yánhǎi yídài de zǒusī huódòng biànběn-jiālì le, cóng kāishĭ de xiāngyān, mótuóchē, dào xiànzài de qìchē, shíyóu.
examples.english: 'Smuggling in the southeastern coastal area has intensified, from the initial cigarettes and motorcycles to the present automobiles and petroleum.'

translations.english: The literal meaning is 'with right titles and proper words - fitting and proper, perfectly justifiable.'

examples.simplified: 双方父母终于同意了这对年轻人的婚事，于是他们名正言顺地结婚了。
examples.pinyin: Shuāngfāng fùmǔ zhōngyú tóngyìle zhè duì niánqīngrén de hūnshì, yúshì tāmen míngzhèng-yánshùn de jiéhūn le.
examples.english: 'Both parents finally agreed on the young couple's marriage; as a result, they got married in a fitting and proper way.'

examples.simplified: 你这样做名正言顺，什么都不用担心！
examples.pinyin: Nĭ zhèyàng zuò míngzhèng-yánshùn, shénme dōu búyòng dānxīn.
examples.english: 'If you do things in a fitting and proper way, you don't have to worry about anything!'

translations.english: 望 means 'gaze or look at,' 梅 means 'plum,'止 means 'stop,' and 渴 means 'thirsty.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'gaze at plums to quench one's thirst.' This is a metaphor for merely consoling oneself with fantasies and being unable to realize one's goals. One possible English translation is 'feed on illusions.'

examples.simplified: 奢侈品店里的东西一般人是买不起的，有的人只好看看橱窗里的样品望梅止渴了。
examples.pinyin: Shēchĭpīndiàn lĭ de dōngxi yìbān rén shì mǎibuqĭ de, yǒu de rén zhĭhǎo kànkan chúchuāng lĭ de yàngpĭn wàngméi-zhĭkě le.
examples.english: 'Ordinary people are unable to afford the things in the luxury goods store; some people have no choice but to look at the samples in the display windows as if they were "gazing at plums to quench their thirst." '

examples.simplified: 指望他帮忙就像望梅止渴，其实根本是帮不上的。
examples.pinyin: Zhĭwàng tā bāngmáng jiù xiàng wàngméi-zhĭkě, qíshí gēnběn shì bāngbushàng de.
examples.english: 'Expecting his help is feeding on illusions; in truth, he is completely unable to help.'

translations.english: 意气 means 'enthusiasm' and 风发 means 'energetic.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'enthusiastic and energetic, with boundless enthusiasm.'

examples.simplified: 年轻人总是意气风发，充满活力。
examples.pinyin: Niánqīng rén zǒngshì yìqì-fēngfā, chōngmān huólì.
examples.english: 'Young people are always enthusiastic and energetic, full of vigor.'

examples.simplified: 新市长意气风发地对记者说，"我希望本市的经济三年大变样，五年翻一番。"
examples.pinyin: Xīn shìzhǎng yìqì-fēngfā de duì jìzhě shuō, "Wǒ xīwàng běnshì de jīngjì sān nián dà biànyàng, wǔ nián fān yì fān."
examples.english: 'The new mayor, with boundless enthusiasm, told the reporter, "I hope that the economy of this city will in three years look very different and in five years double."'

translations.english: 双 means 'two, a pair' and 管 means 'pen, brush.' A literal translation is 'paint with two brushes at the same time.' Later this was used as a metaphor for 'doing two things simultaneously' or 'simultaneously using two ways to achieve one goal.'

examples.simplified: 只有双管齐下才能解决目前的难题，一方面要提高销量，另一方面要节省开支。
examples.pinyin: Zhĭ yǒu shuāngguǎn-qíxià cái néng jiějué mùqián de nántí, yì fāngmiàn yào tígāo xiāoliàng, lìng yì fāngmiàn yào jiéshěng kāizhī.
examples.english: 'Only by doing two things simultaneously can we solve the current difficulty; on the one hand, we must raise sales volume and on the other, we must save on expenditures.'

examples.simplified: 为了有利地解决这次国际争端，该国政府釆取了双管齐下的办法，一边呼吁国际社会进行介入调解，一边加强了军事准备。
examples.pinyin: Wèile yǒulì de jiějué zhè cì guójì zhēngduān, gāi guó zhèngfǔ cǎiqǔle shuāngguǎnqíxià de bànfǎ, yìbiān hūyù guójì shèhuì jìnxíng jièrù tiáojiě, yìbiān jiāqiángle jūnshì zhǔnbèi.
examples.english: 'To resolve this international dispute in a beneficial manner, the government of the country in question adopted an approach of simultaneously using two ways to achieve one goal; on the one hand, it appealed to the international community to undertake and get involved in mediation and, on the other hand, it strengthened its military preparations.'

translations.english: 含 means 'hold in the mouth,' 辛 means 'hot spicy,' 茹 means 'eat,' and 苦 means 'bitter,' so that the literal meaning of this idiom is 'mouth something spicy and eat something bitter.' A freer translation is 'suffer great hardships and difficulties.'

examples.simplified: 你父母含辛茹苦，把你们两个养大，很不容易。
examples.pinyin: Nĭ fùmǔ hánxīn-rúkǔ, bǎ nĭmen liǎng ge yǎngdà, hěn bù róngyì.
examples.english: 'Your parents suffered tremendous hardships in raising the two of you; it was really difficult.'

examples.simplified: 为了得到第一手的资料，他到偏远落后的地区含辛茹苦地调查了几个月。
examples.pinyin: Wèile dédào dìyīshěu de zīliào, tā dào piānyuǎn luòhòu de dìqū hánxīn-rúkǔ de diàochále jĭ ge yuè.
examples.english: 'To obtain first-hand data, he went to remote, backward regions and, suffering great hardships, conducted research for several months.'

translations.english: 立 means 'raise up,'竿 means 'pole,' and 影 means 'shadow.' The literal meaning of this idiom is 'put up a pole and see its shadow.' A freer translation is 'get quick results.'

examples.simplified: 立竿见影的效果。
examples.pinyin: Zhè fù yào fēicháng shénqí, chǎnshēngle lìgān-jiànyĭng de xiàoguǒ.
examples.english: 'This dose of medicine was extremely miraculous; it brought about immediate results.'

examples.simplified: 他的经济政策立竿见影，取得了良好的经济效益。
examples.pinyin: Tā de jīngjì zhèngcè lìgān-jiànyĭng, qǔdéle liánghǎo de jĭngjì xiàoyì.
examples.english: 'His economic policy got off to a quick start, obtaining excellent economic results.'

translations.english: 冲锋 means 'charge forward and attack,'陷 means 'break through or breach,' and 阵 means 'battle formation.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'charge forward and submerge the enemy lines' or 'dash to the front of battle.'

examples.simplified: 这位将军从普通的士兵当起，一辈子冲锋陷阵，为国家立了大功。
examples.pinyin: Zhè wèi jiāngjūn cóng pǔtōng de shìbīg dāngqī, yíbèizi chōngfēng-xiànzhèn, wèi guójiā lìle dàgōng.
examples.english: 'This general has been serving since he was an ordinary rank-and-file soldier; his whole life long he has been charging forward. He has made very meritorious contributions for his country.'

examples.simplified: 他又勇敢又有智谋，这件事可以叫他去冲锋陷阵。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòu yǒnggǎn yòu yǒu zhìmóu, zhè jiàn shì kěyǐ jiào tā qù chōngfēngxiànzhèn.
examples.english: 'He is both courageous and resourceful, so in this matter we can have him charge forward.'

translations.english: 渠 means 'a channel (for water) ' and 成 means 'is formed.' The literal meaning is 'water arrives and channel is formed,' with a freer translation being 'when conditions are ripe success is achieved; achieved naturally and without effort.'

examples.simplified: 他为竞选做了大量的准备，所以成功是水到渠成的事。
examples.pinyin: Tā wèi jìngxuǎn zuòle dàliàng de zhǔnbèi, suǒyĭ chénggōng shì shuĭdào-qúchéng de shì.
examples.english: 'He made a great deal of preparations for the campaign, so it was natural and only to be expected that he would be successful.'

examples.simplified: 等欧洲各国经济上完全融合以后，政治上的统一自然水到渠成。
examples.pinyin: Děng Ōuzhōu gè guó jīngjì shàng wánquán rónghé yĭhòu, zhèngzhì shàng de tǒngyī zìrán shuĭdào-qúchéng
examples.english: 'Once the economies of the various European countries have completely merged, political union will naturally achieve success.'

translations.english: 危言 means 'words said to frighten people' and 耸听 means 'frightening things one hears.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'purposely say startling things in order to frighten people and create a sensation.'

examples.simplified: 这绝不是危言耸听，历史上出现过类似的情況。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jué bú shì wēiyán-sǒngtīng, lìshǐ shàng chūxiànguò lèisì de qíngkuàng.
examples.english: 'This is absolutely not a case of startling things being said to frighten people and create a sensation; in history there have occurred similar situations.'

examples.simplified: 他喜欢吓唬人，总讲一些危言耸听的话。
examples.pinyin: Tā xĭhuān xiàhu rén, zǒng jiǎng yìxiē wēiyán-sǒngtīng de huà.
examples.english: 'He likes to frighten people, always saying some startling things so as to create a sensation.'

translations.english: The first 何 means 'where?' so that 何去 means 'go where?' The second 何 means 'what?' The verb 从 here means 'do' so that 何从 means 'do what?' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'what path to take and what to do.'

examples.simplified: 大学毕业以后，他有些茫然，不知道自己该何去何从。
examples.pinyin: Dàxué bìyè yǐhòu, tā yǒuxiē mángrán, bù zhīdào zìjĭ gāi héqù-hécóng.
examples.english: 'After graduating from college, he was a little lost, not knowing what path he should take or what he should do.'

examples.simplified: 英国地处欧洲，但是一向跟美国友好，现在美国跟欧盟有了重大矛盾，英国将何去何从？
examples.pinyin: Yīngguó dìchǔ Ōuzhōu, dànshì yíxiàng gēn Méiguó yǒuhǎo, xiànzài Měiguó gēn Ōuméng yǒule zhòngdà máodùn, Yīngguó jiāng héqù-hécóng.
examples.english: 'England is located in Europe, but has always been friendly toward the U.S.; now that the U.S. and the European Union have had a major clash, what path will England take and what will it do?'

translations.english: 求 means 'request,'必 means 'certainly,' and 应 means 'respond.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'if there is a request certainly respond,' with a freer translation being 'respond to every plea, grant every request.'

examples.simplified: 他很富有，又很大方，所以他的朋友有困难的时候都去找他帮助，而他每次有求必应。
examples.pinyin: Tā hěn fùyǒu, yòu hě dàfāng, suǒyĭ tā de péngyou yǒu kùnnán de shíhou dōu qù zhǎo tā bāngzhù, ér tā měi cì yǒuqiú-bìyìng.
examples.english: 'He is very wealthy and also very generous, so when his friends have difficulties, they all go looking for him to help, and each time he responds to every request.'

examples.simplified: 那位大牌网球球星没有一点明星的架子，观众请他签名的时候几乎有求必应。
examples.pinyin: Nà wèi dàpái wǎngqiú qiúxīng méiyǒu yìdiǎn míngxīng de jiàzi, guānzhòng qĭng tā qiānmíng de shíhou jīhū yǒuqiú-bìyìng.
examples.english: 'That big-name tennis star doesn't have even a little of the haughtiness of a star; when spectators ask him for an autograph, he grants almost every request.'

translations.english: 杯 means 'cup,'弓 means 'bow (as in archery) ,'蛇 means 'snake,' and 影 here means 'reflection.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is '(mistakenly to take the reflection of a) bow in one's cup as a snake's reflection,' with freer translations being 'entertain imaginary fears, very suspicious, paranoid.'

examples.simplified: 逃犯听见尖锐的声音就以为是警车，简直杯弓蛇影。
examples.pinyin: Táofàn tīngjiàn jiānruì de shēngyīn jiù yĭwéi shì jĭngchē, jiǎnzhí bēigōng-shéyĭng.
examples.english: 'When the escaped convict heard the piercing sound, he thought it was a police car; he was simply paranoid.'

examples.simplified: 投资者要大胆自信，不能杯弓蛇影。
examples.pinyin: Tóuzīzhě yào dàdǎn zìxìn, bùnéng bēigōng-shéyĭng.
examples.english: 'Investors must be bold and self-confident; they cannot entertain imaginary fears.' Usage: Functions mainly as predicate.

translations.english: A literal translation of this idiom is 'wind calm waves still.' The meaning is 'calm and tranquil, uneventful.'

examples.simplified: 暴雨过后，海面上风平浪静。
examples.pinyin: Bàoyǔ guòhòu, hǎimiàn shàng fēngpíng-làngjìng.
examples.english: 'After the rainstorm, the surface of the sea was calm and tranquil.'

examples.simplified: 这几天，股票市场看起来好像风平浪静，但是大家都清楚，过几天就会不平静了。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jĭ tiān, gǔpiào shìchǎng kànqǐlái hǎoxiàng fēngpíng-làngjìng, dànshì dàjiā dōu qīngchu, guò jĭ tiān jiù huì bù píngjìng le.
examples.english: 'The last few days the stock market has looked calm and tranquil, but everyone is clear, in a few days it won't be calm anymore.'

translations.english: 逍遥 means 'carefree and unencumbered' and 法外 means 'outside or beyond the law.' This idiom refers to those who have broken the law but remain unpunished and free. A freer translation is 'at large.'

examples.simplified: 逍遥法外，真让人愤怒。
examples.pinyin: Zhè qĭ ànjiàn yĭjĭng fāshēng yì nián duō le, kěshì xiōngshǒu yīrán xiāoyáo-fǎwài, zhēn ràng rén fènnù.
examples.english: 'This case occurred over a year ago, yet the murderer is still at large; it really makes one angry.'

examples.simplified: 有的高干子弟以为父母有权有钱，他们犯了罪以后仍可以逍遥法外。
examples.pinyin: Yǒu de gāogàn zǐdì yǐwéi fùmǔ yǒu quán yǒu qián, tāmen fànle zuì yǐhòu réng kěyǐ xiāoyáo-fǎwài.
examples.english: 'The sons and daughters of some high-level cadres believe that because their parents have power and money, after they have committed crimes they can still remain free and beyond the reach of the law.'

translations.english: A literal translation is 'lantern is red and wine is green.' The meaning is 'debauchey.'

examples.simplified: 他进了大城市，受不了灯红酒绿的诱惑，慢慢地没有追求了。
examples.pinyin: Tā jìnle dàchéngshì, shòubùliǎo dēnghóng-jiǔlǜ de yòuhuò, mànmàn de méiyǒu zhuīqiú le.
examples.english: 'On entering the big city, he was unable to endure the temptations of debauchery, gradually not having anything that he pursued anymore.'

examples.simplified: 这条街灯红酒绿，不由得让人想起纽约、东京和香港。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tiáo jiē dēnghóng-jiǔlǜ, bùyóude ràng rén xiǎngqǐ Niǔyuē, Dōngjīng hé Xiānggǎng.
examples.english: 'This street is full of bars and brothels; one can't help but think of New York, Tokyo, and Hong Kong.'

translations.english: The literal meaning is 'with one's head reaching the sky and one's feet on the ground.' A freer translation is 'having a heroic or indomitable spirit.'

examples.simplified: 他是一个好丈夫，既能在外面奋斗，又很照顾妻子和孩子，是个顶天立地的男子汉。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yí gè hǎo zhàngfu, jì néng zài wàimiàn fèndòu, yòu hěn zhàogù qīzi hé háizi, shì gè dǐngtiān-lìdì de nánzǐhàn.
examples.english: 'He is a good husband, both able to struggle on the outside and taking good care of his wife and children - a "real man" of indomitable spirit.'

examples.simplified: 这么大的国家当然需要顶天立地的人来领导。
examples.pinyin: Zhème dà de guójiā dāngrán xěyào dǐngtiān-lìdì de rén lái lĭngdǎo.
examples.english: 'So large a country of course needs a person of heroic spirit to lead it.'

translations.english: 鉴 here means 'experience,'于 means 'from,' and 此 means 'this.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'having the experience obtained from this.' Freer translations are 'taking this into consideration, in view of this.'

examples.simplified: 人们的寿命明显增长了，有鉴于此，政府应该加快完善社会养老保障体系。
examples.pinyin: Rénmen de shòumìng míngxiǎnzēngzhǎngle, yǒujiàn-yúcǐ, zhèngfǔ yīnggāi jiākuài wánshàn shèhuì yǎnglǎo bǎozhàng tĭxì.
examples.english: 'People's life spans have clearly increased; in view of this, the government should accelerate the perfection of a system for social retirement safeguards.'

examples.simplified: 英语热兴起了，全民都在学英语，有鉴于此，电视台、出版社纷纷推出跟英语有关的节目和书籍。
examples.pinyin: Yīngyǔ rè xīngqĭle, quánmín dōu zài xué Yīngyǔ, yǒujiàn-yúcǐ, diànshìtái, chūbǎnshè fēnfēn tuīchū gēn Yīngyǔ yǒuguān de jiémù hé shūjí.
examples.english: 'An "English fad" has started up, with everyone learning English; in view of this, television stations and publishers are one after another putting out programs and books related to English.'

translations.english: 义 means 'righteousness,' 愤 means 'indignation,' 填 means 'fill,' and 膺 means 'breast, chest.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'righteous indignation fills the breast,' with a freer translation being 'filled with righteous indignation.'

examples.simplified: 日本右翼分子歪曲第二次世界大战的历史，这令中国人民义愤填膺。
examples.pinyin: Rìbēn yòuyì fènzǐ wāiqū Dì 'èr Cì Shìjiè Dàzhàn de lìshǐ, zhè lìng Zhōngguó rénmín yìfèn-tiányīng.
examples.english: 'Japanese right-wingers distort the history of World War II; this fills the Chinese people with righteous indignation.'

examples.simplified: 他义愤填膺地说，"你这样做会得到报应的。"
examples.pinyin: Tā yìfèn-tiányīng de shuō, "Nǐ zhèyàng zuò huì dédào bàoyìng de."
examples.english: 'Filled with righteous indignation, he said, "Your doing this will receive retribution."'

translations.english: 告 means 'tell, inform.' The whole idiom means 'secretive, confidential, cannot bear the light of day.'

examples.simplified: 他们两个总是背着別人偷偷地说话，好像有不可告人的目的。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen liǎng gè zǒngshì bèizhe biérén tōutōu de shuōhuà, hǎoxiàng yǒu bùkěgàorén de mùdì.
examples.english: 'The two of them always talk in secret with their backs turned to others; it seems they have some secret purpose.'

examples.simplified: 如果你没有不可告人的事情，为什么不当着大家的面讲出来？
examples.pinyin: Rúguǒ nǐ méiyǒu bùkě-gàorén de shìqing, wèishénme bù dāngzhe dàjiā de miàn jiǎng chūlái.
examples.english: 'If you don't have anything confidential, why don't you just say it to everyone's face?'

translations.english: 指 means 'point,' 画 means 'draw,' and 脚 means 'foot.' A literal translation is 'point with the hands and draw with the feet.' The meaning is 'gesticulate' or, by extension, 'make indiscrete remarks, interfere in the affairs of others, criticize.'

examples.simplified: 中国反对任何国家在人权问题上对中国指手画脚。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó fǎnduì rènhé guójiā zài rénquán wèntí shàng duì Zhōngguó zhǐshǒuhuàjiǎo.
examples.english: 'China is opposed to any country's criticism of China in the area of human rights issues.'

examples.simplified: 他指手画脚地说，"你们看看，我当初怎么说来着？如果你们当初听了我的忠告，现在就不会这么惨了吧？ "
examples.pinyin: Tā zhĭshǒu-huàjiǎo de shuō, "Nǐmen kànkan, wǒ dāngchū zěnmo shuō láizhe? Rúguǒ nĭmen dāngchū tīngle wǒ de zhōnggào, xiànzài jiù bú huì zhème cǎnle ba?"
examples.english: 'Gesticulating with his hands he said, "See, what did I say at the outset? If you had listened to my advice at the outset, then I suppose you wouldn't be in such a terrible situation now?" '

translations.english: 扼 means 'grasp' and 要 means 'main points.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'brief and to the point, clear and concise.'

examples.simplified: 警察局长简明扼要地回答了记者提出的问题。
examples.pinyin: Jĭngchájúzhǎng jiǎnmíng-èyào de huídále jìzhě tíchū de wèntí.
examples.english: 'The police station chief briefly and concisely answered the questions raised by the reporters.'

examples.simplified: 这篇文章条理清晰，简明扼要，通俗易懂。
examples.pinyin: Zhè piān wénzhāng tiáolĭ qĭngxī, jiǎnmíng-èyào, tōngsú-yìdǒng.
examples.english: 'This essay is well-ordered and clear, brief and to the point, and easy to understand.'

phrase.pinyin: táng láng bǔ chán, huáng què zài hòu

translations.english: 螳螂 means 'mantis,'捕 means 'catch,'蝉 means 'cicada,' and 黄雀 is a type of finch. A literal translation of this idiom is 'mantis catches cicada, finch is behind,' with a freer translation being 'when a mantis catches a cicada, a finch is right behind.' By metaphor this refers to people who single-mindedly plot against someone else, unaware that another person is also plotting against them.

examples.simplified: 他一辈子算计别人，没想到螳螂捕蝉，黄雀在后，最后他自己被他的秘书算计了。
examples.pinyin: Tā yíbèizi suànjì biérén, méi xiángdào tángláng-bǔchán, huángquè-zàihòu, zuìhòu tā zìjĭ bèi tā de mìshū suànjìle.
examples.english: 'His whole life long he schemed against others, never thinking that "when a mantis catches a cicada, the finch is right behind"; in the end, he himself was plotted against by his secretary.'

examples.simplified: 他得意地说："想不到螳螂捕蝉，黄雀在后吧？我盯着你已经好久了。"
examples.pinyin: Tā déyì de shuō: "Xiángbúdào tángláng-búchán, huángquè-zàihòu ba? Wǒ dīngzhe nĭ yĭjĭng hǎojiǔ le."
examples.english: 'He said with satisfaction: "I guess you didn't think that 'when a mantis catches a cicada, the finch is never far behind,' or did you? I've been keeping a close watch on you for a long time now."'

translations.english: 举 means 'action' and 得 means 'obtain.' A literal translation of this idiom is 'one action two acquisitions,' with a freer translation being 'kill two birds with one stone.'

examples.simplified: 夏季到中国去学中文，还能参观旅游，可谓一举两得。
examples.pinyin: Xiàjì dào Zhōngguó qù xué Zhōngwén, hái néng cānguān lǚyóu, kě wèi yìjǔliǎngdé.
examples.english: 'Going to China in the summer to study Chinese, and in addition being able to see the sites and tour, this can be called "killing two birds with one stone."'

examples.simplified: 把工厂建到农村，既降低了成本，又解决了当地的就业，真是一举两得的好办法。
examples.pinyin: Bǎ gōngchǎng jiàndào nóngcūn, jì jiàngdīle chéngběn, yòu jiějuéle dāngdì de jiùyè, zhēn shì yìjǔ-liǎngdé de hǎo bànfǎ.
examples.english: 'Constructing the factory in the countryside has both reduced costs and solved local employment; it's really a good approach that "kills two birds with one stone."'

translations.english: 置 means 'put,'之 means 'it,' and 度 means 'consider.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'put it outside of one's consideration,' with a freer translation being 'disregard, give no thought to.'

examples.simplified: 那位警察把生死置之度外，勇敢地跟歹徒搏斗。
examples.pinyin: Nà wèi jǐngchá bǎ shēngsǐ zhìzhī-dùwài, yǒnggǎn de gēn dǎitú bódòu.
examples.english: 'That policeman disregarded life and death, bravely fighting with the evildoer.'

examples.simplified: 这场球赛，她把胜负置之度外，因此打得十分放松。
examples.pinyin: Zhè chǎng qiúsài, tā bǎ shèngfù zhìzhī-dùwài, yīncǐ dǎde shífēn fàngsōng.
examples.english: 'In this match, she gave no thought to victory or defeat; therefore, she played in a very relaxed manner.'

translations.english: 永 means 'forever,' 垂 here means 'hand down,' and 朽 means 'decay.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'forever hand down and not decay.' Freer translations include 'immortal, live in one's heart forever.'

examples.simplified: 雷锋精神永垂不朽！
examples.pinyin: Léi Fēng jīngshen yǒngchuí-bùxiǔ.
examples.english: 'The spirit of Lei Feng will live forever!' (

examples.simplified: 他的英明和事业将永垂不朽。
examples.pinyin: Tā de yīngmíng hé shìyè jiāng yǒngchuí-bùxiǔ.
examples.english: 'His brilliance and his causes will be immortal.'

translations.english: 美 means 'good,'中 means 'within,' andmeans 'insufficient.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'the insufficiency within the goodness.' In other words, something is overall quite good but there are still areas where improvement is needed. Freer English translations include 'a minor flaw in something otherwise perfect,' 'a small defect,' and 'what's missing is….'

examples.simplified: 他们夫妻和睦，儿子也很可爱。但是美中不足的是只有一个孩子，如果再 有一个女儿就完美了。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen fūqī hémù, érzi yě hěn kě 'ài. Dànshì měizhōng-bùzú de shì zhĭ yǒu yí gè háizi, rúguǒ zài yǒu yí gè nǔ 'ér jiù wánměi le.
examples.english: 'Husband and wife get along harmoniously, and their son is cute. But the one thing that's missing is they have only one child; if in addition they had a daughter, then it would be perfect.'

examples.simplified: 这部电影拍得很成功，不过美中不足的是结局有些悲惨，让观众心里挺沉重的。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bù diànyĭng pāide hěn chénggōng, búguò měizhōng-bùzú de shì jiéjú yǒu xiē bēicǎn, ràng guānzhòng xīn lĭ tĭng chénzhòng de.
examples.english: 'This movie was made very successfully; however, the one minor flaw is that the ending is a little too tragic; it makes the audience have a very serious and heavy feeling in their hearts.'

translations.english: 人声 means 'human voices,' a 鼎 is a kind of ancient pot, and 沸 means 'boil.'鼎沸 means 'water is boiling in a big pot, bubbling like in a cauldron.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'noisy voices, a hubbub or confusion of voices.'

examples.simplified: 法庭里对同性恋婚姻辩论得很激烈，法庭外支持者和反对者都很多，人声鼎沸。
examples.pinyin: Fătíng lĭ duì tóngxìngliàn hūnyīn biànlùn de hěn jīliè, fǎtíng wài zhīchízhě hé fǎnduìzhē dōu hěn duō, rénshēng-dĭngfèi.
examples.english: 'Inside the courtroom, gay marriage was being debated intensely; outside the courtroom, there were many supporters and many opponents, their voices creating a loud hubbub.'

examples.simplified: 他喜欢在人声鼎沸的闹市区逛街。
examples.pinyin: Tā xĭhuān zài rénshēng-dĭngfèi de nàoshìqū guàngjiē.
examples.english: 'He likes to go strolling through the noisy downtown area.'

translations.english: 天真 means 'innocent, naive' and 烂漫 means 'unaffected, innocent.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'lively and cute, naive and unaffected, pure and natural.'

examples.simplified: 一群天真烂漫的孩子在公园里玩要，非常可爱。
examples.pinyin: Yì qún tiānzhēn-lànmàn de háizi zài gōngyuán lĭ wánshuǎ, fēicháng kǎ'ài.
examples.english: 'A group of innocent and unaffected children were playǒng in the park; they were very cute.'

examples.simplified: 她多想回到天真烂漫的童年啊！
examples.pinyin: Tā duō xiǎng huídào tiānzhēn-lànmàn de tóngnián a!
examples.english: 'How much she wishes she could go back to the naive and innocent years of childhood!'

translations.english: 就 means 'concerning, regarding, according to.' The meaning of the whole idiom is 'consider the matter in and of itself.'

examples.simplified: 我的话不是针对某个人，而是就事论事。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ de huà bú shì zhēnduì mǒu gè rén, érshì jiùshì-lùnshì.
examples.english: 'My words are not directed at any individual, but are considering the matter in and of itself.'

examples.simplified: 我们不应该停留在就事论事的阶段，而应该从大局来看待这件事情。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen bù yīnggāi tíngliú zài jiùshì-lùnshì de jiēduàn, ér yīnggāi cóng dàjú lái kàndài zhè jiàn shìqing.
examples.english: 'We shouldn't stop at the stage where you consider a matter in and of itself, but should treat this matter as seen from the overall situation.'

translations.english: A literal translation of this idiom is 'big hands big feet.' The meaning is 'extravagant, wasteful.'

examples.simplified: 他花钱大手大脚的，太浪费了。
examples.pinyin: Tā huāqián dàshǒu-dàjiǎo de, tài làngfèi le.
examples.english: 'He's extravagant in the way he spends money - just too wasteful!'

examples.simplified: 结婚后，她改变了大手大脚买东西的毛病。
examples.pinyin: Jiéhūn hòu, tā gāibiànle dàshǒu-dàjiǎo mǎi dōngxi de máobìng.
examples.english: 'After she married, she changed her bad habit of making extravagant purchases.'

translations.english: 漫 means 'all over, everywhere,'遍 also means 'all over, everywhere,' and 野 means 'wilderness.' The literal meaning is 'all over the mountains and all over the wilderness,' with a freer translation being 'all over, in great numbers.'

examples.simplified: 新英格兰的秋天，漫山遍野都是红叶，非常漂亮。
examples.pinyin: Xīn Yīnggélán de qiūtiān, mànshān-biànyě dōu shì hóng yè, fēicháng piàoliàng.
examples.english: 'At the time of fall in New England, there are red leaves all over, it's very beautiful.'

examples.simplified: 听说那座山上有千年的人参，人们连夜赶到那里去挖，漫山遍野都是人。
examples.pinyin: Tīngshuō nà zuò shān shàng yǒu qiān nián de rénshēn, rénmen liányè gǎndào nàlĭ qù wā, mànshān-biànyě dōu shì rén.
examples.english: 'When they heard that on that mountain there was 1,000-year-old ginseng, people rushed there to dig straight through the night; there were people everywhere.'

translations.english: 刻 means 'carve,'舟 means 'boat,'求 means 'seek,' and 剑 means 'sword.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'carve marks on a boat (to serve as a reminder of where to) seek the sword (that fell overboard) .' This is a metaphor for 'not know how to adapt to changed conditions,' 'act foolishly without regard to changed circumstances,' or 'incorrect or inappropriate method for solving a problem.'

examples.simplified: 你这样做就是刻舟求剑，十年以后情况不一定变化成啥样呢。
examples.pinyin: Nĭ zhèyàng zuò jiùshì kèzhōu-qiújiàn, shí nián yǐhòu qíngkuàng bù yídìng biànhuà chéng sháyàng ne.
examples.english: 'Your doing it this way is just like the man who made a notch on a boat to mark where a sword had fallen overboard - you don't know what the situation will be like in ten years.'

examples.simplified: 看事情的时候得用发展的眼光去看，否则就是刻舟求剑了。
examples.pinyin: Kàn shìqing de shíhou děi yòng fāzhǎn de yǎnguāng qù kàn, fǒuzé jiùshì kèzhōuqiújiàn le.
examples.english: 'When looking at things you must look at them from a progressive perspective; otherwise, you'll be like the man who made a notch on a boat to mark where a sword had fallen overboard - that is, you won't know how to adapt to changed conditions.'

translations.english: 龙 means 'dragon' and 虎 means 'tiger.' A literal translation is 'live dragon live tiger.' The extended meaning is 'lively and vigorous, bursting with energy.'

examples.simplified: 在球场上，小伙子们一个个生龙活虎，拼得很凶。
examples.pinyin: Zài qiúchǎng shàng, xiǎohuǒzimen yī ge ge shěnglóng-huóhǔ, pīnde hěn xiōng.
examples.english: 'On the ball field, each and every one of the kids was brimming with energy, giving it their utmost.'

examples.simplified: 原来生龙活虎的一个人，怎么病了几天之后，就这么没有精神？
examples.pinyin: Yuánlái shēnglóng-huóhǔ de yí ge rén, zěnme bìngle jĭ tiān zhīhòu, jiù zhème méiyǒu jīngshen?
examples.english: 'A person who formerly was bursting with energy, how come that after being sick for a couple of days, he is this lacking in energy?'

translations.english: 不甘 means 'not resigned to, not reconciled to, unwilling to,'示 means 'show,' and 弱 means 'weak.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is 'unwilling to show weakness (in comparison with others) ,' with a freer translation being 'unwilling to be outdone.'

examples.simplified: 红、白两队进行唱歌比赛，白队赢得了全场掌声，红队不甘示弱，唱起了她们最拿手的歌。
examples.pinyin: Hóng, bái liǎng duì jìnxíng chànggē bĭsài, bái duì yíngdéle quán chǎng zhǎngshēng, hóng duì bùgān-shìruò, chàngqǐle tāmen zuì náshǒu de gē.
examples.english: 'The two teams - red and white - held a singing contest, with the white team winning the applause of the entire audience; the red team, unwilling to be outdone, began singing their signature song.'

examples.simplified: 美国宣布对欧盟某项商品实行制裁，欧盟不甘示弱，马上宣布对美国某重 要出口产品进行反倾销调查。
examples.pinyin: Měiguó xuānbù duì Ōuméng mǒu xiàng shāngpĭn shíxíng zhìcái, Ōuméng bùgānshìruò, mǎshàng xuānbù duì Měiguó mǒu zhòngyào chūkǒu chǎnpĭn jìnxíng fǎn qīngxiāo diàochá.
examples.english: 'When the U.S. announced that it was implementing sanctions against a certain European Union commodity, the European Union, unwilling to be outdone, immediately announced that it was implementing an anti-dumping investigation of a certain important U.S. export product.'

translations.english: 循循 means 'in proper order,' 善 means 'well,' and 诱 means 'guide.' A literal translation is 'in proper order good at guiding others.' This idiom is often translated as 'good at guiding others, teach in a systematic and patient manner.'

examples.simplified: 王教授讲课的时候不是枯燥地讲解，而是给出很多例子，循循善诱。
examples.pinyin: Wáng jiàoshòu jiǎngkè de shíhou bú shì kūzào de jiǎngjiě, ér shì gěi chū hěn duō lìzi, xúnxún-shànyòu.
examples.english: 'When Professor Wang teaches, she doesn't drylv lecture, but gives lots of examples; she is good at guiding others.'

examples.simplified: 他是一位循循善诱的电视访谈节目主持人。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yí wèi xúnxún-shànyòu de diànshì fǎngtán jiémù zhǔchírén.
examples.english: 'He is a television talk show host who is good at guiding others.'

translations.english: 万家 means 'ten thousand families' or 'very many families,' while 灯火 means 'lights.' A literal translation is 'ten thousand families' lamps.' This often refers to a city that is ablaze with lights.

examples.simplified: 虽然已经深夜里，上海依然万家灯火，这是一个不眠的城市。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán yĭjĭng shēn yèlĭ, Shànghǎi yīrán wànjiā-dēnghuǒ, zhè shì yí ge bù mián de chéngshì.
examples.english: 'Though it was already late at night, Shanghai was still ablaze with lights; this was a city that did not sleep.'

examples.simplified: 她站在楼顶，欣赏着万家灯火的美景。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhàn zài lóudĭng, xīnshǎngzhe wànjiā-dēnghuǒ de měijĭng.
examples.english: 'She stood on the roof, enjoying the beautiful sights of a city ablaze with lights.'

translations.english: 执 means 'persist,' 迷 means 'confused,' and 要 means 'realize, understand.' A literal translation is 'persist in being confused and not realize it.' A freer translation is 'persist in one's errors and refuse to come to one's senses.'

examples.simplified: 你要看清形势，不要执迷不悟。
examples.pinyin: Nĭ yào kànqīng xíngshì, bú yào zhímí-búwù.
examples.english: 'You should see the situation clearly; don't persist in your errors and refuse to come to your senses.'

examples.simplified: 科学和历史早已证明世上没有什么长生不老的药，可是还有些执迷不悟的人努力寻找。
examples.pinyin: Kēxué hé lìshǐ zǎoyǐ zhèngmíng shìshàng méiyǒu shénme cháng shēng bù lǎo de yào, kěshì hái yǒu xiē zhímí-búwù de rén nǔlì xúnzhǎo.
examples.english: 'Science and history have long ago proven that there is no medicine in the world that can let you live forever, but there are still some people who refuse to come to their senses who try hard to find it.'

translations.english: 疮 means 'wound' and 孔 means 'hole.' The literal meaning is 'a thousand wounds and a hundred holes,' with a freer translation being 'riddled with gaping wounds, afflicted with any disorder imaginable.' This idiom is also used metaphorically to mean 'full of flaws or shortcomings.'

examples.simplified: 战后的城市千疮百孔，看起来非常悲惨。
examples.pinyin: Zhànhòu de chéngshì qiānchuāng-bǎikǒng, kànqĭlai fēicháng bēicǎn.
examples.english: 'The post-war city was riddled with gaping wounds, looking extremely tragic.'

examples.simplified: 如何挽救一家千疮百孔的亏损的企业，让新来的领导非常发愁。
examples.pinyin: Rúhé wǎnjiù yìjiā qiānchuāng-bǎikǒng de kuīsūn de qĭyè, ràng xīn lái de lĭngdǎo fēicháng fāchóu.
examples.english: 'How to rescue a business that was riddled with flaws and that was losing money made the recently arrived leader very worried.'

translations.english: 悬 means 'hang,' 崖 means 'precipice,'悬崖 means 'sheer cliff,' and 勒 means 'rein in.' A literal translation is 'rein in a horse at the edge of a precipice,' with the extended meaning being 'realize and escape from danger just in the nick of time.'

examples.simplified: 现在你的情况非常危险，如果再不悬崖勒马，肯定会出大事的。
examples.pinyin: Xiànzài nǐ de qíngkuàng fēicháng wēixiǎn, rúguǒ zài bù xuányá-lèmǎ, kěndìng huì chū dà shì de.
examples.english: 'Now your situation is very dangerous; if you still don't escape from danger just in the nick of time, you will definitely have a big accident.'

examples.simplified: 中国警告对方悬崖勒马，否则后果自负。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó jǐnggào duìfāng xuányá-lèmǎ, fǒuzé hòuguǒ zìfù.
examples.english: 'China warned the other side to escape from danger in the nick of time, otherwise they themselves must take responsibility for the consequences.'

translations.english: 半 means 'half,' 斤 is a unit of weight often translated as 'catty,' and 两 is another unit of weight often translated as 'ounce.' The literal translation of this idiom is 'half a catty (is the equivalent of) eight ounces,' with freer translations being 'six of one and half a dozen of the other, tweedledum and tweedledee, the same.'

examples.simplified: 一个人骂对方，另一个人打对方，两个人半斤八两，都有错儿。
examples.pinyin: Yí ge rén mà duìfāng, lìng yi ge rén dǎ duìfāng, liǎng ge rén bànjīn-bāliǎng, dōu yǒu cuòr.
examples.english: 'One person scolded the other party, and the other party hit the first person; it's six of one and half a dozen of the other — they were both wrong.'

examples.simplified: 这种做法跟那种做法半斤八两，都不省力。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng zuòfǎ gēn nà zhǒng zuòfà bànjīn-bāliǎng, dōu bù shěnglì.
examples.english: 'This method is about the same as that method; neither saves labor.'

translations.english: 共 means 'together，' 襄 means 'help，' 盛 means 'great，' and 举 means 'undertaking.' A literal translation is 'together help each other in great undertakings，' with a freer translation being 'join together to accomplish a great task.'

examples.simplified: 我们中国代表团团长说："我们衷心地希望海内外中华儿女共襄盛举，完成祖国统一大业。"
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen Zhōngguó dàibiǎotuán tuánzhǎng shuō: "Wǒmen zhōngxīn de xīwàng hǎinèiwài Zhōnghuà érnǚ gòngxiāng-shèngjǚ，wànchéng zǔguó tòngyī dàyè."
examples.english: 'The head of our Chinese delegation said: "We hope with all our hearts that the sons and daughters of China all over the world will join together to accomplish a great task，and complete the unification of the motherland."'

examples.simplified: 发生了大地震，大陆及港、澳、台三地艺人为了救灾共襄盛举，举办了多场演唱会。
examples.pinyin: Fāshēngle dà dìzhèn，dàlù jí Gǎng，Ào，Tái sān dì yìrén wèile jiùzāi gòngxiāng-shèngjǔ， jùbànle duō chǎng yǎnchànghuì.
examples.english: 'When the major earthquake occurred，entertainers from the mainland and the three areas of Hong Kong，Macao，and Taiwan joined together to accomplish the great task of providing disaster relief， holding numerous performances.'

phrase.pinyin: wǔ shí bù xiào bǎi bù

translations.english: 步 means 'pace，step' and 笑 means 'laugh at.' A literal translation of the whole idiom is '(a man who retreated only) fifty paces laughed at (another man who retreated) a hundred paces.' This means 'disparage someone else for essentially the same thing you yourself have done.'

examples.simplified: 他以前老笑话别人有绯闻，现在自己有了，真是五十步笑百步。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐ qián lǎo xiàohuà biérén yǒu fēiwén，xiànzài zìjǐ yòu le，zhēnshì wùshíbù-xiàobǎibù.
examples.english: 'He used to always laugh at others for having affairs; now he himself is involved in one; it really is a situation of his having disparaged others for the same thing he himself is doing.'

examples.simplified: 两个人同时受审, 在审判的过程中, 两个人同时揭发对方贪污受贿, 并指责对方人品低劣, 这不过是五十步笑百步罢了。
examples.pinyin: Liǎng ge rén tóngshí shòushěn, zài shěnpàn de guòchéng zhōng, liǎng ge rén tóngshí jiēfā duìfāng tānwū shòuhuì, bìng zhǐzé duìfāng rénpǐn dīliè, zhè búguò shì wǔshíbù-xiàobǎibù bàle.
examples.english: 'The two of them stood trial simultaneously; during the course of the trial, the two of them simultaneously exposed each other as being corrupt and having taken bribes, and moreover they found fault with each other for being of bad moral character; this is merely disparaging someone else for essentially the same thing you yourself have done.'

citation.apa: Jiao, L., Kubler, C. C., & Zhang, W. (2010). 500 Common Chinese Idioms: An annotated Frequency Dictionary. Routledge.
